ted-deutch.name: Ted Deutch
ted-deutch.bio: American politician and Jewish communal leader. CEO of the American Jewish Committee (AJC) since 2022. Previously served as a U.S. Representative from Florida (2010-2022). Strong advocate for Israel and combating antisemitism in Congress.

david-harris.name: David Harris
david-harris.bio: American Jewish communal leader. CEO of American Jewish Committee (AJC) from 1990 to 2022 - one of the longest-serving leaders of any major American Jewish organization. Awarded French Legion of Honor. Born in 1949.

jonathan-greenblatt.name: Jonathan Greenblatt
jonathan-greenblatt.bio: American nonprofit executive and CEO of the Anti-Defamation League since 2015. Former Obama White House advisor on social enterprise. Has expanded ADL's mission to include combating online extremism and hate speech across social media platforms.

sigmund-livingston.name: Sigmund Livingston
sigmund-livingston.bio: American attorney and founder of the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) in 1913. Born 1872, Jewish family in Bloomington, Illinois. Established the ADL in response to antisemitism, particularly the Leo Frank case. Served as ADL national chair until 1946.

howard-kohr.name: Howard Kohr
howard-kohr.bio: Long-serving American executive director of AIPAC (American Israel Public Affairs Committee). Under his leadership, AIPAC became one of the most powerful lobbying organizations in Washington, D.C., significantly influencing US-Israel policy.

betsy-berns-korn.name: Betsy Berns Korn
betsy-berns-korn.bio: American political activist. President of AIPAC (American Israel Public Affairs Committee), the most powerful pro-Israel lobbying organization in the United States with enormous influence over U.S. foreign policy toward Israel.

morton-klein.name: Morton Klein
morton-klein.bio: American political activist. President of the Zionist Organization of America (ZOA) since 1993, the oldest pro-Israel organization in the U.S. (founded 1897). Born in a displaced persons camp in Germany to Holocaust survivors. Known for hardline pro-Israel positions.

affiliations.organization: Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations

jeremy-ben-ami.name: Jeremy Ben-Ami
jeremy-ben-ami.bio: American political activist and founder of J Street, a liberal Jewish advocacy group that describes itself as "pro-Israel and pro-peace." Born to a Jewish family. Son of a member of the Irgun. Founded J Street in 2007 as a counterweight to AIPAC.

john-hagee.name: John Hagee
john-hagee.bio: American pastor and televangelist. Born 1940 in Goose Creek, Texas. Founder and National Chairman of Christians United for Israel (CUFI), the largest pro-Israel organization in the United States with over 10 million members. Senior pastor of Cornerstone Church in San Antonio.

william-daroff.name: William Daroff
william-daroff.bio: American Jewish communal leader. CEO of the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations, the main coordinating body for 50+ national Jewish organizations in the United States. Previously served as Senior Vice President for Public Policy at the Jewish Federations of North America.

affiliations.organization: Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations

jack-rosen.name: Jack Rosen
jack-rosen.bio: American businessman and Jewish communal leader. President of the American Jewish Congress. Chairman of the Rosen Partners private equity firm. Active in Jewish-Muslim interfaith dialogue. Connected to real estate and international business networks.

matt-brooks.name: Matt Brooks
matt-brooks.bio: American political operative. Executive Director of the Republican Jewish Coalition (RJC) since 1990. One of the most influential Jewish Republican leaders in America. Has helped shape Republican Party support for Israel over three decades.

halie-soifer.name: Halie Soifer
halie-soifer.bio: American policy advisor and executive. CEO of the Jewish Democratic Council of America (JDCA). Previously served as national security advisor to Senator Kamala Harris and as a staffer at the U.S. Mission to the United Nations.

roz-rothstein.name: Roz Rothstein
roz-rothstein.bio: American pro-Israel activist. Co-founder and CEO of StandWithUs, a prominent international Israel advocacy organization founded in 2001. Built StandWithUs into one of the largest pro-Israel education and advocacy groups with chapters on over 100 college campuses.

rabbi-marvin-hier.name: Rabbi Marvin Hier
rabbi-marvin-hier.bio: American rabbi and the founder and dean of the Simon Wiesenthal Center. Born 1939 in New York City to a Jewish family. Built the SWC into one of the largest Jewish organizations in the world. Also founded the Museum of Tolerance in Los Angeles. Delivered invocation at Trump's 2017 inauguration.

rabbi-abraham-cooper.name: Rabbi Abraham Cooper
rabbi-abraham-cooper.bio: Associate Dean of the Simon Wiesenthal Center. Leads the center's digital hate monitoring and international advocacy efforts. Has testified before Congress and the UN on antisemitism.

affiliations.role: Associate Dean & Director of Global Social Action

eric-fingerhut.name: Eric Fingerhut
eric-fingerhut.bio: American political leader and Jewish communal executive. President and CEO of the Jewish Federations of North America (JFNA), the umbrella organization for 146 Jewish federations and 300+ communities. Former U.S. Congressman and Ohio State Senator.

affiliations.organization: The Jewish Federations of North America

eric-goldstein.name: Eric Goldstein
eric-goldstein.bio: American Jewish communal leader. CEO of UJA-Federation of New York, the largest local Jewish philanthropy in the world, raising and distributing hundreds of millions of dollars annually. Previously served in various leadership roles in the New York Jewish community.

seth-riklin.name: Seth Riklin
seth-riklin.bio: American Jewish communal leader who served as president of B'nai B'rith International, one of the oldest Jewish service organizations. Focused on expanding the organization's advocacy for human rights and Jewish community interests worldwide.

rabbi-menachem-mendel-schneerson.name: Rabbi Menachem Mendel Schneerson
rabbi-menachem-mendel-schneerson.bio: The 7th Lubavitcher Rebbe (1902-1994). Born in Nikolaev, Ukraine. Led the Chabad-Lubavitch movement from 1951 until his death. Transformed Chabad into a global Jewish outreach empire with thousands of centers in over 100 countries. Many followers believed him to be the Messiah.

rabbi-yehuda-krinsky.name: Rabbi Yehuda Krinsky
rabbi-yehuda-krinsky.bio: Belarusian-American rabbi. Born 1933. Senior aide to the Lubavitcher Rebbe for decades. Chairman of Merkos L'Inyonei Chinuch and Machne Israel, the educational and social service arms of the Chabad-Lubavitch movement. One of the most powerful figures in worldwide Jewish outreach.

rabbi-moshe-hauer.name: Rabbi Moshe Hauer
rabbi-moshe-hauer.bio: American rabbi. Executive Vice President of the Orthodox Union (OU), the largest Orthodox Jewish umbrella organization in North America. Formerly rabbi of Bnai Jacob Shaarei Zion in Baltimore. Leads the OU's public policy, community, and religious affairs.

rabbi-rick-jacobs.name: Rabbi Rick Jacobs
rabbi-rick-jacobs.bio: American Reform rabbi and president of the Union for Reform Judaism, the largest Jewish denomination in North America with nearly 850 congregations. Has championed progressive causes including social justice, LGBTQ+ inclusion, and interfaith dialogue.

rabbi-deborah-waxman.name: Rabbi Deborah Waxman
rabbi-deborah-waxman.bio: American rabbi and president of Reconstructing Judaism (formerly Reconstructionist Rabbinical College). The first woman and first lesbian to lead a Jewish denominational organization. A pioneering figure in progressive Jewish leadership.

rabbi-chaim-dovid-zwiebel.name: Rabbi Chaim Dovid Zwiebel
rabbi-chaim-dovid-zwiebel.bio: American rabbi and attorney. Executive Vice President of Agudath Israel of America, the leading voice for Haredi (ultra-Orthodox) Judaism in the U.S. Advocates for religious liberty, educational policy, and social services for Orthodox communities.

ari-berman.name: Ari Berman
ari-berman.bio: American Modern Orthodox rabbi and president of Yeshiva University since 2017. An alumnus of YU's programs, he has focused on balancing Torah values with modern education, expanding the university's research profile and global partnerships.

ronald-liebowitz.name: Ronald Liebowitz
ronald-liebowitz.bio: American academic administrator. President of Brandeis University, the only nonsectarian Jewish-sponsored university in the country, since 2016. Previously president of Middlebury College (2004-2015). Political geographer specializing in the former Soviet Union.

shuly-rubin-schwartz.name: Shuly Rubin Schwartz
shuly-rubin-schwartz.bio: American academic and Jewish communal leader. Chancellor of the Jewish Theological Seminary of America (JTS), the flagship institution of Conservative Judaism, since 2020. First woman to lead JTS in its 130+ year history.

adam-lehman.name: Adam Lehman
adam-lehman.bio: American nonprofit leader and president and CEO of Hillel International, the world's largest Jewish campus organization serving students at over 850 colleges and universities. Focused on engaging unaffiliated Jewish students.

gidi-mark.name: Gidi Mark
gidi-mark.bio: Israeli-American nonprofit executive. CEO of Taglit-Birthright Israel, the program that has sent over 800,000 young Jewish adults from 68 countries on free 10-day trips to Israel since 1999. The program is one of the most significant Jewish identity-building initiatives in modern history.

rhoda-smolow.name: Rhoda Smolow
rhoda-smolow.bio: American Jewish communal leader. National President of Hadassah, the Women's Zionist Organization of America, the largest Jewish women's organization in the U.S. with 300,000 members. Hadassah founded the major medical center in Jerusalem.

affiliations.organization: Hadassah, The Women's Zionist Organization of America

russell-robinson.name: Russell Robinson
russell-robinson.bio: American Jewish communal leader. CEO of Jewish National Fund-USA (JNF-USA), one of the oldest and most prominent Zionist organizations, focused on land development, water infrastructure, and forestry in Israel since 1901.

ariel-zwang.name: Ariel Zwang
ariel-zwang.bio: American nonprofit executive. CEO of the American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee (JDC), the world's leading Jewish humanitarian organization operating in over 70 countries. Previously held senior roles at Goldman Sachs before transitioning to the nonprofit sector.

affiliations.organization: JDC (American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee) - Global

mark-hetfield.name: Mark Hetfield
mark-hetfield.bio: American human rights advocate. President and CEO of HIAS (Hebrew Immigrant Aid Society), founded in 1881 to assist Jewish refugees. Under Hetfield, HIAS expanded to help refugees of all backgrounds globally. International law attorney by training.

doron-almog.name: Doron Almog
doron-almog.bio: Israeli military officer and disability advocate. Born 1951. Chairman of the Jewish Agency for Israel since 2022. Former IDF Major General who led the heroic 1976 Entebbe rescue operation. Founded ALEH, Israel's network for children with severe disabilities.

steven-weil.name: Steven Weil
steven-weil.bio: American Jewish communal leader. National Director and CEO of Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF), one of the largest pro-Israel organizations in the U.S. FIDF provides educational, cultural, and recreational programs for IDF soldiers.

affiliations.organization: American Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)
Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)

jodi-rudoren.name: Jodi Rudoren
jodi-rudoren.bio: American journalist. Editor-in-Chief of The Forward, one of America's most influential Jewish news outlets (founded 1897). Previously served as Jerusalem bureau chief for The New York Times (2012-2015), covering Israel and the Palestinian territories.

david-horovitz.name: David Horovitz
david-horovitz.bio: British-born Israeli journalist. Born 1962 in London. Founding editor of The Times of Israel since 2012. Previously editor of The Jerusalem Post. One of the most influential English-language journalists covering Israel and the Middle East.

alana-newhouse.name: Alana Newhouse
alana-newhouse.bio: American journalist, editor, and founder of Tablet Magazine, an independent online publication covering Jewish news, culture, and ideas. Previously served as arts and culture editor at the Forward. A leading voice in Jewish intellectual discourse.

john-podhoretz.name: John Podhoretz
john-podhoretz.bio: American neoconservative columnist and author. Born 1961 in New York City to a prominent Jewish intellectual family. Son of Norman Podhoretz (longtime editor of Commentary magazine). Editor of Commentary since 2009. Influential voice in Jewish conservative intellectual circles.

jack-kliger.name: Jack Kliger
jack-kliger.bio: American museum executive who served as president and CEO of the Museum of Jewish Heritage in New York City. Previously led Hachette Filipacchi Media, overseeing publications including Elle and Car and Driver.

affiliations.organization: Museum of Jewish Heritage - A Living Memorial to the Holocaust
Museum of Jewish Heritage - A Living Memorial to the Holocaust

stuart-eizenstat.name: Stuart Eizenstat
stuart-eizenstat.bio: American diplomat, attorney, and policy advisor who served in multiple government roles. Key negotiator for Holocaust restitution agreements with Swiss banks, German industry, and European insurance companies. Ambassador to the EU under Clinton.

larry-fink.name: Larry Fink
larry-fink.bio: American billionaire businessman, founder, chairman, and CEO of BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager with over $10 trillion in assets under management. His annual letter to CEOs on stakeholder capitalism has made him one of the most influential figures in global finance.

david-solomon.name: David Solomon
david-solomon.bio: American banker. Born 1962 in Hartsdale, New York, to a Jewish family. CEO of Goldman Sachs since 2018. Also known as DJ D-Sol, performing electronic dance music. Oversees one of the world's most powerful investment banks. Under his leadership, Goldman settled Epstein-related claims.

lloyd-blankfein.name: Lloyd Blankfein
lloyd-blankfein.bio: American investment banker. Born 1954 in the Bronx to a Jewish family. CEO and Chairman of Goldman Sachs (2006-2018). Led Goldman through the 2008 financial crisis. Led Goldman's controversial $5B settlement with USVI over Epstein-related banking.

affiliations.role: Political Donor / Former Goldman Sachs CEO

michael-bloomberg.name: Michael Bloomberg
michael-bloomberg.bio: American billionaire businessman and politician. Born 1942 in Boston to a Jewish family. Founded Bloomberg L.P., the financial data and media company. Served as Mayor of New York City (2002-2013). 2020 presidential candidate. Net worth approximately $100 billion.

larry-ellison.name: Larry Ellison
larry-ellison.bio: American billionaire businessman, co-founder, chairman, and CTO of Oracle Corporation. Born to a Jewish mother in New York City. One of the world's wealthiest people with a net worth exceeding $100 billion. Major investor in Tesla and close ally of Elon Musk.

affiliations.organization: Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)

mark-zuckerberg.name: Mark Zuckerberg
mark-zuckerberg.bio: American internet entrepreneur. Born 1984 in White Plains, New York, to a Jewish family. Founded Facebook (now Meta Platforms) in 2004 at Harvard. Identified as Jewish and has discussed his Jewish identity publicly. Net worth exceeds $180 billion.

sheryl-sandberg.name: Sheryl Sandberg
sheryl-sandberg.bio: American technology executive and author. Born 1969 in Washington, D.C., to a Jewish family. Former COO of Meta Platforms/Facebook (2008-2022). Previously VP at Google. Author of "Lean In". Former chief of staff to U.S. Treasury Secretary Larry Summers.

sergey-brin.name: Sergey Brin
sergey-brin.bio: American computer scientist and billionaire. Born 1973 in Moscow, Soviet Union, to a Jewish family. Co-founded Google with Larry Page in 1998 at Stanford. President of Alphabet Inc. Immigrated to the U.S. at age 6. Net worth exceeds $120 billion.

larry-page.name: Larry Page
larry-page.bio: American computer scientist and internet entrepreneur. Born 1973 in East Lansing, Michigan, to a Jewish mother (Gloria Page). Co-founded Google with Sergey Brin in 1998 while at Stanford. CEO of Alphabet Inc. Net worth exceeds $130 billion.

michael-dell.name: Michael Dell
michael-dell.bio: Jewish founder and CEO of Dell Technologies. Born to a Jewish family in Houston, Texas. Started Dell from his UT Austin dorm room in 1984. Net worth ~$70 billion. Major philanthropist through the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation ($2.4B+ donated). Strong supporter of Israel with Dell's major Ra'anana campus employing 3,000+.

william-lauder.name: William Lauder
william-lauder.bio: American businessman and executive chairman of The Estee Lauder Companies, the global cosmetics conglomerate founded by his grandmother. A third-generation leader of the Lauder family business empire spanning luxury beauty brands including MAC, Clinique, and Bobbi Brown.

est-e-lauder.name: Estée Lauder
est-e-lauder.bio: Jewish-American businesswoman (born Josephine Esther Mentzer, 1906-2004) who founded one of the world's largest cosmetics empires. Daughter of Hungarian-Jewish immigrants. Started by selling skin creams formulated by her uncle. Named one of Time Magazine's 20 most influential business geniuses of the 20th century.

haim-saban.name: Haim Saban
haim-saban.bio: Israeli-American media mogul and political donor. Born 1944 in Alexandria, Egypt, to a Jewish family. Created the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers franchise. Later became a major media investor ($3B deal for ProSiebenSat.1). Largest individual Democratic Party donor for years.

barry-diller.name: Barry Diller
barry-diller.bio: American billionaire businessman and media executive. Chairman of IAC and Expedia Group. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers. Part of the New York media elite that overlapped with Epstein's social circle. Former chairman of Fox Broadcasting and Paramount Pictures.

steven-spielberg.name: Steven Spielberg
steven-spielberg.bio: American filmmaker. Born 1946 in Cincinnati, Ohio, to a Jewish family. Widely regarded as one of the greatest directors of all time. Created Schindler's List, Jurassic Park, E.T., Jaws, Indiana Jones, and many more. Co-founded DreamWorks SKG. Founded Shoah Foundation to preserve Holocaust testimonies.

jeffrey-katzenberg.name: Jeffrey Katzenberg
jeffrey-katzenberg.bio: American film producer and media executive. Born 1950 in New York City to a Jewish family. Former chairman of Walt Disney Studios. Co-founded DreamWorks SKG with Spielberg and Geffen. Founded Quibi (failed short-form streaming service). Major Democratic donor.

david-geffen.name: David Geffen
david-geffen.bio: American business magnate and philanthropist. Born 1943 in Brooklyn to a Jewish family. Co-founded DreamWorks SKG, Asylum Records, and Geffen Records. One of the wealthiest people in entertainment. Major UCLA donor (Geffen School of Medicine). Net worth approximately $10 billion.

david-zaslav.name: David Zaslav
david-zaslav.bio: American media executive. Born 1960 in Brooklyn, Jewish family. CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery since 2022. Previously CEO of Discovery Inc. for 15 years. Oversees HBO, CNN, Warner Bros. Pictures, DC Studios, and Discovery networks. One of the highest-paid media executives.

shari-redstone.name: Shari Redstone
shari-redstone.bio: American media executive and businesswoman. Born 1954, Jewish family. Chair of Paramount Global (formerly ViacomCBS) and president of National Amusements. Daughter of media mogul Sumner Redstone. Controls a media empire spanning CBS, MTV, Nickelodeon, and Paramount Pictures.

bob-iger.name: Bob Iger
bob-iger.bio: American media executive. Born 1951 in New York City to a Jewish family. CEO of The Walt Disney Company (2005-2020, returned 2022). Oversaw acquisitions of Pixar, Marvel, Lucasfilm, and 21st Century Fox. One of the most influential figures in entertainment.

affiliations.role: CEO of The Walt Disney Company

howard-schultz.name: Howard Schultz
howard-schultz.bio: Jewish business leader who built Starbucks into a global brand. Born to a Jewish family in Brooklyn public housing projects. Grew Starbucks from 11 stores to 35,000+ worldwide. Net worth ~$5 billion. Active philanthropist; considered running for US President in 2020.

sheldon-adelson.name: Sheldon Adelson
sheldon-adelson.bio: American billionaire businessman and political donor (1933-2021). Born in Boston to a Jewish Ukrainian immigrant family. Founded Las Vegas Sands Corporation. Major Republican and pro-Israel donor, giving over $500 million to political causes. Built The Venetian casino empire.

miriam-adelson.name: Miriam Adelson
miriam-adelson.bio: Israeli-American physician and philanthropist. Born 1945 in Tel Aviv. Widow of Sheldon Adelson. Major Republican donor. Owner of Las Vegas Sands. One of the wealthiest women in the world.

affiliations.organization: Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)

james-simons.name: James Simons
james-simons.bio: American mathematician and billionaire hedge fund manager (1938-2024). Born to a Jewish family in Brookline, Massachusetts. Founded Renaissance Technologies and its Medallion fund, the most successful quantitative hedge fund in history. Major donor to mathematical research and Democratic political causes.

ken-griffin.name: Ken Griffin
ken-griffin.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager and investor. Born 1968 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Founder and CEO of Citadel LLC, one of the world's largest hedge funds managing over $60 billion. Major political donor and art collector. Net worth approximately $40 billion.

robert-kraft.name: Robert Kraft
robert-kraft.bio: American billionaire businessman. Born 1941 in Brookline, Massachusetts, to a Jewish family. Owner of the New England Patriots NFL team (5 Super Bowl wins). Chairman and CEO of the Kraft Group. Major donor to Columbia University, Harvard, and pro-Israel causes.

affiliations.organization: Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)

amir-ohana.name: Amir Ohana
amir-ohana.bio: Israeli politician. Born 1976, first openly gay member of the Likud party. Speaker of the Knesset since 2023. Previously served as Minister of Public Security and Minister of Justice. Close ally of PM Netanyahu.

benjamin-netanyahu.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
benjamin-netanyahu.bio: Israeli politician. Born 1949 in Tel Aviv. Longest-serving Prime Minister of Israel (1996-1999, 2009-2021, 2022-present). Son of historian Benzion Netanyahu. Brother of Yonatan Netanyahu (killed in Entebbe raid). Studied at MIT. Faces multiple corruption indictments.

yoav-gallant.name: Yoav Gallant
yoav-gallant.bio: Israeli politician and military officer. Born 1958. Served as Minister of Defense. Former IDF general and commander of the Southern Command. Dismissed from defense minister position in 2024 amid policy disagreements with PM Netanyahu.

david-barnea.name: David Barnea
david-barnea.bio: Israeli intelligence official. Director of the Mossad, Israel's national intelligence agency, since June 2021. Career Mossad officer appointed by PM Netanyahu. Oversees foreign intelligence collection, covert operations, and counter-terrorism.

affiliations.organization: Mossad (Institute for Intelligence and Special Operations)

ronen-bar.name: Ronen Bar
ronen-bar.bio: Israeli intelligence official. Director of Shin Bet (Israel Security Agency) since October 2021. Career Shin Bet officer who rose through the ranks of Israel's domestic intelligence service, responsible for counter-terrorism and counter-espionage.

herzi-halevi.name: Herzi Halevi
herzi-halevi.bio: Israeli military officer. Born 1967. 23rd and current Chief of General Staff of the Israel Defense Forces since January 2023. Previously head of IDF Military Intelligence and commander of the Southern Command. Leading the IDF during the 2023-2024 Israel-Hamas war.

amir-yaron.name: Amir Yaron
amir-yaron.bio: Israeli economist. Born 1971. Governor of the Bank of Israel since 2018. Previously professor of finance at the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. PhD from the University of Chicago. Research focuses on asset pricing and macro-finance.

asher-cohen.name: Asher Cohen
asher-cohen.bio: Israeli academic and former president of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. A geography professor specializing in political geography. Led the university through significant expansion of its international partnerships and research programs.

uri-sivan.name: Uri Sivan
uri-sivan.bio: Israeli physicist and academic administrator. President of the Technion - Israel Institute of Technology, one of the world's top engineering and science universities. Specialist in nanotechnology. Oversees the institution known as "Israel's MIT."

ariel-porat.name: Ariel Porat
ariel-porat.bio: Israeli legal scholar. President of Tel Aviv University, Israel's largest university with 30,000 students. Professor of law specializing in tort law, contract law, and law and economics. Leading TAU through its expansion and global partnerships.

alon-chen.name: Alon Chen
alon-chen.bio: Israeli neuroscientist and president of the Weizmann Institute of Science since 2019. Known for groundbreaking research on stress, epigenetics, and the gut-brain axis. Previously headed the Max Planck Institute of Psychiatry in Munich.

arie-zaban.name: Arie Zaban
arie-zaban.bio: Israeli scientist. President of Bar-Ilan University. Physicist specializing in surface science and nanotechnology. Leads Israel's second-largest academic institution with a distinctive combination of research excellence and Jewish values.

gil-shwed.name: Gil Shwed
gil-shwed.bio: Israeli billionaire. Founded Check Point. Invented stateful firewall. Unit 8200 alumnus.

avishai-abrahami.name: Avishai Abrahami
avishai-abrahami.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Co-founder and CEO of Wix.com, a leading cloud-based web development platform with over 250 million users worldwide. Born in Israel. Built Wix from a small Tel Aviv startup to a NASDAQ-listed company valued at over $6 billion.

udi-mokady.name: Udi Mokady
udi-mokady.bio: Israeli-American cybersecurity executive, founder, and executive chairman of CyberArk Software, a global leader in privileged access management. Under his leadership, CyberArk grew from an Israeli startup to a NASDAQ-listed company with over $600 million in annual revenue.

amnon-shashua.name: Amnon Shashua
amnon-shashua.bio: Israeli computer scientist, entrepreneur, and co-founder and CEO of Mobileye, the pioneering autonomous driving technology company acquired by Intel for $15.3 billion in 2017 and re-listed on NASDAQ in 2022. Professor at Hebrew University. One of Israel's wealthiest tech entrepreneurs.

daniel-birnbaum.name: Daniel Birnbaum
daniel-birnbaum.bio: Israeli-Swedish businessman who served as CEO of SodaStream International, leading its global expansion and navigating the BDS controversy. Under his leadership, SodaStream was acquired by PepsiCo for $3.2 billion in 2018. Known for promoting coexistence at SodaStream factories.

micha-kaufman.name: Micha Kaufman
micha-kaufman.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Co-founder and CEO of Fiverr International, the online marketplace for freelance services. Built Fiverr from an Israeli startup to a publicly traded company on NYSE. The platform connects millions of freelancers with businesses worldwide.

roy-mann.name: Roy Mann
roy-mann.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Co-founded Monday.com (formerly dapulse), a cloud-based work operating system platform. Born in Israel. Monday.com IPO'd on NASDAQ in 2021 at a valuation exceeding $7 billion.

amos-schocken.name: Amos Schocken
amos-schocken.bio: Israeli journalist and publisher. Publisher and owner of Haaretz, Israel's oldest daily newspaper and its most left-leaning major publication. Member of the Schocken family, a prominent German-Jewish publishing dynasty that founded Schocken Books.

arnon-mozes.name: Arnon Mozes
arnon-mozes.bio: Israeli media executive. Publisher of Yedioth Ahronoth, Israel's most-read newspaper. Key figure in Israeli media. Charged with bribery in 2017 alongside PM Netanyahu in the Case 2000 scandal involving alleged media-for-legislation deal.

dani-dayan.name: Dani Dayan
dani-dayan.bio: Israeli diplomat and politician. Born 1955 in Argentina. Chairman of Yad Vashem, the World Holocaust Remembrance Center, since 2021. Former chairman of the Yesha Council (settler umbrella organization) and former Israeli Consul General in New York.

yaakov-hagoel.name: Yaakov Hagoel
yaakov-hagoel.bio: Israeli Zionist leader and chairman of the World Zionist Organization and acting chairman of the Jewish Agency for Israel. A long-time Likud party activist who has focused on strengthening Jewish identity and combating antisemitism globally.

ronald-lauder.name: Ronald Lauder
ronald-lauder.bio: American businessman and Jewish communal leader. Born 1944 in New York City. Son of Estee Lauder. President of the World Jewish Congress since 2007. U.S. Ambassador to Austria (1986-1987). Major art collector (Neue Galerie founder). Net worth approximately $4 billion.

marie-van-der-zyl.name: Marie van der Zyl
marie-van-der-zyl.bio: British Jewish communal leader. President of the Board of Deputies of British Jews from 2018 to 2024. Lawyer by profession. First female president of the Board of Deputies elected to a full term. Oversaw the organization during the UK Labour antisemitism crisis.

affiliations.organization: Board of Deputies of British Jews

rabbi-ephraim-mirvis.name: Rabbi Ephraim Mirvis
rabbi-ephraim-mirvis.bio: South African-born British rabbi. Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations of the Commonwealth since 2013. Born 1956 in Johannesburg. Made unprecedented intervention in UK politics by criticizing Labour antisemitism before the 2019 election.

steven-lewis.name: Steven Lewis
steven-lewis.bio: British Jewish communal leader. Chairman of Jewish Care, the largest health and social care charity for the Jewish community in the UK, providing services to over 10,000 people annually through care homes, community centers, and support programs.

gideon-falter.name: Gideon Falter
gideon-falter.bio: British Jewish communal leader. Chairman of the Campaign Against Antisemitism (CAA), a charity that combats antisemitism in the United Kingdom through education, research, and legal action. Led high-profile campaigns against antisemitism in the Labour Party and online.

lord-jacob-rothschild.name: Lord Jacob Rothschild
lord-jacob-rothschild.bio: British investment banker and philanthropist (1936-2024). 4th Baron Rothschild. Chairman of RIT Capital Partners. Member of the Jewish Rothschild banking dynasty. Significant supporter of Israel and Jewish causes. Founded Yad Hanadiv, which funded the Knesset building and Israel Supreme Court.

yonathan-arfi.name: Yonathan Arfi
yonathan-arfi.bio: French Jewish communal leader. President of CRIF (Representative Council of Jewish Institutions of France), the main umbrella body representing Jewish communities in France since 2022. Lawyer and political scientist by training.

affiliations.organization: CRIF (Conseil Représentatif des Institutions Juives de France)
CRIF (Representative Council of Jewish Institutions of France)

jo-l-mergui.name: Joël Mergui
jo-l-mergui.bio: French Jewish communal leader. President of the Consistoire Central, the central body governing Jewish religious life in France since the Napoleonic era. Oversees synagogues, kashrut certification, and rabbinical functions throughout France.

michael-mostyn.name: Michael Mostyn
michael-mostyn.bio: Canadian Jewish communal leader. CEO of B'nai Brith Canada, the country's oldest Jewish advocacy organization founded in 1875. Leads advocacy on antisemitism, hate crimes, and Israel-related issues in Canada.

mark-leibler.name: Mark Leibler
mark-leibler.bio: Australian lawyer and Jewish communal leader. National Chairman of the Australia/Israel & Jewish Affairs Council (AIJAC), Australia's leading pro-Israel advocacy organization. Senior partner at Arnold Bloch Leibler law firm. Prominent in Australian constitutional and reconciliation affairs.

josef-schuster.name: Josef Schuster
josef-schuster.bio: German physician and president of the Central Council of Jews in Germany since 2014. The most prominent representative of Germany's 120,000-strong Jewish community. Advocates for Holocaust remembrance and against rising antisemitism in Europe.

affiliations.organization: Zentralrat der Juden in Deutschland (Central Council of Jews in Germany)
Central Council of Jews in Germany

alexander-boroda.name: Alexander Boroda
alexander-boroda.bio: Russian Jewish communal leader. President of the Federation of Jewish Communities of Russia (FJCR), the largest Jewish umbrella organization in Russia, closely aligned with the Chabad-Lubavitch movement and the Russian government.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities of Russia (FJCR)

rabbi-berel-lazar.name: Rabbi Berel Lazar
rabbi-berel-lazar.bio: Russian-Italian Chabad rabbi who serves as Chief Rabbi of Russia. Born in Milan, he became one of the most influential Jewish leaders in the former Soviet Union, maintaining close ties with the Kremlin while advocating for the revival of Russian Jewish life.

rabbi-warren-goldstein.name: Rabbi Warren Goldstein
rabbi-warren-goldstein.bio: South African rabbi. Chief Rabbi of South Africa since 2005. Born 1971 in Pretoria. Youngest chief rabbi in South African history when appointed. Founded the Sinai Indaba conference and the global Shabbos Project initiative encouraging Jews worldwide to keep one Shabbat.

michael-schudrich.name: Michael Schudrich
michael-schudrich.bio: American-born rabbi. Chief Rabbi of Poland since 2004. Born 1955 in New York. Spent decades helping to revive Jewish life in Poland after the devastation of the Holocaust. Has overseen the reemergence of vibrant Jewish communities in Warsaw, Krakow, and other Polish cities.

affiliations.organization: Union of Jewish Communities in Poland

rabbi-yehuda-sarna.name: Rabbi Yehuda Sarna
rabbi-yehuda-sarna.bio: American Orthodox rabbi serving as the first Chief Rabbi of the Jewish Council of the Emirates and the senior rabbi of the NYU Bronfman Center for Jewish Student Life. Helped establish formal Jewish communal life in the UAE following the Abraham Accords.

herbert-wachtell.name: Herbert Wachtell
herbert-wachtell.bio: American attorney and co-founder of Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz, one of the most prestigious and highest-grossing law firms per attorney in the world. Specializes in complex litigation and corporate matters. A pioneer of modern legal practice.

martin-lipton.name: Martin Lipton
martin-lipton.bio: American attorney, co-founder of Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz, and inventor of the "poison pill" takeover defense in 1982, one of the most important innovations in corporate law. His work fundamentally reshaped how hostile takeovers are defended globally.

joseph-flom.name: Joseph Flom
joseph-flom.bio: American attorney (1923-2011) who was a legendary partner at Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom. He transformed the firm into the world's largest by pioneering hostile takeover law and M&A advisory. Son of Jewish immigrants from Eastern Europe.

marc-kasowitz.name: Marc Kasowitz
marc-kasowitz.bio: American trial lawyer and founding partner of Kasowitz Benson Torres LLP. Served as Donald Trump's personal attorney for over 15 years. Known for high-profile litigation on behalf of major corporations and political figures.

bruce-flatt.name: Bruce Flatt
bruce-flatt.bio: CEO of Brookfield Asset Management. Often compared to Warren Buffett for his long-term investment approach.

stephen-ross.name: Stephen Ross
stephen-ross.bio: American billionaire real estate developer, founder and chairman of Related Companies, which developed Hudson Yards, the largest private real estate development in US history. Also majority owner of the Miami Dolphins NFL team and Hard Rock Stadium.

steven-roth.name: Steven Roth
steven-roth.bio: American billionaire real estate magnate, chairman and CEO of Vornado Realty Trust, one of the largest commercial real estate investment trusts. His properties include landmark Manhattan office buildings. Close ally of the Trump Organization in New York development.

rob-speyer.name: Rob Speyer
rob-speyer.bio: American real estate executive. Born 1969. President and CEO of Tishman Speyer, one of the world's leading real estate developers and operators, managing over $80 billion in properties including Rockefeller Center and Hudson Yards. Jewish. Major New York real estate figure.

jared-kushner.name: Jared Kushner
jared-kushner.bio: American businessman and former White House Senior Advisor. Born 1981 in Livingston, New Jersey, to an Orthodox Jewish family. Married Ivanka Trump. Served in Trump administration (2017-2021) leading Middle East peace efforts including the Abraham Accords. Son of Charles Kushner.

charles-kushner.name: Charles Kushner
charles-kushner.bio: American real estate developer. Born 1954 in Elizabeth, New Jersey, to a Jewish immigrant family from Belarus. Founded Kushner Companies. Father of Jared Kushner (Trump's son-in-law and White House senior advisor). Convicted of federal crimes in 2004, served 14 months, and was pardoned by Trump in 2020.

marc-holliday.name: Marc Holliday
marc-holliday.bio: American real estate executive. CEO of SL Green Realty Corp., the largest office landlord in Manhattan. Born to a Jewish family. Joined SL Green in 1998 and became CEO in 2004. Oversees a portfolio exceeding $15 billion.

larry-silverstein.name: Larry Silverstein
larry-silverstein.bio: American businessman and chairman of Silverstein Properties, best known for his 99-year lease of the World Trade Center six weeks before the September 11, 2001 attacks. Led the $25 billion rebuilding of the WTC complex including the Freedom Tower.

richard-lefrak.name: Richard LeFrak
richard-lefrak.bio: American billionaire real estate developer. Born 1945 to a Jewish family in New York. Chairman of the LeFrak Organization, one of the largest private real estate developers in the U.S. The LeFrak family has been building in New York for over 100 years.

gary-barnett.name: Gary Barnett
gary-barnett.bio: Israeli-American real estate developer, founder and chairman of Extell Development Company, known for building some of Manhattan's tallest and most luxurious residential towers including One57 and Central Park Tower. Born in Haifa, Israel.

scott-rechler.name: Scott Rechler
scott-rechler.bio: American real estate executive. Chairman and CEO of RXR Realty, a major New York real estate firm with over $20 billion in assets. Jewish. Former board member of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. Former vice chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

mortimer-zuckerman.name: Mortimer Zuckerman
mortimer-zuckerman.bio: Canadian-American billionaire media proprietor, real estate magnate, and philanthropist. Former owner and editor-in-chief of U.S. News & World Report and the New York Daily News. Chairman of Boston Properties, one of the largest REITs in the US.

richard-mack.name: Richard Mack
richard-mack.bio: American real estate executive. Founder and CEO of Mack Real Estate Group, a New York-based real estate investment and development firm. Born to a Jewish family involved in New Jersey real estate for generations (Mack-Cali Realty legacy).

michael-moritz.name: Michael Moritz
michael-moritz.bio: Welsh-born American venture capitalist and journalist. Former partner at Sequoia Capital where he led investments in Google, Yahoo!, PayPal, and LinkedIn. Became a billionaire through his venture investments. Previously Time magazine's Man of the Year correspondent.

marc-andreessen.name: Marc Andreessen
marc-andreessen.bio: American businessman, software engineer, and co-founder of Netscape and Andreessen Horowitz (a16z). Created the first widely-used web browser Mosaic. One of Silicon Valley's most influential venture capitalists with investments in Facebook, Airbnb, and Coinbase.

ben-horowitz.name: Ben Horowitz
ben-horowitz.bio: American businessman, author, and co-founder of Andreessen Horowitz. Jewish father of Cameroonian and Jewish heritage. Author of "The Hard Thing About Hard Things." Previously co-founded cloud computing pioneer Loudcloud/Opsware, sold to HP for $1.6 billion.

henry-kravis.name: Henry Kravis
henry-kravis.bio: American businessman and investor. Born 1944 in Tulsa, Oklahoma, to a Jewish family. Co-founded KKR (Kohlberg Kravis Roberts) in 1976. Pioneered the leveraged buyout industry. Led the landmark $25B buyout of RJR Nabisco in 1988. Major philanthropist.

marc-rowan.name: Marc Rowan
marc-rowan.bio: American billionaire businessman. Born 1962, Jewish family in New York. CEO of Apollo Global Management since 2021, succeeding Leon Black who resigned amid Epstein payment revelations. Major donor to the Wharton School. Led efforts to reform Penn leadership after antisemitism controversy.

leon-black.name: Leon Black
leon-black.bio: American billionaire. Co-founder of Apollo Global Management. Paid Epstein $158 million between 2012 and 2017 for "tax and estate planning advice"  -  the largest known payments to Epstein from any individual. Visited Epstein's Manhattan townhouse and New Mexico ranch. An independent review commissioned by Apollo concluded the payments were for legitimate services. Stepped down as Apollo CEO in 2021 after the payments were revealed. His wife Debra was also connected to Epstein socially.

stephen-feinberg.name: Stephen Feinberg
stephen-feinberg.bio: American billionaire businessman, co-founder and co-CEO of Cerberus Capital Management, a major private equity firm. Also served as chair of the President's Intelligence Advisory Board under Trump. Known for extreme privacy and his firm's ownership of DynCorp and Remington.

paul-singer.name: Paul Singer
paul-singer.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Born 1944, Jewish family in Tenafly, New Jersey. Founder and president of Elliott Management Corporation, one of the world's most successful activist hedge funds. Major Republican and pro-Israel donor.

david-siegel.name: David Siegel
david-siegel.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager and co-founder of Two Sigma Investments, a quantitative trading firm managing over $60 billion. A pioneer in applying machine learning and distributed computing to financial markets. PhD in computer science from MIT.

david-shaw.name: David Shaw
david-shaw.bio: American billionaire scientist and hedge fund manager, founder of D.E. Shaw & Co., a computational finance pioneer. Holds a PhD from Stanford and has done groundbreaking computational biochemistry research. Jeff Bezos worked at D.E. Shaw before founding Amazon.

chase-coleman.name: Chase Coleman
chase-coleman.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Born 1975? (exact date not public). Founder and CEO of Tiger Global Management, one of the most successful technology-focused hedge funds. Early investor in Facebook, LinkedIn, and dozens of successful tech companies. Net worth exceeds $8 billion.

bill-ackman.name: Bill Ackman
bill-ackman.bio: American Jewish billionaire activist investor and founder of Pershing Square Capital Management. Known for high-profile campaigns against Herbalife and for investments in companies like Chipotle and Howard Hughes. An outspoken advocate for Jewish causes and critic of campus antisemitism.

steve-tisch.name: Steve Tisch
steve-tisch.bio: American billionaire businessman, film producer, and co-owner of the New York Giants NFL team. Produced films including Forrest Gump, which won the Academy Award for Best Picture. Son of Bob Tisch, who co-owned the Giants with the Mara family.

josh-harris.name: Josh Harris
josh-harris.bio: Co-founder of Apollo Global Management. Owner of the Washington Commanders NFL team.

bruce-ratner.name: Bruce Ratner
bruce-ratner.bio: American real estate developer who led the controversial Barclays Center and Atlantic Yards development in Brooklyn, New York. Former chairman of Forest City Realty Trust. Has been both praised and criticized for urban development projects.

joe-lacob.name: Joe Lacob
joe-lacob.bio: American billionaire venture capitalist and majority owner of the Golden State Warriors NBA team. Under his ownership, the Warriors won four NBA championships (2015, 2017, 2018, 2022). Partner at Kleiner Perkins specializing in life sciences investments.

steve-ballmer.name: Steve Ballmer
steve-ballmer.bio: American billionaire businessman, former CEO of Microsoft (2000-2014), and owner of the Los Angeles Clippers NBA team. Purchased the Clippers for $2 billion in 2014 and built the $1.8 billion Intuit Dome arena. One of the wealthiest people in the world.

mark-cuban.name: Mark Cuban
mark-cuban.bio: American billionaire entrepreneur, investor, and former owner of the Dallas Mavericks NBA team. Made his fortune selling Broadcast.com to Yahoo for $5.7 billion. Star of Shark Tank and founder of Cost Plus Drugs, disrupting pharmaceutical pricing.

larry-dolan.name: Larry Dolan
larry-dolan.bio: American billionaire businessman. Owner of the Cleveland Guardians (MLB) since 2000. Born to a Jewish family in Cleveland. Attorney and businessman. Brother of Cablevision founder Charles Dolan. Paid $323M for the team, now worth over $1 billion.

steve-cohen.name: Steve Cohen
steve-cohen.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager, founder of Point72 Asset Management (formerly SAC Capital), and owner of the New York Mets baseball team. One of the most successful traders in Wall Street history. Paid $1.8 billion to settle SEC insider trading charges at SAC.

martin-indyk.name: Martin Indyk
martin-indyk.bio: Australian-American diplomat (1951-2024). Born in London, raised in Australia. U.S. Ambassador to Israel twice. Special Envoy for Israeli-Palestinian Negotiations. Founded the Washington Institute for Near East Policy.

robert-satloff.name: Robert Satloff
robert-satloff.bio: American foreign policy expert and executive director of The Washington Institute for Near East Policy, a prominent think tank focused on US policy in the Middle East. Author of "Among the Righteous" about Arab rescuers of Jews during the Holocaust.

affiliations.organization: Washington Institute for Near East Policy (WINEP)
Washington Institute for Near East Policy (WINEP)

yigal-carmon.name: Yigal Carmon
yigal-carmon.bio: Israeli intelligence officer (retired) and founder and president of MEMRI (Middle East Media Research Institute). Formerly served as counterterrorism advisor to Israeli Prime Ministers Yitzhak Shamir and Yitzhak Rabin. Translates Arabic and Farsi media for Western audiences.

mark-dubowitz.name: Mark Dubowitz
mark-dubowitz.bio: Canadian-American policy expert and CEO of the Foundation for Defense of Democracies (FDD), a Washington think tank. Widely credited as the architect of many US sanctions against Iran. Has testified before Congress numerous times on Iran and Middle East policy.

daniel-pipes.name: Daniel Pipes
daniel-pipes.bio: American historian, writer, and president of the Middle East Forum. A prominent neoconservative commentator on Islam and the Middle East. Founded Campus Watch to monitor Middle East studies at American universities. Son of historian Richard Pipes.

ralph-lauren.name: Ralph Lauren
ralph-lauren.bio: American fashion designer and billionaire. Born Ralph Lifshitz 1939 in the Bronx to a Jewish family from Belarus. Founded Polo Ralph Lauren Corporation in 1967. Built one of the world's most recognized luxury brands. Net worth approximately $7 billion.

calvin-klein.name: Calvin Klein
calvin-klein.bio: American fashion designer. Born 1942 in the Bronx, New York, to a Jewish family of Hungarian immigrants. Founded Calvin Klein Inc. in 1968. Pioneer of designer jeans and provocative advertising. Sold company to PVH Corporation in 2003.

levi-strauss.name: Levi Strauss
levi-strauss.bio: Founder of Levi Strauss & Co. Bavarian Jewish immigrant who created blue jeans during the California Gold Rush.

marc-jacobs.name: Marc Jacobs
marc-jacobs.bio: American fashion designer and founder of the Marc Jacobs brand. Jewish American who served as creative director of Louis Vuitton for 16 years (1997-2013), transforming it into a fashion powerhouse. Known for his eclectic, avant-garde designs and cultural influence.

michael-kors.name: Michael Kors
michael-kors.bio: American fashion designer. Born Karl Anderson Jr. 1959, later legally changed name. Jewish heritage through his stepfather (Karl Kors). Built Michael Kors Holdings (now Capri Holdings) into a multi-billion dollar luxury fashion empire.

donna-karan.name: Donna Karan
donna-karan.bio: American fashion designer. Born 1948 in Forest Hills, Queens, to a Jewish family. Founded Donna Karan International and DKNY. Creator of the "Seven Easy Pieces" concept for women's professional wardrobes. Sold to LVMH in 2001.

donald-fisher.name: Donald Fisher
donald-fisher.bio: American businessman (1928-2009). Co-founded Gap Inc. in 1969 with his wife Doris in San Francisco. Grew Gap into a global retail empire including Banana Republic, Old Navy, and Athleta. Major philanthropist and art collector.

doris-fisher.name: Doris Fisher
doris-fisher.bio: American billionaire businesswoman and philanthropist. Born 1931. Co-founded Gap Inc. in 1969 with her husband Donald Fisher. Their first Gap store opened in San Francisco selling Levi's jeans. Gap grew into a global retail empire. Major art collector and philanthropist.

bernie-marcus.name: Bernie Marcus
bernie-marcus.bio: American billionaire businessman and co-founder of The Home Depot. Built the company from scratch into the world's largest home improvement retailer with over 2,300 stores. Major Republican donor and philanthropist, founding the Georgia Aquarium and supporting veterans causes.

jeffrey-brotman.name: Jeffrey Brotman
jeffrey-brotman.bio: American businessman (1942-2017). Born to a Jewish family in Tacoma, Washington. Co-founded Costco Wholesale with Jim Sinegal in 1983 in Seattle. Served as chairman of the board. Costco grew to become the world's third-largest retailer.

charles-revson.name: Charles Revson
charles-revson.bio: American businessman (1906-1975). Born to a Jewish family in Boston. Co-founded Revlon cosmetics in 1932, building it into a global beauty empire. Pioneer of modern cosmetics marketing and the concept of "selling hope" rather than just products.

irwin-jacobs.name: Irwin Jacobs
irwin-jacobs.bio: American electrical engineer and billionaire. Born 1933, Jewish family in New Bedford, Massachusetts. Co-founded Qualcomm in 1985, which became a dominant mobile technology company. Developed CDMA technology used in modern cellular networks. Major philanthropist.

andrew-grove.name: Andrew Grove
andrew-grove.bio: Hungarian-born American Jewish business executive (1936-2016) and former chairman and CEO of Intel Corporation. A Holocaust survivor who escaped communist Hungary in 1956. Named Time magazine's Person of the Year in 1997 for his role in the microprocessor revolution.

henry-samueli.name: Henry Samueli
henry-samueli.bio: American billionaire engineer, co-founder and CTO of Broadcom Corporation, a leading semiconductor company. Born to Jewish Holocaust survivors from Poland. Owner of the Anaheim Ducks NHL team and major philanthropist in science and engineering education.

marc-benioff.name: Marc Benioff
marc-benioff.bio: American billionaire businessman. Born 1964 in San Francisco, Jewish family. Founder, Chairman, and CEO of Salesforce, the world's largest CRM platform valued at over $250 billion. Pioneer of cloud computing and the 1-1-1 philanthropic model. Major media owner (Time magazine).

peter-thiel.name: Peter Thiel
peter-thiel.bio: German-American billionaire entrepreneur. Born 1967 in Frankfurt, Germany. Co-founded PayPal with Elon Musk and others, and Palantir with Alex Karp. First outside investor in Facebook. Libertarian political donor. Partner at Founders Fund.

alex-karp.name: Alex Karp
alex-karp.bio: American businessman. Born 1967 to a Jewish father. Co-founder and CEO of Palantir Technologies, a data analytics company worth over $50 billion that works with intelligence agencies, military, and law enforcement. PhD in neoclassical social theory from Goethe University Frankfurt.

sam-altman.name: Sam Altman
sam-altman.bio: American entrepreneur and CEO of OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT and GPT-4. Former president of the startup accelerator Y Combinator. Jewish American who has become one of the most influential figures in artificial intelligence and technology.

travis-kalanick.name: Travis Kalanick
travis-kalanick.bio: American tech entrepreneur. Born 1976 in Los Angeles. Co-founder and former CEO of Uber Technologies. Grew Uber into a $70B+ company before being forced out in 2017 amid workplace culture scandals. College dropout who previously founded Red Swoosh (acquired by Akamai).

nathan-blecharczyk.name: Nathan Blecharczyk
nathan-blecharczyk.bio: American internet entrepreneur. Born 1984 in Boston. Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer of Airbnb, the world's largest hospitality platform. Wrote the original code for Airbnb. Mother is of Jewish heritage from Poland.

adam-neumann.name: Adam Neumann
adam-neumann.bio: Israeli-American entrepreneur. Born 1979 in Israel. Co-founded WeWork in 2010. Built it into a $47B valuation before a spectacular implosion in 2019 amid corporate governance scandals. Received $1.7B exit package from SoftBank. Currently building Flow, a residential real estate startup.

max-levchin.name: Max Levchin
max-levchin.bio: Ukrainian-born American entrepreneur. Born 1975 in Kyiv to a Jewish family. Co-founded PayPal with Peter Thiel. Later founded Yelp, Affirm (BNPL fintech, IPO'd 2021), and Slide. One of the original "PayPal Mafia" members who went on to reshape Silicon Valley.

brian-roberts.name: Brian Roberts
brian-roberts.bio: American billionaire businessman, chairman and CEO of Comcast Corporation, the largest broadcasting and cable television company in the world. Son of founder Ralph Roberts. Under his leadership, Comcast acquired NBCUniversal and Sky Group.

daniel-katz.name: Daniel Katz
daniel-katz.bio: American film producer and co-founder of A24, the independent entertainment company known for critically acclaimed films like Moonlight, Everything Everywhere All at Once, and Hereditary. A24 has become one of the most influential studios in modern cinema.

bryan-lourd.name: Bryan Lourd
bryan-lourd.bio: American talent agent. Co-Chairman of Creative Artists Agency (CAA), one of the most powerful talent agencies in Hollywood. Born 1960 in New Iberia, Louisiana. Represents A-list actors, directors, and musicians.

ari-emanuel.name: Ari Emanuel
ari-emanuel.bio: American talent agent and entertainment executive. Born 1961 in Chicago to a Jewish family (parents were Israeli). CEO of Endeavor Group (formerly WME-IMG). Brother of former Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel. One of the most powerful figures in Hollywood.

sumner-redstone.name: Sumner Redstone
sumner-redstone.bio: American media magnate (1923-2020). Born Sumner Murray Rothstein in Boston to a Jewish family. Chairman of National Amusements, controlling Viacom and CBS. Built a media empire worth tens of billions. Father of Shari Redstone.

bob-pittman.name: Bob Pittman
bob-pittman.bio: Media executive who co-founded MTV and now leads iHeartMedia. Navigated the company through bankruptcy and rebuilt it as a multimedia platform.

a-g-sulzberger.name: A.G. Sulzberger
a-g-sulzberger.bio: American journalist and the fifth-generation publisher of The New York Times, taking over from his father Arthur Sulzberger Jr. in 2018. At 37, he became One of the youngest publishers in the paper's history. Has led the Times's digital transformation.

andrew-breitbart.name: Andrew Breitbart
andrew-breitbart.bio: American conservative publisher and political commentator (1969-2012) who founded Breitbart News. Previously helped launch The Huffington Post and the Drudge Report. Jewish American who became a leading figure in conservative media before his sudden death at age 43.

lynn-schusterman.name: Lynn Schusterman
lynn-schusterman.bio: American billionaire philanthropist and founder of the Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Foundation. Has donated over $3 billion to Jewish causes, education, and social justice. A major supporter of Birthright Israel and Jewish youth engagement programs.

affiliations.organization: Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Philanthropies
Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Philanthropies

charles-bronfman.name: Charles Bronfman
charles-bronfman.bio: Canadian-American businessman and philanthropist. Son of Samuel Bronfman (Seagram's). Co-founder of Birthright Israel with Michael Steinhardt. Founded the Andrea & Charles Bronfman Philanthropies. Former owner of the Montreal Expos.

seth-klarman.name: Seth Klarman
seth-klarman.bio: American billionaire value investor and CEO of Baupost Group, one of the largest hedge funds with $30+ billion in AUM. Jewish American known for his contrarian investment style. Author of the cult classic "Margin of Safety," copies of which sell for thousands of dollars.

penny-pritzker.name: Penny Pritzker
penny-pritzker.bio: American billionaire businesswoman and former US Secretary of Commerce under President Obama. Member of the Pritzker family, one of the wealthiest Jewish families in America. Co-founded PSP Capital Partners and served as national finance chair of Obama's 2008 campaign.

leslie-wexner.name: Leslie Wexner
leslie-wexner.bio: American billionaire businessman. Founder and former CEO of L Brands (Victoria's Secret, Bath & Body Works). Epstein's only known major financial client. Gave Epstein sweeping power of attorney over his finances. Transferred his $77 million Manhattan townhouse to Epstein. Epstein posed as a Victoria's Secret recruiter to lure models and young women. Wexner's foundation provided Epstein with institutional legitimacy. Wexner has said he was "never aware of the illegal activity" and severed ties before the 2008 plea deal, though the exact timeline is disputed. His wife Abigail managed the family's philanthropic reputation afterward.

rabbi-yehoshua-fass.name: Rabbi Yehoshua Fass
rabbi-yehoshua-fass.bio: American-Israeli rabbi and social entrepreneur. Co-founded Nefesh B'Nefesh in 2002 with Tony Gelbart to facilitate and encourage North American and British aliyah (immigration to Israel). Nefesh B'Nefesh has helped bring over 75,000 olim to Israel.

harold-grinspoon.name: Harold Grinspoon
harold-grinspoon.bio: American Jewish philanthropist and founder of the Harold Grinspoon Foundation. Created the PJ Library program that distributes free Jewish children's books to families worldwide, reaching over 680,000 children in 35 countries.

albert-bourla.name: Albert Bourla
albert-bourla.bio: Greek-Jewish CEO of Pfizer whose parents survived the Holocaust in Thessaloniki.

leonard-schleifer.name: Leonard Schleifer
leonard-schleifer.bio: American physician-scientist and billionaire. Born 1953, Jewish family in Queens, New York. Co-founder, President, and CEO of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals, which developed REGN-COV2 (COVID-19 antibody treatment) and Eylea (eye disease drug). Net worth exceeds $3 billion.

howard-lutnick.name: Howard Lutnick
howard-lutnick.bio: American businessman. Born 1961 in Jericho, New York, to a Jewish family. Chairman and CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald. Lost 658 employees (including his brother) in the 9/11 attacks. Rebuilt the firm and committed to paying families of victims. U.S. Secretary of Commerce (2025-present).

alexandre-lazard.name: Alexandre Lazard
alexandre-lazard.bio: French-American banker (19th century). Jewish co-founder of Lazard Freres in 1848 in New Orleans with his brothers Simon and Elie. Lazard grew into one of the world's most prestigious financial advisory firms. The Lazard family were Sephardic Jews from France.

uri-levine.name: Uri Levine
uri-levine.bio: Israeli entrepreneur, co-founder of Waze, the world's largest community-based traffic and navigation app. Waze was acquired by Google for $1.15 billion in 2013. Serial entrepreneur and author of "Fall in Love with the Problem, Not the Solution."

ehud-shabtai.name: Ehud Shabtai
ehud-shabtai.bio: Israeli entrepreneur and co-founder of Waze, the community-based navigation app acquired by Google for $1.15 billion. Led the technical development of the platform. Has continued to invest in Israeli tech startups after the Waze acquisition.

dave-waiser.name: Dave Waiser
dave-waiser.bio: Russian-Israeli entrepreneur. Founder and CEO of Gett, a technology platform for corporate ground transportation and taxi services operating in Israel, the UK, and Russia. Built Gett into one of the largest ride-hailing companies outside the U.S.

daniel-ramot.name: Daniel Ramot
daniel-ramot.bio: Israeli-American entrepreneur. Co-founder and CEO of Via, a transportation technology company that partners with public transit agencies to power on-demand mobility networks. Via's technology is used in over 600 communities across 35 countries.

tomer-weingarten.name: Tomer Weingarten
tomer-weingarten.bio: Israeli cybersecurity entrepreneur. Co-founder and CEO of SentinelOne, an AI-powered cybersecurity platform that IPO'd on the NYSE in 2021 at a valuation of nearly $9 billion. Previously served in Israeli intelligence (Unit 8200). Pioneer of autonomous endpoint protection.

guy-podjarny.name: Guy Podjarny
guy-podjarny.bio: Israeli cybersecurity entrepreneur. Co-founder and president of Snyk, a developer security platform valued at over $7 billion. Previously worked at Akamai Technologies. Pioneer in developer-first security tooling.

shlomi-ben-haim.name: Shlomi Ben Haim
shlomi-ben-haim.bio: Israeli tech executive. Co-founder and CEO of JFrog, a DevOps software company that IPO'd on NASDAQ in 2020 at a valuation exceeding $4 billion. Based in Sunnyvale, California, with major operations in Israel.

daniel-schreiber.name: Daniel Schreiber
daniel-schreiber.bio: Israeli-American entrepreneur, co-founder and CEO of Lemonade Inc., a technology-driven insurance company powered by AI and behavioral economics. Previously served as president of Powermat Technologies. Transformed insurance with a digital-first approach.

shai-wininger.name: Shai Wininger
shai-wininger.bio: Israeli entrepreneur and co-founder of Lemonade Inc. alongside Daniel Schreiber. Previously co-founded Fiverr, the global online marketplace for freelance services. A serial entrepreneur who has disrupted multiple industries through technology innovation.

yuval-tal.name: Yuval Tal
yuval-tal.bio: Israeli fintech entrepreneur. Co-founded Payoneer, a financial services company providing cross-border payments for freelancers and businesses in over 200 countries. Also co-founded Borderfree (acquired by Pitney Bowes). Serial entrepreneur in Israeli tech sector.

adam-singolda.name: Adam Singolda
adam-singolda.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Founder and CEO of Taboola, the world's largest content discovery platform, powering recommendations for major publishers including NBC, Bloomberg, and Der Spiegel. Built Taboola from an Israeli startup to a publicly traded company on NASDAQ.

yaron-galai.name: Yaron Galai
yaron-galai.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Co-founded Outbrain, a leading content recommendation platform used by major publishers worldwide. Previously co-founded Quigo (acquired by AOL). Born in Israel. Pioneer in content discovery and native advertising technology.

dan-adika.name: Dan Adika
dan-adika.bio: Israeli fashion tech entrepreneur. Co-founder and CEO of Kape Technologies (formerly Crossrider) and the fast-fashion brand Adika. Built one of Israel's leading direct-to-consumer fashion brands targeting young women.

shalev-hulio.name: Shalev Hulio
shalev-hulio.bio: Israeli entrepreneur. Co-founder and former CEO of NSO Group, the controversial Israeli cybersecurity company that developed Pegasus, the world's most notorious spyware. Pegasus has been used by governments worldwide to surveil journalists, activists, and political opponents.

simcha-blass.name: Simcha Blass
simcha-blass.bio: Israeli engineer and inventor (1897-1982) who developed modern drip irrigation technology. Born in Warsaw, immigrated to Palestine in 1930. His invention revolutionized agriculture worldwide, enabling farming in arid regions and saving billions of gallons of water.

michael-marks.name: Michael Marks
michael-marks.bio: Co-founder of Marks & Spencer. A Belarusian Jewish immigrant who started with a market stall in Leeds with the motto "Don't ask the price, it's a penny."

nathan-mayer-rothschild.name: Nathan Mayer Rothschild
nathan-mayer-rothschild.bio: German-born British Jewish financier (1777-1836) who founded N M Rothschild & Sons in London. The third son of Mayer Amschel Rothschild, he became the wealthiest man in Britain and arguably the world. Financed Britain's war against Napoleon.

roman-abramovich.name: Roman Abramovich
roman-abramovich.bio: Russian-Israeli Jewish billionaire businessman and former owner of Chelsea Football Club (2003-2022). Made his fortune in the post-Soviet oil industry. Forced to sell Chelsea due to UK sanctions following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Israeli and Portuguese citizen.

daniel-levy.name: Daniel Levy
daniel-levy.bio: British Jewish businessman and chairman of Tottenham Hotspur Football Club since 2001. Oversaw the construction of the new $1.3 billion Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, one of the most advanced sports venues in the world. Known for tough negotiations in transfer markets.

sir-naim-dangoor.name: Sir Naim Dangoor
sir-naim-dangoor.bio: British-Iraqi Jewish businessman and philanthropist (1914-2015) who founded the Exilarch's Foundation to preserve Babylonian Jewish heritage. Born in Baghdad, he built a property empire in the UK. Published "The Scribe," a journal of Babylonian Jewish heritage.

david-de-rothschild.name: David de Rothschild
david-de-rothschild.bio: Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Rothschild & Co. Head of the French branch of the Rothschild banking family.

mathias-d-pfner.name: Mathias Döpfner
mathias-d-pfner.bio: German journalist and CEO of Axel Springer SE, Europe's largest digital publishing house. Under his leadership, Springer acquired Business Insider, Politico, and other digital media properties. A prominent supporter of Israel and critic of antisemitism.

gail-asper.name: Gail Asper
gail-asper.bio: Canadian businesswoman, philanthropist, and president of the Asper Foundation. Led the campaign to build the Canadian Museum for Human Rights in Winnipeg as a legacy of her father Israel (Izzy) Asper. Major figure in Canadian Jewish philanthropy and media.

edgar-bronfman-sr.name: Edgar Bronfman Sr.
edgar-bronfman-sr.bio: Canadian-American businessman (1929-2013). Born to a Jewish family in Montreal. CEO of Seagram Company. President of the World Jewish Congress (1981-2007). Major figure in Jewish communal life and business. Father of Edgar Jr. (Warner Music). Bronfman family fortune from Seagram liquor.

paul-reichmann.name: Paul Reichmann
paul-reichmann.bio: Canadian-Austrian Jewish real estate developer (1930-2013) who built Olympia & York into the world's largest commercial real estate company. Developed Canary Wharf in London and the World Financial Center in New York. An ultra-Orthodox Jew and major Jewish philanthropist.

heather-reisman.name: Heather Reisman
heather-reisman.bio: Canadian Jewish businesswoman, founder and CEO of Indigo Books & Music, Canada's largest bookstore chain. A leading figure in Canadian Jewish philanthropy, she founded the Heseg Foundation for Lone Soldiers in Israel. Married to Onex CEO Gerry Schwartz.

gerry-schwartz.name: Gerry Schwartz
gerry-schwartz.bio: Canadian Jewish billionaire businessman and founder and CEO of Onex Corporation, one of Canada's largest private equity firms managing over $50 billion. A major donor to Canadian and Jewish causes alongside wife Heather Reisman.

frank-lowy.name: Frank Lowy
frank-lowy.bio: Czech-born Australian-Israeli Jewish billionaire businessman and co-founder of Westfield Corporation, one of the world's largest shopping center companies. Holocaust survivor who fought in Israel's War of Independence before immigrating to Australia.

harry-triguboff.name: Harry Triguboff
harry-triguboff.bio: Chinese-born Australian Jewish billionaire, Australia's richest property developer.

mikhail-fridman.name: Mikhail Fridman
mikhail-fridman.bio: Ukrainian-born Russian-Israeli Jewish billionaire businessman and co-founder of Alfa Group, one of Russia's largest financial and industrial conglomerates. Co-founded LetterOne investment vehicle. Has faced EU sanctions over Russia ties since 2022.

viktor-vekselberg.name: Viktor Vekselberg
viktor-vekselberg.bio: Ukrainian-born Russian-Israeli Jewish billionaire industrialist and founder of the Renova Group. Made his fortune in aluminum and oil. Known for purchasing a collection of Faberge eggs for over $100 million and for philanthropic investments in innovation.

ernest-oppenheimer.name: Ernest Oppenheimer
ernest-oppenheimer.bio: German-born South African mining magnate (1880-1957) who founded the Anglo American Corporation and transformed De Beers into a global diamond monopoly. Born to a Jewish family in Friedberg, Germany. Built one of the most powerful mining empires in history.

nicky-oppenheimer.name: Nicky Oppenheimer
nicky-oppenheimer.bio: South African billionaire businessman, former chairman of De Beers (1998-2012), and grandson of Ernest Oppenheimer. Sold the family's 40% stake in De Beers to Anglo American for $5.1 billion. One of the wealthiest people in Africa.

adrian-gore.name: Adrian Gore
adrian-gore.bio: South African Jewish businessman, founder and CEO of Discovery Limited, a pioneering insurance company whose Vitality wellness program operates in over 40 markets. Named one of the most innovative companies globally. Transformed insurance through behavioral economics.

joseph-safra.name: Joseph Safra
joseph-safra.bio: Brazilian-Lebanese Jewish banking magnate (1938-2020) who built the Safra banking dynasty into one of the world's wealthiest families. Controlled Banco Safra and J. Safra Sarasin. Born in Beirut to a Sephardic Jewish family with banking roots dating to Ottoman times.

affiliations.organization: Safra National Bank of New York

george-soros.name: George Soros
george-soros.bio: Hungarian-American billionaire investor and philanthropist. Born 1930 in Budapest to a Jewish family that survived the Holocaust by posing as Christians. Founded Open Society Foundations. Known for "breaking the Bank of England." Major progressive political donor. Frequent target of antisemitic conspiracy theories.

len-blavatnik.name: Len Blavatnik
len-blavatnik.bio: Soviet-born British-American billionaire businessman. Founder and chairman of Access Industries. Owner of Warner Music Group. One of the largest donors to Oxford University and other institutions. Born to a Jewish family in Odessa, Ukraine.

bernie-sanders.name: Bernie Sanders
bernie-sanders.bio: American politician. Born 1941 in Brooklyn to a Jewish family of Polish immigrants. U.S. Senator from Vermont since 2007. Independent who caucuses with Democrats. Presidential candidate 2016, 2020. First Jewish candidate to win a presidential primary.

chuck-schumer.name: Chuck Schumer
chuck-schumer.bio: American politician. Born 1950 in Brooklyn, New York, to a Jewish family. U.S. Senate Majority Leader (2021-2025). Senior U.S. Senator from New York since 1999. Highest-ranking Jewish elected official in American history. Strong supporter of Israel.

antony-blinken.name: Antony Blinken
antony-blinken.bio: American diplomat and 71st US Secretary of State under President Biden. Jewish American stepson of Holocaust survivor Samuel Pisar. Has led US foreign policy through the Ukraine crisis, Israel-Hamas war, and strategic competition with China.

janet-yellen.name: Janet Yellen
janet-yellen.bio: American economist. Born 1946 in Brooklyn to a Jewish family. First female U.S. Secretary of the Treasury (2021-present). First female Chair of the Federal Reserve (2014-2018). Also first woman to head the Council of Economic Advisers.

merrick-garland.name: Merrick Garland
merrick-garland.bio: American jurist. Born 1952 in Chicago to a Jewish family. 86th U.S. Attorney General (2021-present). Previously served as Chief Judge of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit. Nominated to the Supreme Court by Obama in 2016 but denied a hearing by Senate Republicans.

jerry-seinfeld.name: Jerry Seinfeld
jerry-seinfeld.bio: American comedian, actor, and writer, best known as the creator and star of the sitcom Seinfeld (1989-1998), one of the most successful TV shows in history. Jewish American who has been outspoken in his support of Israel. Net worth estimated at nearly $1 billion.

seth-rogen.name: Seth Rogen
seth-rogen.bio: Canadian-American Jewish actor, comedian, filmmaker, and screenwriter known for films including Superbad, Knocked Up, and The Interview. Co-founded Houseplant cannabis company and Hilarity for Charity. Born to Jewish parents in Vancouver.

gal-gadot.name: Gal Gadot
gal-gadot.bio: Israeli actress, model, and producer best known for portraying Wonder Woman in the DC Extended Universe. Former Miss Israel (2004) and served in the Israel Defense Forces. One of the highest-paid actresses in Hollywood and a global ambassador for Israeli identity.

natalie-portman.name: Natalie Portman
natalie-portman.bio: Israeli-American actress born in Jerusalem. Won the Academy Award for Best Actress for Black Swan (2010). A Harvard graduate in psychology, she has appeared in over 40 films including the Star Wars prequels. Has been critical of Israeli government policies while supporting the country.

scarlett-johansson.name: Scarlett Johansson
scarlett-johansson.bio: American actress of Ashkenazi Jewish descent who became one of the highest-grossing box office stars in history through the Marvel Cinematic Universe as Black Widow. Has won BAFTA and Tony awards. Briefly served as SodaStream ambassador, sparking BDS controversy.

albert-einstein.name: Albert Einstein
albert-einstein.bio: German-born American theoretical physicist. Nobel Prize in Physics (1921). Born 1879 in Ulm, Germany, to a Jewish family. Developed theory of relativity. Emigrated to US in 1933. Died 1955. Offered presidency of Israel in 1952.

j-robert-oppenheimer.name: J. Robert Oppenheimer
j-robert-oppenheimer.bio: American Jewish theoretical physicist (1904-1967), known as the "father of the atomic bomb" for directing the Manhattan Project at Los Alamos. Later opposed hydrogen bomb development and had his security clearance revoked during McCarthyism. Posthumously exonerated in 2022.

richard-feynman.name: Richard Feynman
richard-feynman.bio: American Jewish theoretical physicist (1918-1988) who made fundamental contributions to quantum electrodynamics, earning the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1965. Known for his charismatic teaching, bestselling memoirs, and role investigating the Challenger disaster.

noam-chomsky.name: Noam Chomsky
noam-chomsky.bio: American linguist, philosopher, and political activist. Institute Professor Emeritus at MIT. One of the most cited scholars in history. Met with Jeffrey Epstein multiple times after his 2008 conviction, including at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse. Confirmed meetings in 2015 and 2016. Said he saw nothing wrong with meeting Epstein and that "what's the point" of asking about it. Also arranged for Epstein to meet with other academics.

jeff-zucker.name: Jeff Zucker
jeff-zucker.bio: American Jewish media executive who served as CEO of NBCUniversal and president of CNN. Credited with making Today the #1 morning show and greenlighting The Apprentice. Left CNN in 2022 after failing to disclose a workplace relationship.

les-moonves.name: Les Moonves
les-moonves.bio: American media executive. Born 1949 in Brooklyn to a Jewish family. CEO of CBS (2003-2018). Forced to resign amid #MeToo sexual misconduct allegations from multiple women. Denied $120M severance. Transformed CBS into the most-watched U.S. network.

ariel-muzicant.name: Ariel Muzicant
ariel-muzicant.bio: Austrian Jewish businessman and former president of the Jewish Community of Vienna (IKG) and vice-president of the European Jewish Congress. A leading voice against antisemitism in Austria and a prominent real estate developer.

henry-lehman.name: Henry Lehman
henry-lehman.bio: German-Jewish immigrant (1822-1855) who founded H. Lehman, a general store in Montgomery, Alabama, in 1844. This became the origin of Lehman Brothers, which grew into one of the most powerful investment banks in history before its 2008 collapse.

alan-greenberg.name: Alan Greenberg
alan-greenberg.bio: American investment banker (1927-2014). Born to a Jewish family in Wichita, Kansas. CEO and chairman of Bear Stearns for over 30 years (1978-1993 CEO, then chairman). Known for aggressive trading culture. His protege was Jeffrey Epstein, whom he hired at Bear Stearns in 1976.

arthur-salomon.name: Arthur Salomon
arthur-salomon.bio: American banker (1880-1962). Jewish co-founder of Salomon Brothers investment bank in 1910 with his brothers Herbert and Percy. Salomon Brothers became a Wall Street powerhouse and pioneer in bond trading before its acquisition by Travelers Group (later Citigroup).

jacob-schiff.name: Jacob Schiff
jacob-schiff.bio: German-born American Jewish banker and philanthropist (1847-1920) who led Kuhn, Loeb & Co. into one of the most influential investment banks in America. Financed Japan in the Russo-Japanese War and was the largest Jewish philanthropist of his era.

james-tisch.name: James Tisch
james-tisch.bio: American billionaire businessman. Born 1953 to the prominent Tisch Jewish family. CEO of Loews Corporation. Son of Laurence Tisch. The Tisch family are major philanthropists and leaders in New York Jewish communal life, supporting NYU and other institutions.

daniel-och.name: Daniel Och
daniel-och.bio: American Jewish hedge fund manager, founder of Sculptor Capital Management (formerly Och-Ziff Capital Management). Former Goldman Sachs partner who built one of the largest hedge funds before the firm faced foreign bribery charges in Africa.

steven-a-cohen.name: Steven A. Cohen
steven-a-cohen.bio: American Jewish billionaire hedge fund manager and founder of SAC Capital Advisors and its successor Point72 Asset Management. One of the most successful traders in Wall Street history. Owner of the New York Mets. Paid $1.8 billion in SAC insider trading settlement.

daniel-loeb.name: Daniel Loeb
daniel-loeb.bio: American Jewish activist investor, founder and CEO of Third Point LLC. Known for his combative activist campaigns against companies including Sony, Yahoo, and Campbell Soup. An art collector with a net worth exceeding $4 billion.

carl-icahn.name: Carl Icahn
carl-icahn.bio: American billionaire financier. Founder of Icahn Enterprises. Known as a corporate raider and activist investor. Has taken major positions in companies including TWA, Texaco, and Apple. Born to a Jewish family in Queens, New York.

marcus-goldman.name: Marcus Goldman
