robert-bank.bio: President and CEO of American Jewish World Service, the premier Jewish global human rights organization.

jonathan-davis.name: Jonathan Davis
jonathan-davis.bio: Director General and CEO of World ORT, operating education programs in 35 countries.

moshe-kantor.name: Moshe Kantor
moshe-kantor.bio: Russian-Israeli industrialist and former president of the European Jewish Congress. Sanctioned by the EU in 2022.

peter-orszag.name: Peter Orszag
peter-orszag.bio: CEO of Lazard. Former Director of the Office of Management and Budget under President Obama.

mark-walter.name: Mark Walter
mark-walter.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Guggenheim Partners. Part-owner of the Los Angeles Dodgers.

rich-handler.name: Rich Handler
rich-handler.bio: CEO of Jefferies Financial Group since 2001. Known for his active social media presence and leadership style.

ken-moelis.name: Ken Moelis
ken-moelis.bio: Founder, Chairman and CEO of Moelis & Company. Former head of UBS Investment Bank.

roger-altman.name: Roger Altman
roger-altman.bio: Founder and Senior Chairman of Evercore. Former Deputy Secretary of the US Treasury under President Clinton.

john-weinberg-evercore.name: John Weinberg
john-weinberg-evercore.bio: American banker and executive at Evercore, the independent investment banking advisory firm. Part of a noted Wall Street family. Has advised on major corporate transactions in his career in investment banking.

chip-kaye.name: Chip Kaye
chip-kaye.bio: American businessman and managing partner of Warburg Pincus, one of the world's largest private equity firms. Under his leadership, Warburg Pincus has grown to manage over $80 billion in assets. Previously served as co-president of the firm.

michael-arougheti.name: Michael Arougheti
michael-arougheti.bio: Co-founder, CEO and President of Ares Management. Leading figure in alternative credit markets.

david-e-shaw.name: David E. Shaw
david-e-shaw.bio: Founder of D.E. Shaw. Computational scientist turned hedge fund pioneer. Jeff Bezos worked at D.E. Shaw before founding Amazon.

kenneth-griffin.name: Kenneth Griffin
kenneth-griffin.bio: Founder and CEO of Citadel. Billionaire investor and major political donor. Moved Citadel headquarters from Chicago to Miami.

john-overdeck.name: John Overdeck
john-overdeck.bio: American billionaire mathematician and co-founder of Two Sigma Investments, a quantitative hedge fund managing over $60 billion. Previously worked at D.E. Shaw and Amazon. Known for applying advanced mathematics and AI to financial markets.

joey-levin.name: Joey Levin
joey-levin.bio: American businessman and CEO of IAC, the media and Internet holding company controlled by Barry Diller. Oversees a portfolio including Dotdash Meredith, Care.com, and other digital businesses. Led the spinoff of Match Group and Vimeo.

bobby-kotick.name: Bobby Kotick
bobby-kotick.bio: Former CEO of Activision Blizzard (1991-2023). Led the company through its growth into one of the largest gaming companies before the Microsoft acquisition.

donald-newhouse.name: Donald Newhouse
donald-newhouse.bio: American billionaire. Co-owner of Advance Publications (Conde Nast, Reddit, Discovery). Named in Epstein's black book. One of the wealthiest and most reclusive media owners in America.

dara-khosrowshahi.name: Dara Khosrowshahi
dara-khosrowshahi.bio: Iranian-American businessman. Born 1969 in Tehran to a Jewish-Iranian family (Baha'i-Jewish heritage). CEO of Uber Technologies since 2017. Previously CEO of Expedia (2005-2017). His family fled Iran during the 1979 revolution.

brian-chesky.name: Brian Chesky
brian-chesky.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Airbnb. Transformed the hospitality industry with the home-sharing platform.

stephen-m-ross.name: Stephen M. Ross
stephen-m-ross.bio: Founder and Chairman of Related Companies. Billionaire developer behind Hudson Yards. Owner of the Miami Dolphins.

jerry-speyer.name: Jerry Speyer
jerry-speyer.bio: Chairman and Co-CEO of Tishman Speyer. Billionaire real estate developer who led the acquisition of Rockefeller Center.

ron-liebowitz.name: Ron Liebowitz
ron-liebowitz.bio: President of Brandeis University. Political geographer and former president of Middlebury College.

stacy-schusterman.name: Stacy Schusterman
stacy-schusterman.bio: Chair of Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Philanthropies. Daughter of founder Charles Schusterman.

affiliations.organization: Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Foundation
Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Philanthropies

micky-arison.name: Micky Arison
micky-arison.bio: Owner of the Miami Heat. Israeli-American billionaire and former CEO of Carnival Corporation.

richard-francis-teva.name: Richard Francis
richard-francis-teva.bio: CEO of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, the world's largest generic drug manufacturer.

lahav-shani.name: Lahav Shani
lahav-shani.bio: Music Director of the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra and the Berlin Philharmonic. One of the youngest conductors to lead both ensembles.

yitshak-kreiss.name: Yitshak Kreiss
yitshak-kreiss.bio: Director General of Sheba Medical Center, the largest hospital in the Middle East.

ephraim-mirvis.name: Ephraim Mirvis
ephraim-mirvis.bio: Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations of the Commonwealth since 2013. South African-born Orthodox rabbi.

karen-pollock.name: Karen Pollock
karen-pollock.bio: CEO of the Holocaust Educational Trust. CBE for services to Holocaust education.

alexandre-de-rothschild.name: Alexandre de Rothschild
alexandre-de-rothschild.bio: Chairman of Rothschild & Co. Seventh generation of the Rothschild banking dynasty.

stuart-machin.name: Stuart Machin
stuart-machin.bio: British businessman and CEO of Marks & Spencer since 2022. Has led the retailer's turnaround strategy focusing on food, clothing quality, and digital transformation. Previously served as Managing Director of M&S Food.

haim-korsia.name: Haim Korsia
haim-korsia.bio: French rabbi and the Grand Rabbi of France since 2014. The spiritual leader of French Jewry, he has worked to strengthen interfaith dialogue and combat antisemitism in France. Also serves as an officer in the French military reserves.

arthur-sadoun.name: Arthur Sadoun
arthur-sadoun.bio: Chairman and CEO of Publicis Groupe, one of the world's largest advertising groups.

nicolas-brusson.name: Nicolas Brusson
nicolas-brusson.bio: French tech entrepreneur. Co-founder and CEO of BlaBlaCar, the world's leading long-distance carpooling platform. Grew BlaBlaCar from a French startup to a global company operating in 22 countries with over 100 million members.

mathias-dopfner.name: Mathias Dopfner
mathias-dopfner.bio: German journalist and CEO of Axel Springer SE, Europe's largest digital media company. Has transformed Springer from a traditional German publisher into a global digital media powerhouse owning Politico and Business Insider. Outspoken defender of Israel.

robert-brozin.name: Robert Brozin
robert-brozin.bio: South African Jewish entrepreneur who co-founded Nando's and built it into an international restaurant chain.

berel-lazar.name: Berel Lazar
berel-lazar.bio: Chief Rabbi of Russia since 2000. Italian-born Chabad-Lubavitch rabbi who has rebuilt Jewish life across Russia.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities of Russia

richard-lovett.name: Richard Lovett
richard-lovett.bio: American talent agent. President of Creative Artists Agency (CAA) since 1995, the most powerful talent agency in Hollywood. Born to a Jewish family. Represents some of the biggest names in entertainment.

michael-ovitz.name: Michael Ovitz
michael-ovitz.bio: American businessman. Co-founder of Creative Artists Agency (CAA) and briefly President of The Walt Disney Company. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers. One of the most powerful figures in Hollywood history.

steve-feinberg.name: Steve Feinberg
steve-feinberg.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Cerberus Capital Management. Former chairman of the President's Intelligence Advisory Board.

antony-ressler.name: Antony Ressler
antony-ressler.bio: Co-founder and Executive Chairman of Ares Management. Co-owner of the Atlanta Hawks NBA team.

leonard-lauder.name: Leonard Lauder
leonard-lauder.bio: American billionaire businessman. Chairman Emeritus of The Estée Lauder Companies. Born 1933 to a Jewish family. Major art philanthropist (donated $1B+ to Metropolitan Museum).

stephane-bancel.name: Stephane Bancel
stephane-bancel.bio: CEO of Moderna since 2011. French businessman who led the company through the COVID-19 pandemic.

noubar-afeyan.name: Noubar Afeyan
noubar-afeyan.bio: Co-founder and Chairman of Moderna. Founder of Flagship Pioneering venture capital firm.

george-yancopoulos.name: George Yancopoulos
george-yancopoulos.bio: Co-founder, President and Chief Scientific Officer of Regeneron. Greek-American geneticist.

eran-zinman.name: Eran Zinman
eran-zinman.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Co-founder and CTO of Monday.com, the work operating system platform. Built the technical architecture powering a platform used by 186,000+ organizations. Monday.com IPO'd on NASDAQ in 2021 at over $7.5B valuation.

simon-marks.name: Simon Marks
simon-marks.bio: Son of founder Michael Marks. Led M&S for decades and built it into a British retail institution. Created Baron Marks of Broughton.

marcus-samuel-shell.name: Marcus Samuel
marcus-samuel-shell.bio: Founder of Shell Transport and Trading Company. Jewish merchant who became 1st Viscount Bearsted and Lord Mayor of London.

paul-julius-reuter.name: Paul Julius Reuter
paul-julius-reuter.bio: Founder of Reuters news agency. Born Israel Beer Josaphat in Kassel, Germany. Pioneered the use of telegraph cables for news transmission.

adolphe-cremieux.name: Adolphe Cremieux
adolphe-cremieux.bio: Founding president of the Alliance Israelite Universelle. French lawyer, politician, and Minister of Justice who championed Jewish emancipation.

ugur-sahin.name: Ugur Sahin
ugur-sahin.bio: Co-founder and CEO of BioNTech. Turkish-German physician-scientist who led development of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.

ozlem-tureci.name: Ozlem Tureci
ozlem-tureci.bio: Co-founder and Chief Medical Officer of BioNTech. Ugur Sahin's wife and co-developer of the mRNA COVID-19 vaccine.

german-khan.name: German Khan
german-khan.bio: Co-founder of Alfa Group. Ukrainian-born Russian-Jewish billionaire and business partner of Mikhail Fridman.

raymond-ackerman.name: Raymond Ackerman
raymond-ackerman.bio: Founder of Pick n Pay. Jewish South African businessman and philanthropist who built one of Africa's largest retail chains. Died in 2023.

peter-lowy.name: Peter Lowy
peter-lowy.bio: Australian-American-Israeli Jewish billionaire businessman, co-chairman of the Lowy Family Group and former co-CEO of Westfield Corporation. Son of Frank Lowy. Manages the family's extensive real estate and investment portfolio.

richard-pratt-business.name: Richard Pratt
richard-pratt-business.bio: Founder of Pratt Industries. Jewish Australian billionaire and philanthropist who built the world's largest recycled packaging company. Died in 2009.

jorge-paulo-lemann.name: Jorge Paulo Lemann
jorge-paulo-lemann.bio: Co-founder of 3G Capital. Swiss-Brazilian billionaire and the wealthiest person in Brazil. Led acquisitions of Burger King and Kraft Heinz.

zygmunt-stepinski.name: Zygmunt Stepinski
zygmunt-stepinski.bio: Polish museum director and former head of the Jewish Historical Institute in Warsaw. Has worked to preserve Polish-Jewish heritage and the Ringelblum Archive, a UNESCO Memory of the World document from the Warsaw Ghetto.

piotr-cywinski.name: Piotr Cywinski
piotr-cywinski.bio: Polish historian and director of the Auschwitz-Birkenau State Museum since 2006. Has modernized the museum's educational programs and preservation efforts, welcoming over 2 million visitors annually to ensure the memory of the Holocaust endures.

ivan-glasenberg.name: Ivan Glasenberg
ivan-glasenberg.bio: Former CEO of Glencore (2002-2021). South African-born Jewish businessman who led Glencore's transformation and IPO.

michael-rapino.name: Michael Rapino
michael-rapino.bio: President and CEO of Live Nation Entertainment, the world's largest live entertainment company.

rich-barton.name: Rich Barton
rich-barton.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Zillow Group. Also founded Expedia and co-founded Glassdoor.

lloyd-frink.name: Lloyd Frink
lloyd-frink.bio: American Jewish entrepreneur and co-founder of Zillow Group. Served as president and vice chairman of Zillow. Previously worked at Microsoft. His technological leadership helped build Zillow into the dominant US real estate information platform.

neil-blumenthal.name: Neil Blumenthal
neil-blumenthal.bio: Co-founder and Co-CEO of Warby Parker. Disrupted the eyewear industry with direct-to-consumer model.

dave-gilboa.name: Dave Gilboa
dave-gilboa.bio: American entrepreneur. Co-founder and Co-CEO of Warby Parker, the eyewear company that disrupted the optical industry with affordable direct-to-consumer glasses. Born to a Jewish family. Warby Parker went public in 2021. Previously worked at Bain and Allen & Company.

herbert-simon.name: Herbert Simon
herbert-simon.bio: Co-founder of Simon Property Group. Jewish American businessman and philanthropist based in Indianapolis.

ralph-roberts.name: Ralph Roberts
ralph-roberts.bio: Co-founder of Comcast Corporation. Jewish American businessman from New York who moved to Philadelphia. Died in 2015.

henry-hassenfeld.name: Henry Hassenfeld
henry-hassenfeld.bio: Co-founder of Hasbro. Polish Jewish immigrant who started the company as a textile business in Providence, Rhode Island.

ruth-handler.name: Ruth Handler
ruth-handler.bio: Co-founder of Mattel and inventor of the Barbie doll. Born to a Jewish family of Polish immigrants in Denver, Colorado. Died in 2002.

ingvar-kamprad.name: Ingvar Kamprad
ingvar-kamprad.bio: Swedish billionaire founder of IKEA (1926-2018). Built IKEA into the world's largest furniture retailer. Controversially revealed in 1994 to have had involvement with Swedish fascist organizations in the 1940s-1950s, for which he later expressed deep regret. His fortune was estimated at $58 billion at the time of his death.

jesper-brodin.name: Jesper Brodin
jesper-brodin.bio: CEO of Ingka Group (operating company of most IKEA stores) since 2017. Oversees operations of the majority of IKEA retail locations worldwide.

jon-abrahamsson-ring.name: Jon Abrahamsson Ring
jon-abrahamsson-ring.bio: CEO of Inter IKEA Group, which owns the IKEA concept, brand, and franchise system.

daniel-zhang.name: Daniel Zhang
daniel-zhang.bio: Former CEO and chairman of Alibaba Group (2015-2023). Oversaw the company's massive growth including expansion into cloud computing and Israeli tech investments.

eddie-wu.name: Eddie Wu
eddie-wu.bio: CEO of Alibaba Group since 2023. Co-founded Alipay and has been with Alibaba since its founding.

michael-tuchin.name: Michael Tuchin
michael-tuchin.bio: American businessman and co-founder and co-CEO of Sculptor Capital Management (formerly Och-Ziff Capital Management). Managed tens of billions in assets across credit and multi-strategy investment funds.

isaiah-l-kenen.name: Isaiah L. Kenen
isaiah-l-kenen.bio: Canadian-born American journalist and lobbyist who founded AIPAC (originally the American Zionist Committee for Public Affairs) in 1951.

steve-rosen.name: Steve Rosen
steve-rosen.bio: Former AIPAC policy director charged in 2005 with passing classified information to Israeli officials. Charges were dropped in 2009.

robert-rubin.name: Robert Rubin
robert-rubin.bio: Former Goldman Sachs co-CEO who served as US Treasury Secretary under President Clinton (1995-1999). Controversial for his role in financial deregulation.

malcolm-hoenlein.name: Malcolm Hoenlein
malcolm-hoenlein.bio: American Jewish leader. Executive Vice Chairman of the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations (1986-2022). Born 1943 in Philadelphia to a Jewish family. One of the most powerful figures in American Jewish political life.

affiliations.organization: Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations

affiliations.role: Former Conference of Presidents Vice Chair

harriet-schleifer.name: Harriet Schleifer
harriet-schleifer.bio: American Jewish communal leader and former president of the American Jewish Committee (AJC). A leading advocate for Jewish interests in global diplomacy and interfaith relations. First woman to serve as AJC president.

affiliations.organization: Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations

abram-sachar.name: Abram Sachar
abram-sachar.bio: Founding president of Brandeis University (1948-1968). Historian and educator who built the university from a new institution to a nationally recognized research university.

christian-sewing.name: Christian Sewing
christian-sewing.bio: CEO of Deutsche Bank since 2018. Has led restructuring efforts to reduce the bank's investment banking exposure and address its troubled legacy.

josef-ackermann.name: Josef Ackermann
josef-ackermann.bio: Swiss banker who served as CEO of Deutsche Bank from 2002 to 2012. Oversaw the bank's expansion into a global investment banking powerhouse.

paul-achleitner.name: Paul Achleitner
paul-achleitner.bio: Former chairman of Deutsche Bank's supervisory board (2012-2022). Austrian businessman of partial Jewish heritage.

dolf-van-den-brink.name: Dolf van den Brink
dolf-van-den-brink.bio: CEO of Heineken N.V. since 2020. Previously led Heineken's operations in the Americas and Asia Pacific.

charlene-de-carvalho-heineken.name: Charlene de Carvalho-Heineken
charlene-de-carvalho-heineken.bio: Dutch-British billionaire, granddaughter of Freddy Heineken. Controls 25% of Heineken through L'Arche Green N.V. One of the wealthiest women in the world with an estimated net worth exceeding $15 billion.

freddy-heineken.name: Freddy Heineken
freddy-heineken.bio: Alfred Henry "Freddy" Heineken (1923-2002), grandson of the founder, who transformed Heineken from a Dutch brewery into the world's most international beer brand. Was famously kidnapped and held for ransom in 1983.

mark-schneider.name: Mark Schneider
mark-schneider.bio: CEO of Nestle since 2017. German-American businessman, first outsider to lead Nestle in nearly a century. Previously CEO of Fresenius.

peter-brabeck-letmathe.name: Peter Brabeck-Letmathe
peter-brabeck-letmathe.bio: Austrian businessman who served as Nestle CEO (1997-2008) and chairman (2005-2017). Controversial for comments on water privatization.

paul-bulcke.name: Paul Bulcke
paul-bulcke.bio: Chairman of Nestle since 2017. Belgian-Swiss businessman who served as CEO from 2008 to 2017.

mike-tattersfield.name: Mike Tattersfield
mike-tattersfield.bio: New Zealand businessman and CEO who has led major food and beverage companies. Active in New Zealand Jewish community life, contributing to the small but active Jewish community in Auckland and beyond.

olivier-goudet.name: Olivier Goudet
olivier-goudet.bio: Chairman of Krispy Kreme and CEO of JAB Holding Company, the Reimann family's investment vehicle that owns Krispy Kreme.

slawomir-krupa.name: Slawomir Krupa
slawomir-krupa.bio: CEO of Societe Generale since 2023. Polish-born French banker who previously headed the bank's Americas operations.

jerome-kerviel.name: Jerome Kerviel
jerome-kerviel.bio: French trader who caused a 4.9 billion euro loss at Societe Generale in 2008 through unauthorized trades, one of the largest rogue trading incidents in history. Convicted and sentenced to prison.

sean-marks.name: Sean Marks
sean-marks.bio: New Zealand-born former NBA player (San Antonio Spurs) and current general manager of the Brooklyn Nets. The first New Zealander to play in the NBA. Has rebuilt the Nets into a competitive franchise in the Eastern Conference.

donald-sterling.name: Donald Sterling
donald-sterling.bio: Jewish-American real estate developer (born Donald Tokowitz) who owned the Clippers from 1981 to 2014. Banned for life from the NBA after racist comments were recorded and leaked. Previously settled the largest housing discrimination case in US history ($2.725 million) for refusing to rent to Black and Hispanic tenants.

peter-guber.name: Peter Guber
peter-guber.bio: Jewish-American entertainment executive and co-owner of the Golden State Warriors. Former chairman of Sony Pictures. Also owns the Los Angeles FC (MLS) and is part owner of the Los Angeles Dodgers.

daniela-amodei.name: Daniela Amodei
daniela-amodei.bio: President and co-founder of Anthropic. Former VP of Operations at OpenAI. Sister of Dario Amodei. Manages Anthropic's business operations and safety research.

brian-niccol.name: Brian Niccol
brian-niccol.bio: CEO of Starbucks since 2024. Previously CEO of Chipotle Mexican Grill where he oversaw a major turnaround.

martin-lorentzon.name: Martin Lorentzon
martin-lorentzon.bio: Swedish internet entrepreneur who co-founded Spotify with Daniel Ek. Previously co-founded digital marketing company Tradedoubler.

christian-klein.name: Christian Klein
christian-klein.bio: CEO of SAP since 2020 (sole CEO since 2023). Youngest CEO of a DAX company when appointed.

hasso-plattner.name: Hasso Plattner
hasso-plattner.bio: Co-founder of SAP who served as chairman of the supervisory board until 2024. Donated to Jewish cultural restoration projects in Germany. Billionaire philanthropist.

ken-murphy.name: Ken Murphy
ken-murphy.bio: CEO of Tesco since 2020. Irish businessman who previously held senior roles at Boots/Walgreens.

leslie-porter.name: Leslie Porter
leslie-porter.bio: Son-in-law of founder Jack Cohen. Served as Tesco chairman and as leader of Westminster City Council, where he was involved in the "homes for votes" gerrymandering scandal, being ordered to pay 27 million pounds surcharge.

jean-laurent-bonnafe.name: Jean-Laurent Bonnafe
jean-laurent-bonnafe.bio: CEO of BNP Paribas since 2011. French banker who has overseen the bank's expansion and navigated regulatory challenges.

tim-davie.name: Tim Davie
tim-davie.bio: Director-General of the BBC since 2020. Faced intense scrutiny over the BBC's coverage of the Israel-Hamas war and its refusal to label Hamas as terrorists.

michael-eisner.name: Michael Eisner
michael-eisner.bio: American media executive. Born 1942 in Mount Kisco, New York, to a Jewish family. CEO of The Walt Disney Company (1984-2005). Transformed Disney from a struggling studio into a global entertainment powerhouse. Previously president of Paramount Pictures.

greg-brockman.name: Greg Brockman
greg-brockman.bio: American entrepreneur and co-founder of OpenAI. Served as president and chairman of the board. Previously CTO of Stripe. A key figure in the development of GPT models and the commercialization of artificial intelligence technology.

joel-kaplan.name: Joel Kaplan
joel-kaplan.bio: Head of global policy at Meta since 2024. Previously VP of global public policy. Former White House Deputy Chief of Staff.

stephen-cohen-palantir.name: Stephen Cohen
stephen-cohen-palantir.bio: Co-founder of Palantir Technologies. Software engineer who helped design Palantir's initial data analysis platform.

drew-weissman.name: Drew Weissman
drew-weissman.bio: Jewish-American immunologist who co-won the 2023 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for discoveries that enabled mRNA vaccines. His research at the University of Pennsylvania was foundational to the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.

robert-kapito.name: Robert Kapito
robert-kapito.bio: Co-founder and president of BlackRock. Jewish-American financier who has been with BlackRock since its founding.

james-cayne.name: James Cayne
james-cayne.bio: Jewish-American banker who served as Bear Stearns CEO from 1993 to 2008, presiding over the firm's collapse. Criticized for playing bridge and golf during the crisis. His $1 billion stake in the firm was reduced to approximately $61 million in the JPMorgan deal.

martin-eberhard.name: Martin Eberhard
martin-eberhard.bio: Jewish-American engineer who co-founded Tesla Motors in 2003 and served as its first CEO. Conceived the Tesla Roadster. Was later ousted from the company and sued Musk and Tesla (settled 2009).

jb-straubel.name: JB Straubel
jb-straubel.bio: Co-founder and CTO of Tesla from 2004 to 2019. Key architect of Tesla's battery technology and Gigafactory concept. Founded Redwood Materials for battery recycling.

robert-greenhill.name: Robert Greenhill
robert-greenhill.bio: Jewish-American investment banker who built Morgan Stanley's preeminent M&A practice. Served as president. Later founded Greenhill & Co.

stephanie-linnartz.name: Stephanie Linnartz
stephanie-linnartz.bio: American businesswoman and former CEO of Under Armour (2023-2024) and previously president of Marriott International. Led Marriott's digital transformation and loyalty programs. One of the most prominent female executives in American hospitality.

fred-ehrsam.name: Fred Ehrsam
fred-ehrsam.bio: Co-founder of Coinbase and Paradigm, a crypto investment firm. Of Jewish heritage. Former Goldman Sachs trader who left to co-found Coinbase.

samuel-newhouse-sr.name: S.I. Newhouse Sr.
samuel-newhouse-sr.bio: Jewish-American media mogul (born Solomon Isadore Neuhaus, 1895-1979) who founded Advance Publications by acquiring newspapers. Built one of America's largest privately held media empires.

john-collison.name: John Collison
john-collison.bio: Irish entrepreneur who co-founded Stripe with his brother Patrick. The youngest self-made billionaire in history at the time.

gary-nagle.name: Gary Nagle
gary-nagle.bio: South African CEO of Glencore since 2021. Previously headed Glencore's coal operations.

c-s-venkatakrishnan.name: C.S. Venkatakrishnan
c-s-venkatakrishnan.bio: Indian-American CEO of Barclays since 2021. Known as "Venkat." Previously the bank's chief risk officer.

jes-staley.name: Jes Staley
jes-staley.bio: British-American banker. Former CEO of JPMorgan Chase's investment bank, later CEO of Barclays. Had one of the closest banking relationships with Epstein. Exchanged over 1,200 emails with Epstein. Visited Epstein's island. JPMorgan internal communications revealed Staley referenced Epstein's ability to provide young women. Left Barclays in 2021 after UK regulators investigated his Epstein ties. JPMorgan later settled for $290 million with victims, partly due to revelations about Staley's conduct.

noel-quinn.name: Noel Quinn
noel-quinn.bio: British banker and former CEO of HSBC Holdings (2020-2024), one of the world's largest banking and financial services organizations. Led HSBC through a strategic pivot focusing on Asia and wealth management while reducing operations in less profitable markets.

georges-elhedery.name: Georges Elhedery
georges-elhedery.bio: Lebanese-born British banker and CEO of HSBC Holdings since September 2024, succeeding Noel Quinn. Previously served as HSBC's Chief Financial Officer. The first person of Middle Eastern heritage to lead the global banking giant.

rose-mattus.name: Rose Mattus
rose-mattus.bio: Jewish-American businesswoman who co-founded Häagen-Dazs with husband Reuben. Continued to promote the brand and Jewish philanthropy after Reuben's death.

kenichiro-yoshida.name: Kenichiro Yoshida
kenichiro-yoshida.bio: Chairman, President, and CEO of Sony Group since 2018. Oversaw the company's pivot to entertainment, gaming, and image sensors.

tommy-mottola.name: Tommy Mottola
tommy-mottola.bio: Italian-American music executive who served as chairman of Sony Music (1988-2003). Married to Mariah Carey (1993-1998). His tenure was later criticized by artists including Michael Jackson.

salil-parekh.name: Salil Parekh
salil-parekh.bio: CEO and Managing Director of Infosys since 2018. Previously led Capgemini's operations.

joaquin-duato.name: Joaquin Duato
joaquin-duato.bio: CEO of Johnson & Johnson since 2022. Spanish-born executive who has been with J&J for over 30 years.

craig-billings.name: Craig Billings
craig-billings.bio: CEO of Wynn Resorts since 2022. Previously served as CFO and president of the company.

baiju-bhatt.name: Baiju Bhatt
baiju-bhatt.bio: Indian-American entrepreneur who co-founded Robinhood with Vlad Tenev at Stanford University.

glenn-fogel.name: Glenn Fogel
glenn-fogel.bio: Jewish-American CEO of Booking Holdings since 2017. Previously led the company's M&A strategy. Has navigated the controversy over listing settlement properties in the West Bank.

jack-cockwell.name: Jack Cockwell
jack-cockwell.bio: Jewish South African-born Canadian businessman who transformed Brookfield from a Brazilian power company into a global asset management firm.

natarajan-chandrasekaran.name: N. Chandrasekaran
natarajan-chandrasekaran.bio: Chairman of Tata Sons since 2017. Previously CEO of Tata Consultancy Services, where he oversaw global technology operations including Israeli partnerships.

marta-ortega.name: Marta Ortega
marta-ortega.bio: Spanish businesswoman, daughter of founder Amancio Ortega. Became chair of Inditex in 2022. One of the youngest women to lead a major global corporation.

donald-klopfer.name: Donald Klopfer
donald-klopfer.bio: Jewish-American publisher who co-founded Random House with Bennett Cerf. Managed the business side while Cerf served as the public face.

sergio-ermotti.name: Sergio Ermotti
sergio-ermotti.bio: Swiss-Italian CEO of UBS, returning for a second term in 2023 to manage the Credit Suisse integration.

christoph-meili.name: Christoph Meili
christoph-meili.bio: Former UBS security guard who discovered the bank was shredding Holocaust-era documents in 1997. Became a whistleblower, faced legal threats, and had to flee to the United States. Received American citizenship through a special act of Congress.

brady-dougan.name: Brady Dougan
brady-dougan.bio: Jewish-American banker who served as CEO of Credit Suisse from 2007 to 2015. Faced criticism for the bank's $2.6 billion tax evasion settlement with the DOJ while receiving large bonuses.

euisun-chung.name: Euisun Chung
euisun-chung.bio: Executive Chairman of Hyundai Motor Group. Third-generation leader of the Chung family conglomerate. Overseeing the company's push into electric vehicles and autonomous driving with Israeli tech partnerships.

francesco-milleri.name: Francesco Milleri
francesco-milleri.bio: Italian CEO of EssilorLuxottica. Was a longtime aide to founder Leonardo Del Vecchio.

richard-gonzalez-abbvie.name: Richard Gonzalez
richard-gonzalez-abbvie.bio: CEO of AbbVie from its spinoff in 2013 until 2024. Built the company around the Humira franchise into a pharmaceutical giant.

bill-rudin.name: Bill Rudin
bill-rudin.bio: Jewish-American real estate executive, third-generation leader of Rudin Management. Co-chairman of the Real Estate Board of New York. Major Jewish philanthropist. Prominent in New York civic affairs.

jacob-davis-jeans.name: Jacob Davis
jacob-davis-jeans.bio: Jewish-Latvian immigrant (born Jacob Youphes, 1831-1908) who co-invented riveted denim pants with Levi Strauss. A tailor in Reno, Nevada who lacked funds to file the patent alone and partnered with Strauss.

michelle-gass-levi.name: Michelle Gass
michelle-gass-levi.bio: CEO of Levi Strauss & Co. since 2024. Previously CEO of Kohl's and held senior positions at Starbucks.

fabrizio-freda.name: Fabrizio Freda
fabrizio-freda.bio: Italian-American businessman and CEO of The Estée Lauder Companies since 2009. Under his leadership, the company's market cap grew from $7 billion to over $90 billion at its peak. Expanded the company's digital presence and Asian market share.

jerome-kohlberg-jr.name: Jerome Kohlberg Jr.
jerome-kohlberg-jr.bio: Jewish-American financier (1925-2015) who co-founded KKR. Left the firm in 1987 after disagreements over the increasingly aggressive takeover strategy.

alexander-soros.name: Alexander Soros
alexander-soros.bio: Son of George Soros who took over leadership of the Open Society Foundations in 2023. PhD in history from UC Berkeley.

robert-evans.name: Robert Evans
robert-evans.bio: Jewish-American film producer (1930-2019) who headed Paramount Pictures during its 1970s golden age, overseeing The Godfather, Chinatown, and Rosemary's Baby. His memoir "The Kid Stays in the Picture" became a classic.

shlomo-kramer.name: Shlomo Kramer
shlomo-kramer.bio: Israeli cybersecurity entrepreneur who co-founded Check Point and later co-founded Imperva and Cato Networks. One of the most prolific cybersecurity entrepreneurs in the world.

arthur-sackler.name: Arthur Sackler
arthur-sackler.bio: Jewish-American physician, businessman, and philanthropist (1913-1987). Eldest of the three Sackler brothers. Pioneered pharmaceutical advertising practices that later became central to the OxyContin scandal. His estate stressed he died before OxyContin was created.

richard-sackler.name: Richard Sackler
richard-sackler.bio: Son of Raymond Sackler. Former chairman of Purdue Pharma. Internal documents revealed he pushed aggressive OxyContin marketing and allegedly said "we have to hammer on abusers in every way possible" to deflect blame from the drug.

david-sackler.name: David Sackler
david-sackler.bio: Grandson of Raymond Sackler. Served on Purdue Pharma's board. Part of the family negotiations for the $6 billion settlement.

erik-nordstrom.name: Erik Nordstrom
erik-nordstrom.bio: Fourth-generation Nordstrom family member and CEO of the company. Oversaw the company's transition to a private company.

john-ketchum.name: John Ketchum
john-ketchum.bio: CEO of NextEra Energy since 2022. Overseeing the company's expansion as the world's largest wind and solar energy producer.

jack-fusco-cheniere.name: Jack Fusco
jack-fusco-cheniere.bio: CEO of Cheniere Energy since 2016. Appointed after Carl Icahn pushed out founder Charif Souki.

eric-martel-bombardier.name: Éric Martel
eric-martel-bombardier.bio: CEO of Bombardier since 2020. Former CEO of Hydro-Québec. Tasked with turning around the company after years of financial difficulties.

richard-edelman.name: Richard Edelman
richard-edelman.bio: Jewish-American PR executive and CEO of Edelman, the world's largest PR firm. Son of founder Daniel J. Edelman. Known for the annual Edelman Trust Barometer.

philippe-krakowsky.name: Philippe Krakowsky
philippe-krakowsky.bio: CEO of Interpublic Group since 2021. Has led the company's digital transformation and strategic positioning.

mark-read-wpp.name: Mark Read
mark-read-wpp.bio: British businessman and CEO of WPP, the world's largest advertising and public relations company. Has led WPP's transformation from a holding company into an integrated creative transformation company. Succeeded Sir Martin Sorrell in 2018.

martin-cohen-cs.name: Martin Cohen
martin-cohen-cs.bio: Jewish-American financier who co-founded Cohen & Steers and pioneered REIT investing as a mainstream asset class.

daniel-ellsberg.name: Daniel Ellsberg
daniel-ellsberg.bio: Jewish-American military analyst (1931-2023) who worked at RAND and leaked the Pentagon Papers in 1971, exposing government lies about the Vietnam War. One of the most famous whistleblowers in American history.

herman-kahn-rand.name: Herman Kahn
herman-kahn-rand.bio: Jewish-American futurist and nuclear strategist (1922-1983) at RAND. Developed nuclear war scenarios. Satirized as Dr. Strangelove. Later founded the Hudson Institute.

lars-fruergaard-jorgensen.name: Lars Fruergaard Jørgensen
lars-fruergaard-jorgensen.bio: CEO of Novo Nordisk since 2017. Oversaw the company's rise to become Europe's most valuable company driven by Ozempic and Wegovy demand.

avi-gabbay-partner.name: Avi Gabbay
avi-gabbay-partner.bio: Israeli businessman and politician who served as CEO of Bezeq. Later became chairman of the Israeli Labor Party. His career exemplifies the intersection of Israeli business and politics.

chaim-sheba.name: Dr. Chaim Sheba
chaim-sheba.bio: Pioneering Israeli physician (1908-1971) who founded Sheba Medical Center. Also known as the "father of Israeli medicine." Served as Director General of Israel's Ministry of Health.

piers-handling.name: Piers Handling
piers-handling.bio: Led TIFF for over 20 years and navigated the controversial 2009 Tel Aviv spotlight controversy.

paul-perreault-csl.name: Paul Perreault
paul-perreault-csl.bio: Former CEO of CSL Limited who transformed the company into one of the world's largest biotech firms.

robert-morgenthau.name: Robert M. Morgenthau
robert-morgenthau.bio: Jewish-American attorney (1919-2019) who served as Manhattan District Attorney for 35 years (the longest-serving in NYC history). Grandson of Henry Morgenthau Sr. Champion of the Museum of Jewish Heritage.

hannah-solomon.name: Hannah Greenebaum Solomon
hannah-solomon.bio: Jewish-American social activist (1858-1942) who founded NCJW at the 1893 World's Fair in Chicago. One of the pioneering Jewish feminists in America. Advocated for women's suffrage, child welfare, and immigrant rights.

david-hartman.name: Rabbi David Hartman
david-hartman.bio: Canadian-American-Israeli rabbi and philosopher (1931-2013) who founded the Shalom Hartman Institute in Jerusalem. A leading Jewish thinker who advocated for pluralism and dialogue within Judaism.

affiliations.organization: Shalom Hartman Institute of North America

sandy-bernstein-avi-chai.name: Sanford "Sandy" Bernstein
sandy-bernstein-avi-chai.bio: Jewish-American investor (1926-2014) who founded Sanford C. Bernstein & Co. (now Alliance Bernstein) and the AVI CHAI Foundation. Gave away over $1 billion to Jewish education causes. A ba'al teshuva (returnee to Jewish observance) who used his wealth to strengthen Jewish identity.

hector-magnetto.name: Héctor Magnetto
hector-magnetto.bio: Longtime CEO of Grupo Clarín who built it into Argentina's largest media conglomerate. Controversial figure in Argentine media and politics.

alfred-knopf-sr.name: Alfred A. Knopf Sr.
alfred-knopf-sr.bio: Jewish-American publisher (1892-1984) who co-founded the prestigious Knopf publishing house. Known for literary excellence, the Borzoi colophon, and introducing global literature to American readers.

blanche-knopf.name: Blanche Knopf
blanche-knopf.bio: Jewish-American publisher (1894-1966) who co-founded Knopf with her husband. A brilliant editor who championed European and African literature, often overshadowed in historical accounts despite her central role.

frederic-mazzella.name: Frédéric Mazzella
frederic-mazzella.bio: French entrepreneur who founded BlaBlaCar in 2006, building it into the world's largest long-distance ride-sharing platform with over 100 million members.

petr-papousek.name: Petr Papousek
petr-papousek.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities in the Czech Republic. Leads communal affairs and heritage preservation.

affiliations.organization: Federace židovských obcí v České republice

reuben-hasid.name: Reuben Hasid
reuben-hasid.bio: President of the Jewish Welfare Board of Singapore, overseeing the small but historic Jewish community.

ronny-naftaniel.name: Ronny Naftaniel
ronny-naftaniel.bio: Longtime director of the CJO and prominent voice for Dutch Jewry on Holocaust restitution and combating antisemitism.

alexandru-florian.name: Alexandru Florian
alexandru-florian.bio: Director of the Elie Wiesel National Institute, leading Romania's official Holocaust research and education efforts.

affiliations.organization: Elie Wiesel National Institute for the Study of the Holocaust in Romania

gadi-luzzatto-voghera.name: Gadi Luzzatto Voghera
gadi-luzzatto-voghera.bio: Director of CDEC, historian specializing in Italian Jewish history and antisemitism.

rowan-sobel-sobel.name: Rowan Sobel
rowan-sobel-sobel.bio: Chairman of the South African Zionist Federation, leading Israel advocacy in South Africa.

walker-meghnagi.name: Walker Meghnagi
walker-meghnagi.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Milan, Italy's largest Jewish congregation.

mirjam-wenzel.name: Mirjam Wenzel
mirjam-wenzel.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum Frankfurt, overseeing its reopening and expansion in 2020.

raymond-simonson.name: Raymond Simonson
raymond-simonson.bio: CEO of JW3 since its founding, building it into London's premier Jewish cultural center.

isaac-querub-caro.name: Isaac Querub Caro
isaac-querub-caro.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities of Spain, leading the community's representation and advocacy.

affiliations.organization: Federación de Comunidades Judías de España (FCJE)

ishak-ibrahimzadeh.name: Ishak Ibrahimzadeh
ishak-ibrahimzadeh.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Turkey, leading the community's representation and institutional management.

chezki-lifshitz.name: Rabbi Chezki Lifshitz
chezki-lifshitz.bio: Director of Chabad of Kathmandu since 1999. Coordinated major rescue efforts during the 2015 Nepal earthquake.

sidney-klajner-einstein.name: Sidney Klajner
sidney-klajner-einstein.bio: President of Hospital Israelita Albert Einstein. Leading physician and hospital administrator in Brazil.

jeffrey-epstein.name: Jeffrey Epstein
jeffrey-epstein.bio: American financier and convicted sex offender (1953-2019). Ran one of the largest sex trafficking networks ever documented. Former math teacher at the Dalton School (hired by AG William Barr's father Donald Barr). Financial manager for billionaire Leslie Wexner. Pleaded guilty in 2008 to Florida state prostitution charges, receiving a controversial 13-month sentence with work release negotiated by Alexander Acosta. Arrested again in July 2019 by SDNY on federal sex trafficking charges. Found dead in his Metropolitan Correctional Center cell on August 10, 2019  -  officially ruled suicide by hanging, but circumstances (broken cameras, sleeping guards, taken off suicide watch) fueled widespread skepticism. His black book contained 1,571 contacts. Flight logs documented hundreds of passengers on his Boeing 727 "Lolita Express." Properties included a Manhattan townhouse, Palm Beach mansion, New Mexico ranch, Paris apartment, and two Caribbean islands. His financial empire was largely opaque  -  the source of his wealth was never fully explained. Connected to intelligence services through Ghislaine's father Robert Maxwell (Mossad) and associates like Ehud Barak. The full scope of his crimes and network remains unknown.

ghislaine-maxwell.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
ghislaine-maxwell.bio: British socialite, daughter of media magnate Robert Maxwell (suspected Mossad agent). Convicted in 2021 on 5 of 6 federal charges including sex trafficking of a minor. Sentenced to 20 years in prison. Groomed, recruited, and trafficked young girls for Epstein from approximately 1994 to at least 2004. Used her elite social connections and charm to gain victims' trust. Met Epstein after her father's death in 1991. Previously a prominent socialite in New York and London. Her siblings (Ian, Isabel, Christine, Kevin) remain controversial. Her relationship with Epstein evolved from romantic partner to trafficking co-conspirator. Multiple victims described her as equally culpable or worse than Epstein himself. Currently incarcerated at FCI Tallahassee.

jean-luc-brunel.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
jean-luc-brunel.bio: French modeling agent (1946-2022). Founder of MC2 Model Management, funded by Epstein. Accused by multiple women of sexual abuse and trafficking young models. Arrested in Paris in December 2020 on rape and trafficking charges. Found dead by apparent hanging in his jail cell in February 2022, echoing Epstein's death. Former protege of John Casablancas at Elite Model Management. Used the modeling industry as a pipeline to supply Epstein with girls, operating across France, the US, and internationally. Flight logs show him as one of the most frequent passengers on the Lolita Express.

mort-fridman.name: Mort Fridman
mort-fridman.bio: American Jewish community leader and philanthropist who has supported various Jewish communal organizations. Active in strengthening Jewish institutional life and cultural preservation in the United States.

robert-asher.name: Robert Asher
robert-asher.bio: American Jewish communal leader and former president of AIPAC. Played a significant role in building AIPAC into one of the most powerful lobbying organizations in Washington, D.C., influencing US-Israel policy.

david-steiner.name: David Steiner
david-steiner.bio: Resigned after a recorded phone call revealed boasts about influence over US foreign policy appointments.

tom-dine.name: Tom Dine
tom-dine.bio: American Jewish political operative and former executive director of AIPAC (1980-1993). Transformed AIPAC from a small lobbying group into a major political force. Later served as president of Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty.

keith-weissman.name: Keith Weissman
keith-weissman.bio: Charged under the Espionage Act in 2005 alongside Steve Rosen. Charges dropped in 2009.

morris-amitay.name: Morris J. Amitay
morris-amitay.bio: American Jewish lobbyist and former executive director of AIPAC (1974-1980). Helped establish AIPAC's bipartisan approach to pro-Israel advocacy. Later founded the Washington Political Action Committee and continued advocacy work.

lillian-pinkus.name: Lillian Pinkus
lillian-pinkus.bio: American Jewish communal leader. First female president of AIPAC (American Israel Public Affairs Committee), serving from 2016. Lawyer by profession. Her presidency marked a milestone for the most influential pro-Israel lobbying organization in the United States.

rob-bassin.name: Rob Bassin
rob-bassin.bio: South African Jewish community leader and executive director of the South African Jewish Board of Deputies. Represents and advocates for the interests of South Africa's approximately 52,000-strong Jewish community.

dick-fuld.name: Dick Fuld
dick-fuld.bio: American Jewish banker and former chairman and CEO of Lehman Brothers, who led the firm through its 2008 collapse - the largest bankruptcy in US history. Known as the "Gorilla of Wall Street" for his aggressive management style.

harvey-weinstein.name: Harvey Weinstein
harvey-weinstein.bio: American former film producer. Co-founder of Miramax and The Weinstein Company. Named in Epstein's black book. Convicted of rape and sexual assault in 2020 (sentenced to 23 years). His case, along with Epstein's, became defining events of the #MeToo movement. Both men exploited positions of power for sexual predation.

wolf-blitzer.name: Wolf Blitzer
wolf-blitzer.bio: American Jewish journalist and former lead political anchor for CNN, hosting The Situation Room for nearly two decades. Born in Augsburg, Germany, to Holocaust survivor parents. Previously served as Jerusalem correspondent for the Jerusalem Post.

sarah-kellen.name: Sarah Kellen
sarah-kellen.bio: Close associate of Epstein and Maxwell. Named as a co-conspirator in the 2008 non-prosecution agreement (given immunity). Described by victims as Epstein's "lieutenant" who scheduled appointments with victims. Maintained Epstein's contact lists and organized his calendar of abuse. Renamed herself Sarah Kensington after the scandal. Despite being named by multiple victims and identified as a key enabler, she was never charged due to the NPA immunity.

al-schwimmer.name: Al Schwimmer
al-schwimmer.bio: American-Israeli (1917-2011). Founded IAI. Smuggled aircraft to Israel in 1948. Pardoned by Clinton.

nadia-marcinkova.name: Nadia Marcinkova
nadia-marcinkova.bio: Slovakian-born woman who was allegedly brought to the US by Jeffrey Epstein from the former Yugoslavia when she was a teenager. She was named as an alleged participant and later co-conspirator in Epstein abuse. She later changed her name to Nadia Marcinko and became a licensed pilot. She received a non-prosecution agreement as part of the 2008 plea deal.

lesley-groff.name: Lesley Groff
lesley-groff.bio: American woman who served as Jeffrey Epstein executive assistant for over two decades. She was named as a co-conspirator in the original federal investigation but received a non-prosecution agreement in the 2008 plea deal. Victims alleged she helped schedule appointments with underage girls and managed logistics of the trafficking operation.

adolph-ochs.name: Adolph Ochs
adolph-ochs.bio: American newspaper publisher (1858-1935) who purchased The New York Times in 1896 and transformed it into a respected newspaper of record. Born to a Jewish immigrant family from Bavaria, he established the Ochs-Sulzberger family dynasty that controlled the Times for over a century.

lawrence-summers-harvard.name: Lawrence Summers
lawrence-summers-harvard.bio: American economist who served as President of Harvard University (2001-2006) and US Secretary of the Treasury (1999-2001). During his tenure at Harvard, the university accepted donations from Jeffrey Epstein, and Summers met with Epstein on multiple occasions. He later stated the meetings were a mistake.

bob-weinstein.name: Bob Weinstein
bob-weinstein.bio: American film producer who co-founded Miramax Films with his brother Harvey Weinstein in 1979. He later co-founded The Weinstein Company. After Harvey conviction for sexual assault, Bob distanced himself but faced his own allegations of workplace harassment.

joi-ito.name: Joi Ito
joi-ito.bio: Japanese-American activist and entrepreneur who served as director of the MIT Media Lab from 2011 to 2019. He resigned after revelations that he had solicited and accepted donations from Jeffrey Epstein, and concealed the nature and extent of the relationship from MIT officials. Internal emails showed Epstein was a "disqualified donor."

nicholas-negroponte.name: Nicholas Negroponte
nicholas-negroponte.bio: Greek-American architect and computer scientist. Founder of the MIT Media Lab. Directed Epstein donations to the Media Lab. His successor Joichi Ito resigned over the concealed Epstein donations. Negroponte defended accepting Epstein's money.

donald-barr.name: Donald Barr
donald-barr.bio: American educator (1921-2004) who served as headmaster of the elite Dalton School in Manhattan. He hired Jeffrey Epstein to teach there in 1974 despite Epstein lacking a college degree. He was the father of William Barr, who later served as US Attorney General during Epstein death in federal custody.

robert-maxwell.name: Robert Maxwell
robert-maxwell.bio: Czech-born British media proprietor (1923-1991). Father of Ghislaine Maxwell. Built a publishing empire including Mirror Group Newspapers and Macmillan Publishers. Born Jan Ludvik Hoch. After his mysterious death having fallen from his yacht the Lady Ghislaine near the Canary Islands, it was revealed he had embezzled hundreds of millions from the Mirror Group pension fund. Alleged connections to Mossad, MI6, and the KGB. His intelligence ties and the question of whether these were passed to or through Ghislaine to Epstein remain one of the most scrutinized aspects of the case.

geoffrey-berman.name: Geoffrey Berman
geoffrey-berman.bio: American attorney who served as US Attorney for the SDNY from 2018 to 2020. He oversaw the Epstein prosecution and arrest. He was controversially fired by Attorney General William Barr in June 2020 and later wrote a memoir alleging political interference in cases.

michael-reiter.name: Michael Reiter
michael-reiter.bio: Former Palm Beach Police Chief who initiated and led the first comprehensive investigation into Jeffrey Epstein beginning in 2005. He pushed for federal involvement when the local state attorney refused to file felony charges.

denise-george.name: Denise George
denise-george.bio: Former Attorney General of the U.S. Virgin Islands. Filed a landmark lawsuit against Epstein's estate in 2020 and later against JP Morgan. Was fired by the governor the day after suing JP Morgan, raising concerns about political interference.

ari-ben-menashe.name: Ari Ben-Menashe
ari-ben-menashe.bio: Israeli-Canadian former intelligence officer. Claimed that Robert Maxwell and later Ghislaine Maxwell and Epstein were Israeli intelligence assets, with Epstein used as a means to compromise and blackmail powerful figures. His claims are unverified but have been widely circulated.

robert-mueller.name: Robert Mueller
robert-mueller.bio: American attorney who served as FBI Director from 2001 to 2013, overlapping with periods when Epstein complaints were known to the bureau. Later served as Special Counsel investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election.

seth-lloyd.name: Seth Lloyd
seth-lloyd.bio: American mechanical engineer and professor at MIT. Received $225,000 in research funding from Epstein after his 2008 conviction. MIT placed him on paid leave in 2019 after it was revealed he had continued accepting Epstein funds.

bill-gates.name: Bill Gates
bill-gates.bio: American billionaire and Microsoft co-founder. Met with Epstein numerous times from 2011-2014, years after Epstein's 2008 conviction. Internal Microsoft emails show Gates asked colleagues to help establish a relationship with Epstein. Visited Epstein's Manhattan townhouse multiple times. Melinda Gates cited Bill's relationship with Epstein as a factor in their divorce. Gates initially claimed he barely knew Epstein, then gradually acknowledged more meetings. Epstein reportedly advised Gates on how to end his marriage. Epstein's former science adviser Boris Nikolic was listed as a backup executor of Epstein's will. The Gates Foundation and JPMorgan discussed a charitable fund that Epstein proposed. Gates has called the relationship a "huge mistake."

melinda-french-gates.name: Melinda French Gates
melinda-french-gates.bio: American philanthropist and former wife of Bill Gates. Born 1964 in Dallas. Former Microsoft general manager. Co-founded Gates Foundation. Cited Bill's Epstein meetings as factor in their 2021 divorce. Left the Gates Foundation in 2024.

boris-nikolic.name: Boris Nikolic
boris-nikolic.bio: Croatian-American physician and venture capitalist. Former science advisor to Bill Gates. Named as backup executor of Jeffrey Epstein's will - reportedly without his knowledge. His spokesperson said Nikolic was "shocked" by the designation and would decline to serve.

glenn-dubin.name: Glenn Dubin
glenn-dubin.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Co-founder of Highbridge Capital Management. One of Epstein's closest friends for over 20 years. Virginia Giuffre alleged she was trafficked to Dubin. His wife Eva Andersson-Dubin (former Miss Sweden and Epstein's ex-girlfriend) was named as a backup executor of Epstein's will. The Dubins' au pair was allegedly sent to Epstein for "training." Dubin denied all allegations. Named in both the black book and flight logs.

eva-andersson-dubin.name: Eva Andersson-Dubin
eva-andersson-dubin.bio: Swedish-American physician and former Miss Sweden. Dated Jeffrey Epstein in the 1980s. Married billionaire hedge fund manager Glenn Dubin. Her family remained close to Epstein for decades after their relationship ended. Epstein named her as a backup executor of his will.

henry-kissinger.name: Henry Kissinger
henry-kissinger.bio: American diplomat and political scientist (1923-2023). Former U.S. Secretary of State and National Security Advisor. Nobel Peace Prize laureate. Named in Epstein's black book. Attended dinners at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse. One of the most powerful political figures of the 20th century and one of the highest-profile names in Epstein's network.

affiliations.role: Former Secretary of State & National Security Advisor

lawrence-krauss.name: Lawrence Krauss
lawrence-krauss.bio: American-Canadian theoretical physicist. Foundation Professor at Arizona State University. Close associate of Epstein who attended his dinners and events. Defended Epstein publicly after his 2008 conviction. Resigned from ASU in 2019 after sexual misconduct allegations and renewed scrutiny of his Epstein ties.

john-brockman.name: John Brockman
john-brockman.bio: American literary agent and author. Founder of Edge Foundation, which organized annual gatherings of top scientists. Key connector between Epstein and the scientific community. Facilitated introductions between Epstein and numerous scientists and intellectuals. Described Epstein as "extremely bright" and a "close friend."

naomi-campbell.name: Naomi Campbell
naomi-campbell.bio: British supermodel. Appeared in Epstein's flight logs and was photographed on his yacht and at social events with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. Part of the international social circle surrounding Epstein.

kevin-spacey.name: Kevin Spacey
kevin-spacey.bio: American actor. Born 1959. Two-time Academy Award winner. Flew on Epstein's "Lolita Express" to Africa with Bill Clinton in 2002. Photographed on Epstein's plane with Maxwell. Later accused of sexual assault by multiple men.

cy-vance-jr.name: Cyrus Vance Jr.
cy-vance-jr.bio: American prosecutor. Manhattan District Attorney 2010-2021. Son of Secretary of State Cyrus Vance. His office argued to downgrade Epstein's sex offender status. Also declined to prosecute Harvey Weinstein in 2015.

michael-larson.name: Michael Larson
michael-larson.bio: American investment manager. Chief investment officer of Cascade Investment (Bill Gates' family office) since 1995. Manages approximately $80 billion. Accused of workplace harassment in a 2022 New York Times expose.

paul-allen.name: Paul Allen
paul-allen.bio: American business magnate and philanthropist (1953-2018). Co-founded Microsoft with Bill Gates in 1975. Jewish mother. Owner of Seattle Seahawks and Portland Trail Blazers. Founded Vulcan Inc. Died of lymphoma in 2018.

satya-nadella.name: Satya Nadella
satya-nadella.bio: Indian-American business executive. CEO of Microsoft since 2014. Born 1967 in Hyderabad, India. Transformed Microsoft into a cloud-first company, growing market cap from $300B to over $3 trillion.

james-comey.name: James Comey
james-comey.bio: American lawyer who served as 7th Director of the FBI (2013-2017). Born 1960. Appointed by Obama, fired by Trump in 2017 amid Russia investigation. His Southern District of New York tenure preceded Epstein investigations.

audrey-strauss.name: Audrey Strauss
audrey-strauss.bio: American attorney who served as Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York. Oversaw the indictment and arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in July 2020. Previously a longtime federal prosecutor and white-collar defense attorney.

bill-clinton-individual.name: Bill Clinton
bill-clinton-individual.bio: The 42nd President of the United States. Flew on the Lolita Express at least 26 times according to flight logs. Visited Epstein's private island (Little St. James). Epstein claimed to have co-founded the Clinton Global Initiative. Secret Service agents sometimes declined to accompany Clinton. Traveled with Epstein to Africa, Asia, and Europe. Named in Virginia Giuffre's depositions. Clinton denied any knowledge of Epstein's crimes and said he only flew 4 times, contradicted by logs. His aide Doug Band emailed about Epstein: "He served his time. He's a free man." Clinton's chief of staff John Podesta and DNC chair Terry McAuliffe were also in Epstein's contacts. Political adviser George Mitchell was named by Giuffre. Clinton's relationship with Epstein spanned decades.

virginia-giuffre.name: Virginia Giuffre
virginia-giuffre.bio: American victim advocate. Born Virginia Roberts. Key accuser and survivor in the Jeffrey Epstein case. Recruited by Ghislaine Maxwell at age 16 while working at Mar-a-Lago. Alleged she was trafficked to multiple prominent men including Prince Andrew, Alan Dershowitz, and others. Filed landmark lawsuit against Maxwell. Settled civil suit with Prince Andrew for estimated $12 million. Her testimony and legal battles were instrumental in bringing the Epstein network to justice. Named in court as having been flown around the world on the "Lolita Express" to Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, the US Virgin Islands, and to London and Paris.

david-boies.name: David Boies
david-boies.bio: American attorney. Chairman of Boies Schiller Flexner. One of the most prominent trial lawyers in America. His firm represented Virginia Giuffre in the Epstein cases. Previously represented Al Gore in Bush v. Gore and the DOJ in the Microsoft antitrust case.

donald-trump-ind.name: Donald Trump
donald-trump-ind.bio: 45th and 47th President of the United States. Born 1946 in Queens, New York. Social relationship with Epstein in 1990s-2000s. Said in 2002: Epstein "likes beautiful women as much as I do, and many of them are on the younger side." Giuffre recruited from his Mar-a-Lago.

alan-dershowitz-ind.name: Alan Dershowitz
alan-dershowitz-ind.bio: American lawyer and Harvard Law professor emeritus. Part of Epstein's defense team that negotiated the 2008 plea deal. Virginia Giuffre accused him of being one of the men she was trafficked to, which he vehemently denied for years. Filed defamation suits and counter-suits. In 2024, Giuffre dropped her lawsuit, saying she "may have made a mistake." Appeared on flight logs. Received a massage at Epstein's home (claimed he kept his underwear on). His aggressive public defense of himself and Epstein became one of the most visible aspects of the scandal. Later served on Trump's impeachment defense team.

alexander-acosta-ind.name: Alexander Acosta
alexander-acosta-ind.bio: American attorney and politician. Born 1969 in Miami, Cuban-American. As U.S. Attorney, negotiated Epstein's lenient 2008 plea deal. Served as Trump's Labor Secretary 2017-2019, resigned under Epstein scrutiny.

elon-musk-ind.name: Elon Musk
elon-musk-ind.bio: South African-born American billionaire. CEO of Tesla, SpaceX, owner of X (formerly Twitter). Photographed at an event with Ghislaine Maxwell in 2011. His name appeared in Epstein's contacts. Has stated he did not have a personal relationship with Epstein.

reid-hoffman-ind.name: Reid Hoffman
reid-hoffman-ind.bio: American entrepreneur and venture capitalist. Born 1967. Co-founded LinkedIn (sold to Microsoft for $26.2B). Apologized for facilitating Epstein-MIT Media Lab meetings at Epstein's request. Investor in Breakthrough Energy Ventures.

steve-bannon-ind.name: Steve Bannon
steve-bannon-ind.bio: American political strategist and media executive. Born 1953. Co-founded Breitbart News. Trump campaign CEO and White House Chief Strategist. Reportedly met with Epstein before 2019 arrest. Pardoned by Trump after fraud charges.

woody-allen-ind.name: Woody Allen
woody-allen-ind.bio: American filmmaker and comedian. Had dinner with Jeffrey Epstein and others. A photograph exists of Allen with Epstein and others at social events. His relationship with Epstein was described as casual and social.

george-stephanopoulos-ind.name: George Stephanopoulos
george-stephanopoulos-ind.bio: American journalist and former political advisor. Born 1961, Greek-American. ABC News anchor. Former Clinton White House Communications Director. Attended dinner at Epstein Manhattan townhouse in 2010 post-conviction.

ehud-barak-ind.name: Ehud Barak
ehud-barak-ind.bio: Israeli politician and military leader. Born 1942 in British Mandatory Palestine. Most decorated soldier in IDF history. 10th Prime Minister of Israel (1999-2001). Visited Epstein properties. Received $2.5M from Epstein via foundation.

prince-andrew-ind.name: Prince Andrew
prince-andrew-ind.bio: British royal, Duke of York. Born 1960, third child of Queen Elizabeth II. Key figure in Epstein scandal. Virginia Giuffre alleged trafficking at age 17. Settled civil suit for ~12M pounds. Stripped of military titles and royal patronages.

klaus-schwab.name: Klaus Schwab
klaus-schwab.bio: German-born engineer, economist, and founder of the World Economic Forum (WEF). Has convened annual meetings of global leaders in Davos since 1971. Author of "The Great Reset" and proponent of stakeholder capitalism. One of the most influential non-governmental figures in global governance.

guy-laliberte.name: Guy Laliberté
guy-laliberte.bio: Canadian billionaire businessman, co-founder of Cirque du Soleil. Transformed street performance into a $3 billion global entertainment empire with permanent shows in Las Vegas and touring productions worldwide. Also known for his poker playing and space tourism trip in 2009.

yoram-weiss.name: Yoram Weiss
yoram-weiss.bio: Israeli physician and director-general of Hadassah Medical Center, one of Israel's leading hospitals. Under his leadership, Hadassah expanded its international patient program and medical research capabilities. The hospital serves as a model of Jewish-Arab coexistence with mixed staff.

ilan-cohen.name: Ilan Cohen
ilan-cohen.bio: Chief Executive Officer of Osem-Nestle Israel, overseeing one of Israel's largest food manufacturers producing snacks, beverages, and prepared meals

dan-propper.name: Dan Propper
dan-propper.bio: Former longtime Chairman of Osem Industries who led the company through its major growth period and partnership with Nestle

gerald-schwartz-sr.name: Gerald Schwartz
gerald-schwartz-sr.bio: Canadian billionaire businessman, founder and chairman of Onex Corporation, major philanthropist who co-funded the Schwartz/Reisman Centre

alfred-bauer.name: Alfred Bauer
alfred-bauer.bio: German film historian who founded the Berlin International Film Festival in 1951 and served as its director until 1976

rabbi-benji-levy.name: Rabbi Benji Levy
rabbi-benji-levy.bio: Israeli-Australian rabbi and educator who served as Principal of Moriah College, later founding the IsraelX educational initiative

marcelo-mindlin-museum.name: Marcelo Mindlin
marcelo-mindlin-museum.bio: Argentine businessman and President of the Buenos Aires Holocaust Museum, also Chairman of Pampa Energia, major supporter of Holocaust education in Latin America

sarah-cohen-kochi.name: Sarah Cohen

prince-andrew.name: Prince Andrew
prince-andrew.bio: Prince Andrew, Duke of York. Second son of Queen Elizabeth II. Friend of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. Virginia Giuffre alleged she was trafficked to Andrew three times when she was 17. Settled Giuffre's civil lawsuit in February 2022 for an estimated $12 million while denying the allegations. Stripped of military titles and royal patronages. The infamous photograph of Andrew with his arm around Giuffre's waist at Maxwell's London home became one of the defining images of the scandal. Gave a disastrous BBC Newsnight interview in 2019 that was widely seen as evasive. Used Epstein money to pay Sarah Ferguson's debts. Stayed at Epstein's properties multiple times including after the 2008 conviction.

donald-trump.name: Donald Trump
donald-trump.bio: The 45th and 47th President of the United States. Had a well-documented social relationship with Jeffrey Epstein spanning the 1990s-2000s. Trump's Mar-a-Lago is where Ghislaine Maxwell recruited Virginia Giuffre (then Roberts) at age 16 while her father worked there as a maintenance man. Trump called Epstein a "terrific guy" who "likes beautiful women as much as I do, and many of them are on the younger side" in a 2002 New York Magazine interview. Named in Epstein's black book with 14 phone numbers. Flight logs show trips on the Lolita Express. In 2004, Trump reportedly barred Epstein from Mar-a-Lago (disputed accounts of why). Epstein's 2008 plea deal was facilitated by Alexander Acosta, whom Trump later appointed as Secretary of Labor. Trump wished Ghislaine Maxwell "well" after her 2020 arrest. His AG William Barr oversaw the federal facility where Epstein died.

reid-hoffman.name: Reid Hoffman
reid-hoffman.bio: American billionaire internet entrepreneur. Co-founder of LinkedIn. Met with Epstein multiple times after his 2008 conviction for advice on philanthropy and AI. Publicly apologized in 2019 for the association, stating he was told Epstein had served his time. Donated $500K to MIT to compensate for Epstein's tainted donations. Major Democratic Party donor and tech industry networker.

ehud-barak.name: Ehud Barak
ehud-barak.bio: Former Prime Minister of Israel (1999-2001). Close associate of Jeffrey Epstein post-conviction. Co-invested with Epstein in Carbyne, an Israeli emergency call technology company. Photographed entering Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2016. Admitted to visiting Epstein's island and New York home but denied any wrongdoing. Received funding from Epstein-linked entities. Virginia Giuffre named him in court documents. His deep connection to Epstein was one of the most significant international political links in the network.

steven-pinker.name: Steven Pinker
steven-pinker.bio: Canadian-American cognitive psychologist, linguist, and author. Harvard professor. Provided legal advice to Epstein's defense team in 2007, helping to argue that Epstein's solicitation did not constitute sex trafficking under federal law. Flew on Epstein's plane at least once in 2002 to a TED conference. Has stated his contact with Epstein was limited and professional.

mort-zuckerman.name: Mort Zuckerman
mort-zuckerman.bio: Canadian-American billionaire media proprietor and real estate developer. Co-founded Boston Properties. Former publisher of the New York Daily News and editor-in-chief of U.S. News & World Report. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers. Part of Epstein's inner social circle in New York. Former boyfriend of Ghislaine Maxwell, which was one of the key social connections that helped Epstein access New York elite society.

peter-mandelson.name: Peter Mandelson
peter-mandelson.bio: British Labour politician, Baron Mandelson. Former Secretary of State for Business. Close associate of Jeffrey Epstein. Met with Epstein multiple times including at his properties. Named in Epstein's black book and flight logs. Photographed at social events with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

alexander-acosta.name: Alexander Acosta
alexander-acosta.bio: American attorney and politician. As U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, he negotiated the extraordinarily lenient 2008 plea deal that allowed Epstein to plead to state prostitution charges instead of federal sex trafficking charges, receive only 13 months in county jail (with 12 hours of work release 6 days a week), and provide immunity to all co-conspirators  -  effectively shielding the entire trafficking network. The deal was made without notifying victims, violating the Crime Victims' Rights Act (later confirmed by federal court). Acosta later said he was told Epstein "belonged to intelligence" and to "leave it alone." Donald Trump appointed him Secretary of Labor in 2017. He resigned in July 2019 after Epstein's re-arrest brought renewed scrutiny to the deal.

steve-bannon.name: Steve Bannon
steve-bannon.bio: American media executive and political strategist. Former White House Chief Strategist. Met with Epstein at his Manhattan townhouse in late 2018, months before Epstein's arrest. Said he was there to discuss politics and media. The meeting raised questions about why Bannon visited a convicted sex offender.

joichi-ito.name: Joichi Ito
joichi-ito.bio: Japanese-American activist, businessman, and former director of MIT Media Lab. Resigned in September 2019 after it was revealed he had concealed the extent of Epstein's donations to MIT. Emails showed he deliberately listed Epstein as "anonymous" in donation records. Had received $1.7 million from Epstein for his personal investments and helped direct $7.5 million to the MIT Media Lab.

marvin-minsky.name: Marvin Minsky
marvin-minsky.bio: American cognitive and computer scientist (1927-2016). Pioneer of artificial intelligence and co-founder of MIT AI Lab. Visited Epstein's private island. Virginia Giuffre alleged she was directed to have sexual relations with Minsky, though he denied any sexual contact. Received research funding through Epstein-connected channels.

george-mitchell.name: George Mitchell
george-mitchell.bio: American politician and diplomat. Former U.S. Senate Majority Leader (1989-1995) and Special Envoy to the Middle East. Named in court documents related to the Epstein case. Virginia Giuffre alleged encounters with Mitchell, which he denied. His name appeared in Epstein's flight logs.

bill-richardson.name: Bill Richardson
bill-richardson.bio: American politician (1947-2023). Former Governor of New Mexico and U.S. Secretary of Energy. Named in court documents related to the Epstein case. Virginia Giuffre alleged encounters with Richardson, which he denied. Epstein had a ranch in New Mexico near Richardson's sphere of influence.

tom-barrack.name: Tom Barrack
tom-barrack.bio: American private equity real estate investor. Founder of Colony Capital (now DigitalBridge). Named in Epstein's contacts. Part of the New York real estate and finance social circle that overlapped with Epstein's network. Later indicted on charges of acting as an unregistered foreign agent for the UAE; acquitted in 2022.

leslie-groff.name: Lesley Groff
leslie-groff.bio: Long-time personal assistant to Jeffrey Epstein. Named in court documents as one of the key members of Epstein's inner circle. Helped organize Epstein's schedule and logistics. Granted non-prosecution agreement as part of the 2008 plea deal.

adriana-ross.name: Adriana Ross
adriana-ross.bio: Former model from Poland. Named as one of Epstein's associates and alleged co-conspirators. Part of Epstein's inner circle of young women. Granted immunity under the 2008 non-prosecution agreement. Invoked the Fifth Amendment when deposed.

denny-hastert.name: Dennis Hastert
denny-hastert.bio: American politician. Former Speaker of the United States House of Representatives (1999-2007). Named in Epstein's contact records. Later convicted in 2015 of structuring bank withdrawals to conceal hush money paid to cover up sexual abuse of boys he had coached in wrestling decades earlier.

stuart-pivar.name: Stuart Pivar
stuart-pivar.bio: American art collector and businessman. Co-founder of the New York Academy of Art with Andy Warhol. Close friend of Jeffrey Epstein for over 20 years. Described himself as Epstein's oldest friend and claimed to have been the one who introduced Epstein to many in the art world.

victoria-zdrok.name: Victoria Zdrok
victoria-zdrok.bio: Ukrainian-American model, lawyer, and author. Named in Epstein's black book and flight logs. Part of the social circle surrounding Epstein.

ron-klein.name: Ron Klein
ron-klein.bio: American politician. Former U.S. Representative from Florida (2007-2011). Chair of the National Jewish Democratic Council. Previously served in the Florida State Legislature.

bob-sternfels.name: Bob Sternfels
bob-sternfels.bio: American business executive. Global Managing Partner of McKinsey & Company since 2021. Leads one of the world's most influential management consulting firms.

rachel-lithgow.name: Rachel Lithgow
rachel-lithgow.bio: American museum and cultural heritage administrator. Executive Director of the American Jewish Historical Society, overseeing the oldest ethnic historical organization in the United States.

neil-barr.name: Neil Barr
neil-barr.bio: American lawyer. Managing Partner of Davis Polk & Wardwell, one of the oldest and most prestigious law firms on Wall Street. The firm has long-standing ties to major financial institutions.

christoph-schweizer.name: Christoph Schweizer
christoph-schweizer.bio: German business executive. CEO of Boston Consulting Group (BCG) since 2021. Leads one of the Big Three management consulting firms with over 25,000 employees worldwide.

jonathan-kessler.name: Jonathan Kessler
jonathan-kessler.bio: American advocacy professional. Executive Director of the American Israel Education Foundation (AIEF), the philanthropic arm of AIPAC that sponsors educational trips to Israel for U.S. lawmakers and political leaders.

canary-mission-anonymous.name: Anonymous Founders
canary-mission-anonymous.bio: The anonymous founders of Canary Mission, a controversial database that documents individuals and organizations allegedly promoting anti-Semitism, support for BDS, and hatred of the USA/Israel on college campuses.

russell-robinson-ind.name: Russell Robinson
russell-robinson-ind.bio: American nonprofit executive. CEO of the Jewish National Fund-USA (JNF-USA). Has led the organization's land development and environmental projects in Israel.

rupert-murdoch.name: Rupert Murdoch
rupert-murdoch.bio: Australian-born American media mogul. Founder and Chairman Emeritus of News Corp and 21st Century Fox. Built a global media empire including Fox News, The Wall Street Journal, The Times (UK), and HarperCollins. One of the most influential media figures in modern history.

warden-lamine-ndiaye.name: Lamine N'Diaye
warden-lamine-ndiaye.bio: American corrections official. Served as Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. Was warden during the period when Jeffrey Epstein died in custody in August 2019.

bernd-lembcke.name: Bernd Lembcke
bernd-lembcke.bio: German-American hospitality executive. Former Club Manager of Mar-a-Lago, Donald Trump's private club in Palm Beach, Florida.

eli-glickman.name: Eli Glickman
eli-glickman.bio: Israeli business executive. President and CEO of ZIM Integrated Shipping Services, one of the world's largest container shipping companies. Under his leadership ZIM went public on the NYSE in 2021.

hein-schumacher.name: Hein Schumacher
hein-schumacher.bio: Dutch business executive. CEO of Unilever since July 2023. Previously served as CEO of FrieslandCampina. Leads one of the world's largest consumer goods companies.

john-brown-iwm.name: Sir John Brown
john-brown-iwm.bio: British businessman and engineer. Former CEO of BP (1995-2007). Chairman of the Imperial War Museum (2017-2024). Oversaw the expansion of the IWM Holocaust Exhibition.

edmond-elmaleh.name: Edmond El Maleh
edmond-elmaleh.bio: French-Moroccan media professional. Director of Radio Shalom, the Jewish community radio station in Paris broadcasting since 1981.

yonathan-arfi-ind.name: Yonathan Arfi
yonathan-arfi-ind.bio: French Jewish communal leader. President of CRIF (Representative Council of French Jewish Institutions) since 2022, the main umbrella organization representing French Jewish communities.

howard-feldman.name: Howard Feldman
howard-feldman.bio: South African journalist and editor. Editor of the SA Jewish Report, the main English-language Jewish newspaper in South Africa covering community news and Israeli affairs.

richard-sobel.name: Richard Sobel
richard-sobel.bio: South African museum director. Director of the Cape Town Holocaust and Genocide Centre, South Africa's only museum dedicated to the Holocaust and other genocides.

mark-schneider-nestle.name: Mark Schneider
mark-schneider-nestle.bio: German business executive. CEO of Nestle since 2017. Previously led Fresenius health care group. Oversees the world's largest food and beverage company by revenue.

brian-moynihan.name: Brian Moynihan
brian-moynihan.bio: American businessman. Chairman and CEO of Bank of America since 2010. Leads one of the Big Four banking institutions in the United States.

steve-schwarzman.name: Steve Schwarzman
steve-schwarzman.bio: American billionaire businessman. Chairman, CEO, and co-founder of Blackstone, the world's largest alternative investment firm managing $1 trillion in assets. Born to a Jewish family in Philadelphia. Major Republican donor.

paul-singer-ind.name: Paul Singer
paul-singer-ind.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Founder of Elliott Management Corporation, one of the most powerful activist hedge funds. Known for aggressive tactics including seizing Argentine naval vessel. Major Republican donor and pro-Israel advocate.

dan-loeb.name: Dan Loeb
dan-loeb.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Founder and CEO of Third Point LLC. Known as an activist investor targeting companies like Yahoo, Sony, and Nestle. Born to a Jewish family.

nelson-peltz.name: Nelson Peltz
