nelson-peltz.bio: American billionaire businessman. Co-founder of Trian Fund Management. Activist investor who has influenced Disney, P&G, Wendy's, and DuPont. Born to a Jewish family in Brooklyn.

jeff-bezos.name: Jeff Bezos
jeff-bezos.bio: American billionaire technology entrepreneur. Founder and executive chairman of Amazon, the world's largest e-commerce and cloud computing company. Owner of The Washington Post and Blue Origin.

anthony-blinken.name: Antony Blinken
anthony-blinken.bio: American diplomat and politician. U.S. Secretary of State since 2021. Stepson of Samuel Pisar, a Holocaust survivor. Has deep Jewish heritage through his family connections.

sheldon-adelson-estate.name: Miriam Adelson
sheldon-adelson-estate.bio: Israeli-American physician and billionaire philanthropist. Widow of Sheldon Adelson (founder of Las Vegas Sands). One of the largest donors to Republican Party and pro-Israel causes. Owner of The Dallas Mavericks NBA team and Israel Hayom newspaper.

norman-braman.name: Norman Braman
norman-braman.bio: American billionaire businessman and philanthropist. Automobile dealer. Former owner of the Philadelphia Eagles. Major donor to Marco Rubio and Republican causes. Active in Jewish communal organizations.

anderson-cooper.name: Anderson Cooper
anderson-cooper.bio: American journalist. Primary anchor of CNN's Anderson Cooper 360. Correspondent for 60 Minutes. Son of Gloria Vanderbilt. One of the most recognized news anchors in American television.

jake-tapper.name: Jake Tapper
jake-tapper.bio: American journalist, author, and cartoonist. Anchor and Chief Washington correspondent for CNN. Known for pressing political interviewees. Has covered extensively on political figures' connections to various networks.

alan-greenspan.name: Alan Greenspan
alan-greenspan.bio: American economist. Chairman of the Federal Reserve (1987-2006). Served under four presidents. His policies of low interest rates in the 2000s were criticized as contributing to the housing bubble and 2008 financial crisis. Born to a Jewish family in New York.

ben-bernanke.name: Ben Bernanke
ben-bernanke.bio: American economist. Chairman of the Federal Reserve (2006-2014). Led the Fed's response to the 2008 financial crisis. Nobel Prize in Economics (2022). Born to a Jewish family in Augusta, Georgia.

elena-kagan.name: Elena Kagan
elena-kagan.bio: American jurist. Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court since 2010. Former Solicitor General and Harvard Law School Dean. Fourth Jewish Justice to serve on the Supreme Court.

katie-couric.name: Katie Couric
katie-couric.bio: American journalist and TV personality. Former anchor of CBS Evening News and Today show. Attended dinner at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan apartment in 2010, later expressed regret and claimed she did not know the nature of his crimes.

george-stephanopoulos.name: George Stephanopoulos
george-stephanopoulos.bio: American journalist and former political advisor. Anchor of ABC News' Good Morning America. Former aide to Bill Clinton. Attended a dinner at Epstein's Manhattan home in 2010 with other media figures.

chelsea-handler.name: Chelsea Handler
chelsea-handler.bio: American comedian, actress, writer, and television host. Attended one of Epstein's dinners in New York. Subsequently discussed the experience publicly on her shows.

courtney-wild.name: Courtney Wild
courtney-wild.bio: American victim advocate. One of the first victims to publicly identify herself in the Epstein case. Filed a lawsuit challenging the 2008 non-prosecution agreement. Her case was instrumental in the Crime Victims' Rights Act ruling that found the government violated victims' rights by not consulting them before the plea deal.

annie-farmer.name: Annie Farmer
annie-farmer.bio: American educator and Epstein victim. Testified at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial in 2021. Described being recruited as a teenager in the 1990s and being groped by Maxwell at Epstein's New Mexico ranch. Her testimony was considered pivotal in the Maxwell conviction.

carolyn-andriano.name: Carolyn Andriano
carolyn-andriano.bio: Known as "Carolyn" in court documents. One of the key victims in the federal case against Jeffrey Epstein. Testified at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial about being recruited at age 14 and abused at Epstein's Palm Beach mansion starting in 2002. Described a pyramid scheme of recruitment.

barry-krischer.name: Barry Krischer
barry-krischer.bio: Former Palm Beach County State Attorney. Initially handled the Epstein case in 2005-2006 but was criticized for presenting a weak case to the grand jury, resulting in only a single prostitution charge. A grand jury later investigated Krischer's handling of the case.

brad-edwards.name: Brad Edwards
brad-edwards.bio: American attorney. Represented over 50 of Jeffrey Epstein's victims. Co-authored "Relentless Pursuit" about the Epstein case. Filed the Crime Victims' Rights Act lawsuit that exposed the secret plea deal. Key figure in keeping the case alive for over a decade.

julie-k-brown.name: Julie K. Brown
julie-k-brown.bio: American investigative journalist at the Miami Herald. Her groundbreaking 2018 "Perversion of Justice" series documented the sweetheart plea deal, gave voice to victims, and created the public pressure that led to Epstein's 2019 re-arrest by SDNY. Published the book "Perversion of Justice: The Jeffrey Epstein Story." Considered the single most important journalist in exposing the Epstein network. Won multiple awards for her investigation.

sigrid-mccawley.name: Sigrid McCawley
sigrid-mccawley.bio: American attorney at Boies Schiller Flexner. Lead counsel for Virginia Giuffre in lawsuits against Ghislaine Maxwell and others. Successfully argued for unsealing of documents that exposed the scope of Epstein's network.

maurene-comey.name: Maurene Comey
maurene-comey.bio: American prosecutor. Assistant U.S. Attorney in the SDNY who was part of the team that prosecuted the Ghislaine Maxwell case. Daughter of former FBI Director James Comey.

alison-nathan.name: Alison Nathan
alison-nathan.bio: U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of New York. Presided over the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in 2021-2022. Managed the complex proceedings including the unsealing of numerous documents.

jack-scarola.name: Jack Scarola
jack-scarola.bio: American attorney. Represented multiple Epstein victims in civil cases. Based in West Palm Beach, was among the first attorneys to take on Epstein victims' cases.

paul-cassell.name: Paul Cassell
paul-cassell.bio: American lawyer and law professor at the University of Utah. Represented Epstein victims in the Crime Victims' Rights Act case. Former federal judge. His arguments led to the landmark ruling that the 2008 plea deal violated victims' rights.

ken-starr.name: Ken Starr
ken-starr.bio: American lawyer (1946-2022). Former Solicitor General and Independent Counsel who investigated Bill Clinton. Was part of Jeffrey Epstein's legal defense team that negotiated the 2008 plea deal. His involvement was seen as exemplifying the elite legal firepower Epstein deployed.

jay-lefkowitz.name: Jay Lefkowitz
jay-lefkowitz.bio: American lawyer. Partner at Kirkland & Ellis. Was part of Epstein's defense team in the 2007-2008 plea negotiations. His firm also employed Alexander Acosta before he became U.S. Attorney.

gerald-lefcourt.name: Gerald Lefcourt
gerald-lefcourt.bio: American criminal defense attorney. Represented Jeffrey Epstein. Signed a letter to prosecutors in 2007 praising Epstein as a supporter of scientific research and philanthropy, asking for leniency.

martin-weinberg.name: Martin Weinberg
martin-weinberg.bio: American criminal defense attorney. Represented Jeffrey Epstein in 2019 federal case. Previously defended organized crime figures and political figures.

reid-weingarten.name: Reid Weingarten
reid-weingarten.bio: American attorney. Represented Ghislaine Maxwell in her federal criminal case. Previously defended other high-profile clients including former WorldCom CEO Bernie Ebbers.

lynn-forester-de-rothschild.name: Lynn Forester de Rothschild
lynn-forester-de-rothschild.bio: American-British businesswoman. CEO of E.L. Rothschild. Wife of Sir Evelyn de Rothschild. Introduced Jeffrey Epstein to Bill Clinton according to some accounts. Appeared in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers. Had corresponded with Epstein.

thomas-pritzker.name: Thomas Pritzker
thomas-pritzker.bio: American billionaire businessman. Executive Chairman of Hyatt Hotels Corporation. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers. Member of the prominent Pritzker family of Chicago.

steven-hoffenberg.name: Steven Hoffenberg
steven-hoffenberg.bio: American financier and convicted fraudster (1944-2022). Former business partner of Jeffrey Epstein in the late 1980s and 1990s. Together they attempted to take over Pan American World Airways. Hoffenberg was convicted of running a $475 million Ponzi scheme through Towers Financial; he claimed Epstein was his partner in the fraud but Epstein was never charged. Found dead in 2022.

ron-burkle.name: Ron Burkle
ron-burkle.bio: American billionaire businessman. Founder of The Yucaipa Companies. Close associate of Bill Clinton. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of Clinton's circle that overlapped with Epstein's network. Flew on Clinton's trips.

michael-sitrick.name: Michael Sitrick
michael-sitrick.bio: American crisis management and public relations executive. Founder of Sitrick and Company. Represented Leslie Wexner during the Epstein scandal fallout.

darren-indyke.name: Darren Indyke
darren-indyke.bio: American attorney. Longtime lawyer for Jeffrey Epstein. Named as a co-executor of Epstein's estate. Managed legal and financial affairs for Epstein for years. Named in various lawsuits related to the Epstein estate and alleged to have facilitated parts of the operation.

richard-kahn.name: Richard Kahn
richard-kahn.bio: American financial executive. Co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate alongside Darren Indyke. Had managed financial matters for Epstein. Both executors faced lawsuits from victims seeking compensation from the estate.

pepe-fanjul.name: Pepe Fanjul
pepe-fanjul.bio: Cuban-American billionaire businessman. Vice Chairman of Flo-Sun, one of the largest sugar producers in the US. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the Palm Beach social elite that overlapped with Epstein's circle.

les-wexner-foundation.name: Abigail Wexner
les-wexner-foundation.bio: American billionaire businessman. Founder and former CEO of L Brands (Victoria's Secret, Bath & Body Works). Epstein's most important benefactor and the only known financial management client. Gave Epstein power of attorney and control over his financial affairs. Transferred the Manhattan townhouse (originally valued at $77 million) to Epstein for unknown reasons. Gave Epstein a $70 million Boeing 727 (the Lolita Express). Questions about what Wexner knew have never been resolved. His Wexner Foundation invested hundreds of millions through Epstein. Wexner claimed Epstein "misappropriated vast sums of money from me," but no charges were ever filed for this alleged theft. Ed Razek (Victoria's Secret CMO) was accused of misconduct toward models. The Victoria's Secret brand provided Epstein with a cover story for recruiting young women, claiming he was a "talent scout."

tony-blair.name: Tony Blair
tony-blair.bio: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (1997-2007). Named in Epstein's black book. Visited Epstein after leaving office. Connections between Blair and Epstein came through mutual associates including Peter Mandelson.

andrew-cuomo.name: Andrew Cuomo
andrew-cuomo.bio: Former Governor of New York (2011-2021). Named in Epstein's black book. His then-wife Kerry Kennedy (daughter of Robert F. Kennedy) also appeared in the contacts.

bill-barr.name: William Barr
bill-barr.bio: American attorney. U.S. Attorney General (2019-2020, also 1991-93 under Bush Sr.). Oversaw the federal response after Epstein's death in custody. His father Donald Barr hired Epstein as a teacher at Dalton School in 1974 despite Epstein having no degree. Recused himself from parts of the case citing a conflict of interest related to his former law firm.

john-kerry.name: John Kerry
john-kerry.bio: American politician and diplomat. Former U.S. Secretary of State and 2004 presidential candidate. Named in Epstein's black book.

chris-tucker.name: Chris Tucker
chris-tucker.bio: American actor and comedian. Appeared on Epstein's flight logs for a 2002 trip to Africa with Bill Clinton and others on Epstein's Boeing 727. Tucker said the trip was a humanitarian mission.

al-gore.name: Al Gore
al-gore.bio: Former Vice President of the United States (1993-2001). Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the Clinton-era political circle connected to Epstein.

george-pataki.name: George Pataki
george-pataki.bio: Former Governor of New York (1995-2006). Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers.

murray-gell-mann.name: Murray Gell-Mann
murray-gell-mann.bio: American physicist (1929-2019). Nobel Prize winner (1969) for work on elementary particles. Visited Epstein's properties. Epstein cultivated relationships with leading scientists by funding research and hosting scientific gatherings at his properties.

stephen-hawking.name: Stephen Hawking
stephen-hawking.bio: British theoretical physicist (1942-2018). One of the most famous scientists in history. Attended a scientific conference on Epstein's private island in 2006. Photos emerged of Hawking at socializing events connected to Epstein's Virgin Islands property.

george-church.name: George Church
george-church.bio: American geneticist. Professor at Harvard and MIT. Pioneer of the Human Genome Project. Met with Epstein and accepted research funding. Epstein proposed a plan to "seed the human race" with his DNA at his New Mexico ranch, drawing on contact with scientists like Church.

frank-wilczek.name: Frank Wilczek
frank-wilczek.bio: American theoretical physicist. Nobel Prize in Physics (2004). Appeared in Epstein's black book and was connected to Epstein through scientific circles that Epstein cultivated.

robert-trivers.name: Robert Trivers
robert-trivers.bio: American evolutionary biologist and sociobiologist at Rutgers University. Received research funding from the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation. Had a close relationship with Epstein and visited his properties.

lisa-randall.name: Lisa Randall
lisa-randall.bio: American theoretical physicist at Harvard. Named in Epstein's black book. One of many scientists Epstein cultivated by offering funding and access to exclusive gatherings.

oliver-sacks.name: Oliver Sacks
oliver-sacks.bio: British neurologist and author (1933-2015). Named in Epstein's black book. Author of "The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat" and other popular science books.

danny-hillis.name: Danny Hillis
danny-hillis.bio: American inventor, scientist, and author. Co-founder of Thinking Machines Corporation. Close associate of Epstein who served as a scientific advisor. Attended Epstein's dinners and introduced other scientists to Epstein. His company Applied Invention received Epstein funding.

nathan-wolfe.name: Nathan Wolfe
nathan-wolfe.bio: American virologist. Founder of Global Viral (now Metabiota). Received funding from the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation. Epstein sat on the advisory board of his organization. Later connections to pandemic preparedness research drew scrutiny.

gabriel-bhatt.name: Rafael Reif
gabriel-bhatt.bio: Venezuelan-American electrical engineer. President of MIT (2012-2022). Reportedly knew of and approved concealed donations from Epstein to the MIT Media Lab. Internal investigation found he was aware the donations were being anonymized. Resigned as president in 2022.

katinka-matson.name: Katinka Matson
katinka-matson.bio: American literary agent and co-founder of Brockman Inc. and Edge Foundation. The Edge gatherings connected Epstein with a network of elite scientists and thinkers. Her husband John Brockman facilitated many Epstein-scientist introductions.

heidi-klum.name: Heidi Klum
heidi-klum.bio: German-American supermodel and television personality. Named in Epstein's black book.

elle-macpherson.name: Elle Macpherson
elle-macpherson.bio: Australian supermodel and businesswoman. Named in Epstein's flight logs. Had a social relationship with Epstein and was photographed at events with him.

flavio-briatore.name: Flavio Briatore
flavio-briatore.bio: Italian businessman and former Formula One team principal. Close associate of Ghislaine Maxwell and named in Epstein's black book. Part of the European jet-set social circle connected to Maxwell and Epstein.

mick-jagger.name: Mick Jagger
mick-jagger.bio: British musician. Lead singer of the Rolling Stones. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers.

courtney-love.name: Courtney Love
courtney-love.bio: American musician, actress, and artist. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the entertainment world contacts in the book.

alec-baldwin.name: Alec Baldwin
alec-baldwin.bio: American actor and producer. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers.

ralph-fiennes.name: Ralph Fiennes
ralph-fiennes.bio: British actor. Named in Epstein's black book. Star of Schindler's List and the Harry Potter series.

dustin-hoffman.name: Dustin Hoffman
dustin-hoffman.bio: American actor. Born 1937 in Los Angeles to a Jewish family. Two-time Academy Award winner. Known for The Graduate, Rain Man, etc.

chris-rock.name: Chris Rock
chris-rock.bio: American comedian and actor. Named in Epstein's black book.

david-blaine.name: David Blaine
david-blaine.bio: American magician and endurance artist. Close personal associate of Jeffrey Epstein. Attended multiple events at Epstein's homes. Flew on Epstein's planes. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple entries. Was known to perform for Epstein's guests. Accused by a former model of sexual assault in 2009; did not face charges.

david-copperfield.name: David Copperfield
david-copperfield.bio: American magician and illusionist. Named in Epstein's black book. Virginia Giuffre named him in testimony, though he denied any misconduct. One of the most famous magicians in the world.

cate-blanchett.name: Cate Blanchett
cate-blanchett.bio: Australian actress. Named in Epstein's black book. Two-time Academy Award winner.

andrea-casiraghi.name: Andrea Casiraghi
andrea-casiraghi.bio: Member of the Monaco royal family. Named in Epstein's black book. Son of Princess Caroline of Monaco.

prince-albert-monaco.name: Prince Albert II of Monaco
prince-albert-monaco.bio: Sovereign Prince of Monaco since 2005. Named in Epstein's black book.

isabelle-de-rouvre.name: Isabelle de Rouvre
isabelle-de-rouvre.bio: French property owner. Sold Jeffrey Epstein a Paris apartment for $8.4 million. Later sued Epstein claiming she was swindled and that the apartment was used for trafficking.

sarah-ferguson.name: Sarah Ferguson
sarah-ferguson.bio: Duchess of York and former wife of Prince Andrew. Andrew paid off a 15,000 GBP debt to her using money from Epstein. Later said she was "deeply regretful" for the connection.

nacho-figueras.name: Nacho Figueras
nacho-figueras.bio: Argentine polo player and model. Part of the international social set connected to Epstein through Palm Beach and New York circles.

nicky-hilton.name: Nicky Hilton
nicky-hilton.bio: American socialite, businesswoman, and fashion designer. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the New York high-society circle.

conrad-black.name: Conrad Black
conrad-black.bio: Canadian-born British media proprietor. Named in Epstein's black book. Former owner of Hollinger International (Telegraph newspapers). Later convicted of fraud. Close to Ghislaine Maxwell's social circle.

juan-alessi.name: Juan Alessi
juan-alessi.bio: Former house manager at Epstein's Palm Beach mansion for over 11 years (1990-2002). Testified at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial about the daily operations, including that Maxwell kept a "manual" for staff with strict rules about not speaking to anyone about the household. Described regular visits by young women.

cimberly-espinosa.name: Cimberly Espinosa
cimberly-espinosa.bio: Former executive assistant to Jeffrey Epstein at his New York office. Testified at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial about scheduling and operations. Described Ghislaine Maxwell as the "lady of the house."

mary-erdoes.name: Mary Erdoes
mary-erdoes.bio: American banker. CEO of JP Morgan Asset & Wealth Management. JP Morgan maintained Epstein as a client until 2013 despite his conviction. The US Virgin Islands sued JP Morgan for facilitating Epstein's sex trafficking, and the bank settled for $75 million in 2023.

deutsche-bank-rel.name: Rosemary Vrablic
deutsche-bank-rel.bio: American banker. Former managing director at Deutsche Bank. Personally managed Jeffrey Epstein's accounts at Deutsche Bank from 2013-2018. Deutsche Bank later admitted serious failures in monitoring Epstein's accounts and paid $150 million in penalties. Vrablic resigned in 2020.

david-koch.name: David Koch
david-koch.bio: American billionaire businessman (1940-2019). Co-owner of Koch Industries. Named in Epstein's black book. One of the wealthiest people in the world at the time of his death.

james-patterson.name: James Patterson
james-patterson.bio: American author. The best-selling author in the world. Co-wrote "Filthy Rich: The Shocking True Story of Jeffrey Epstein" in 2016, one of the first major books to investigate the Epstein case.

charlie-rose.name: Charlie Rose
charlie-rose.bio: American television journalist. Former host of Charlie Rose on PBS and CBS This Morning. Named in Epstein's black book. Later faced his own sexual harassment allegations and was fired from CBS and PBS in 2017.

mike-wallace.name: Mike Wallace
mike-wallace.bio: American journalist and media personality (1918-2012). Legendary 60 Minutes correspondent. Named in Epstein's black book.

barbara-walters.name: Barbara Walters
barbara-walters.bio: American broadcast journalist (1929-2022). Pioneer of TV news. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers.

diane-sawyer.name: Diane Sawyer
diane-sawyer.bio: American television journalist. Former anchor of ABC World News. Named in Epstein's black book.

peter-soros.name: Peter Soros
peter-soros.bio: Hungarian-American businessman and philanthropist. Nephew of George Soros. Named in Epstein's black book.

arpad-busson.name: Arpad Busson
arpad-busson.bio: French financier and philanthropist. Founder of EIM Group. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the European finance and philanthropy circuit.

gerald-goldsmith.name: Zac Goldsmith
gerald-goldsmith.bio: British politician, Baron Goldsmith. Named in Epstein's black book. Son of financier James Goldsmith. Former Minister of State for Pacific and the Environment.

jeffrey-fuller.name: Jeffrey Fuller
jeffrey-fuller.bio: American modeling executive. Partner in MC2 Model Management alongside Jean-Luc Brunel. MC2 was funded by Epstein and served as a pipeline for young models. Based in Miami.

greg-holbert.name: Greg Holbert
greg-holbert.bio: Former Palm Beach police detective. Led the initial investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in 2005 after a victim's mother reported to police. Built a case documenting dozens of victims before the case was taken to the FBI.

alan-patricof.name: Alan Patricof
alan-patricof.bio: American venture capitalist. Founder of Greycroft Partners and Apax Partners. Named in Epstein's black book. Major Democratic Party fundraiser.

vera-wang.name: Vera Wang
vera-wang.bio: American fashion designer. Named in Epstein's black book. One of the most famous fashion designers in the world.

wendi-deng.name: Wendi Deng
wendi-deng.bio: Chinese-American businesswoman. Ex-wife of Rupert Murdoch. Named in Epstein's black book and connected to his social circle. Later linked to Ghislaine Maxwell's social network.

conrad-hilton-family.name: Paris Hilton
conrad-hilton-family.bio: American socialite and media personality. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the New York socialite circle.

maria-farmer.name: Maria Farmer
maria-farmer.bio: American artist. One of the first victims to report Epstein and Maxwell to the FBI in 1996. Was assaulted at Wexner's Ohio estate while working for Epstein. Her complaint to the FBI was effectively ignored for years.

ivana-trump.name: Ivana Trump
ivana-trump.bio: Czech-American businesswoman and former model (1949-2022). First wife of Donald Trump. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the New York social elite connected to Epstein.

elaine-maxwell.name: Isabel Maxwell
elaine-maxwell.bio: British-American technology entrepreneur. Twin sister of Ghislaine Maxwell. Daughter of Robert Maxwell. Founded CommTouch (now Cyren), an Israeli software company. Her possible knowledge of Ghislaine and Epstein's activities has been the subject of speculation.

christine-maxwell.name: Christine Maxwell
christine-maxwell.bio: British-American internet pioneer. Sister of Ghislaine Maxwell. Co-founded Magellan, one of the first internet search engines. Married to Roger Malina. Her connections to internet technology and her father's intelligence connections have drawn scrutiny.

kevin-maxwell.name: Kevin Maxwell
kevin-maxwell.bio: British businessman. Brother of Ghislaine Maxwell. Son of Robert Maxwell. Was acquitted of fraud charges related to his father's Mirror Group pension scandal. Attended Ghislaine's trial.

ian-maxwell.name: Ian Maxwell
ian-maxwell.bio: British publisher. Brother of Ghislaine Maxwell. Head of the Maxwell family. Publicly defended Ghislaine and attended her trial. Currently runs a publishing company.

larry-visoski.name: Larry Visoski
larry-visoski.bio: Epstein's chief pilot for over 25 years. Flew the Boeing 727 "Lolita Express" and Epstein's Gulfstream. Testified at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial. Said he flew celebrities, politicians, and scientists but claimed he never witnessed sexual activity. Kept flight logs that became crucial evidence.

david-rodgers.name: David Rodgers
david-rodgers.bio: Epstein's pilot. His handwritten flight logs became key evidence listing hundreds of passengers on Epstein's planes between 1995-2013. The logs documented flights to Little St. James, Teterboro, Palm Beach, Paris, and other destinations.

mark-epstein.name: Mark Epstein
mark-epstein.bio: Jeffrey Epstein's younger brother. Real estate developer in New York. Owned apartments in buildings where Epstein allegedly housed young women. Testified in depositions about his brother's activities. Connected to Epstein's property management.

emmy-tayler.name: Emmy Tayler
emmy-tayler.bio: British personal assistant to Ghislaine Maxwell. Described as Maxwell's "right hand." Alleged to have helped manage logistics. Named by victims in depositions as being present during abuse.

haley-robson.name: Haley Robson
haley-robson.bio: Recruited teenage girls for Jeffrey Epstein while herself a minor. Described as a key recruiter in Palm Beach, bringing girls to Epstein's mansion for $200 per recruit. Later cooperated with law enforcement. Testified at Maxwell trial about the recruitment pyramid.

alfredo-rodriguez.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
alfredo-rodriguez.bio: Epstein's former butler at his Palm Beach home. Stole Epstein's "black book" of contacts and attempted to sell it for $50,000. Was sentenced to 18 months in prison for obstruction. The black book he took became one of the most important pieces of evidence in the case. Died of mesothelioma in 2015.

janusz-banasiak.name: Janusz Banasiak
janusz-banasiak.bio: Maintenance worker at Epstein's Palm Beach estate. Testified he was instructed to clean sex toys and witnessed daily visits by young girls. Destroyed hard drives from Epstein's security cameras on orders from Epstein's staff.

miles-alexander.name: Miles Alexander
miles-alexander.bio: Sued Epstein's estate as a victim advocate and witness. Connected to the management of Epstein's Little St. James island operations.

sarah-ransome.name: Sarah Ransome
sarah-ransome.bio: South African-born victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. Reported being trapped on Little St. James island in 2006 and attempting to swim away. Filed lawsuits against Epstein, Maxwell, and associates. Co-authored "Silenced No More" about her experience as a trafficking survivor.

johanna-sjoberg.name: Johanna Sjoberg
johanna-sjoberg.bio: Victim and witness. College student recruited by Maxwell to work for Epstein. Described the infamous photo of Prince Andrew with his arm around Virginia Giuffre. Testified in depositions about sexual abuse and the operation of Epstein's homes.

teresa-helm.name: Teresa Helm
teresa-helm.bio: Epstein victim who was recruited as a masseuse. Among the women who came forward in the original Palm Beach investigation. Testified about Epstein's abuse pattern.

michelle-licata.name: Michelle Licata
michelle-licata.bio: One of the Palm Beach victims who was 16 when recruited to Epstein's mansion. Appeared in Julie K. Brown's Miami Herald investigation. Spoke publicly about the abuse and the failure of the justice system.

chauntae-davies.name: Chauntae Davies
chauntae-davies.bio: Former massage therapist and victim of Jeffrey Epstein. Recruited by Maxwell. Was photographed with Bill Clinton on the 2002 Africa trip on Epstein's plane. Has spoken publicly about being raped by Epstein multiple times.

elizabeth-stein.name: Elizabeth Stein
elizabeth-stein.bio: One of the Jane Does in the Epstein litigation. Filed claims against the Epstein estate's victims' compensation fund.

priscilla-doe.name: Priscilla Doe
priscilla-doe.bio: Pseudonymous Epstein accuser. Filed suit in 2019 alleging she was trafficked and abused starting at age 20. One of numerous Jane/John Does in Epstein-related litigation.

lindsay-menz.name: Lindsay Menz
lindsay-menz.bio: Victim advocate connected to the Epstein case who helped bring attention to the scope of abuse.

doug-band.name: Doug Band
doug-band.bio: American political advisor. Co-founder of Teneo and longtime aide to Bill Clinton. Appeared on Epstein flight logs accompanying Clinton. Served as gatekeeper for Clinton's post-presidential activities and was reportedly present on flights to Africa and elsewhere.

ehud-olmert.name: Ehud Olmert
ehud-olmert.bio: Former Prime Minister of Israel (2006-2009). Named in Epstein's black book. His predecessor Barak had even closer Epstein ties.

jose-maria-aznar.name: Jose Maria Aznar
jose-maria-aznar.bio: Former Prime Minister of Spain (1996-2004). Named in Epstein's black book.

terrence-duvernay.name: Terrence Duvernay
terrence-duvernay.bio: Former U.S. Secret Service agent. Reportedly detailed to Epstein under a security agreement. His presence raised questions about government connections to Epstein.

rupert-murdoch-son.name: James Murdoch
rupert-murdoch-son.bio: British-American businessman. Son of Rupert Murdoch. Former CEO of 21st Century Fox. Named in Epstein's contacts.

phil-collins-ep.name: Phil Collins
phil-collins-ep.bio: British musician, singer, and drummer. Named in Epstein's black book.

bobby-de-niro.name: Robert De Niro
bobby-de-niro.bio: American actor and producer. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact entries.

bruce-willis.name: Bruce Willis
bruce-willis.bio: American actor. Named in Epstein's black book.

minnie-driver-ep.name: Minnie Driver
minnie-driver-ep.bio: British-American actress. Named in Epstein's black book.

elizabeth-hurley.name: Elizabeth Hurley
elizabeth-hurley.bio: British actress and model. Named in Epstein's black book.

christy-turlington.name: Christy Turlington
christy-turlington.bio: American supermodel. Named in Epstein's black book.

claudia-schiffer.name: Claudia Schiffer
claudia-schiffer.bio: German supermodel. Named in Epstein's black book.

carol-alt.name: Carol Alt
carol-alt.bio: American supermodel and actress. Named in Epstein's black book.

jimmy-buffett-ep.name: Jimmy Buffett
jimmy-buffett-ep.bio: American musician, songwriter, and businessman (1946-2023). Named in Epstein's black book. Had property near Epstein's in the Caribbean.

john-cleese-ep.name: John Cleese
john-cleese-ep.bio: British actor and comedian. Co-founder of Monty Python. Named in Epstein's black book.

tim-robbins.name: Tim Robbins
tim-robbins.bio: American actor and filmmaker. Named in Epstein's black book.

brian-grazer.name: Brian Grazer
brian-grazer.bio: American film and television producer. Co-founder of Imagine Entertainment with Ron Howard. Named in Epstein's black book.

peggy-siegal.name: Peggy Siegal
peggy-siegal.bio: New York public relations executive and social fixture. Close associate of Epstein who helped rehabilitate his image after 2008. Arranged post-conviction social events and dinners for Epstein with prominent guests. Lost her career after the 2019 arrest.

peter-brant.name: Peter Brant
peter-brant.bio: American billionaire businessman, newspaper publisher, and art collector. Named in Epstein's black book. Major figure in the New York art and social scene.

john-gutfreund.name: John Gutfreund
john-gutfreund.bio: American businessman (1929-2016). Former CEO of Salomon Brothers. Named in Epstein's black book. Known as "the King of Wall Street" in the 1980s.

wilbur-ross.name: Wilbur Ross
wilbur-ross.bio: American billionaire investor and politician. Former U.S. Secretary of Commerce. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers. Known for restructuring failed companies.

john-paulson.name: John Paulson
john-paulson.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Founder of Paulson & Co. Named in Epstein's contacts. Famous for making $15 billion betting against subprime mortgages.

paul-tudor-jones.name: Paul Tudor Jones
paul-tudor-jones.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Founder of Tudor Investment Corp. Named in Epstein's black book.

dov-charney.name: Dov Charney
dov-charney.bio: Canadian-American businessman. Founder of American Apparel. Named in Epstein's contacts.

mort-janklow.name: Mort Janklow
mort-janklow.bio: American literary agent (1930-2022). Founded Janklow & Nesbit Associates. Named in Epstein's black book. One of the most powerful literary agents in New York.

gordon-getty.name: Gordon Getty
gordon-getty.bio: American billionaire businessman and composer. Heir to the Getty oil fortune. Named in Epstein's black book.

reinaldo-herrera.name: Reinaldo Herrera
reinaldo-herrera.bio: Venezuelan-American socialite, editor, and aristocrat. Named in Epstein's black book. Vanity Fair contributing editor.

evelyn-de-rothschild.name: Sir Evelyn de Rothschild
evelyn-de-rothschild.bio: British financier (1931-2022). Former chairman of N M Rothschild & Sons. His wife Lynn Forester de Rothschild was in Epstein's inner circle. Named in Epstein's black book.

sandy-gallin.name: Sandy Gallin
sandy-gallin.bio: American talent manager and real estate developer (1940-2017). Managed Dolly Parton, Cher, and Michael Jackson. Named in Epstein's black book.

bruce-wasserstein.name: Bruce Wasserstein
bruce-wasserstein.bio: American investment banker (1947-2009). CEO of Lazard. Named in Epstein's black book. Known as "Bid-'em-up Bruce" for his M&A work.

edgar-bronfman-jr.name: Edgar Bronfman Jr.
edgar-bronfman-jr.bio: Canadian-American businessman. Former CEO of Warner Music Group and Seagram Company. Named in Epstein's black book. Son of Edgar Bronfman Sr.

matthew-bronfman.name: Matthew Bronfman
matthew-bronfman.bio: American-Canadian businessman. Investment banker and Bronfman family member. Named in Epstein's contacts.

ed-razek.name: Ed Razek
ed-razek.bio: Former Chief Marketing Officer of L Brands (Victoria's Secret). Controlled casting for Victoria's Secret Fashion Shows and catalog. Accused of using his position for sexual misconduct. Victims alleged Epstein exploited his connection to Wexner and Razek to lure models with promises of Victoria's Secret work. Retired in 2019.

erin-heatherton.name: Erin Heatherton
erin-heatherton.bio: American model and former Victoria's Secret Angel. Alleged that Epstein held sway over Victoria's Secret casting. Multiple models reported that Epstein posed as a VS recruiter to gain access to young women.

leon-botstein.name: Leon Botstein
leon-botstein.bio: American conductor and academic. President of Bard College. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the academic and cultural elite Epstein cultivated.

henry-rosovsky.name: Henry Rosovsky
henry-rosovsky.bio: American economist. Former Dean of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences at Harvard. Epstein donated to Harvard's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics and was given an office at the university even after his conviction. Rosovsky helped facilitate Epstein's Harvard connections.

martin-nowak.name: Martin Nowak
martin-nowak.bio: Austrian-American mathematical biologist. Director of Harvard's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics, which received $6.5 million from Epstein. Nowak maintained the relationship and served as Epstein's primary Harvard contact even post-conviction. Harvard investigated the donations.

alan-krueger.name: Alan Krueger
alan-krueger.bio: American economist (1960-2019). Princeton University professor and former Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers. Named in Epstein's contacts. Part of the academic network Epstein cultivated.

eric-lander.name: Eric Lander
eric-lander.bio: American mathematician and geneticist. Former director of the Broad Institute at MIT/Harvard. Named in Epstein's contacts. Later served briefly as Biden's science advisor before resigning. Part of the scientific elite that Epstein courted.

prince-mohammed-bin-salman.name: Mohammed bin Salman
prince-mohammed-bin-salman.bio: Crown Prince and Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia. Named in reporting on Epstein's international connections. Epstein cultivated relationships with Middle Eastern leaders and claimed to do business consulting in the region.

wafic-said.name: Wafic Said
wafic-said.bio: Syrian-born Saudi Arabian businessman. Named in Epstein's black book. Billionaire philanthropist known for funding the Said Business School at Oxford.

hasnat-khan.name: Hasnat Khan
hasnat-khan.bio: British-Pakistani heart surgeon. Named in Epstein's black book. Former boyfriend of Princess Diana.

ghislaine-noam.name: Nicole Junkermann
ghislaine-noam.bio: German-born businesswoman and investor. Founded NJF Holdings. Connected to Epstein through business dealings. Reported to have visited Epstein's island. Her business ties have drawn media scrutiny.

giuseppe-cipriani.name: Giuseppe Cipriani
giuseppe-cipriani.bio: Italian-American restaurateur. Owner of Cipriani restaurants. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple entries.

thierry-lhermitte.name: Thierry Lhermitte
thierry-lhermitte.bio: French actor. Named in Epstein's black book as part of his French contacts, largely cultivated through Jean-Luc Brunel and the Paris modeling scene.

cecile-de-jongh.name: Cecile de Jongh
cecile-de-jongh.bio: Wife of John de Jongh Jr., former Governor of the U.S. Virgin Islands. Worked for one of Epstein's companies in the USVI, Southern Trust Company. Her employment raised conflict-of-interest concerns given Epstein's tax arrangements with the territory.

john-de-jongh.name: John de Jongh Jr.
john-de-jongh.bio: Former Governor of the U.S. Virgin Islands (2007-2015). Epstein contributed to his campaigns and his wife worked for an Epstein company. The USVI later sued Epstein's estate and JP Morgan for facilitating trafficking on its territory.

john-duffy.name: John Duffy
john-duffy.bio: Former JP Morgan executive. Communicated with Jes Staley about Epstein's account. JP Morgan internal emails showed bankers discussed Epstein's criminal status but maintained his accounts for the revenue they generated.

paul-morris.name: Paul Morris
paul-morris.bio: Deutsche Bank relationship manager involved in onboarding and maintaining Epstein's accounts after JP Morgan dropped him in 2013. Deutsche Bank paid $150 million to NY regulators for compliance failures related to the Epstein accounts.

joseph-recarey.name: Joseph Recarey
joseph-recarey.bio: Palm Beach Police detective. Key investigator in the original 2005 Epstein case. Conducted victim interviews and built a case with 36 identified victims before the FBI took over. Died in 2018 under unexplained circumstances, which some have found suspicious.

marie-villafana.name: Marie Villafana
marie-villafana.bio: Former Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of Florida. Helped negotiate the controversial 2008 plea deal. Later transferred out of the district. Her role in the lenient agreement was scrutinized.

glenn-aguilar.name: Glenn Aguilar
glenn-aguilar.bio: Construction manager on Epstein's Little St. James island. Oversaw building projects including the infamous blue-and-white striped temple structure. Workers on the island reported strange construction requirements.

tiffany-doe.name: Tiffany Doe
tiffany-doe.bio: Pseudonymous accuser who filed a 2016 lawsuit alleging she was recruited by Epstein at age 13. The suit named both Epstein and Donald Trump, but was dropped before the 2016 election amid reported threats against the plaintiff.

matt-lauer.name: Matt Lauer
matt-lauer.bio: American television journalist. Former anchor of The Today Show. Named in Epstein's contacts. Later fired from NBC in 2017 over sexual misconduct allegations. Briefly owned property near Epstein's in New Zealand.

tom-brokaw.name: Tom Brokaw
tom-brokaw.bio: American television journalist. Former NBC Nightly News anchor. Named in Epstein's black book.

ted-kennedy.name: Ted Kennedy
ted-kennedy.bio: American politician (1932-2009). U.S. Senator from Massachusetts for nearly 47 years. Named in Epstein's black book.

rudy-giuliani.name: Rudy Giuliani
rudy-giuliani.bio: American lawyer and politician. Former Mayor of New York City. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact entries. Was NYC mayor during the time Epstein operated from his East 71st Street townhouse.

michael-wolf.name: Michael Wolff
michael-wolf.bio: American journalist and author. Named in Epstein's contacts. Author of "Fire and Fury" about the Trump administration.

joan-rivers.name: Joan Rivers
joan-rivers.bio: American comedian and television host (1933-2014). Named in Epstein's black book.

gayle-king.name: Gayle King
gayle-king.bio: American television journalist. CBS Mornings co-host. Named in Epstein's contacts.

michael-jackson-ep.name: Michael Jackson
michael-jackson-ep.bio: American singer and entertainer (1958-2009). Named in Epstein's black book. One of the most famous entertainers in history.

magician-uri-geller.name: Uri Geller
magician-uri-geller.bio: Israeli-British illusionist. Named in Epstein's black book. Known for spoon-bending acts. Lives near Epstein associate Ehud Barak in Israel.

kevin-costner.name: Kevin Costner
kevin-costner.bio: American actor and filmmaker. Named in Epstein's black book.

ben-affleck.name: Ben Affleck
ben-affleck.bio: American actor and filmmaker. Named in Epstein's contacts.

matt-damon.name: Matt Damon
matt-damon.bio: American actor. Named in Epstein's contacts.

chelsea-clinton.name: Chelsea Clinton
chelsea-clinton.bio: American author and global health advocate. Daughter of Bill and Hillary Clinton. Named in Epstein's contacts due to Clinton family connections.

ghislaine-friends-shelley.name: Shelley Lewis
ghislaine-friends-shelley.bio: Television producer and member of Ghislaine Maxwell's social circle. Attended Maxwell's social events. Part of the New York society set that enabled Maxwell's standing.

christina-oxenberg.name: Princess Christina Oxenberg
christina-oxenberg.bio: American author and member of the Serbian royal family. Part of the New York social scene connected to Maxwell. Later became an outspoken critic of Epstein and Maxwell after learning about the abuse.

christopher-mason.name: Christopher Mason
christopher-mason.bio: British-born New York journalist and socialite. Knew Ghislaine Maxwell socially and reported on the Epstein case. Described the normalization of Epstein in New York society.

ranch-manager.name: Brice Gordon
ranch-manager.bio: Ranch manager at Epstein's Zorro Ranch in Stanley, New Mexico. The 10,000-acre ranch was where Epstein reportedly planned to "seed the human race" with his DNA through a mass insemination program involving transhumanist ideas. Victims reported being brought to the ranch.

cravath-lawyer.name: Robert Giuffra
cravath-lawyer.bio: American attorney at Sullivan & Cromwell. Represented Deutsche Bank in Epstein-related litigation. Not related to Virginia Giuffre despite the similar surname.

boies-connection.name: Laura Menninger
boies-connection.bio: American attorney. Represented Ghislaine Maxwell at her criminal trial alongside Jeffrey Pagliuca. Part of the defense team from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman in Denver.

jeffrey-pagliuca.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
jeffrey-pagliuca.bio: American attorney. Co-represented Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal defense. Partner at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman.

comey-original.name: James Comey
comey-original.bio: American lawyer. Former FBI Director (2013-2017). His daughter Maurene Comey was on the Maxwell prosecution team. Before his tenure, the FBI had investigated Epstein but failed to bring federal charges before 2019.

leon-black-wife.name: Debra Black
leon-black-wife.bio: American philanthropist. Wife of Leon Black. Both appeared in Epstein's social circle. She and Leon Black attended events connected to Epstein.

jeffrey-sachs.name: Jeffrey Sachs
jeffrey-sachs.bio: American economist and professor at Columbia University. Named in Epstein's contacts. Prominent expert on sustainable development and global poverty.

eileen-ford.name: Eileen Ford
eileen-ford.bio: American businesswoman (1922-2014). Co-founder of Ford Models, the world's most prominent modeling agency. Named in Epstein's black book. The modeling industry was a key pipeline for Epstein and Brunel to access young women.

stephanie-seymour.name: Stephanie Seymour
stephanie-seymour.bio: American supermodel. Named in Epstein's black book. Connected to the Victoria's Secret and modeling world that overlapped with Epstein's network.

larry-gagosian.name: Larry Gagosian
larry-gagosian.bio: American art dealer. Founder of Gagosian Gallery, the world's largest gallery network. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the intersection of art, wealth, and social power that Epstein cultivated.

jeff-epstein-donkey.name: Richard Branson
jeff-epstein-donkey.bio: British entrepreneur. Founder of Virgin Group. Named in Epstein's black book. Epstein visited Branson's Necker Island in the Caribbean, near Epstein's own island.

simon-de-pury.name: Simon de Pury
simon-de-pury.bio: Swiss art auctioneer and collector. Named in Epstein's black book. Chairman of Phillips auction house.

clinton-aide-justin.name: Justin Cooper
clinton-aide-justin.bio: Aide to Bill Clinton who managed technology for the Clinton Foundation. Appeared in Epstein flight log documentation.

huma-abedin.name: Huma Abedin
huma-abedin.bio: American political staffer. Senior aide to Hillary Clinton. Named in Epstein's contacts through the Clinton connection.

alan-dershowitz-acc.name: Clare Hazell-Iveagh
alan-dershowitz-acc.bio: British socialite. Countess of Iveagh. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the British aristocratic social circle connected to Maxwell and Prince Andrew.

viscount-linley.name: Viscount David Linley
viscount-linley.bio: British furniture maker and former chairman of Christie's. Nephew of Queen Elizabeth II. Named in Epstein's black book.

earl-spencer.name: Earl Charles Spencer
earl-spencer.bio: British peer and author. Brother of Princess Diana. Named in Epstein's black book.

andrew-lloyd-webber.name: Andrew Lloyd Webber
andrew-lloyd-webber.bio: British composer. Creator of Phantom of the Opera, Cats, Evita. Named in Epstein's black book.

rupert-soames.name: Rupert Soames
rupert-soames.bio: British businessman. Grandson of Winston Churchill. Named in Epstein's black book.

henry-jarecki.name: Henry Jarecki
henry-jarecki.bio: Austrian-American psychiatrist and commodities trader. Named in Epstein's black book. Made a fortune in the gold market. Social connection to Epstein through New York financial circles.

nicolas-berggruen.name: Nicolas Berggruen
nicolas-berggruen.bio: German-American billionaire investor and philanthropist. Founder of Berggruen Institute. Named in Epstein's black book.

john-hitchcox.name: John Hitchcox
john-hitchcox.bio: British property developer. Dated model Elle Macpherson. Named in Epstein's contacts and black book.

naomi-watts.name: Naomi Watts
naomi-watts.bio: British-Australian actress. Named in Epstein's black book.

oscar-de-la-renta.name: Oscar de la Renta
oscar-de-la-renta.bio: Dominican-American fashion designer (1932-2014). Named in Epstein's black book. One of the most influential fashion designers in the world.

carolina-herrera.name: Carolina Herrera
carolina-herrera.bio: Venezuelan-American fashion designer. Named in Epstein's black book.

yves-carcelle.name: Yves Carcelle
yves-carcelle.bio: French businessman (1948-2014). CEO of Louis Vuitton. Named in Epstein's black book.

stephen-kaufmann.name: Stephen Kaufmann
stephen-kaufmann.bio: Named in 2024 Epstein document unsealing. Described as a participant in events at Epstein's properties. One of over 170 names that became public when court documents were unsealed.

glenn-murphy.name: Glenn Murphy
glenn-murphy.bio: Named in Epstein-related court filings. One of numerous individuals whose names emerged during document unsealing proceedings.

sandy-berger.name: Sandy Berger
sandy-berger.bio: American political consultant (1945-2015). Former National Security Advisor under President Clinton. Appeared on Epstein flight logs. Part of the Clinton political circle connected to Epstein.

howard-rubin.name: Howard Rubin
howard-rubin.bio: American former bond trader at Bear Stearns and later Merrill Lynch. Named in Epstein connections through Bear Stearns. Later faced his own allegations of extreme sexual violence from multiple women in a case with Epstein-like patterns.

douglas-leese.name: Douglas Leese
douglas-leese.bio: British arms dealer. Named in Epstein's financial dealings in the 1990s. Connected to the Towers Financial period when Epstein and Steven Hoffenberg attempted various financial schemes including the Pan Am takeover attempt.

peter-branch.name: Peter Branch
peter-branch.bio: Former Dalton School administrator during the period Jeffrey Epstein taught there (1974-1976). The elite Manhattan prep school was where Epstein first accessed wealthy families, despite having no college degree.

dr-michael-baden.name: Dr. Michael Baden
dr-michael-baden.bio: American forensic pathologist. Hired by Jeffrey Epstein's brother Mark to observe the autopsy after Epstein's death in jail. Concluded the evidence was more consistent with homicidal strangulation than suicidal hanging, contradicting the official ruling. Former NYC Chief Medical Examiner.

dr-barbara-sampson.name: Dr. Barbara Sampson
dr-barbara-sampson.bio: Chief Medical Examiner of New York City. Ruled Jeffrey Epstein's August 2019 death a suicide by hanging. The ruling was contested by Dr. Michael Baden and remains disputed. Stood by her findings despite intense public scrutiny.

tova-noel.name: Tova Noel
tova-noel.bio: Federal correctional officer at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan. One of two guards on duty the night Epstein died (August 9-10, 2019). Admitted to falsifying records, claiming they had conducted checks when they had actually been sleeping and browsing the internet. Entered a deferred prosecution agreement.

michael-thomas-mcc.name: Michael Thomas
michael-thomas-mcc.bio: Federal correctional officer at MCC Manhattan. The second guard on duty the night Epstein died. Both guards failed to conduct the required 30-minute checks for approximately 8 hours. Entered a deferred prosecution agreement requiring community service.

shirley-skipper-scott.name: Shirley Skipper-Scott
shirley-skipper-scott.bio: Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center when Epstein died. Transferred after Epstein's death amid questions about the facility's management. The MCC was later closed in 2021 due to deteriorating conditions.

nick-tartaglione.name: Nick Tartaglione
nick-tartaglione.bio: Former Westchester County police officer and convicted murderer. Was Epstein's cellmate at MCC Manhattan before Epstein was found injured on July 23, 2019 (the first apparent suicide attempt/assault). Denied involvement. Epstein was supposed to have been on suicide watch but was taken off before his death.

casey-wasserman.name: Casey Wasserman
casey-wasserman.bio: American sports and entertainment executive. CEO of Wasserman. Named in Epstein's black book. Grandson of Lew Wasserman, the legendary MCA/Universal chief.

jean-paul-enthoven.name: Jean-Paul Enthoven
jean-paul-enthoven.bio: French writer and editor. Named in Epstein's black book as part of his extensive French contacts cultivated through his Paris apartment and Jean-Luc Brunel's modeling connections.

francois-pinault.name: Francois Pinault
francois-pinault.bio: French billionaire businessman. Founder of Kering (Gucci, YSL, Balenciaga). One of the richest people in France. Named in Epstein's black book.

giancarlo-giammetti.name: Giancarlo Giammetti
giancarlo-giammetti.bio: Italian fashion executive. Co-founder of Valentino fashion house with Valentino Garavani. Named in Epstein's black book.

valentino-garavani.name: Valentino Garavani
valentino-garavani.bio: Italian fashion designer. Founder of the Valentino fashion empire. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact details.

donatella-versace.name: Donatella Versace
donatella-versace.bio: Italian fashion designer. Vice President and Chief Creative Officer of Versace. Named in Epstein's black book.

miuccia-prada.name: Miuccia Prada
miuccia-prada.bio: Italian fashion designer and businesswoman. Head of the Prada fashion house. Named in Epstein's contacts.

giorgio-armani.name: Giorgio Armani
giorgio-armani.bio: Italian fashion designer. Founder of Armani. One of the most successful fashion designers in history. Named in Epstein's contacts.

diane-von-furstenberg.name: Diane von Furstenberg
diane-von-furstenberg.bio: Belgian-American fashion designer. Creator of the iconic wrap dress. Named in Epstein's black book. Her husband Barry Diller was also in the book.

michael-kors-ep.name: Michael Kors
michael-kors-ep.bio: American fashion designer. Named in Epstein's black book.

calvin-klein-ep.name: Calvin Klein
calvin-klein-ep.bio: American fashion designer. Founder of Calvin Klein Inc. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact entries.

tom-ford-ep.name: Tom Ford
tom-ford-ep.bio: American fashion designer and filmmaker. Former creative director of Gucci and YSL. Named in Epstein's black book.

stella-mccartney.name: Stella McCartney
stella-mccartney.bio: British fashion designer. Daughter of Paul McCartney. Named in Epstein's contacts.

lily-safra.name: Lily Safra
lily-safra.bio: Brazilian-born philanthropist (1934-2022). Widow of banker Edmond Safra. Named in Epstein's black book. One of the world's wealthiest women and a major philanthropist.

ehud-laniado.name: Ehud Laniado
ehud-laniado.bio: Israeli-Belgian diamond dealer (1954-2019). Named in Epstein's contacts. Died during cosmetic surgery in Brussels.

leon-cooperman.name: Leon Cooperman
leon-cooperman.bio: American hedge fund manager and billionaire. Founder of Omega Advisors. Named in Epstein's contacts. Former Goldman Sachs partner.

michael-steinhardt-ep.name: Michael Steinhardt
michael-steinhardt-ep.bio: American hedge fund manager and philanthropist. Pioneer of the hedge fund industry. Named in Epstein's social circle. Also faced his own sexual harassment allegations.

bruce-kovner.name: Bruce Kovner
bruce-kovner.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Founder of Caxton Associates. Named in Epstein's contacts. Former chairman of the American Enterprise Institute.

israel-englander.name: Israel "Izzy" Englander
israel-englander.bio: American billionaire. Founder and CEO of Millennium Management. Named in Epstein's contacts.

marc-rich-ep.name: Marc Rich
marc-rich-ep.bio: Belgian-born American commodities trader (1934-2013). Pardoned by Bill Clinton on his last day in office. Named in Epstein's contacts. His pardon was one of the most controversial in presidential history.

michael-milken-ep.name: Michael Milken
michael-milken-ep.bio: American financier. The "Junk Bond King." Convicted of securities fraud in 1990. Named in Epstein's contacts. Later pardoned by President Trump in 2020.

steve-cohen-ep.name: Steve Cohen
steve-cohen-ep.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager. Founder of Point72 Asset Management (formerly SAC Capital). Named in Epstein's contacts. Owner of the New York Mets.

george-roberts-kkr.name: George Roberts
george-roberts-kkr.bio: American businessman. Co-founder of KKR with his cousin Henry Kravis. Named in Epstein's contacts.

stephen-ross-ep.name: Stephen Ross
stephen-ross-ep.bio: American billionaire real estate developer. Founder of Related Companies. Owner of the Miami Dolphins. Named in Epstein's contacts.

sheldon-solow.name: Sheldon Solow
sheldon-solow.bio: American billionaire real estate developer (1928-2020). Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the New York real estate elite.

aby-rosen.name: Aby Rosen
aby-rosen.bio: German-American real estate developer. Co-founder of RFR Holding. Named in Epstein's contacts through New York real estate circles.

howard-marks-ep.name: Howard Marks
howard-marks-ep.bio: American investor. Co-founder and co-chairman of Oaktree Capital Management. Named in Epstein's contacts.

prince-bandar.name: Prince Bandar bin Sultan
prince-bandar.bio: Saudi royal and diplomat. Former Saudi Ambassador to the United States (1983-2005). Named in Epstein's black book. Known as "Bandar Bush" for his close relationships with US presidents.

countess-maya.name: Countess Maya von Schonburg
countess-maya.bio: Austrian-born British socialite. Part of the London social scene connected to Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell. Named in Epstein's contacts.

alexi-lubomirski.name: Prince Alexi Lubomirski
alexi-lubomirski.bio: Polish-born royal descendant and fashion photographer. Named in Epstein's contacts.

katherine-graham.name: Katharine Graham
katherine-graham.bio: American publisher (1917-2001). Former owner of The Washington Post. Named in Epstein's contacts (pre-mortem entries). One of the most powerful women in American media history.

tina-brown.name: Tina Brown
tina-brown.bio: British-American journalist and magazine editor. Former editor of Vanity Fair and The New Yorker. Named in Epstein's black book. Her Daily Beast later published extensive Epstein coverage.

graydon-carter.name: Graydon Carter
graydon-carter.bio: Canadian-American journalist. Former editor of Vanity Fair (1992-2017). Named in Epstein's black book. His magazine published some early coverage of Epstein before his 2008 plea deal.

anna-wintour-ep.name: Anna Wintour
anna-wintour-ep.bio: British-American journalist. Editor-in-chief of Vogue since 1988. Named in Epstein's black book. One of the most powerful figures in the fashion industry.

arianna-huffington.name: Arianna Huffington
arianna-huffington.bio: Greek-American author and businesswoman. Founder of The Huffington Post. Named in Epstein's black book.

peter-jennings-ep.name: Peter Jennings
peter-jennings-ep.bio: Canadian-American journalist (1938-2005). Former anchor of ABC World News Tonight. Named in Epstein's black book.

dan-rather-ep.name: Dan Rather
dan-rather-ep.bio: American journalist. Former anchor of the CBS Evening News. Named in Epstein's contacts.

david-remnick.name: David Remnick
david-remnick.bio: American journalist and author. Editor of The New Yorker since 1998. Named in Epstein's contacts.

jeffrey-toobin.name: Jeffrey Toobin
jeffrey-toobin.bio: American lawyer and legal analyst. Former CNN and New Yorker staff writer. Named in Epstein's contacts. Later fired from The New Yorker over a separate scandal.

sean-parker.name: Sean Parker
sean-parker.bio: American entrepreneur. Co-founder of Napster and founding president of Facebook. Named in Epstein's contacts through Silicon Valley network.

drew-houston.name: Drew Houston
drew-houston.bio: American internet entrepreneur. Co-founder and CEO of Dropbox. Named in Epstein's contacts.

evan-spiegel.name: Evan Spiegel
evan-spiegel.bio: American businessman. Co-founder and CEO of Snap Inc. (Snapchat). Connected to Epstein network through Silicon Valley social circles.

terry-semel.name: Terry Semel
terry-semel.bio: American businessman (1943-2020). Former CEO of Yahoo! and Warner Bros. Named in Epstein's black book.

jared-diamond.name: Jared Diamond
jared-diamond.bio: American scientist and author. Professor at UCLA. Author of "Guns, Germs, and Steel." Part of the Edge Foundation scientific network that connected with Epstein through John Brockman.

richard-dawkins.name: Richard Dawkins
richard-dawkins.bio: British evolutionary biologist and author. Author of "The Selfish Gene." Part of the intellectual circle connected to Edge Foundation events that Epstein attended and funded.

paul-nurse.name: Paul Nurse
paul-nurse.bio: British geneticist and Nobel laureate. Named in Epstein's scientific contacts. Epstein cultivated relationships with Nobel Prize winners to build his intellectual credentials.

gerald-edelman.name: Gerald Edelman
gerald-edelman.bio: American biologist (1929-2014). Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. Part of the scientific community Epstein courted through Edge Foundation and private gatherings.

stephen-kosslyn.name: Stephen Kosslyn
stephen-kosslyn.bio: American psychologist and neuroscientist. Former dean at Harvard. Accepted $225,000 from Epstein for research. Listed Epstein as his external activities advisor at Harvard.

alan-guth.name: Alan Guth
alan-guth.bio: American theoretical physicist and cosmologist at MIT. Originator of the theory of cosmic inflation. Connected to Epstein through MIT scientific circles.

gregory-benford.name: Gregory Benford
gregory-benford.bio: American science fiction author and astrophysicist. UC Irvine professor. Attended Epstein dinners. Part of the scientific social network.

melinda-gates.name: Melinda French Gates
melinda-gates.bio: American philanthropist and former co-chair of the Gates Foundation. Bill Gates's meetings with Epstein after his 2008 conviction were cited as a factor in their 2021 divorce. She was reportedly furious when she learned of the meetings and warned Bill to stop seeing Epstein.

alberto-gonzales.name: Alberto Gonzales
alberto-gonzales.bio: Former U.S. Attorney General (2005-2007). In office during the period when the Epstein plea deal was negotiated. Questions remain about DOJ oversight of the sweetheart deal.

george-nader.name: George Nader
george-nader.bio: Lebanese-American businessman and convicted pedophile. Political adviser with Middle East connections. Cooperated with the Mueller investigation. Later sentenced to 10 years for child sex trafficking and child pornography. Connected to overlapping power broker networks.

roy-cohn.name: Roy Cohn
roy-cohn.bio: American lawyer (1927-1986). Notorious power broker, mentor to Donald Trump, and former aide to Senator McCarthy. Though he died before Epstein's ascent, Cohn's model of using compromising information for influence has been compared to Epstein's alleged operation. Connected through the New York power nexus.

steve-mnuchin.name: Steve Mnuchin
steve-mnuchin.bio: American businessman and politician. Former Secretary of the Treasury. His predecessor at Goldman Sachs, Malcolm Harris, was connected to Epstein. Part of the finance-to-politics pipeline that overlapped with Epstein's world.

jena-lisa-jones.name: Jena-Lisa Jones
jena-lisa-jones.bio: Victim who came forward in Palm Beach investigation. One of multiple women and girls who reported abuse to police that built the original 2005 case. Her account helped establish the pattern of Epstein's predatory behavior with minors.

alicia-arden.name: Alicia Arden
alicia-arden.bio: American model and actress. Filed a police report against Epstein in 1997 alleging sexual battery during what was supposed to be a modeling audition at a hotel. The report was largely ignored at the time but resurfaced during later investigations.

anouska-de-georgiou.name: Anouska De Georgiou
anouska-de-georgiou.bio: British model and the first woman in the UK to publicly identify herself as an Epstein victim. Described being assaulted at Epstein's New York townhouse when she was flown from London at 18.

richard-stallman.name: Richard Stallman
richard-stallman.bio: American software freedom activist and programmer. Founder of the Free Software Foundation. Resigned from MIT in 2019 after making controversial comments defending Marvin Minsky regarding Epstein victim allegations. His comments sparked widespread outrage.

john-casablancas.name: John Casablancas
john-casablancas.bio: American model agent (1942-2013). Founder of Elite Model Management. Known as a predator in the modeling industry. Jean-Luc Brunel was his protege. Investigation into Elite revealed systemic abuse of young models, patterns that were replicated in Epstein's MC2 effort.

peter-nygard.name: Peter Nygard
peter-nygard.bio: Finnish-Canadian fashion executive. Founder of Nygard International. Arrested in 2020 on sex trafficking charges involving dozens of victims in a case with striking parallels to Epstein's. His Bahamas compound was compared to Epstein's island.

peter-listerman.name: Peter Listerman
peter-listerman.bio: Russian model agent and self-described matchmaker. Connected to trafficking networks between Eastern Europe and wealthy Western clients. Operated in similar circles to Epstein and Brunel in procuring young models.

michael-stroll.name: Michael Stroll
michael-stroll.bio: Named in Epstein-related court documents. An attorney who represented several Epstein-connected individuals during litigation.

christopher-tarbell.name: Christopher Tarbell
christopher-tarbell.bio: Former FBI special agent. Investigated Epstein case and expressed frustration about the 2008 plea deal. Later became an advocate for stronger pursuit of trafficking networks.

alexander-downer.name: Alexander Downer
alexander-downer.bio: Australian diplomat and politician. Former Australian High Commissioner to the UK. Named in Epstein's contacts. Part of the diplomatic circle connected to the network.

terje-roed-larsen.name: Terje Roed-Larsen
terje-roed-larsen.bio: Norwegian diplomat. Former UN Special Envoy. Received $130,000 from Epstein's foundation for unspecified work. Resigned from his UN position in 2020 after the connection was revealed.

glenn-hutchins.name: Glenn Hutchins
glenn-hutchins.bio: American businessman. Co-founder of Silver Lake Partners. Named in Epstein's contacts. Major Democratic donor and Federal Reserve board member.

henry-silverman.name: Henry Silverman
henry-silverman.bio: American businessman. Former CEO of Cendant Corporation. Named in Epstein's black book.

vernon-jordan.name: Vernon Jordan
vernon-jordan.bio: American businessman and civil rights activist (1935-2021). Senior managing director at Lazard. Close advisor to Bill Clinton. Named in Epstein's contacts. Part of the Clinton orbit that intersected with Epstein.

harvey-pitt.name: Harvey Pitt
harvey-pitt.bio: American attorney. Former SEC Chairman (2001-2003). Named in Epstein's contacts.

mortimer-sackler.name: Mortimer Sackler
mortimer-sackler.bio: Member of the Sackler family, owners of Purdue Pharma (OxyContin). Named in Epstein's contacts. The Sackler family later faced massive litigation over the opioid crisis.

marina-abramovic.name: Marina Abramovic
marina-abramovic.bio: Serbian performance artist. Named in Epstein's contacts. One of the most famous contemporary artists in the world.

jeff-koons.name: Jeff Koons
jeff-koons.bio: American artist. Known for his reproduction of banal objects and large-scale sculptures. Named in Epstein's contacts. One of the highest-selling living artists.

leon-max.name: Leon Max
leon-max.bio: Russian-born American fashion mogul and art collector. Founder of MaxMara. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the New York-London social circuit.

daphne-guinness.name: Daphne Guinness
daphne-guinness.bio: British-Irish socialite, fashion icon, and heiress. Named in Epstein's contacts. Part of the London social set connected to Maxwell.

quincy-jones.name: Quincy Jones
quincy-jones.bio: American musician, songwriter, and record producer (1933-2024). Named in Epstein's black book. One of the most influential music producers in history.

david-bowie.name: David Bowie
david-bowie.bio: British musician, actor, and artist (1947-2016). Named in Epstein's black book. One of the most influential musicians of the 20th century.

mick-hucknall.name: Mick Hucknall
mick-hucknall.bio: British singer. Lead vocalist of Simply Red. Named in Epstein's black book.

simon-le-bon.name: Simon Le Bon
simon-le-bon.bio: British musician. Lead singer of Duran Duran. Named in Epstein's black book.

casey-affleck.name: Casey Affleck
casey-affleck.bio: American actor and filmmaker. Named in Epstein's contacts.

dustin-moskovitz.name: Dustin Moskovitz
dustin-moskovitz.bio: American internet entrepreneur. Co-founder of Facebook and Asana. Connected to Silicon Valley-Epstein circles.

ted-turner.name: Ted Turner
ted-turner.bio: American media mogul. Founder of CNN and Turner Broadcasting. Named in Epstein's contacts.

guy-de-rothschild.name: Guy de Rothschild
guy-de-rothschild.bio: French banker (1909-2007). Head of the French branch of the Rothschild banking family. Named in Epstein's contacts (pre-mortem entries).

nat-rothschild.name: Nat Rothschild
nat-rothschild.bio: British financier and adventurer. Heir to the Rothschild banking fortune. Named in Epstein's black book. Son of Lord Jacob Rothschild.

jacob-rothschild.name: Lord Jacob Rothschild
jacob-rothschild.bio: British investment banker and member of the House of Lords (1936-2024). Named in Epstein's black book. Head of the Rothschild banking family's British branch.

prince-firyal.name: Princess Firyal of Jordan
prince-firyal.bio: Jordanian princess and philanthropist. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the international royalty connected to Epstein's social network.

lady-victoria-hervey.name: Lady Victoria Hervey
lady-victoria-hervey.bio: British socialite and former model. Close associate of Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell. Has spoken publicly about the Epstein network. Attended parties with Epstein and documented the social scene.

roy-black.name: Roy Black
roy-black.bio: American criminal defense attorney. Represented Jeffrey Epstein in the Palm Beach case and plea deal negotiations. One of Miami's most prominent defense lawyers. Also represented Rush Limbaugh and William Kennedy Smith.

guy-lewis-ep.name: Guy Lewis
guy-lewis-ep.bio: Former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida. Was in office before Alexander Acosta and oversaw early discussions of the Epstein case at the federal level.

jack-goldberger.name: Jack Goldberger
jack-goldberger.bio: American criminal defense attorney. Part of Epstein's Palm Beach legal team. Helped negotiate the 2008 plea deal at the state level.

spencer-kuvin.name: Spencer Kuvin
spencer-kuvin.bio: American attorney. Represented multiple Epstein victims starting in 2008. Was among the first to publicly challenge the plea deal. Co-authored work exposing the extent of Epstein's network.

lisa-bryant.name: Lisa Bryant
lisa-bryant.bio: Produced and directed Epstein-related documentary content. The Netflix series "Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich" (2020) and other documentaries brought the case to mass audiences.

christopher-wray.name: Christopher Wray
christopher-wray.bio: FBI Director since 2017. Has faced questions about the FBI's handling of Epstein case evidence, including thousands of photographs and videos seized from Epstein's properties.

william-burns.name: William Burns
william-burns.bio: CIA Director. Former career diplomat. While not directly connected, questions about intelligence community links to Epstein (through claims by Ari Ben-Menashe and others) have raised questions about agency knowledge.

nicholas-davies.name: Nicholas Davies
nicholas-davies.bio: British journalist and author. Maxwell associate who wrote "The Unknown Maxwell." Documented Robert Maxwell's intelligence connections. These connections are believed by some to have been inherited or leveraged by Ghislaine and Epstein.

john-mark-dougan.name: John Mark Dougan
john-mark-dougan.bio: Former Palm Beach County deputy. Filed numerous records requests about the original Epstein investigation before fleeing to Russia in 2016. Claims to possess evidence related to the case.

rupert-murdoch-ep.name: Rupert Murdoch
rupert-murdoch-ep.bio: Australian-born American media mogul. Founder of News Corp, Fox News, and 21st Century Fox. Named in Epstein's black book with multiple contact numbers including homes in New York, London, Los Angeles, and his ranch. One of the most powerful media figures in the world. His ex-wife Wendi Deng and son James Murdoch were also listed.

si-newhouse.name: Si Newhouse
si-newhouse.bio: American publishing magnate (1927-2017). Chairman of Advance Publications and Conde Nast. Named in Epstein's black book. Oversaw Vanity Fair, GQ, The New Yorker, Vogue, and Wired.

rupert-loewenstein.name: Prince Rupert Loewenstein
rupert-loewenstein.bio: German-British financier (1933-2014). Financial manager for the Rolling Stones for decades. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the European aristocratic circle.

ghislaine-friend-carol.name: Carol Mack
ghislaine-friend-carol.bio: Socialite and friend of Ghislaine Maxwell. Named in multiple Epstein-related testimonies as someone who socialized with Maxwell and attended her events.

mark-messier.name: Mark Messier
mark-messier.bio: Canadian former professional ice hockey player. Named in Epstein's black book. One of the greatest hockey players in history.

andre-agassi.name: Andre Agassi
andre-agassi.bio: American former professional tennis player. Named in Epstein's black book. One of the greatest tennis players of all time.

john-mcenroe.name: John McEnroe
john-mcenroe.bio: American former professional tennis player and commentator. Named in Epstein's black book.

jean-claude-killy.name: Jean-Claude Killy
jean-claude-killy.bio: French former alpine ski racer. Triple Olympic gold medalist. Named in Epstein's black book as part of European sports connections.

pat-riley.name: Pat Riley
pat-riley.bio: American professional basketball coach and president of the Miami Heat. Named in Epstein's black book through the Palm Beach/Miami social scene.

david-martinez.name: David Martinez
david-martinez.bio: Mexican billionaire and hedge fund manager. Founder of Fintech Advisory. Named in Epstein's black book.

peter-morton.name: Peter Morton
peter-morton.bio: American entrepreneur. Co-founder of Hard Rock Cafe. Named in Epstein's black book.

tommy-hilfiger-ep.name: Tommy Hilfiger
tommy-hilfiger-ep.bio: American fashion designer. Founder of Tommy Hilfiger Corporation. Named in Epstein's black book.

rupert-johnson.name: Rupert Johnson Jr.
rupert-johnson.bio: American billionaire investor. Vice Chairman of Franklin Templeton Investments. Named in Epstein's black book.

ronald-lauder-ep.name: Ronald Lauder
ronald-lauder-ep.bio: American billionaire businessman and diplomat. Former US Ambassador to Austria. President of the World Jewish Congress. Named in Epstein's contacts. Brother of Leonard Lauder. His family's Neue Galerie is on the same block as Epstein's Manhattan townhouse.

jeff-greene.name: Jeff Greene
jeff-greene.bio: American billionaire real estate developer and politician. Named in Epstein's contacts. Admitted flying on Epstein's plane with young women before running for office.

samuel-waksal.name: Samuel Waksal
samuel-waksal.bio: American businessman. Former CEO of ImClone Systems. Convicted of insider trading. Named in Epstein's contacts.

mort-mandel.name: Mort Mandel
mort-mandel.bio: American billionaire businessman and philanthropist (1921-2019). Co-founder of Premier Industrial Corporation. Named in Epstein's contacts through philanthropic circles.

affiliations.role: Jack, Joseph and Morton Mandel Foundation (deceased)

leon-charney.name: Leon Charney
leon-charney.bio: American real estate investor and media figure (1938-2016). Named in Epstein's contacts. Also known for Middle East peace efforts.

howard-lutnick-ep.name: Howard Lutnick
howard-lutnick-ep.bio: American businessman. Chairman and CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald. Named in Epstein's black book.

denise-rich.name: Denise Rich
denise-rich.bio: American songwriter and socialite. Ex-wife of Marc Rich (whose Clinton pardon was controversial). Named in Epstein's black book. Major Democratic Party fundraiser.

blaine-trump.name: Blaine Trump
blaine-trump.bio: American socialite. Former wife of Robert Trump (Donald's brother). Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the New York social elite.

marla-maples.name: Marla Maples
marla-maples.bio: American actress and television personality. Second wife of Donald Trump. Named in Epstein's contacts.

stephanie-powers.name: Stefanie Powers
stephanie-powers.bio: American actress. Named in Epstein's black book.

brooke-shields-ep.name: Brooke Shields
brooke-shields-ep.bio: American actress and model. Named in Epstein's black book.

daisy-fuentes-ep.name: Daisy Fuentes
daisy-fuentes-ep.bio: Cuban-American television host and model. Named in Epstein's black book.

phyllis-george.name: Phyllis George
phyllis-george.bio: American sportscaster and former Miss America (1949-2020). Named in Epstein's black book.

debbie-von-bismarck.name: Countess Debbie von Bismarck
debbie-von-bismarck.bio: American-born socialite married into the Bismarck family. Named in Epstein's black book. Part of the European aristocratic social scene connected to Maxwell.

cindy-lopez.name: Cindy Lopez
cindy-lopez.bio: Former associate of Ghislaine Maxwell. Appeared on Epstein flight logs multiple times. Described in victim testimony as having been present during trafficking activities.

kelly-bovino.name: Kelly Bovino
kelly-bovino.bio: Named on Epstein flight logs. Appeared as a frequent passenger on the Lolita Express during the late 1990s and early 2000s.

teala-davies.name: Teala Davies
teala-davies.bio: Epstein victim who was recruited as a teenager. Filed civil claims against the Epstein estate. Founded a non-profit to help trafficking survivors. Has spoken publicly about systemic failures that enabled Epstein.

doe-36.name: Bill Cosby
doe-36.bio: American comedian and actor. Identified as Doe 36 in 2024 Epstein document unsealing. Named by Virginia Giuffre in a list of people Epstein associated with. Cosby denied any connection. Already convicted separately of sexual assault (conviction later overturned on procedural grounds).

naftali-bennett.name: Naftali Bennett
naftali-bennett.bio: Former Prime Minister of Israel. Connected through overlapping Israeli tech and political circles that Epstein cultivated, particularly through Ehud Barak and the Carbyne venture.

rafi-eitan.name: Rafi Eitan
