bradley-edwards.bio: Bradley Edwards was a victims' attorney who stated Trump was the only powerful person to voluntarily assist his investigation into Epstein's crimes.

affiliations.role: Victims' attorney who stated Trump was the only powerful person to voluntarily assist his investigation

ghislaine-maxwell-maralago.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
ghislaine-maxwell-maralago.bio: Ghislaine Maxwell recruited Virginia Giuffre from Mar-a-Lago and had membership and access to the club.

affiliations.role: Recruited Giuffre from Mar-a-Lago; had membership/access to the club

virginia-giuffre-dershowitz.name: Virginia Giuffre
virginia-giuffre-dershowitz.bio: Virginia Giuffre accused Alan Dershowitz of sexual abuse on multiple occasions. Defamation suits between them were eventually settled in 2024.

affiliations.role: Accused Dershowitz of sexual abuse on multiple occasions; defamation suits settled in 2024

david-boies-dershowitz.name: David Boies
david-boies-dershowitz.bio: David Boies is a partner at Boies Schiller who represented Virginia Giuffre and filed claims against Dershowitz.

affiliations.role: Boies Schiller attorney who represented Giuffre and filed claims against Dershowitz

brad-edwards-dershowitz.name: Brad Edwards
brad-edwards-dershowitz.bio: Brad Edwards is a victims' attorney who brought original Crime Victims' Rights Act claims that implicated Dershowitz.

affiliations.role: Victims' attorney who brought original Crime Victims' Rights Act claims implicating Dershowitz

ben-sasse.name: Sen. Ben Sasse
ben-sasse.bio: Ben Sasse is a former U.S. Senator who publicly challenged Acosta about the Epstein NPA during his 2017 confirmation hearing for Secretary of Labor.

affiliations.role: U.S. Senator who publicly challenged Acosta about the Epstein NPA during his 2017 confirmation hearing

larry-cohen-gates.name: Larry Cohen
larry-cohen-gates.bio: Larry Cohen was a Gates Foundation advisor who helped arrange and attended meetings between Gates and Epstein.

affiliations.role: Gates Foundation advisor who helped arrange meetings between Gates and Epstein

eva-dubin-gates.name: Eva Dubin
eva-dubin-gates.bio: Eva Dubin is a socialite and wife of Glenn Dubin who hosted at least one Gates-Epstein dinner at her home.

affiliations.role: Socialite and wife of Glenn Dubin who hosted at least one Gates-Epstein dinner

jes-staley-gates.name: Jes Staley
jes-staley-gates.bio: Jes Staley is the former JPMorgan CEO and former Barclays CEO who had a close relationship with Epstein and moved in the same circles as Gates.

affiliations.role: Former JPMorgan and Barclays CEO with close Epstein relationship; moved in same circles as Gates

ghislaine-maxwell-musk.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
ghislaine-maxwell-musk.bio: Ghislaine Maxwell was photographed with Musk and his then-partner Talulah Riley at a 2014 Vanity Fair Oscar party.

affiliations.role: Photographed with Musk at a 2014 Vanity Fair Oscar party

talulah-riley.name: Talulah Riley
talulah-riley.bio: Talulah Riley is Musk's ex-wife. Epstein falsely claimed to have introduced her to Musk, which both Riley and Musk deny.

affiliations.role: Musk's ex-wife; Epstein falsely claimed to have introduced her to Musk

reid-hoffman-musk.name: Reid Hoffman
reid-hoffman-musk.bio: Reid Hoffman is the LinkedIn co-founder who facilitated Epstein's connections in Silicon Valley and later publicly apologized for the association.

affiliations.role: LinkedIn co-founder who facilitated Epstein's connections in Silicon Valley; later publicly apologized

joi-ito-hoffman.name: Joi Ito
joi-ito-hoffman.bio: Japanese-American activist and entrepreneur who directed the MIT Media Lab from 2011 to 2019. He accepted donations from Epstein and concealed them. He resigned in September 2019 after reporting by Ronan Farrow in The New Yorker.

affiliations.role: MIT Media Lab director who accepted Epstein donations facilitated in part by Hoffman and resigned in 2019

danny-hillis-hoffman.name: Danny Hillis
danny-hillis-hoffman.bio: Pioneer in parallel computing who co-founded Thinking Machines Corporation. He acknowledged receiving research funding from Epstein and attending events at Epstein's residences.

affiliations.role: Computer scientist and Edge Foundation member who received Epstein funding through overlapping networks

seth-lloyd-hoffman.name: Seth Lloyd
seth-lloyd-hoffman.bio: MIT mechanical engineering professor and quantum computing pioneer. He received $225,000 in personal gifts from Epstein and visited his island. MIT placed him on paid administrative leave in 2020.

affiliations.role: MIT quantum computing professor who received $225,000 in personal gifts from Epstein

michael-wolff-bannon.name: Michael Wolff
michael-wolff-bannon.bio: Journalist and author of 'Fire and Fury' and 'Siege.' In his reporting on the Trump White House, Wolff documented contacts between Bannon and Epstein.

affiliations.role: Journalist who documented Bannon-Epstein contacts while reporting on the Trump orbit

guo-wengui-bannon.name: Guo Wengui (Miles Guo)
guo-wengui-bannon.bio: Chinese businessman and political dissident. Bannon was arrested aboard Guo's yacht in August 2020 on fraud charges related to the 'We Build the Wall' campaign.

affiliations.role: Chinese billionaire and Bannon associate on whose yacht Bannon was arrested for fraud in 2020

katie-couric-allen.name: Katie Couric
katie-couric-allen.bio: Television journalist and former NBC Today Show anchor. She attended a 2010 dinner at Epstein's townhouse after Epstein's conviction. She wrote about the visit in her 2021 memoir 'Going There.'

affiliations.role: Journalist who attended a 2010 dinner at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse alongside Allen and other media figures

chelsea-handler-allen.name: Chelsea Handler
chelsea-handler-allen.bio: American comedian who attended a 2010 dinner party at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse with other media and entertainment figures.

affiliations.role: Comedian who attended a 2010 dinner at Epstein's Manhattan home alongside Allen post-conviction

charlie-rose-allen.name: Charlie Rose
charlie-rose-allen.bio: Former CBS anchor and PBS talk show host who attended social events at Epstein's townhouse and appeared in Epstein's contacts. Rose was later fired from CBS and PBS in 2017 over his own sexual harassment allegations.

affiliations.role: Television journalist who attended social events at Epstein's Manhattan residence

george-stephanopoulos-allen.name: George Stephanopoulos
george-stephanopoulos-allen.bio: Television journalist and former Clinton White House Communications Director who attended the same 2010 dinner at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse.

affiliations.role: ABC News anchor who attended the same 2010 post-conviction dinner at Epstein's home alongside Allen

katie-couric-stephanopoulos.name: Katie Couric
katie-couric-stephanopoulos.bio: Television journalist who attended the same 2010 dinner at Epstein's townhouse. She later wrote about the experience in her 2021 memoir 'Going There.'

affiliations.role: NBC/CBS journalist who attended the same 2010 post-conviction dinner at Epstein's Manhattan home

woody-allen-stephanopoulos.name: Woody Allen
woody-allen-stephanopoulos.bio: American filmmaker who attended the 2010 dinner at Epstein's home alongside Stephanopoulos, Couric, and others.

affiliations.role: Filmmaker who attended the same 2010 dinner at Epstein's home alongside Stephanopoulos

chelsea-handler-stephanopoulos.name: Chelsea Handler
chelsea-handler-stephanopoulos.bio: American comedian who was among the guests at the 2010 dinner at Epstein's townhouse.

affiliations.role: Comedian who attended the same 2010 post-conviction dinner at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse

abigail-wexner.name: Abigail Koppel Wexner
abigail-wexner.bio: Abigail Koppel Wexner is Les Wexner's wife who co-managed the Wexner Foundation during the period of Epstein's financial involvement.

affiliations.role: Les Wexner's wife; co-managed the Wexner Foundation during Epstein's financial involvement

robert-morosky.name: Robert Morosky
robert-morosky.bio: Robert Morosky was the former Vice Chairman of The Limited whose departure from the company was allegedly influenced by Epstein's growing control.

affiliations.role: Former Vice Chairman of The Limited whose departure was allegedly influenced by Epstein's growing control

ghislaine-maxwell-terramar.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
ghislaine-maxwell-terramar.bio: British socialite who founded TerraMar in 2012 ostensibly for ocean conservation. The nonprofit dissolved on July 12, 2019, just six days after Epstein's arrest. Convicted of sex trafficking in December 2021.

affiliations.role: Founder and president of the TerraMar Project, which dissolved six days after Epstein's 2019 arrest

scott-borgerson-terramar.name: Scott Borgerson
scott-borgerson-terramar.bio: CEO of CargoMetrics. He was Maxwell's romantic partner before her arrest. Maxwell was hiding at a property purchased by Borgerson in New Hampshire when the FBI arrested her in July 2020.

affiliations.role: Maritime technology CEO and Maxwell's partner connected to TerraMar through ocean industry circles

jan-eliasson-terramar.name: Jan Eliasson
jan-eliasson-terramar.bio: Swedish diplomat who served as UN Deputy Secretary-General. He appeared at TerraMar events at the United Nations, lending the organization international legitimacy.

affiliations.role: Former UN Deputy Secretary-General who appeared at TerraMar Project events at the United Nations

alexandra-cousteau-terramar.name: Alexandra Cousteau
alexandra-cousteau-terramar.bio: National Geographic explorer and granddaughter of Jacques Cousteau. She appeared at TerraMar Project events providing environmental credibility.

affiliations.role: Ocean conservationist and granddaughter of Jacques Cousteau who appeared at TerraMar Project events

les-wexner-jeco.name: Les Wexner
les-wexner-jeco.bio: L Brands founder and billionaire who was Epstein's only publicly identified major client. He granted Epstein full power of attorney over his finances.

affiliations.role: Only confirmed major client of J. Epstein & Co. who granted Epstein extraordinary financial authority

lesley-groff-jeco.name: Lesley Groff
lesley-groff-jeco.bio: Served as Epstein's executive assistant both at J. Epstein & Co. and personally for approximately 20 years. Named as a potential co-conspirator in the 2008 plea deal.

affiliations.role: Executive assistant who managed Epstein's schedule and communications at J. Epstein & Co. for 20 years

darren-indyke-jeco.name: Darren Indyke
darren-indyke-jeco.bio: Attorney who served as Epstein's personal lawyer for years and was appointed co-executor of Epstein's estate. He managed legal affairs connected to Epstein's financial entities.

affiliations.role: Epstein's longtime attorney, co-executor of his estate, and legal advisor for J. Epstein & Co.

richard-kahn-jeco.name: Richard Kahn
richard-kahn-jeco.bio: Served as co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate alongside Darren Indyke. He was a longtime associate who managed financial and estate matters.

affiliations.role: Co-executor of Epstein's estate and longtime financial associate of Epstein

virginia-giuffre-dubin.name: Virginia Giuffre
virginia-giuffre-dubin.bio: Virginia Giuffre alleged in court filings that Epstein directed her to have sexual encounters with Glenn Dubin.

affiliations.role: Alleged in court filings that Epstein directed her to have sexual encounters with Glenn Dubin

celina-dubin.name: Celina Dubin
celina-dubin.bio: Celina Dubin is the daughter of Glenn and Eva Dubin. Jeffrey Epstein established a trust fund for her.

affiliations.role: Glenn and Eva's daughter for whom Epstein established a trust fund

tom-pritzker.name: Tom Pritzker

person-nahum-zemach.name: Nahum Zemach
person-nahum-zemach.bio: Founded Habima in Moscow in 1917 as a Hebrew-language theater company. Led the troupe through its early years before it relocated to British Mandate Palestine in 1928.

person-hanna-rovina.name: Hanna Rovina
person-hanna-rovina.bio: Iconic actress who became synonymous with Habima, starring in the landmark 1922 production of The Dybbuk. Received the Israel Prize in 1956.

person-ilan-ronen.name: Ilan Ronen
person-ilan-ronen.bio: Served as artistic director of Habima from 2004 to 2010, overseeing a period of artistic renewal and the renovation of the theater building in Tel Aviv.

person-osnat-trabelsi.name: Osnat Trabelsi
person-osnat-trabelsi.bio: Appointed general director of Habima, managing the administrative and financial operations of Israel's national theater.

person-omer-keilaf.name: Omer Keilaf
person-omer-keilaf.bio: Co-founded Innoviz Technologies in 2016 and has led the LiDAR sensor company through its SPAC merger and Nasdaq listing in 2021. Previously served in the IDF's elite intelligence Unit 8200.

person-oren-rosenzweig.name: Oren Rosenzweig
person-oren-rosenzweig.bio: Co-founded Innoviz and oversees its LiDAR technology development. Holds a Ph.D. in electrical engineering and previously worked at SiGe Semiconductor.

person-oren-buskila.name: Oren Buskila
person-oren-buskila.bio: Co-founded Innoviz in 2016 after experience at Elbit Systems and other Israeli defense tech firms. Leads research and development of solid-state LiDAR systems.

person-amit-steinberg.name: Amit Steinberg
person-amit-steinberg.bio: Co-founded Innoviz Technologies in 2016. Brought experience in electro-optics and defense technology to the company's LiDAR sensor development.

person-theodor-herzl.name: Theodor Herzl
person-theodor-herzl.bio: Proposed the creation of a national fund for land purchase at the Fifth Zionist Congress in 1901. Father of modern political Zionism and author of Der Judenstaat.

person-johann-kremenezky.name: Johann Kremenezky
person-johann-kremenezky.bio: Austrian industrialist who served as the first president of JNF from its founding in 1901. Managed the fund's early land acquisition efforts in Ottoman Palestine.

person-avraham-duvdevani.name: Avraham Duvdevani
person-avraham-duvdevani.bio: Served as chairman of KKL-JNF, overseeing its reforestation, water, and environmental programs across Israel. Led efforts to plant millions of trees in the Negev and Galilee.

person-yosef-weitz.name: Yosef Weitz
person-yosef-weitz.bio: Led JNF's land and afforestation department for decades in the mid-20th century. Known as the 'father of the forests of Israel' for planting millions of trees across the country.

person-daniel-barel.name: Daniel Barel
person-daniel-barel.bio: Co-founded REE Automotive and has led the company since inception, guiding it through its 2021 Nasdaq listing. Pioneered REE's modular electric vehicle platform technology.

person-ahishay-sardes.name: Ahishay Sardes
person-ahishay-sardes.bio: Co-founded REE Automotive and serves as chief technology officer. Developed the company's REEcorner technology that integrates drivetrain components into the wheel arch.

person-josh-tech.name: Josh Tech
person-josh-tech.bio: Served as chief financial officer at REE Automotive, managing the company's financial strategy during its transition to a publicly traded company on Nasdaq.

person-dror-bin.name: Dror Bin
person-dror-bin.bio: Served as CEO of the Israel Innovation Authority, steering government support programs for Israeli tech startups and R&D. Previously held senior positions in the Israeli defense industry.

person-ami-appelbaum.name: Ami Appelbaum
person-ami-appelbaum.bio: Served as chairman of the Israel Innovation Authority's board. Also holds a professorship and has extensive experience in technology management and innovation policy.

person-avi-hasson.name: Avi Hasson
person-avi-hasson.bio: Served as Israel's Chief Scientist at the Ministry of Economy and became the first CEO when the office was restructured into the Israel Innovation Authority in 2016.

person-eli-groner.name: Eli Groner
person-eli-groner.bio: Played a key role in the establishment of the Israel Innovation Authority in 2016 as director general of the Prime Minister's Office, helping transition from the Office of the Chief Scientist.

person-avi-nir.name: Avi Nir
person-avi-nir.bio: Long-serving CEO of Keshet Media Group, the franchise holder of Channel 12. Oversaw the network's rise to become Israel's most-watched television channel.

person-yossi-vardy.name: Yossi Vardy
person-yossi-vardy.bio: Co-founded Keshet Broadcasting, the company behind Channel 2's news franchise which later became Channel 12 in 2017. A major figure in Israeli commercial broadcasting.

person-guy-pines.name: Guy Pines
person-guy-pines.bio: Led Channel 12's news division, making it one of the most-watched news programs in Israel. Oversaw major journalistic investigations and prime-time news broadcasts.

person-amos-schocken.name: Amos Schocken
person-amos-schocken.bio: Israeli media executive involved in the broader landscape of Channel 12's corporate governance and Israeli media industry.

person-amnon-shashua.name: Amnon Shashua
person-amnon-shashua.bio: Co-founded OrCam Technologies in 2010 alongside his work at Mobileye. Professor of computer science at Hebrew University and a pioneer in computer vision and AI.

person-ziv-aviram.name: Ziv Aviram
person-ziv-aviram.bio: Co-founded OrCam Technologies in 2010, bringing entrepreneurial leadership to the assistive technology company. Previously co-founded Mobileye with Amnon Shashua.

person-yonatan-wexler.name: Yonatan Wexler
person-yonatan-wexler.bio: Led OrCam's research and development team, driving the AI and computer vision technology behind the OrCam MyEye wearable device for visually impaired users.

person-dan-adika.name: Dan Adika
person-dan-adika.bio: Co-founded WalkMe in 2011 and led the company through its 2021 Nasdaq IPO, achieving a valuation of over $2.5 billion. Grew the digital adoption platform to serve Fortune 500 companies globally.

person-rafael-sweary.name: Rafael Sweary
person-rafael-sweary.bio: Co-founded WalkMe in 2011 and served as president, overseeing business development and strategic partnerships. Previously founded and led several Israeli tech startups.

person-eyal-cohen.name: Eyal Cohen
person-eyal-cohen.bio: Co-founded WalkMe and served as chief technology officer, architecting the digital adoption platform's core technology and AI-driven guidance systems.

person-rephael-duek.name: Rephael Duek
person-rephael-duek.bio: Served as CFO of WalkMe, steering the company's financial operations through its Nasdaq IPO and managing its financial strategy as a public company. WalkMe was acquired by SAP in 2024.

person-barrie-levitt.name: Barrie Levitt
person-barrie-levitt.bio: Led Taro Pharmaceutical Industries for decades, building it into a major generic pharmaceutical company. Oversaw operations from its headquarters in Haifa Bay, Israel.

person-uday-baldota.name: Uday Baldota
person-uday-baldota.bio: Appointed CEO of Taro Pharmaceutical Industries, managing the company's global generic drug operations. Taro is a subsidiary of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries.

person-dilip-shanghvi.name: Dilip Shanghvi
person-dilip-shanghvi.bio: Indian billionaire founder of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, which acquired a controlling stake in Taro Pharmaceutical in 2010 after a prolonged takeover battle.

person-tal-levitt.name: Tal Levitt
person-tal-levitt.bio: Served on Taro Pharmaceutical's board of directors, part of the Levitt family that founded and long controlled the Israeli-based generic drug manufacturer.

person-eitan-achlow.name: Eitan Achlow
person-eitan-achlow.bio: Co-founded Candiru (officially registered as Saito Tech Ltd) around 2014. Led the secretive Israeli spyware company that develops offensive cyber tools for government clients.

person-yaakov-weizman.name: Yaakov Weizman
person-yaakov-weizman.bio: Co-founded Candiru and helped build its suite of cyber-espionage tools. The firm was sanctioned by the U.S. Commerce Department in November 2021.

person-isaac-zack.name: Isaac Zack
person-isaac-zack.bio: Prominent investor in Israeli cyber-intelligence companies including Candiru and NSO Group. Co-founded Founders Group, an Israeli venture capital firm focused on cybersecurity.

person-avraham-ophir.name: Avraham Ophir
person-avraham-ophir.bio: Led IDE Technologies during its growth into one of the world's largest desalination companies. Oversaw construction of major reverse osmosis plants including the Sorek facility.

person-miriam-talmor.name: Miriam Talmor
person-miriam-talmor.bio: Served in a senior leadership role at IDE Technologies, contributing to the company's global expansion in desalination and water treatment solutions.

person-ehud-barak-ide.name: Ehud Barak
person-ehud-barak-ide.bio: Had connections to IDE Technologies through Israel Chemicals Ltd (ICL), which co-owned IDE alongside Delek Group before its restructuring.

person-ron-robin.name: Ron Robin
person-ron-robin.bio: Served as president of the University of Haifa, overseeing its academic programs and research initiatives. A historian by training, he previously held academic posts in the United States.

person-abba-hushi.name: Abba Hushi
person-abba-hushi.bio: As mayor of Haifa, championed the establishment of a university in the city in the 1960s. The University of Haifa was founded in 1963 as a branch of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

person-gustave-leven.name: Gustave Leven
person-gustave-leven.bio: French-Jewish businessman and former CEO of Perrier who donated generously to the University of Haifa. The main library bears his name in recognition of his contributions.

person-aaron-ben-zeev.name: Aaron Ben-Ze'ev
person-aaron-ben-zeev.bio: Served as president of the University of Haifa from 2005 to 2013. A professor of philosophy known for his research on emotions and the philosophy of mind.

person-chaim-weizmann.name: Chaim Weizmann
person-chaim-weizmann.bio: Established the Daniel Sieff Research Institute in 1934, which became the Weizmann Institute in 1949. A renowned chemist and the first President of the State of Israel.

person-alon-chen.name: Alon Chen
person-alon-chen.bio: Appointed president of the Weizmann Institute of Science in 2019, becoming the youngest person to hold the position. A neuroscientist known for research on stress and brain mechanisms.

person-daniel-zajfman.name: Daniel Zajfman
person-daniel-zajfman.bio: Served as president of the Weizmann Institute from 2006 to 2019. An atomic physicist whose research focused on molecular physics and storage ring technology.

person-adi-shamir.name: Adi Shamir
person-adi-shamir.bio: Israeli cryptographer and professor at the Weizmann Institute. Co-inventor of the RSA algorithm within RSA cryptography, and recipient of the 2002 Turing Award.

person-michael-sela.name: Michael Sela
person-michael-sela.bio: Served as president of the Weizmann Institute from 1975 to 1985. Pioneered the development of Copaxone, a widely used treatment for multiple sclerosis.

person-avi-felder.name: Avi Felder
person-avi-felder.bio: Served as CEO of IMI Systems, overseeing the state-owned defense company's munitions and defense technology divisions before its acquisition by Elbit Systems in 2018.

person-bezalel-machlis.name: Bezalel Machlis
person-bezalel-machlis.bio: As CEO of Elbit Systems, completed the acquisition of IMI Systems in 2018 for approximately $495 million, integrating IMI's munitions and defense capabilities into Elbit.

person-uzi-gal.name: Uzi Gal
person-uzi-gal.bio: Designed the iconic Uzi submachine gun in the late 1940s, manufactured by IMI. The Uzi became one of the most widely used submachine guns in the world and a symbol of Israeli defense innovation.

person-barak-eilam.name: Barak Eilam
person-barak-eilam.bio: Appointed CEO of NICE Ltd in 2014 and transformed the company into a leading cloud platform for customer engagement and financial crime prevention. Grew annual revenue past $2 billion.

person-haim-shani.name: Haim Shani
person-haim-shani.bio: Co-founded NICE Systems (now NICE Ltd) in 1986 and served as CEO during its early growth. Built the company from an Israeli startup into a global enterprise software leader.

person-david-shatel.name: David Shatel
person-david-shatel.bio: Served as chairman of NICE Ltd's board of directors, providing strategic oversight as the company expanded its cloud and AI-driven product portfolio.

person-ron-gutler.name: Ron Gutler
person-ron-gutler.bio: Long-time chairman of NICE Ltd's board, guiding the company's strategic direction during its expansion into cloud computing and workforce engagement management.

person-shlomo-barak.name: Shlomo Barak
person-shlomo-barak.bio: Co-founded Orbotech in 1981 in Yavne, Israel. Helped develop the company's pioneering automated optical inspection technology used in PCB and flat panel display manufacturing.

person-asher-levy-orbotech.name: Asher Levy
person-asher-levy-orbotech.bio: Led Orbotech as CEO and president, growing the company into a global leader in inspection and imaging solutions for the electronics industry.

person-rick-wallace.name: Rick Wallace
person-rick-wallace.bio: Served as CEO of KLA Corporation, which acquired Orbotech in 2019 for approximately $3.4 billion, integrating its inspection technology into KLA's semiconductor process control portfolio.

person-amichai-steimberg.name: Amichai Steimberg
person-amichai-steimberg.bio: Served as president and CEO of Orbotech from 2013 until its acquisition by KLA in 2019. Positioned the company for growth in advanced electronics and semiconductor markets.

person-gideon-saar.name: Gideon Sa'ar
person-gideon-saar.bio: Appointed Israel's Minister of Foreign Affairs in the Netanyahu government. Previously served as Minister of Justice and founded the New Hope party.

person-moshe-sharett.name: Moshe Sharett
person-moshe-sharett.bio: Served as Israel's first Minister of Foreign Affairs from 1948 to 1956 and as the country's second Prime Minister. Helped establish Israel's diplomatic corps and foreign policy framework.

person-abba-eban.name: Abba Eban
person-abba-eban.bio: Served as Israel's Foreign Minister from 1966 to 1974 and as ambassador to the UN and United States. Known as one of the most eloquent diplomats of the 20th century.

person-golda-meir.name: Golda Meir
person-golda-meir.bio: Served as Israel's Foreign Minister from 1956 to 1966 before becoming Prime Minister in 1969. One of the founders of the State of Israel and a towering figure in its diplomacy.

person-david-dahan.name: David Dahan
person-david-dahan.bio: Co-founded Habana Labs in 2016 and led the AI chip startup until its acquisition by Intel in December 2019 for approximately $2 billion. Previously co-founded PrimeSense.

person-ran-zilca.name: Ran Zilca
person-ran-zilca.bio: Co-founded Habana Labs and served as CTO, architecting the Gaudi AI training processor and Goya AI inference processor used in data center AI workloads.

person-pat-gelsinger.name: Pat Gelsinger
person-pat-gelsinger.bio: As Intel CEO, oversaw the integration of Habana Labs into Intel's data center AI strategy. The acquisition was Intel's largest in Israel and part of its push into AI hardware.

person-naveen-rao.name: Naveen Rao
person-naveen-rao.bio: Led Intel's AI Products Group which integrated Habana Labs' Gaudi processors into Intel's AI chip lineup for data center training and inference applications.

person-daniel-ramot.name: Daniel Ramot
person-daniel-ramot.bio: Co-founded Via Transportation in 2012 and serves as CEO. Holds a Ph.D. in neuroscience from Princeton and has built Via into a global leader in transit-as-a-service technology.

person-oren-shoval.name: Oren Shoval
person-oren-shoval.bio: Co-founded Via Transportation in 2012 and leads its technology development. Built the real-time routing algorithms that power Via's on-demand transit platform used in over 600 cities.

person-dror-shinnaar.name: Dror Shinnaar
person-dror-shinnaar.bio: Led engineering at Via Transportation, developing the dynamic routing and ride-sharing optimization algorithms at the core of the company's public transit technology platform.

person-david-horovitz.name: David Horovitz
person-david-horovitz.bio: Founded The Times of Israel in 2012 and serves as its editor. Previously served as editor-in-chief of The Jerusalem Post from 2004 to 2011.

person-seth-klarman.name: Seth Klarman
person-seth-klarman.bio: American billionaire hedge fund manager and CEO of Baupost Group who provided founding investment for The Times of Israel in 2012. A prominent supporter of Israeli media and civil society.

person-amanda-borschel-dan.name: Amanda Borschel-Dan
person-amanda-borschel-dan.bio: Serves as a senior editor at The Times of Israel, leading coverage of Jewish world news and archaeology. Previously worked at other major Israeli English-language media outlets.

person-stuart-winer.name: Stuart Winer
person-stuart-winer.bio: Long-serving news editor at The Times of Israel, overseeing daily news coverage and breaking stories since the publication's early years.

person-oren-kaniel.name: Oren Kaniel
person-oren-kaniel.bio: Co-founded AppsFlyer in 2011 and serves as CEO. Built the company into the world's leading mobile attribution and marketing analytics platform, serving over 12,000 brands globally.

person-reshef-mann.name: Reshef Mann
person-reshef-mann.bio: Co-founded AppsFlyer in 2011 and serves as CTO. Architected the company's mobile attribution technology and privacy-preserving measurement solutions.

person-brian-quinn.name: Brian Quinn
person-brian-quinn.bio: Served as president of AppsFlyer, overseeing global business operations and expansion. Played a key role in growing the company's annual recurring revenue past $300 million.

person-micha-kaufman.name: Micha Kaufman
person-micha-kaufman.bio: Co-founded Fiverr in 2010 and led the freelance marketplace through its 2019 NYSE IPO. Built the platform into one of the world's largest online marketplaces for freelance services.

person-shai-wininger.name: Shai Wininger
person-shai-wininger.bio: Co-founded Fiverr in 2010, developing its original concept as a marketplace for $5 services. Later co-founded Lemonade, the insurtech company, and left Fiverr's active leadership.

person-ofer-katz.name: Ofer Katz
person-ofer-katz.bio: Served as CFO of Fiverr International, managing the company's finances through its NYSE IPO in 2019 and its subsequent growth as a public company.

person-hila-klein.name: Hila Klein
person-hila-klein.bio: Led product strategy at Fiverr, driving the evolution of the platform beyond its original gig-based model to include Fiverr Business and subscription-based services.

person-russell-ellwanger.name: Russell Ellwanger
person-russell-ellwanger.bio: Served as CEO of Tower Semiconductor since 2005, growing the specialty foundry into a global leader in analog semiconductor manufacturing. Led the company through Intel's $5.4 billion acquisition attempt.

person-oren-shirazi.name: Oren Shirazi
person-oren-shirazi.bio: Long-serving CFO of Tower Semiconductor, overseeing the company's financial operations and investor relations through multiple growth phases and its Nasdaq listing.

person-noel-hurley.name: Noel Hurley
person-noel-hurley.bio: Served as chief operating officer of Tower Semiconductor, managing global foundry operations across fabrication facilities in Israel, the US, and Japan.

person-yigal-grandman.name: Yigal Grandman
person-yigal-grandman.bio: Founded Tower Semiconductor in Migdal HaEmek, Israel, building it from a single fabrication plant into a specialty semiconductor foundry with global reach.

person-dave-waiser.name: Dave Waiser
person-dave-waiser.bio: Co-founded Gett (originally GetTaxi) in 2010 and served as CEO. Built the ride-hailing platform into a major mobility company operating across Israel, the UK, and Russia.

person-roi-more.name: Roi More
person-roi-more.bio: Co-founded Gett in 2010 and served as CTO, building the ride-hailing technology platform. Previously worked in software development roles at Israeli tech companies.

person-matteo-de-renzi.name: Matteo de Renzi
person-matteo-de-renzi.bio: Appointed CEO of Gett to lead the company's corporate transportation business strategy. Oversaw Gett's pivot toward B2B ground transportation management.

person-scott-galit.name: Scott Galit
person-scott-galit.bio: Served on Gett's board of directors, providing strategic guidance during the company's growth and fundraising rounds totaling over $700 million.

person-eli-hurvitz.name: Eli Hurvitz
person-eli-hurvitz.bio: Led Teva as CEO from 1976 to 2002 and chairman until 2010, transforming it from a small Israeli firm into the world's largest generic pharmaceutical company. Received the Israel Prize in 2011.

person-richard-francis.name: Richard Francis
person-richard-francis.bio: Appointed CEO of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries in 2023. Previously served as CEO of Sandoz, Novartis's generics division, bringing deep experience in the global generic drug industry.

person-kare-schultz.name: Kare Schultz
person-kare-schultz.bio: Served as CEO of Teva from 2017 to 2023, tasked with reducing the company's massive debt and restructuring operations after a costly acquisition spree. Cut over $3 billion in costs.

person-israel-makov.name: Israel Makov
person-israel-makov.bio: Served as CEO of Teva from 2002 to 2007, continuing the company's aggressive global acquisition strategy including the purchase of IVAX Corporation for $7.4 billion.

person-jeremy-levin.name: Jeremy Levin
person-jeremy-levin.bio: Served briefly as CEO of Teva from 2012 to 2013, attempting to shift the company's strategy toward specialty branded pharmaceuticals before being replaced by the board.

person-dani-dayan.name: Dani Dayan
person-dani-dayan.bio: Appointed chairman of Yad Vashem in 2021. Previously served as Israel's Consul General in New York and as chairman of the Yesha Council representing Israeli settlers.

person-mordecai-paldiel.name: Mordecai Paldiel
person-mordecai-paldiel.bio: Led Yad Vashem's Righteous Among the Nations program for over two decades, overseeing the recognition of non-Jews who risked their lives to save Jews during the Holocaust.

person-avner-shalev.name: Avner Shalev
person-avner-shalev.bio: Served as chairman of Yad Vashem from 1993 to 2021, overseeing the creation of the new museum complex designed by Moshe Safdie and the massive expansion of its digital archives.

person-gideon-hausner.name: Gideon Hausner
person-gideon-hausner.bio: Served as chairman of Yad Vashem's council from 1968 to 1990. Previously served as Attorney General of Israel and was the lead prosecutor in the 1961 Adolf Eichmann trial.

person-yitzhak-arad-yv.name: Yitzhak Arad
person-yitzhak-arad-yv.bio: Served as chairman of Yad Vashem from 1972 to 1993. A Holocaust survivor, historian, and former IDF brigadier general who authored major works on the Holocaust in the Soviet Union.

person-piers-handling.name: Piers Handling
person-piers-handling.bio: Led TIFF for over two decades (1994–2018), transforming it into one of the world's most prestigious film festivals.

person-cameron-bailey.name: Cameron Bailey
person-cameron-bailey.bio: Became CEO of TIFF in 2020 after serving as Artistic Director, guiding the festival's programming and strategic vision.

person-lisa-de-wilde.name: Lisa de Wilde
person-lisa-de-wilde.bio: Served as Chair of TIFF's Board of Directors, contributing governance leadership to the organization.

person-michele-maheux.name: Michèle Maheux
person-michele-maheux.bio: Served as Executive Director and COO of TIFF for many years, overseeing operations and industry programming.

person-gerry-schwartz.name: Gerry Schwartz
person-gerry-schwartz.bio: Founded Onex Corporation in 1984 and built it into one of Canada's largest private equity firms.

person-bobby-le-blanc.name: Bobby Le Blanc
person-bobby-le-blanc.bio: Succeeded Gerry Schwartz as CEO, leading Onex's global private equity and credit operations.

person-heather-reisman.name: Heather Reisman
person-heather-reisman.bio: CEO of Indigo Books and wife of Gerry Schwartz, she served on the Onex board and is a prominent Canadian business figure.

person-ewout-heersink.name: Ewout Heersink
person-ewout-heersink.bio: Senior Managing Director at Onex who played a key role in the firm's private equity investment strategy.

person-tobi-lutke.name: Tobi Lütke
person-tobi-lutke.bio: Co-founded Shopify in 2006 and grew it into one of the world's leading e-commerce platforms, headquartered in Ottawa.

person-harley-finkelstein.name: Harley Finkelstein
person-harley-finkelstein.bio: Joined Shopify early and became President, serving as a key public face and advocate for entrepreneurship.

person-daniel-weinand.name: Daniel Weinand
person-daniel-weinand.bio: Co-founded Shopify alongside Tobi Lütke and Scott Lake, leading the platform's early design and user experience.

person-amy-shapero.name: Amy Shapero
person-amy-shapero.bio: Served as Shopify's CFO during a period of rapid growth, overseeing the company's financial strategy and public market performance.

person-joseph-armand-bombardier.name: Joseph-Armand Bombardier
person-joseph-armand-bombardier.bio: Founded Bombardier in 1942 in Valcourt, Quebec, initially manufacturing snowmobiles before the company expanded into aerospace and rail.

person-laurent-beaudoin.name: Laurent Beaudoin
person-laurent-beaudoin.bio: Son-in-law of the founder, he led Bombardier's transformation into a global aerospace and transportation conglomerate.

person-pierre-beaudoin.name: Pierre Beaudoin
person-pierre-beaudoin.bio: Grandson of the founder who served as CEO and later Chairman, overseeing the C Series aircraft development.

person-eric-martel.name: Éric Martel
person-eric-martel.bio: Became CEO in 2020 and led Bombardier's strategic refocus on business aviation after divesting rail and commercial aerospace units.

person-paul-reichmann.name: Paul Reichmann
person-paul-reichmann.bio: The driving force behind Olympia & York, he masterminded the development of Canary Wharf in London and major Toronto projects.

person-albert-reichmann.name: Albert Reichmann
person-albert-reichmann.bio: Co-founded Olympia & York with his brothers and managed key aspects of the family's vast real estate empire.

person-ralph-reichmann.name: Ralph Reichmann
person-ralph-reichmann.bio: One of the three Reichmann brothers who built Olympia & York into the world's largest real estate development company in the 1980s.

person-samuel-reichmann.name: Samuel Reichmann
person-samuel-reichmann.bio: Father of Paul, Albert, and Ralph, he was a Hungarian-born businessman whose family emigrated to Canada and laid the foundation for the dynasty.

person-michael-mostyn.name: Michael Mostyn
person-michael-mostyn.bio: Serves as CEO of B'nai Brith Canada, leading the organization's advocacy, anti-hate, and community service work.

person-sam-katz-bnai.name: Sam Katz
person-sam-katz-bnai.bio: Served as president of B'nai Brith Canada, guiding the organization's policy and community engagement initiatives.

person-david-matas.name: David Matas
person-david-matas.bio: Prominent international human rights lawyer who has served as senior legal counsel for B'nai Brith Canada.

person-anita-bromberg.name: Anita Bromberg
person-anita-bromberg.bio: Led B'nai Brith Canada's legal affairs and the League for Human Rights, combating antisemitism and discrimination.

person-peter-munk.name: Peter Munk
person-peter-munk.bio: Hungarian-born Canadian businessman who founded Barrick Gold in 1983, building it into the world's largest gold mining company.

person-mark-bristow.name: Mark Bristow
person-mark-bristow.bio: Became CEO of Barrick Gold following the 2019 merger with Randgold Resources, which he previously led.

person-john-thornton.name: John Thornton
person-john-thornton.bio: Former Goldman Sachs president who became Executive Chairman of Barrick Gold, guiding its strategic direction.

person-aaron-regent.name: Aaron Regent
person-aaron-regent.bio: Served as CEO of Barrick Gold from 2009 to 2012, overseeing the company during a period of high gold prices and expansion.

person-nikki-gershbain.name: Nikki Gershbain
person-nikki-gershbain.bio: Served as CEO of Jewish Federations of Canada – UIA, overseeing the national umbrella for Jewish community fundraising and services.

person-linda-frum.name: Linda Frum
person-linda-frum.bio: Canadian senator and journalist who served in leadership roles supporting the federation's national campaigns.

person-jerry-lewkowitz.name: Jerry Lewkowitz
person-jerry-lewkowitz.bio: Served as national chair of JFCUIA, providing volunteer leadership for Canada's Jewish federation system.

person-joseph-mapa.name: Joseph Mapa
person-joseph-mapa.bio: Led Mount Sinai Hospital for many years, overseeing its growth into a leading teaching and research hospital in Toronto.

person-zane-cohen.name: Zane Cohen
person-zane-cohen.bio: Renowned colorectal surgeon at Mount Sinai Hospital whose legacy includes the Zane Cohen Centre for Digestive Diseases.

person-samuel-lunenfeld.name: Samuel Lunenfeld
person-samuel-lunenfeld.bio: Major philanthropist whose donations established the Lunenfeld-Tanenbaum Research Institute at Mount Sinai Hospital.

person-alan-bernstein.name: Alan Bernstein
person-alan-bernstein.bio: Leading biomedical researcher who helped build Mount Sinai's research institute into a world-class facility.

person-yair-szlak.name: Yair Szlak
person-yair-szlak.bio: Leads Federation CJA in Montreal, overseeing community services, fundraising, and Israel engagement for the Jewish community.

person-eric-bhak.name: Eric Bhak
person-eric-bhak.bio: Served as Chair of the Board of Directors of Federation CJA, providing volunteer leadership to Montreal's Jewish community.

person-marc-gold.name: Marc Gold
person-marc-gold.bio: Canadian Senator who previously served as president of Federation CJA, strengthening community programming in Montreal.

person-shimon-koffler-fogel.name: Shimon Koffler Fogel
person-shimon-koffler-fogel.bio: Led CIJA as its CEO for many years, serving as Canadian Jewry's primary advocacy voice on Parliament Hill and in public policy.

person-david-cape.name: David Cape
person-david-cape.bio: Served as Chair of CIJA's board, helping shape the organization's government relations and public affairs strategies.

person-richard-marceau.name: Richard Marceau
person-richard-marceau.bio: Former Bloc Québécois MP who joined CIJA to lead its Quebec advocacy and legal affairs.

person-israel-asper.name: Israel Asper
person-israel-asper.bio: Media mogul and founder of CanWest Global Communications who conceived the idea for the Canadian Museum for Human Rights in Winnipeg before his death in 2003.

person-gail-asper.name: Gail Asper
person-gail-asper.bio: Daughter of Israel Asper who championed the museum's creation, leading fundraising and advocacy to bring it to completion in 2014.

person-stuart-murray.name: Stuart Murray
person-stuart-murray.bio: Served as the museum's first President and CEO, overseeing its construction and opening in Winnipeg.

person-isha-khan.name: Isha Khan
person-isha-khan.bio: Appointed CEO of the Canadian Museum for Human Rights, leading the institution's programming and public engagement.

person-avi-benlolo.name: Avi Benlolo
person-avi-benlolo.bio: Founded and led Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center for Holocaust Studies in Canada, becoming a leading voice against antisemitism and hate.

person-michael-levitt.name: Michael Levitt
person-michael-levitt.bio: Former Liberal MP who became President and CEO, continuing the organization's Holocaust education and anti-hate mission.

person-jaime-kirzner-roberts.name: Jaime Kirzner-Roberts
person-jaime-kirzner-roberts.bio: Leads the policy and advocacy work at Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center, focusing on combating antisemitism and online hate.

person-janice-stein.name: Janice Gross Stein
person-janice-stein.bio: Renowned political scientist who served as the founding director of the Munk School, shaping its research and policy focus.

person-randall-hansen.name: Randall Hansen
person-randall-hansen.bio: Political science professor who served as director, overseeing the school's academic programs and research centres.

person-peter-loewen.name: Peter Loewen
person-peter-loewen.bio: Political scientist appointed as Director of the Munk School, leading its expansion in public policy education and research.

person-samuel-bronfman.name: Samuel Bronfman
person-samuel-bronfman.bio: Seagram empire patriarch who served as president of the Canadian Jewish Congress for over two decades, guiding it through WWII and post-war refugee resettlement.

person-irving-abella.name: Irving Abella
person-irving-abella.bio: Historian and author of 'None Is Too Many' who served as president of the Canadian Jewish Congress, documenting Canada's restrictive wartime immigration policies.

person-saul-hayes.name: Saul Hayes
person-saul-hayes.bio: Long-serving executive director of the Canadian Jewish Congress who managed day-to-day operations and external affairs for decades.

person-jack-jedwab.name: Jack Jedwab
person-jack-jedwab.bio: Headed the Quebec region of the Canadian Jewish Congress and later became a leading researcher on Canadian diversity and identity.

person-peter-brown.name: Peter Brown
person-peter-brown.bio: Built Canaccord from a small Vancouver brokerage into a major independent investment firm and served as its long-time chairman.

person-dan-daviau.name: Dan Daviau
person-dan-daviau.bio: Leads Canaccord Genuity Group as President and CEO, overseeing its global capital markets and wealth management operations.

person-stuart-reaney.name: Stuart Reaney
person-stuart-reaney.bio: Served in senior capital markets roles at Canaccord Genuity, driving the firm's equity underwriting business.

person-adam-minsky.name: Adam Minsky
person-adam-minsky.bio: Leads UJA Federation of Greater Toronto, overseeing one of North America's largest Jewish community fundraising and social service organizations.

person-julia-koschitzky.name: Julia Koschitzky
person-julia-koschitzky.bio: Prominent community leader and philanthropist who served as Chair of UJA Federation and has held leadership roles in global Jewish organizations.

person-ted-sokolsky.name: Ted Sokolsky
person-ted-sokolsky.bio: Previously led UJA Federation of Greater Toronto, strengthening its community programs and annual campaigns.

person-larry-tanenbaum.name: Larry Tanenbaum
person-larry-tanenbaum.bio: Sports and business mogul who has been a key philanthropic leader and supporter of UJA Federation of Greater Toronto.

person-alice-herscovitch.name: Alice Herscovitch
person-alice-herscovitch.bio: Led the Montreal Holocaust Museum for many years, building it into a leading Holocaust education institution in Canada.

person-cornelia-goldsmith.name: Cornelia Goldsmith
person-cornelia-goldsmith.bio: Served as President of the board, overseeing the museum's educational programming and exhibition development.

person-eszter-andor.name: Eszter Andor
person-eszter-andor.bio: Curates the Montreal Holocaust Museum's permanent and travelling exhibitions, managing its collection of survivor artifacts and testimonies.

person-mordechai-ben-dat.name: Mordechai Ben-Dat
person-mordechai-ben-dat.bio: Served as editor and later publisher of the Canadian Jewish News, guiding the paper through its transition to digital media.

person-elizabeth-faber.name: Elizabeth Faber
person-elizabeth-faber.bio: Served as editor of the Canadian Jewish News, shaping editorial coverage of Canadian Jewish community issues.

person-bernie-lebow.name: Bernie Lebow
person-bernie-lebow.bio: Served as publisher of the Canadian Jewish News for many years, overseeing its operations as the major English-language Jewish newspaper in Canada.

person-robert-krell.name: Robert Krell
person-robert-krell.bio: Child Holocaust survivor, psychiatrist, and co-founder of the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre, dedicated to preserving survivor testimony.

person-nina-krieger.name: Nina Krieger
person-nina-krieger.bio: Leads the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre, overseeing its educational programs and exhibitions on Holocaust remembrance.

person-frieda-miller.name: Frieda Miller
person-frieda-miller.bio: Shaped the VHEC's educational mandate over many years, building its programs for students and teachers across British Columbia.

person-benjamin-katz-thmp.name: Benjamin Katz
person-benjamin-katz-thmp.bio: Involved in the governance of the Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park, one of the major Jewish cemeteries serving the Greater Toronto Area.

person-allan-offman.name: Allan Offman
person-allan-offman.bio: Served in an administrative capacity at the Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park, managing cemetery operations and community relations.

person-harvey-ostroff.name: Harvey Ostroff
person-harvey-ostroff.bio: Served on the board of the Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park, contributing to governance and community outreach efforts.

person-bruce-flatt.name: Bruce Flatt
person-bruce-flatt.bio: Has led Brookfield Asset Management since 2002, growing it into one of the world's largest alternative asset managers with over $900 billion in AUM.

person-jack-cockwell.name: Jack Cockwell
person-jack-cockwell.bio: South African-born businessman who built the Brascan/Brookfield empire alongside the Bronfman family, serving as the company's strategic architect.

person-edward-bronfman.name: Edward Bronfman
person-edward-bronfman.bio: Member of the Bronfman family who served as chairman of Brascan (predecessor to Brookfield), shaping its early growth in Canadian real estate and resources.

person-sachin-shah.name: Sachin Shah
person-sachin-shah.bio: Leads the publicly listed Brookfield Asset Management entity, overseeing client relationships and capital raising globally.

person-guy-laliberte.name: Guy Laliberté
person-guy-laliberte.bio: Former street performer who co-founded Cirque du Soleil in 1984 in Baie-Saint-Paul, Quebec, revolutionizing the circus arts globally.

person-gilles-ste-croix.name: Gilles Ste-Croix
person-gilles-ste-croix.bio: Co-founded Cirque du Soleil with Guy Laliberté and played a key creative role in developing the company's signature artistic style.

person-daniel-lamarre.name: Daniel Lamarre
person-daniel-lamarre.bio: Led Cirque du Soleil for nearly two decades, expanding its shows worldwide and navigating the company through ownership changes.

person-stephane-lefebvre.name: Stéphane Lefebvre
person-stephane-lefebvre.bio: Appointed CEO of Cirque du Soleil, leading the company's recovery and expansion following the pandemic restructuring.

person-lino-saputo-sr.name: Lino Saputo Sr.
person-lino-saputo-sr.bio: Founded Saputo Inc. in Montreal in 1954, growing it from a small cheese shop into one of the world's largest dairy processors.

person-lino-saputo-jr.name: Lino Saputo Jr.
person-lino-saputo-jr.bio: Son of the founder who has led Saputo as CEO, expanding the company through global acquisitions in dairy and food products.

person-carl-colizza.name: Carl Colizza
person-carl-colizza.bio: Serves as President and COO of Saputo Inc., overseeing the company's global dairy operations across multiple continents.

person-maxime-therrien.name: Maxime Therrien
person-maxime-therrien.bio: Serves as Chief Financial Officer of Saputo, managing the company's financial strategy during its international growth phase.

person-rami-kleinmann.name: Rami Kleinmann
person-rami-kleinmann.bio: Leads Canadian Friends of the Hebrew University, fostering academic partnerships and fundraising to support Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

person-avie-bennett.name: Avie Bennett
person-avie-bennett.bio: Canadian real estate developer and publisher who served as national president and was a leading philanthropic supporter of Hebrew University.

person-jack-bick.name: Jack Bick
person-jack-bick.bio: Served as national chair of CFHU, providing volunteer leadership and championing academic excellence at Hebrew University.

person-josef-schuster.name: Josef Schuster
person-josef-schuster.bio: As President of the Central Council of Jews in Germany, he serves as publisher of the Jüdische Allgemeine, the council's official weekly newspaper.

person-charlotte-knobloch.name: Charlotte Knobloch
person-charlotte-knobloch.bio: Served as President of the Central Council from 2006 to 2010 and remains President of the Jewish Community of Munich and Upper Bavaria.

person-paul-spiegel.name: Paul Spiegel
person-paul-spiegel.bio: Led the Central Council of Jews in Germany from 2000 until his death in 2006, advocating for Holocaust remembrance and Jewish life in Germany.

person-daniel-botmann.name: Daniel Botmann
person-daniel-botmann.bio: Serves as Managing Director of the Central Council of Jews in Germany, overseeing day-to-day operations and organizational strategy.

person-niklas-ostberg.name: Niklas Östberg
person-niklas-ostberg.bio: Swedish entrepreneur who co-founded Delivery Hero in 2011 in Berlin and has led it as CEO, growing it into a global food delivery platform.

person-emmanuel-thomassin.name: Emmanuel Thomassin
person-emmanuel-thomassin.bio: Served as CFO of Delivery Hero from 2015, overseeing its IPO and financial strategy during rapid international expansion.

person-pieter-jan-vandepitte.name: Pieter-Jan Vandepitte
person-pieter-jan-vandepitte.bio: Became CFO of Delivery Hero, managing the company's financial operations across its global food delivery network.

person-hakan-koc.name: Hakan Koç
person-hakan-koc.bio: Co-founded Delivery Hero alongside Niklas Östberg, helping build the initial platform that became one of Europe's largest food delivery companies.

person-leo-baeck.name: Leo Baeck
person-leo-baeck.bio: Rabbi and leader of Progressive Judaism in Germany who survived Theresienstadt; the institute was named in his honor to preserve German-Jewish heritage.

person-william-seltzer.name: William Seltzer
person-william-seltzer.bio: Served as President of the Leo Baeck Institute, stewarding its mission to document and preserve the history of German-speaking Jewry.

person-carol-kahn-strauss.name: Carol Kahn Strauss
person-carol-kahn-strauss.bio: Led the Leo Baeck Institute in New York for decades, building its archive and library into essential resources for German-Jewish history research.

person-michael-brenner.name: Michael Brenner
person-michael-brenner.bio: Historian and professor at LMU Munich who serves as International President of the Leo Baeck Institute, advancing scholarship on German-Jewish history.

person-ronald-lauder.name: Ronald S. Lauder
person-ronald-lauder.bio: Estée Lauder heir and President of the World Jewish Congress who founded the Ronald S. Lauder Foundation to revitalize Jewish life in Central and Eastern Europe.

person-joshua-spinner.name: Joshua Spinner
person-joshua-spinner.bio: Senior executive who has helped lead the Lauder Foundation's programs in Germany, supporting Jewish education and community building.

person-sabine-bamberger-stemmann.name: Sabine Bamberger-Stemmann
person-sabine-bamberger-stemmann.bio: Has overseen the Lauder Foundation's educational and cultural programs in Germany, fostering Jewish identity among young people.

person-mirjam-wenzel.name: Mirjam Wenzel
person-mirjam-wenzel.bio: Serves as Director of the Jewish Museum Frankfurt, overseeing its major renovation and reopening in 2020 with a modernized exhibition concept.

person-fritz-backhaus.name: Fritz Backhaus
person-fritz-backhaus.bio: Served as Deputy Director and chief curator of the Jewish Museum Frankfurt, shaping its exhibitions on Frankfurt's rich Jewish history.

person-sabine-koss.name: Sabine Koss
person-sabine-koss.bio: Manages the operational side of the Jewish Museum Frankfurt, supporting its educational programs and public outreach.

person-bernhard-purin.name: Bernhard Purin
person-bernhard-purin.bio: Served as founding Director of the Jewish Museum Munich since its opening in 2007, curating exhibitions on Munich's Jewish history and culture.

person-lilian-harlander.name: Lilian Harlander
person-lilian-harlander.bio: Serves as curator at the Jewish Museum Munich, developing exhibitions exploring Jewish life, history, and culture in the Bavarian capital.

person-alon-meyer.name: Alon Meyer
person-alon-meyer.bio: As President of Maccabi Germany, he led the organization of the 2015 European Maccabi Games held in Berlin, a landmark event for Jewish sports in Europe.

person-oren-osterer.name: Oren Osterer
person-oren-osterer.bio: Serves as Vice President of Maccabi Germany, supporting the organization's sports programs and community initiatives.

person-uri-schaefer.name: Uri Schäfer
person-uri-schaefer.bio: Active board member of Maccabi Germany, contributing to the organization's mission of promoting Jewish identity through sport.

person-rebecca-siemoneit-barum.name: Rebecca Siemoneit-Barum
person-rebecca-siemoneit-barum.bio: Serves as President of WIZO Germany, leading fundraising and awareness efforts for women's and children's welfare programs in Israel.

person-karen-lux.name: Karen Lux
person-karen-lux.bio: Serves as Vice President of WIZO Germany, supporting the organization's charitable work and advocacy for women's issues.

person-esther-herlitz.name: Esther Herlitz
person-esther-herlitz.bio: Israeli diplomat and former Knesset member who served as World WIZO President and inspired the German chapter's activities.

person-axel-springer.name: Axel Springer
person-axel-springer.bio: Founded the publishing house in 1946 in Hamburg, building it into Europe's largest digital publisher; he was a strong advocate for Israel and German-Israeli reconciliation.

person-mathias-dopfner.name: Mathias Döpfner
person-mathias-dopfner.bio: Has led Axel Springer SE as CEO since 2002, transforming the traditional publisher into a leading digital media and classifieds company.

person-friede-springer.name: Friede Springer
person-friede-springer.bio: Widow of Axel Springer who became the company's largest shareholder and a powerful force in German media and philanthropy.

person-ralph-buchi.name: Ralph Büchi
person-ralph-buchi.bio: Senior executive who has led key divisions of Axel Springer's international media operations.

person-gunter-demnig.name: Gunter Demnig
person-gunter-demnig.bio: German artist who conceived and began installing Stolpersteine in 1992, creating the world's largest decentralized Holocaust memorial with over 100,000 brass plaques across Europe.

person-michael-friedrichs-friedlaender.name: Michael Friedrichs-Friedländer
person-michael-friedrichs-friedlaender.bio: Master craftsman in Berlin who hand-stamps each Stolperstein brass plaque, personally producing thousands of memorial stones.

person-anna-warda.name: Anna Warda
person-anna-warda.bio: Coordinates the Stolpersteine project logistics and community engagement, managing installations across multiple European countries.

person-gideon-joffe.name: Gideon Joffe
person-gideon-joffe.bio: Has served as Chairman of the Jewish Community of Berlin, representing one of the fastest-growing Jewish communities in Europe.

person-michael-jochanan-blumenthal.name: Michael Jochanan Blumenthal
person-michael-jochanan-blumenthal.bio: Former U.S. Treasury Secretary who later became a leader of the Jewish Community of Berlin and first director of the Jewish Museum Berlin.

person-yehuda-teichtal.name: Yehuda Teichtal
person-yehuda-teichtal.bio: Chabad rabbi serving the Jewish Community of Berlin, prominent in interfaith dialogue and community outreach programs.

person-peter-eisenman.name: Peter Eisenman
person-peter-eisenman.bio: American architect who designed the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe in Berlin, consisting of 2,711 concrete stelae opened in 2005.

person-lea-rosh.name: Lea Rosh
person-lea-rosh.bio: German journalist and activist who spearheaded the campaign to build the Holocaust Memorial in Berlin, chairing the supporting foundation.

person-uwe-neumarker.name: Uwe Neumärker
person-uwe-neumarker.bio: Serves as Director of the Foundation for the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe, overseeing the memorial and its information center.

person-hermann-simon.name: Hermann Simon
person-hermann-simon.bio: Historian who founded and directed the Centrum Judaicum in the Neue Synagoge Berlin, building it into a major center for Berlin's Jewish history.

person-chana-schustermann.name: Chana Schüstermann
person-chana-schustermann.bio: Leads the Centrum Judaicum foundation housed in the Neue Synagoge, managing exhibitions and educational programs on Berlin Jewish life.

person-daniel-libeskind.name: Daniel Libeskind
person-daniel-libeskind.bio: Polish-American architect who designed the iconic zinc-clad Jewish Museum Berlin building, which opened in 2001 as a landmark of deconstructivist architecture.

person-w-michael-blumenthal.name: W. Michael Blumenthal
person-w-michael-blumenthal.bio: Former U.S. Treasury Secretary who served as the founding Director of the Jewish Museum Berlin from 1997 to 2014, shaping its mission and identity.

person-hetty-berg.name: Hetty Berg
person-hetty-berg.bio: Dutch museum professional who became Director of the Jewish Museum Berlin in 2020, overseeing its exhibitions and public programs.

person-cilly-kugelmann.name: Cilly Kugelmann
person-cilly-kugelmann.bio: Served as Program Director and chief curator of the Jewish Museum Berlin, shaping major exhibitions on German-Jewish history and culture.

person-axel-drecoll.name: Axel Drecoll
person-axel-drecoll.bio: Serves as Director of the Sachsenhausen Memorial and Museum, overseeing the preservation of the former concentration camp as a site of remembrance and education.

person-guenter-morsch.name: Günter Morsch
person-guenter-morsch.bio: Led the Sachsenhausen Memorial and the Brandenburg Memorials Foundation for many years, establishing it as a leading Holocaust education site.

person-astrid-ley.name: Astrid Ley
person-astrid-ley.bio: Serves as Deputy Director and head curator of the Sachsenhausen Memorial, leading research and exhibition development on the camp's history.

person-walter-homolka.name: Walter Homolka
person-walter-homolka.bio: Founded Abraham Geiger College in 1999 at the University of Potsdam, establishing the first rabbinical seminary in continental Europe since the Holocaust.

person-abraham-geiger.name: Abraham Geiger
person-abraham-geiger.bio: 19th-century German rabbi considered a founding figure of Reform Judaism, after whom the college is named.

person-rabbiner-henry-g-brandt.name: Henry G. Brandt
person-rabbiner-henry-g-brandt.bio: Prominent Reform rabbi in Germany who served as Honorary President of the Abraham Geiger College and championed liberal Jewish life in Europe.

person-robert-gentz.name: Robert Gentz
person-robert-gentz.bio: Co-founded Zalando in 2008 in Berlin and has served as Co-CEO, building it into Europe's leading online fashion and lifestyle platform.

person-david-schneider.name: David Schneider
person-david-schneider.bio: Co-founded Zalando with Robert Gentz and served as Co-CEO, overseeing the company's technology and platform strategy.

person-rubin-ritter.name: Rubin Ritter
person-rubin-ritter.bio: Served as Co-CEO of Zalando alongside Gentz and Schneider until 2021, leading the company's commercial and marketing strategy.

person-oliver-samwer.name: Oliver Samwer
person-oliver-samwer.bio: Co-founder of Rocket Internet who served as a key early investor and backer of Zalando, helping it scale rapidly across Europe.

person-julius-schoeps.name: Julius H. Schoeps
person-julius-schoeps.bio: Historian and great-great-grandson of Moses Mendelssohn who founded the Moses Mendelssohn Center at the University of Potsdam in 1992.

person-elke-vera-kotowski.name: Elke-Vera Kotowski
person-elke-vera-kotowski.bio: Serves as Deputy Director of the Moses Mendelssohn Center, leading research projects on European-Jewish history and culture.

person-werner-tressl.name: Werner Treß
person-werner-tressl.bio: Historian at the Moses Mendelssohn Center who researches the history of book burnings and cultural persecution in Nazi Germany.

person-aron-schuster.name: Aron Schuster
person-aron-schuster.bio: Serves as Director of the Central Welfare Office of Jews in Germany, overseeing social services and integration programs for Jewish communities.

person-benjamin-bloch.name: Benjamin Bloch
person-benjamin-bloch.bio: Serves as Deputy Director of the ZWST, managing welfare and educational programs for Jewish communities throughout Germany.

person-henry-g-brandt.name: Henry G. Brandt
person-henry-g-brandt.bio: Served as founding Chairman of the General Rabbinical Conference of Germany, unifying Reform, Conservative, and Liberal rabbis in Germany.

person-andreas-nachama.name: Andreas Nachama
person-andreas-nachama.bio: Rabbi and historian who serves as Chairman of the Allgemeine Rabbinerkonferenz, also known for directing the Topography of Terror documentation center in Berlin.

person-avichai-apel.name: Avichai Apel
person-avichai-apel.bio: Orthodox rabbi in Germany who participates in the General Rabbinical Conference, representing the Orthodox stream in interfaith and community dialogue.

person-yossi-sharabi.name: Yossi Sharabi
person-yossi-sharabi.bio: Served as Tournament Director for multiple European Maccabi Games, coordinating logistics and athletic competitions across host cities.

person-pierre-kahn.name: Pierre Kahn
person-pierre-kahn.bio: Leads the European Maccabi Confederation which oversees the European Maccabi Games, promoting Jewish identity through sports across the continent.

person-guido-knopp.name: Guido Knopp
person-guido-knopp.bio: Renowned German historian and journalist who has contributed to the Jüdische Allgemeine's coverage of German-Jewish history and current affairs.

person-detlef-david-kauschke.name: Detlef David Kauschke
person-detlef-david-kauschke.bio: Serves as Editor-in-Chief of the Jüdische Allgemeine, the leading Jewish newspaper in Germany, published by the Central Council of Jews.

person-mike-cannon-brookes.name: Mike Cannon-Brookes
person-mike-cannon-brookes.bio: Co-founded Atlassian in 2002 in Sydney with Scott Farquhar, building it into a global software company known for Jira, Confluence, and Trello.

person-scott-farquhar.name: Scott Farquhar
person-scott-farquhar.bio: Co-founded Atlassian with Mike Cannon-Brookes, serving as Co-CEO and helping grow the company to over 300,000 enterprise customers worldwide.

person-jay-simons.name: Jay Simons
person-jay-simons.bio: Served as President of Atlassian for over a decade, driving the company's go-to-market strategy and its unique no-sales-team model.

person-anu-bharadwaj.name: Anu Bharadwaj
person-anu-bharadwaj.bio: Serves as COO of Atlassian, overseeing the company's product and engineering teams across its collaboration software suite.

person-pauline-rockman.name: Pauline Rockman
person-pauline-rockman.bio: Daughter of Holocaust survivors who served as President of the Jewish Holocaust Centre in Melbourne, championing survivor testimony and education.

person-helen-mahemoff.name: Helen Mahemoff
person-helen-mahemoff.bio: Led the Jewish Holocaust Centre Melbourne as President, overseeing its educational programs and outreach to schools across Victoria.

person-jayne-josem.name: Jayne Josem
person-jayne-josem.bio: Serves as Director of the Jewish Holocaust Centre Melbourne, managing its museum, archives and survivor testimony programs.

person-paul-perreault.name: Paul Perreault
person-paul-perreault.bio: Led CSL Limited as CEO from 2013, growing the Melbourne-based biopharmaceutical company into a global leader in plasma-derived therapies.

person-brian-mcnamee.name: Brian McNamee
person-brian-mcnamee.bio: Served as CEO of CSL from 1990 to 2013, overseeing the company's transformation from government laboratory to global biopharmaceutical giant.

person-paul-mckenzie.name: Paul McKenzie
person-paul-mckenzie.bio: Became CEO of CSL, continuing the company's growth in plasma-derived and recombinant therapies and vaccine manufacturing.

person-elizabeth-alexander.name: Elizabeth Alexander
person-elizabeth-alexander.bio: Serves as Chair of CSL Limited's board, providing governance leadership for one of Australia's most valuable companies.

person-anthony-pratt.name: Anthony Pratt
person-anthony-pratt.bio: Leads Visy Industries as Executive Chairman, making it one of the world's largest privately owned packaging and recycling companies; one of Australia's wealthiest individuals.

person-richard-pratt.name: Richard Pratt
person-richard-pratt.bio: Built Visy Industries into a packaging empire and was a renowned philanthropist before his death in 2009; father of Anthony Pratt.

person-fiona-pratt.name: Fiona Pratt
person-fiona-pratt.bio: Member of the Pratt family and active philanthropist supporting arts, education, and Jewish community causes in Australia.

person-frank-lowy.name: Frank Lowy
person-frank-lowy.bio: Hungarian-born Australian billionaire and Westfield founder who established the Lowy Institute in 2003 to promote informed debate on Australia's international policy.

person-michael-fullilove.name: Michael Fullilove
person-michael-fullilove.bio: Leads the Lowy Institute as Executive Director, making it one of the leading independent international policy think tanks in the Asia-Pacific region.

person-steven-lowy.name: Steven Lowy
person-steven-lowy.bio: Son of Frank Lowy who serves on the Lowy Institute board, continuing the family's commitment to public policy and philanthropy.

person-jeanne-pratt.name: Jeanne Pratt
person-jeanne-pratt.bio: Co-founded the Pratt Foundation with her husband Richard and continues to lead it as Chair, directing grants to arts, education, and community welfare.

person-sam-lipski.name: Sam Lipski
person-sam-lipski.bio: Legendary Australian Jewish journalist who served as Editor-in-Chief of The Australian Jewish News, shaping Jewish media in Australia for decades.

person-harry-triguboff.name: Harry Triguboff
person-harry-triguboff.bio: Founded Meriton in 1963 and built it into Australia's largest apartment developer; a Chinese-born Australian billionaire often called 'high-rise Harry'.

person-peter-spira.name: Peter Spira
person-peter-spira.bio: Long-serving General Manager of Meriton who oversees the company's development operations across Sydney, Brisbane, and the Gold Coast.

person-adrian-bo.name: Adrian Bo
person-adrian-bo.bio: Leads Meriton's sales division, managing residential property sales across one of Australia's most prolific apartment development portfolios.

person-helen-light.name: Helen Light
person-helen-light.bio: Served as Director of the Jewish Museum of Australia in Melbourne for many years, shaping its exhibitions on the Australian Jewish experience.

person-robert-gillespie.name: Robert Gillespie
person-robert-gillespie.bio: Served as President of the Jewish Museum of Australia, providing governance leadership and supporting the museum's community engagement programs.

person-tamara-green.name: Tamara Green
person-tamara-green.bio: Serves as curator at the Jewish Museum of Australia, developing exhibitions that explore Jewish life, art, and heritage in the Australian context.

person-norman-seligman.name: Norman Seligman
person-norman-seligman.bio: Holocaust survivor who co-founded the Sydney Jewish Museum in 1992 to preserve Holocaust memory and combat prejudice through education.

person-gus-lehrer.name: Gus Lehrer
person-gus-lehrer.bio: Served as President of the Sydney Jewish Museum board, overseeing its governance and strategic direction as a leading Holocaust education center.

person-roslyn-sugarman.name: Roslyn Sugarman
person-roslyn-sugarman.bio: Leads the education and content team at the Sydney Jewish Museum, developing programs that use Holocaust history to promote tolerance and human rights.

person-jeremy-leibler.name: Jeremy Leibler
person-jeremy-leibler.bio: Prominent Australian lawyer who serves as President of the Zionist Federation of Australia, leading advocacy for Israel and Jewish community interests.

person-ginette-searle.name: Ginette Searle
person-ginette-searle.bio: Serves as CEO of the Zionist Federation of Australia, managing the organization's operations, programs, and Israel engagement activities.

person-mark-leibler.name: Mark Leibler
person-mark-leibler.bio: Former national chairman and honorary life member of the ZFA, he is one of Australia's most influential Jewish community leaders and tax lawyers.

person-lesli-berger.name: Lesli Berger
person-lesli-berger.bio: Has served as President of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, the elected representative body of the Jewish community in New South Wales.

person-vic-alhadeff.name: Vic Alhadeff
person-vic-alhadeff.bio: Led the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies as CEO for many years, serving as the community's primary spokesperson and interfaith advocate.

person-darren-bark.name: Darren Bark
person-darren-bark.bio: Serves as CEO of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, overseeing community advocacy, government relations, and communal affairs in New South Wales.

person-rabbi-james-kennard.name: Rabbi James Kennard
person-rabbi-james-kennard.bio: Serves as Principal of Mount Scopus Memorial College in Melbourne, one of Australia's largest Jewish day schools.

person-tony-rubin.name: Tony Rubin
person-tony-rubin.bio: Served as President of the Mount Scopus Foundation, supporting the college's educational programs and facilities in Melbourne.

person-steven-rothfield.name: Steven Rothfield
person-steven-rothfield.bio: Community leader who has served in board leadership roles at Mount Scopus Memorial College, supporting the school's governance and fundraising.

person-john-mimran.name: John Mimran
person-john-mimran.bio: Serves as Principal of Moriah College in Sydney, leading one of Australia's largest Jewish day schools in academics and Jewish education.

person-adam-carpenter.name: Adam Carpenter
person-adam-carpenter.bio: Serves as President of the Moriah College board, overseeing governance and strategic direction for Sydney's largest Jewish school.

person-ray-kellerman.name: Ray Kellerman
person-ray-kellerman.bio: Long-serving past president of Moriah College who guided the school's growth and development over many years.

person-zeddy-lawrence.name: Zeddy Lawrence
person-zeddy-lawrence.bio: Serves as Editor-in-Chief of The Australian Jewish News, the primary Jewish community newspaper serving Melbourne and Sydney.

person-robert-gillespie-ajn.name: Robert Gillespie
person-robert-gillespie-ajn.bio: Served as Chairman of the board of The Australian Jewish News, providing governance and strategic direction for the publication.

person-daniel-aghion.name: Daniel Aghion
person-daniel-aghion.bio: Serves as President of the Jewish Community Council of Victoria, the elected representative body of the Jewish community in Victoria.

person-jennifer-huppert.name: Jennifer Huppert
person-jennifer-huppert.bio: Served as President of the JCCV, advocating for the Jewish community's interests and combating antisemitism in Victoria.

person-judy-fetter.name: Judy Fetter
person-judy-fetter.bio: Served as President of the JCCV, contributing to community governance and interfaith dialogue in the Victorian Jewish community.

person-dick-dusseldorp.name: Dick Dusseldorp
person-dick-dusseldorp.bio: Dutch-born Australian industrialist who founded Lend Lease Corporation in 1958, building it into one of Australia's leading property and infrastructure companies.

person-tony-lombardo.name: Tony Lombardo
person-tony-lombardo.bio: Serves as CEO and Managing Director of Lendlease Group, overseeing its global property development, construction, and investment operations.

person-steve-mccann.name: Steve McCann
person-steve-mccann.bio: Led Lendlease Group as CEO from 2008 to 2021, guiding the company through major international development projects and strategic transformation.

person-michael-ullmer.name: Michael Ullmer
person-michael-ullmer.bio: Serves as Chairman of Lendlease Group, providing board-level governance for the multinational property and infrastructure corporation.

person-mark-baker.name: Mark Baker
person-mark-baker.bio: Historian who directs the Australian Centre for Jewish Civilisation at Monash University, leading research and teaching on Jewish history and culture.

person-andrew-markus.name: Andrew Markus
person-andrew-markus.bio: Pratt Foundation Research Professor of Jewish Civilisation at Monash University, known for his research on Australian social cohesion and immigration.

person-myer-samra.name: Myer Samra
person-myer-samra.bio: Lectures in Jewish civilization at Monash University, contributing to the academic program on Jewish history and culture in Australia.

person-jack-skirball.name: Jack H. Skirball
person-jack-skirball.bio: Jack H. Skirball was a rabbi, film producer, and philanthropist whose foundation funded the creation of the Skirball Cultural Center. He envisioned an institution dedicated to exploring the connections between Jewish heritage and American democratic ideals.

person-uri-herscher.name: Uri D. Herscher
person-uri-herscher.bio: Uri D. Herscher served as the founding president and CEO of the Skirball Cultural Center, overseeing its development and opening in 1996. A scholar and cultural leader, he shaped the center into a major Los Angeles cultural institution.

person-jessie-kornberg.name: Jessie Kornberg
person-jessie-kornberg.bio: Jessie Kornberg succeeded Uri Herscher as president and CEO of the Skirball Cultural Center. She has led the center's expansion of programming and community engagement initiatives.

person-audrey-skirball-kenis.name: Audrey Skirball-Kenis
person-audrey-skirball-kenis.bio: Audrey Skirball-Kenis was a philanthropist and the wife of Jack H. Skirball who helped establish the Skirball Cultural Center. She continued supporting the center through the Skirball Foundation after her husband's passing.

person-eric-yuan-zm.name: Eric Yuan
person-eric-yuan-zm.bio: Founded Zoom Video Communications in 2011 after leaving Cisco. Led the platform's explosive growth during the COVID-19 pandemic.

person-aparna-bawa-zm.name: Aparna Bawa
person-aparna-bawa-zm.bio: Served as Chief Operating Officer of Zoom, responsible for legal, compliance, security, and business operations.

person-kelly-steckelberg-zm.name: Kelly Steckelberg
person-kelly-steckelberg-zm.bio: Served as Chief Financial Officer of Zoom Video Communications, guiding the company's financial strategy through its IPO and rapid growth period.

person-jamie-dimon-jpm.name: Jamie Dimon
person-jamie-dimon-jpm.bio: Has served as Chairman and CEO of JPMorgan Chase since 2005. One of the most prominent figures in global banking, he led the firm through the 2008 financial crisis.

person-daniel-pinto-jpm.name: Daniel Pinto
person-daniel-pinto-jpm.bio: President and Chief Operating Officer of JPMorgan Chase. Previously led the Corporate & Investment Bank division.

person-mary-erdoes-jpm.name: Mary Callahan Erdoes
person-mary-erdoes-jpm.bio: Head of JPMorgan's Asset & Wealth Management division overseeing trillions in client assets. Consistently ranked among the most powerful women in finance.

person-marianne-lake-jpm.name: Marianne Lake
person-marianne-lake-jpm.bio: Co-CEO of Consumer & Community Banking at JPMorgan Chase. Previously served as the firm's Chief Financial Officer.

person-bernard-lander.name: Bernard Lander
person-bernard-lander.bio: Rabbi Dr. Bernard Lander founded Touro College in 1970 with a mission to serve the Jewish and wider community through higher education. He served as president until his death in 2010, building it into a major institution with multiple campuses.
