person-alan-kadish.name: Alan Kadish
person-alan-kadish.bio: Dr. Alan Kadish has served as president and CEO of Touro University since 2010, succeeding founder Bernard Lander. A cardiologist and researcher, he has overseen the university's continued expansion and academic development.

person-doniel-lander.name: Doniel Lander
person-doniel-lander.bio: Rabbi Doniel Lander served as chancellor of Touro College and was the son of founder Bernard Lander. He continued his father's vision of integrating Jewish values with professional education until his passing in 2022.

person-hadar-susskind.name: Hadar Susskind
person-hadar-susskind.bio: Hadar Susskind has served as president and CEO of Americans for Peace Now, the U.S. sister organization of Israel's Shalom Achshav movement. He previously held leadership roles at the Jewish Federations of North America and Bend the Arc.

person-debra-delee.name: Debra DeLee
person-debra-delee.bio: Debra DeLee served as president and CEO of Americans for Peace Now for over a decade. She previously served as executive director of the Democratic National Committee.

person-ori-nir.name: Ori Nir
person-ori-nir.bio: Ori Nir serves as spokesperson and communications director for Americans for Peace Now. He previously worked as a Washington correspondent for the Israeli newspaper Haaretz and the Forward.

person-robert-kraft.name: Robert Kraft
person-robert-kraft.bio: Robert Kraft purchased the New England Patriots in 1994 and built the franchise into one of the NFL's most successful teams, winning six Super Bowl championships. He is chairman and CEO of the Kraft Group, a diversified business conglomerate.

person-jonathan-kraft.name: Jonathan Kraft
person-jonathan-kraft.bio: Jonathan Kraft is president of the Kraft Group and serves in a senior leadership role with the New England Patriots organization. He is the son of owner Robert Kraft and oversees the family's business operations.

person-daniel-kraft-nep.name: Daniel Kraft
person-daniel-kraft-nep.bio: Daniel Kraft serves as president of international for the Kraft Group operating companies. He is a son of Robert Kraft and plays a key role in the family's global business expansion efforts.

person-robert-morgenthau.name: Robert M. Morgenthau
person-robert-morgenthau.bio: Robert M. Morgenthau served as founding chairman of the Museum of Jewish Heritage in New York City's Battery Park. He was also the legendary District Attorney of Manhattan, serving from 1975 to 2009.

person-bruce-ratner.name: Bruce C. Ratner
person-bruce-ratner.bio: Bruce C. Ratner served as chairman of the board of the Museum of Jewish Heritage. He was also a prominent New York real estate developer known for the Barclays Center and Atlantic Yards projects.

person-jack-kliger.name: Jack Kliger
person-jack-kliger.bio: Jack Kliger has served as president and CEO of the Museum of Jewish Heritage – A Living Memorial to the Holocaust. He previously served as CEO of Hachette Filipacchi Media U.S.

person-david-marwell.name: David G. Marwell
person-david-marwell.bio: David G. Marwell served as director of the Museum of Jewish Heritage from 2000 to 2019. He previously worked at the U.S. Department of Justice's Office of Special Investigations pursuing Nazi war criminals.

person-joaquin-duato-jnj.name: Joaquin Duato
person-joaquin-duato-jnj.bio: Became CEO of Johnson & Johnson in 2022 after over 30 years with the company. Oversaw the split of the consumer health division.

person-alex-gorsky-jnj.name: Alex Gorsky
person-alex-gorsky-jnj.bio: Led Johnson & Johnson as CEO from 2012 to 2022, guiding the company through significant growth and the development of its COVID-19 vaccine.

person-paul-stoffels-jnj.name: Paul Stoffels
person-paul-stoffels-jnj.bio: Served as J&J's Chief Scientific Officer and Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee, driving pharmaceutical innovation including the Janssen COVID vaccine.

affiliations.role: Former Vice Chairman & Chief Scientific Officer

person-jennifer-taubert-jnj.name: Jennifer Taubert
person-jennifer-taubert-jnj.bio: Executive Vice President and Worldwide Chairman of Johnson & Johnson's pharmaceutical business, one of the largest pharma divisions globally.

person-michael-bloomberg-bp.name: Michael Bloomberg
person-michael-bloomberg-bp.bio: Billionaire businessman and former Mayor of New York City who has donated over $17 billion to philanthropic causes through Bloomberg Philanthropies.

person-patricia-harris-bp.name: Patricia Harris
person-patricia-harris-bp.bio: CEO of Bloomberg Philanthropies, overseeing all of the organization's charitable initiatives spanning public health, environment, education, and the arts.

person-james-anderson-bp.name: James Anderson
person-james-anderson-bp.bio: Leads Bloomberg Philanthropies' Government Innovation programs including What Works Cities and the American Cities Climate Challenge.

person-jon-ballis.name: Jon A. Ballis
person-jon-ballis.bio: Jon A. Ballis has served as chairman of Kirkland & Ellis, one of the world's largest and most profitable law firms. Under his leadership, the firm reached the top of global law firm revenue rankings.

person-jeffrey-hammes.name: Jeffrey C. Hammes
person-jeffrey-hammes.bio: Jeffrey C. Hammes served as chairman of Kirkland & Ellis from 2010 to 2020, presiding over a period of dramatic growth. He transformed the firm into the highest-revenue law firm globally through its dominance in private equity work.

person-jack-levin.name: Jack S. Levin
person-jack-levin.bio: Jack S. Levin was a legendary Kirkland & Ellis partner widely regarded as a pioneer of modern private equity law. He authored the seminal treatise on structuring venture capital and private equity transactions used across the industry.

person-henrietta-szold.name: Henrietta Szold
person-henrietta-szold.bio: Henrietta Szold founded Hadassah, the Women's Zionist Organization of America, in 1912, which publishes Hadassah Magazine. She was a pioneering Jewish American leader who established major health and social services in pre-state Israel.

person-alan-tigay.name: Alan M. Tigay
person-alan-tigay.bio: Alan M. Tigay served as executive editor of Hadassah Magazine for over two decades, shaping it into one of the largest-circulation Jewish publications in America. Under his leadership the magazine won numerous journalism awards.

person-lisa-hostein.name: Lisa Hostein
person-lisa-hostein.bio: Lisa Hostein served as executive editor of Hadassah Magazine, overseeing the publication's editorial content and digital expansion. She guided the magazine's coverage of Jewish life, Israel, health, and culture.

person-ira-forman.name: Ira N. Forman
person-ira-forman.bio: Ira N. Forman served as executive director of the National Jewish Democratic Council from 1996 to 2013. He later served as the U.S. State Department's Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Anti-Semitism under President Obama.

person-marc-stanley.name: Marc Stanley
person-marc-stanley.bio: Marc Stanley served as national chairman of the National Jewish Democratic Council. A Dallas-based attorney, he later served as U.S. Ambassador to Argentina under President Biden.

person-greg-rosenbaum.name: Greg Rosenbaum
person-greg-rosenbaum.bio: Greg Rosenbaum served as chairman of the National Jewish Democratic Council. He is a business executive and Democratic Party activist involved in Jewish political advocacy for decades.

person-h-rodgin-cohen.name: H. Rodgin Cohen
person-h-rodgin-cohen.bio: H. Rodgin Cohen is senior chairman of Sullivan & Cromwell and is widely considered the leading banking lawyer in the United States. He has advised on virtually every major U.S. bank merger and financial crisis intervention for over four decades.

person-joseph-shenker.name: Joseph C. Shenker
person-joseph-shenker.bio: Joseph C. Shenker has served as chairman of Sullivan & Cromwell. He is a leading corporate lawyer specializing in major mergers, acquisitions, and capital markets transactions.

person-robert-giuffra.name: Robert J. Giuffra Jr.
person-robert-giuffra.bio: Robert J. Giuffra Jr. is a senior partner at Sullivan & Cromwell and co-head of the firm's litigation group. He is one of the most prominent corporate trial lawyers in the United States.

person-jed-margolis.name: Jed Margolis
person-jed-margolis.bio: Jed Margolis served as executive director of Maccabi USA, the organization that selects and sends American athletes to the Maccabiah Games in Israel. He oversaw delegation operations and athlete development programs.

person-ron-carner.name: Ron Carner
person-ron-carner.bio: Ron Carner served as president of Maccabi USA and was instrumental in growing American participation in the Maccabiah Games. He helped develop junior programs to nurture young Jewish athletes.

person-marshall-einhorn.name: Marshall Einhorn
person-marshall-einhorn.bio: Marshall Einhorn served as chairman of Maccabi USA, helping lead the organization that represents Jewish American athletes internationally. He was active in building partnerships to support U.S. delegations to the Maccabiah Games.

person-george-soros.name: George Soros
person-george-soros.bio: George Soros founded Soros Fund Management in 1969, which became one of the most successful hedge funds in history. A Hungarian-born investor and philanthropist, he is known for his currency trades and his Open Society Foundations.

person-dawn-fitzpatrick.name: Dawn Fitzpatrick
person-dawn-fitzpatrick.bio: Dawn Fitzpatrick has served as chief investment officer of Soros Fund Management since 2017. She previously spent over 25 years at UBS, where she was head of the O'Connor division.

person-robert-soros.name: Robert Soros
person-robert-soros.bio: Robert Soros served as deputy chairman and president of Soros Fund Management. The eldest son of George Soros, he played a key role in the firm's investment strategy before pursuing independent ventures.

person-jonathan-soros-sfm.name: Jonathan Soros
person-jonathan-soros-sfm.bio: Jonathan Soros is a son of George Soros who held senior roles at Soros Fund Management. He later became an advocate for campaign finance reform and co-founded Friends of Democracy.

person-david-zaslav.name: David Zaslav
person-david-zaslav.bio: David Zaslav is president and CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery, formed through the 2022 merger of WarnerMedia and Discovery, Inc. He previously led Discovery Communications for over a decade, growing it into a global media company.

person-jeff-zucker.name: Jeff Zucker
person-jeff-zucker.bio: Jeff Zucker served as chairman of WarnerMedia News and Sports and president of CNN Worldwide until 2022. He previously served as president and CEO of NBCUniversal.

affiliations.role: Former Chairman of WarnerMedia News & Sports

person-gunnar-wiedenfels.name: Gunnar Wiedenfels
person-gunnar-wiedenfels.bio: Gunnar Wiedenfels serves as chief financial officer of Warner Bros. Discovery. He previously served as CFO of Discovery Communications and ProSiebenSat.1 Media in Germany.

person-richard-gonzalez-abbv.name: Richard Gonzalez
person-richard-gonzalez-abbv.bio: Served as founding Chairman and CEO of AbbVie when it was spun off from Abbott Laboratories in 2013. Led the company's growth driven by blockbuster drug Humira.

person-robert-michael-abbv.name: Robert Michael
person-robert-michael-abbv.bio: Became CEO of AbbVie in 2024, overseeing the company's transition beyond Humira and growth of its immunology, oncology, and neuroscience pipeline.

person-laura-schumacher-abbv.name: Laura Schumacher
person-laura-schumacher-abbv.bio: Served as Vice Chairman, External Affairs and Chief Legal Officer at AbbVie, one of the highest-ranking women in the pharmaceutical industry.

person-calvin-klein-ck.name: Calvin Klein
person-calvin-klein-ck.bio: Founded his eponymous fashion house in 1968, becoming renowned for minimalist design and provocative advertising. Sold the brand to PVH Corp in 2003.

person-barry-schwartz-ck.name: Barry Schwartz
person-barry-schwartz-ck.bio: Childhood friend of Calvin Klein who co-founded the company and served as Chairman and CEO, managing the business side of the brand for decades.

person-manny-chirico-ck.name: Emanuel 'Manny' Chirico
person-manny-chirico-ck.bio: Served as CEO of PVH Corp (parent company of Calvin Klein) from 2006 to 2021, overseeing the acquisition and global expansion of the Calvin Klein brand.

person-marc-jacobs-mj.name: Marc Jacobs
person-marc-jacobs-mj.bio: Founded his namesake label and served as creative director of Louis Vuitton from 1997 to 2014. One of the most influential American fashion designers of his generation.

person-robert-duffy-mj.name: Robert Duffy
person-robert-duffy-mj.bio: Business partner and co-founder of Marc Jacobs International who managed the business operations of the brand for over two decades.

person-sebastian-suhl-mj.name: Sebastian Suhl
person-sebastian-suhl-mj.bio: Served as CEO of Marc Jacobs International, overseeing the brand's commercial operations and global expansion under LVMH ownership.

person-bernard-revel.name: Bernard Revel
person-bernard-revel.bio: Rabbi Dr. Bernard Revel was the founding president of Yeshiva University, transforming the Rabbi Isaac Elchanan Theological Seminary into a modern university. He pioneered the synthesis of Torah study and secular academic education.

person-norman-lamm.name: Norman Lamm
person-norman-lamm.bio: Rabbi Dr. Norman Lamm served as president of Yeshiva University from 1976 to 2003 and then as chancellor. A renowned Jewish philosopher, he championed Torah Umadda and authored numerous works on Jewish law and thought.

person-richard-joel.name: Richard Joel
person-richard-joel.bio: Richard Joel served as president of Yeshiva University from 2003 to 2017. He previously served as international director of Hillel, where he transformed the organization into a major force on college campuses.

person-ari-berman.name: Ari Berman
person-ari-berman.bio: Rabbi Dr. Ari Berman became the fifth president of Yeshiva University in 2017. He has focused on positioning YU as a leading values-based research university with global reach.

person-bruce-nordstrom-jwn.name: Bruce Nordstrom
person-bruce-nordstrom-jwn.bio: Third-generation member of the Nordstrom family who served as Chairman and helped expand the department store chain nationally.

person-erik-nordstrom-jwn.name: Erik Nordstrom
person-erik-nordstrom-jwn.bio: Fourth-generation family member serving as CEO of Nordstrom. Has led the company's digital transformation and omnichannel retail strategy.

person-pete-nordstrom-jwn.name: Pete Nordstrom
person-pete-nordstrom-jwn.bio: Fourth-generation family member serving as President and Chief Brand Officer, overseeing Nordstrom's merchandising and brand strategy.

person-john-nordstrom-jwn.name: John W. Nordstrom
person-john-nordstrom-jwn.bio: Swedish immigrant who founded the original Nordstrom shoe store in Seattle in 1901 using gold rush earnings, building the foundation for the retail empire.

person-benjamin-frankel.name: Benjamin Frankel
person-benjamin-frankel.bio: Rabbi Benjamin Frankel founded the first Hillel chapter at the University of Illinois in 1923 to serve Jewish students on campus. His vision grew into the largest Jewish campus organization in the world.

person-eric-fingerhut.name: Eric Fingerhut
person-eric-fingerhut.bio: Eric Fingerhut served as president and CEO of Hillel International from 2013 to 2019. He previously served as a U.S. Congressman from Ohio and later became president of the Jewish Federations of North America.

person-adam-lehman.name: Adam Lehman
person-adam-lehman.bio: Adam Lehman became president and CEO of Hillel International in 2019. He has focused on expanding Jewish student engagement and strengthening Hillel's presence on campuses worldwide.

person-richard-joel-hillel.name: Richard Joel
person-richard-joel-hillel.bio: Richard Joel served as international director of Hillel from 1989 to 2003, transforming it from a sleepy campus organization into a dynamic presence at over 500 colleges. He later became president of Yeshiva University.

person-james-mckinsey.name: James O. McKinsey
person-james-mckinsey.bio: James O. McKinsey founded the consulting firm bearing his name in 1926 in Chicago. A University of Chicago professor, he pioneered the concept of management consulting as a professional discipline.

person-marvin-bower.name: Marvin Bower
person-marvin-bower.bio: Marvin Bower served as managing director of McKinsey & Company from 1950 to 1967 and is considered the firm's most influential leader. He established McKinsey's professional standards and values-based culture that defined modern management consulting.

person-bob-sternfels.name: Bob Sternfels
person-bob-sternfels.bio: Bob Sternfels became global managing partner of McKinsey & Company in 2021. He previously led the firm's operations in the western United States and its work in petroleum and other industries.

person-dominic-barton.name: Dominic Barton
person-dominic-barton.bio: Dominic Barton served as global managing partner of McKinsey & Company from 2009 to 2018, leading the firm through significant growth. He later served as Canada's Ambassador to China from 2019 to 2021.

person-bob-pittman.name: Bob Pittman
person-bob-pittman.bio: Bob Pittman serves as chairman and CEO of iHeartMedia, the largest radio broadcaster in the United States. He is also known as co-founder of MTV and has held senior leadership roles at AOL and other major media companies.

person-rich-bressler.name: Rich Bressler
person-rich-bressler.bio: Rich Bressler serves as president, chief operating officer, and chief financial officer of iHeartMedia. He previously held senior executive positions at Time Warner and other media companies.

person-lowry-mays.name: Lowry Mays
person-lowry-mays.bio: Lowry Mays co-founded Clear Channel Communications in 1972, which eventually became iHeartMedia after a series of mergers and rebrandings. He built it from a single San Antonio radio station into the largest radio company in America.

person-howard-schultz-sbux.name: Howard Schultz
person-howard-schultz-sbux.bio: Joined Starbucks in 1982 and served as CEO across three stints, transforming a small Seattle coffee chain into a global brand with over 35,000 stores worldwide.

person-jerry-baldwin-sbux.name: Jerry Baldwin
person-jerry-baldwin-sbux.bio: Co-founded Starbucks in 1971 in Seattle's Pike Place Market alongside Zev Siegl and Gordon Bowker, originally as a roasted coffee bean retailer.

person-zev-siegl-sbux.name: Zev Siegl
person-zev-siegl-sbux.bio: Co-founded Starbucks in 1971 and served as the first manager of the original Pike Place store before departing in 1980.

person-kevin-johnson-sbux.name: Kevin Johnson
person-kevin-johnson-sbux.bio: Served as Starbucks CEO from 2017 to 2022, leading the company through the COVID-19 pandemic and expansion of its digital ordering capabilities.

person-gary-hirshberg-stony.name: Gary Hirshberg
person-gary-hirshberg-stony.bio: Co-founded Stonyfield Farm in 1983 and served as CEO for nearly three decades, building it into the world's leading organic yogurt brand and a pioneer in sustainable business.

person-samuel-kaymen-stony.name: Samuel Kaymen
person-samuel-kaymen-stony.bio: Co-founded Stonyfield Farm with Gary Hirshberg at the Rural Education Center in Wilton, New Hampshire. An organic farming pioneer and educator.

person-esteve-torrens-stony.name: Esteve Torrens
person-esteve-torrens-stony.bio: Served as CEO of Stonyfield Farm after Gary Hirshberg, overseeing the brand under Lactalis ownership while maintaining its organic and mission-driven identity.

person-cyrus-adler.name: Cyrus Adler
person-cyrus-adler.bio: Cyrus Adler was a founding member and later president of the American Jewish Historical Society, established in 1892. He was also president of the Jewish Theological Seminary and a towering figure in American Jewish institutional life.

person-jonathan-sarna.name: Jonathan D. Sarna
person-jonathan-sarna.bio: Jonathan D. Sarna is a preeminent American Jewish historian who has served as chief historian and academic advisor to the American Jewish Historical Society. He is the Joseph H. and Belle R. Braun Professor of American Jewish History at Brandeis University.

person-oscar-straus.name: Oscar S. Straus
person-oscar-straus.bio: Oscar S. Straus was an early leader and supporter of the American Jewish Historical Society. He served as the first Jewish U.S. Cabinet member as Secretary of Commerce and Labor under President Theodore Roosevelt.

person-clifford-may.name: Clifford D. May
person-clifford-may.bio: Clifford D. May is the founder and president of the Foundation for Defense of Democracies, established shortly after the September 11 attacks in 2001. He is a former journalist and communications director for the Republican National Committee.

person-mark-dubowitz.name: Mark Dubowitz
person-mark-dubowitz.bio: Mark Dubowitz serves as chief executive of the Foundation for Defense of Democracies and is considered an architect of U.S. sanctions policy against Iran. He has advised multiple administrations on economic pressure campaigns.

person-jonathan-schanzer.name: Jonathan Schanzer
person-jonathan-schanzer.bio: Jonathan Schanzer serves as senior vice president for research at the Foundation for Defense of Democracies. He is a former terrorism finance analyst at the U.S. Department of the Treasury.

person-reuel-marc-gerecht.name: Reuel Marc Gerecht
person-reuel-marc-gerecht.bio: Reuel Marc Gerecht is a senior fellow at the Foundation for Defense of Democracies specializing in the Middle East and intelligence. He is a former CIA case officer in the Directorate of Operations.

person-mitt-romney.name: Mitt Romney
person-mitt-romney.bio: Mitt Romney co-founded Bain Capital in 1984, building it into one of the world's leading private investment firms. He later served as Governor of Massachusetts and as a U.S. Senator from Utah.

person-joshua-bekenstein.name: Joshua Bekenstein
person-joshua-bekenstein.bio: Joshua Bekenstein is co-chairman of Bain Capital and one of its earliest employees, joining in 1984. He has been instrumental in building the firm's private equity business into a global powerhouse.

person-jonathan-lavine.name: Jonathan Lavine
person-jonathan-lavine.bio: Jonathan Lavine serves as co-managing partner of Bain Capital. He also serves as chairman of the board of trustees of Columbia University and is a major philanthropist.

person-stephen-pagliuca.name: Stephen Pagliuca
person-stephen-pagliuca.bio: Stephen Pagliuca serves as co-chairman of Bain Capital and is a co-owner of the Boston Celtics NBA franchise. He has been with Bain Capital since 1989 and helped build its global investment platform.

person-ali-ghodsi.name: Ali Ghodsi
person-ali-ghodsi.bio: Ali Ghodsi is co-founder and CEO of Databricks, which he helped create out of the AMPLab at UC Berkeley in 2013. He has led the company's growth into one of the most valuable private technology companies in the world.

person-ion-stoica.name: Ion Stoica
person-ion-stoica.bio: Ion Stoica is co-founder and executive chairman of Databricks and a professor of computer science at UC Berkeley. He is also co-founder of Anyscale and has made foundational contributions to distributed systems research.

person-matei-zaharia.name: Matei Zaharia
person-matei-zaharia.bio: Matei Zaharia is the original creator of Apache Spark and co-founder and chief technologist of Databricks. He is a professor of computer science at UC Berkeley and has received numerous awards for his contributions to big data.

person-reynold-xin.name: Reynold Xin
person-reynold-xin.bio: Reynold Xin is a co-founder of Databricks who helped develop the company from UC Berkeley's AMPLab research. He played a key role in the development of Apache Spark and Databricks' lakehouse platform architecture.

person-claudia-gould.name: Claudia Gould
person-claudia-gould.bio: Claudia Gould served as the Helen Goldsmith Menschel Director of The Jewish Museum from 2010 to 2023. She previously served as director of the Institute of Contemporary Art in Philadelphia.

person-joan-rosenbaum.name: Joan Rosenbaum
person-joan-rosenbaum.bio: Joan Rosenbaum served as director of The Jewish Museum in New York from 1981 to 2010, one of the longest tenures in the museum's history. She transformed it into an internationally recognized institution for art and Jewish culture.

person-karl-katz.name: Karl Katz
person-karl-katz.bio: Karl Katz served as director of The Jewish Museum during a formative period of the institution's development. He later joined the Metropolitan Museum of Art as a special projects director.

person-jim-robo-nee.name: James Robo
person-jim-robo-nee.bio: Served as Chairman, President and CEO of NextEra Energy from 2012 to 2022, growing it into the world's largest generator of renewable energy from wind and sun.

person-john-ketchum-nee.name: John Ketchum
person-john-ketchum-nee.bio: Became CEO of NextEra Energy in 2022, continuing the company's leadership in renewable energy development and clean energy infrastructure.

person-rebecca-kujawa-nee.name: Rebecca Kujawa
person-rebecca-kujawa-nee.bio: President and CEO of NextEra Energy Resources, the world's largest generator of renewable energy from wind and solar, and a leader in battery storage.

affiliations.role: President & CEO of NextEra Energy Resources

person-jeremy-ben-ami.name: Jeremy Ben-Ami
person-jeremy-ben-ami.bio: Jeremy Ben-Ami founded J Street in 2007 as a pro-Israel, pro-peace lobbying organization and political action committee. He previously served as a policy advisor in the Clinton White House and in various political campaigns.

person-daniel-levy-jstreet.name: Daniel Levy
person-daniel-levy-jstreet.bio: Daniel Levy was involved in the founding of J Street and is president of the U.S./Middle East Project. He previously served as an advisor in the Israeli Prime Minister's Office and participated in Israeli-Palestinian peace negotiations.

person-alan-elsner.name: Alan Elsner
person-alan-elsner.bio: Alan Elsner served as vice president of communications at J Street. He is a former Reuters journalist and author who helped shape J Street's public messaging and media strategy.

person-jennifer-laszlo-mizrahi.name: Jennifer Laszlo Mizrahi
person-jennifer-laszlo-mizrahi.bio: Jennifer Laszlo Mizrahi founded The Israel Project in 2003 to provide factual information about Israel to the media and public. She is a communications strategist and disability rights advocate who also founded RespectAbility.

person-josh-block.name: Josh Block
person-josh-block.bio: Josh Block served as president and CEO of The Israel Project from 2012 until its closure in 2019. He previously served as a spokesman for the American Israel Public Affairs Committee (AIPAC).

person-marcus-sheff-tip.name: Marcus Sheff
person-marcus-sheff-tip.bio: Marcus Sheff served in a senior role at The Israel Project before becoming CEO of IMPACT-se, which monitors education standards worldwide. He is a former journalist who has worked across Israeli media and advocacy organizations.

person-penny-pritzker.name: Penny Pritzker
person-penny-pritzker.bio: Penny Pritzker chairs the Pritzker Foundation and is a billionaire businesswoman and civic leader. She served as U.S. Secretary of Commerce under President Obama from 2013 to 2017.

person-thomas-pritzker.name: Thomas J. Pritzker
person-thomas-pritzker.bio: Thomas J. Pritzker is executive chairman of Hyatt Hotels Corporation and a leader of the Pritzker family's philanthropic efforts. He oversees the family's wide-ranging charitable activities in education, medicine, and the arts.

person-jb-pritzker.name: J.B. Pritzker
person-jb-pritzker.bio: J.B. Pritzker is a member of the Pritzker family philanthropic dynasty and has served as Governor of Illinois since 2019. He is a businessman and venture capitalist who co-founded the Pritzker Group.

person-donna-karan-dk.name: Donna Karan
person-donna-karan-dk.bio: Founded Donna Karan International in 1984 and launched the DKNY line in 1989. Known for creating the 'Seven Easy Pieces' wardrobe concept for modern women.

person-stephan-weiss-dk.name: Stephan Weiss
person-stephan-weiss-dk.bio: Co-founded Donna Karan International with his wife Donna Karan and served as CEO and sculptor. Passed away in 2001.

person-caroline-brown-dk.name: Caroline Brown
person-caroline-brown-dk.bio: Served as CEO of Donna Karan International under LVMH ownership, managing the brand's global operations and retail strategy.

affiliations.role: Former CEO of Donna Karan International

person-jerry-speyer.name: Jerry Speyer
person-jerry-speyer.bio: Jerry Speyer co-founded Tishman Speyer and served as chairman and CEO, building it into one of the world's premier real estate firms. The firm owns and operates landmark properties including Rockefeller Center and the Chrysler Building.

person-rob-speyer.name: Rob Speyer
person-rob-speyer.bio: Rob Speyer serves as president and CEO of Tishman Speyer, succeeding his father Jerry Speyer. He has led the firm's global expansion and major development projects around the world.

person-robert-tishman.name: Robert V. Tishman
person-robert-tishman.bio: Robert V. Tishman co-founded Tishman Speyer with Jerry Speyer, merging the Tishman family's historic real estate legacy with a new global platform. The Tishman family had been prominent in New York real estate since the early 20th century.

person-charif-souki-che.name: Charif Souki
person-charif-souki-che.bio: Lebanese-born co-founder of Cheniere Energy who led the development of the first large-scale LNG export facility in the contiguous United States at Sabine Pass.

person-jack-fusco-che.name: Jack Fusco
person-jack-fusco-che.bio: Serves as President and CEO of Cheniere Energy, overseeing operations of the largest natural gas liquefaction and LNG export company in the United States.

person-anatol-feygin-che.name: Anatol Feygin
person-anatol-feygin-che.bio: Executive Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer of Cheniere Energy, managing the company's global LNG marketing and commercial strategy.

person-adolph-zukor.name: Adolph Zukor
person-adolph-zukor.bio: Hungarian-Jewish immigrant who founded Paramount Pictures in 1912 and led the studio for decades.

person-jesse-lasky.name: Jesse L. Lasky
person-jesse-lasky.bio: Co-founded the Jesse L. Lasky Feature Play Company which merged to form Paramount Pictures.

person-barney-balaban.name: Barney Balaban
person-barney-balaban.bio: Served as president of Paramount Pictures from 1936 to 1964, overseeing the studio during its golden era.

person-bp-schulberg.name: B.P. Schulberg
person-bp-schulberg.bio: Led Paramount's West Coast production operations during the late 1920s and early 1930s.

person-emanuel-cohen.name: Emanuel Cohen
person-emanuel-cohen.bio: Served as head of production at Paramount in the 1930s, overseeing numerous classic films.

person-laurence-tisch.name: Laurence Tisch
person-laurence-tisch.bio: Co-built the Loews Corporation conglomerate with his brother and later served as CEO of CBS.

person-preston-robert-tisch.name: Preston Robert Tisch
person-preston-robert-tisch.bio: Co-built Loews Corporation with his brother Laurence and served as U.S. Postmaster General.

person-james-tisch.name: James S. Tisch
person-james-tisch.bio: Son of Laurence Tisch who has led Loews Corporation as president and CEO.

person-andrew-tisch.name: Andrew H. Tisch
person-andrew-tisch.bio: Son of Preston Robert Tisch who serves in senior leadership at Loews Corporation.

person-jonathan-tisch.name: Jonathan M. Tisch
person-jonathan-tisch.bio: Son of Preston Robert Tisch who also serves as chairman of Loews Hotels and Resorts.

person-irving-kristol.name: Irving Kristol
person-irving-kristol.bio: Influential neoconservative intellectual known as the godfather of neoconservatism and a longtime AEI senior fellow.

person-norman-ornstein.name: Norman Ornstein
person-norman-ornstein.bio: Political scientist and longtime AEI resident scholar known for his work on Congress and American governance.

person-paul-wolfowitz.name: Paul Wolfowitz
person-paul-wolfowitz.bio: Former Deputy Secretary of Defense and World Bank president who served as a visiting scholar at AEI.

person-michael-rubin.name: Michael Rubin
person-michael-rubin.bio: Middle East policy expert and resident scholar at AEI specializing in Iran, Turkey, and Kurdish issues.

person-leon-kass.name: Leon Kass
person-leon-kass.bio: Physician and bioethicist who served as chairman of the President's Council on Bioethics and as a fellow at AEI.

person-carl-laemmle.name: Carl Laemmle
person-carl-laemmle.bio: German-Jewish immigrant who founded Universal Pictures in 1912, one of Hollywood's oldest major studios.

person-carl-laemmle-jr.name: Carl Laemmle Jr.
person-carl-laemmle-jr.bio: Son of the founder who ran Universal's production operations and greenlit iconic horror films of the 1930s.

person-irving-thalberg.name: Irving Thalberg
person-irving-thalberg.bio: Legendary Hollywood producer who began his career as studio manager at Universal before moving to MGM.

person-lew-wasserman.name: Lew Wasserman
person-lew-wasserman.bio: Transformative entertainment mogul who led MCA-Universal for decades and shaped the modern entertainment industry.

person-sidney-sheinberg.name: Sidney Sheinberg
person-sidney-sheinberg.bio: Longtime president of MCA Inc. who discovered Steven Spielberg and oversaw Universal's operations for years.

person-leslie-wexner.name: Leslie Wexner
person-leslie-wexner.bio: Billionaire founder of L Brands who established the Wexner Foundation to develop Jewish professional and volunteer leaders.

person-abigail-wexner.name: Abigail Wexner
person-abigail-wexner.bio: Attorney and philanthropist who co-leads the Wexner Foundation with her husband Leslie.

person-herbert-friedman.name: Rabbi Herbert A. Friedman
person-herbert-friedman.bio: Rabbi and former leader of the UJA who served as the founding president of the Wexner Heritage Foundation.

person-jay-kaiman.name: Jay Kaiman
person-jay-kaiman.bio: Longtime president of the Wexner Foundation overseeing its leadership development programs for the Jewish community.

person-stephen-feinberg.name: Stephen Feinberg
person-stephen-feinberg.bio: Billionaire investor who co-founded Cerberus Capital Management and built it into a leading private equity firm.

person-mark-neporent.name: Mark Neporent
person-mark-neporent.bio: Co-founder and chief operating officer of Cerberus Capital Management since its inception in 1992.

person-lenard-tessler.name: Lenard Tessler
person-lenard-tessler.bio: Senior executive at Cerberus Capital Management who oversees portfolio company operations as vice chairman.

person-lee-millstein.name: Lee Millstein
person-lee-millstein.bio: Senior managing director at Cerberus responsible for key investment strategy and portfolio decisions.

person-philippe-krakowsky.name: Philippe Krakowsky
person-philippe-krakowsky.bio: Chief executive officer of Interpublic Group who previously led the company's digital and strategy operations.

person-michael-roth.name: Michael Roth
person-michael-roth.bio: Led Interpublic Group as chairman and CEO from 2005 to 2021, revitalizing the advertising conglomerate.

person-donny-deutsch.name: Donny Deutsch
person-donny-deutsch.bio: Advertising executive and television personality who led Deutsch Inc, a major IPG-owned agency.

person-david-deutsch.name: David Deutsch
person-david-deutsch.bio: Founded Deutsch Inc in 1969, which grew into one of the largest U.S. advertising agencies and joined IPG.

person-jon-feltheimer.name: Jon Feltheimer
person-jon-feltheimer.bio: Chief executive officer who has led Lionsgate Entertainment since 2000 and built it into a major film and TV studio.

person-michael-burns.name: Michael Burns
person-michael-burns.bio: Longtime vice chairman of Lionsgate Entertainment who helped shape the company's strategic growth.

person-rob-friedman.name: Rob Friedman
person-rob-friedman.bio: Veteran film executive who co-led Lionsgate's motion picture division and oversaw major franchise releases.

affiliations.role: Former Co-Chairman, Lionsgate Motion Picture Group

person-avi-arad.name: Avi Arad
person-avi-arad.bio: Israeli-American producer known for launching Marvel's film franchise who has produced films distributed by Lionsgate.

person-patrick-wachsberger.name: Patrick Wachsberger
person-patrick-wachsberger.bio: Film executive who co-led Lionsgate's motion picture group and oversaw the Hunger Games and Twilight franchises.

affiliations.role: Former Co-Chairman, Lionsgate Motion Picture Group

person-bob-iger.name: Bob Iger
person-bob-iger.bio: Longtime Disney CEO who oversaw the acquisitions of Pixar, Marvel, Lucasfilm, and 21st Century Fox.

person-michael-eisner.name: Michael Eisner
person-michael-eisner.bio: Led The Walt Disney Company from 1984 to 2005, revitalizing the studio and expanding its theme park empire.

person-jeffrey-katzenberg.name: Jeffrey Katzenberg
person-jeffrey-katzenberg.bio: Led Disney's film division during its animation renaissance of the late 1980s and early 1990s.

affiliations.role: Former Chairman of Walt Disney Studios

person-alan-horn.name: Alan Horn
person-alan-horn.bio: Veteran film executive who served as chairman of Walt Disney Studios Content, overseeing record-breaking releases.

affiliations.role: Former Chairman of Walt Disney Studios

person-alan-braverman.name: Alan Braverman
person-alan-braverman.bio: Served as senior executive vice president and general counsel of The Walt Disney Company for over a decade.

person-mark-hetfield.name: Mark Hetfield
person-mark-hetfield.bio: Leads HIAS as president and CEO, guiding its mission to protect and assist refugees and displaced persons worldwide.

person-dianne-lob.name: Dianne Lob
person-dianne-lob.bio: Chair of the HIAS board of directors overseeing the organization's global refugee assistance programs.

person-leonard-glickman.name: Leonard Glickman
person-leonard-glickman.bio: Led HIAS through a period of transformation as the agency expanded its mission to refugees of all backgrounds.

person-gideon-aronoff.name: Gideon Aronoff
person-gideon-aronoff.bio: Served as HIAS president and CEO, advocating for refugee protection and comprehensive immigration reform.

person-marc-lasry.name: Marc Lasry
person-marc-lasry.bio: Moroccan-born Jewish-American billionaire and Avenue Capital founder who co-owned the Milwaukee Bucks.

person-wes-edens.name: Wes Edens
person-wes-edens.bio: Co-founder of Fortress Investment Group who co-purchased the Milwaukee Bucks in 2014.

person-jamie-dinan.name: Jamie Dinan
person-jamie-dinan.bio: Hedge fund manager and founder of York Capital Management who is a co-owner of the Milwaukee Bucks.

person-mike-fascitelli.name: Mike Fascitelli
person-mike-fascitelli.bio: Real estate executive and former Vornado Realty Trust CEO who joined the Milwaukee Bucks ownership group.

person-joseph-durst.name: Joseph Durst
person-joseph-durst.bio: Jewish immigrant from Austria-Hungary who founded the Durst Organization in New York City in 1915.

person-seymour-durst.name: Seymour Durst
person-seymour-durst.bio: Second-generation leader of the Durst Organization who expanded its Manhattan real estate holdings.

person-douglas-durst.name: Douglas Durst
person-douglas-durst.bio: Third-generation leader who chairs the Durst Organization and is a pioneer of green building development in New York.

person-jody-durst.name: Jody Durst
person-jody-durst.bio: Serves as president of the Durst Organization overseeing its portfolio of New York City commercial properties.

person-jonathan-durst.name: Jonathan Durst
person-jonathan-durst.bio: Third-generation family member active in the leadership and operations of the Durst Organization.

person-alfred-knopf-sr.name: Alfred A. Knopf Sr.
person-alfred-knopf-sr.bio: Founded the Alfred A. Knopf publishing house in 1915, renowned for literary excellence and the Borzoi imprint.

person-blanche-knopf.name: Blanche Knopf
person-blanche-knopf.bio: Co-founded Alfred A. Knopf with her husband and served as president, championing major European and American authors.

person-robert-gottlieb.name: Robert Gottlieb
person-robert-gottlieb.bio: Acclaimed literary editor who led Alfred A. Knopf before becoming editor of The New Yorker.

person-alfred-knopf-jr.name: Alfred A. Knopf Jr.
person-alfred-knopf-jr.bio: Son of the founders who worked in the family publishing business and later co-founded Atheneum Publishers.

person-stewart-butterfield-slack.name: Stewart Butterfield
person-stewart-butterfield-slack.bio: Co-founded Slack Technologies and served as CEO until its $27.7 billion acquisition by Salesforce in 2021. Previously co-founded Flickr.

person-cal-henderson-slack.name: Cal Henderson
person-cal-henderson-slack.bio: Co-founded Slack and served as Chief Technology Officer, designing and building the messaging platform's core architecture.

person-eric-costello-slack.name: Eric Costello
person-eric-costello-slack.bio: Co-founded Slack Technologies and contributed to the platform's development. Previously worked with Stewart Butterfield at Flickr.

person-serguei-mourachov-slack.name: Serguei Mourachov
person-serguei-mourachov-slack.bio: Co-founded Slack Technologies alongside Stewart Butterfield, Cal Henderson, and Eric Costello. Part of the original team at Tiny Speck.

person-travis-kalanick-uber.name: Travis Kalanick
person-travis-kalanick-uber.bio: Co-founded Uber in 2009 and served as CEO until 2017, growing it into one of the most valuable startups in history before a series of controversies led to his departure.

person-garrett-camp-uber.name: Garrett Camp
person-garrett-camp-uber.bio: Co-founded Uber alongside Travis Kalanick. A Canadian entrepreneur who previously co-founded StumbleUpon.

person-dara-khosrowshahi-uber.name: Dara Khosrowshahi
person-dara-khosrowshahi-uber.bio: Became CEO of Uber in 2017, leading the company through its IPO and shift toward profitability. Previously CEO of Expedia Group.

person-robert-kindler.name: Robert Kindler
person-robert-kindler.bio: Prominent mergers and acquisitions lawyer who was a leading partner at Davis Polk before joining Morgan Stanley as vice chairman.

person-carey-dunne.name: Carey R. Dunne
person-carey-dunne.bio: Senior partner at Davis Polk and Wardwell who also served as general counsel to the Manhattan District Attorney.

person-karen-seymour.name: Karen Seymour
person-karen-seymour.bio: Former federal prosecutor who became a senior partner at Davis Polk and later served as general counsel of Goldman Sachs.

person-william-fox.name: William Fox
person-william-fox.bio: Hungarian-Jewish immigrant who founded the Fox Film Corporation in 1915, which became 20th Century Fox.

person-joseph-schenck.name: Joseph Schenck
person-joseph-schenck.bio: Russian-Jewish film executive who co-founded 20th Century Pictures, which merged with Fox Film in 1935.

person-marvin-davis.name: Marvin Davis
person-marvin-davis.bio: Jewish-American billionaire oil magnate who purchased 20th Century Fox in 1981 and owned the studio until 1985.

person-peter-chernin.name: Peter Chernin
person-peter-chernin.bio: Media executive who served as chairman and CEO of the Fox Group, overseeing 20th Century Fox's operations.

person-sol-wurtzel.name: Sol Wurtzel
person-sol-wurtzel.bio: Longtime Fox studio production executive who oversaw the B-film production unit for decades.

person-tony-ressler.name: Tony Ressler
person-tony-ressler.bio: Billionaire co-founder of Ares Management who purchased the Atlanta Hawks in 2015.

person-jami-gertz.name: Jami Gertz
person-jami-gertz.bio: Actress and philanthropist who co-owns the Atlanta Hawks with her husband Tony Ressler.

person-michael-gearon-jr.name: Michael Gearon Jr.
person-michael-gearon-jr.bio: Longtime Atlanta Hawks co-owner and member of the ownership group who helped facilitate the Ressler acquisition.

person-grant-hill.name: Grant Hill
person-grant-hill.bio: NBA Hall of Famer and television analyst who is a co-owner of the Atlanta Hawks.

person-rich-lesser.name: Rich Lesser
person-rich-lesser.bio: Served as CEO and then global chair of Boston Consulting Group, leading the firm's strategic direction.

person-bruce-henderson.name: Bruce Henderson
person-bruce-henderson.bio: Founded the Boston Consulting Group in 1963 and pioneered the growth-share matrix as a strategy tool.

person-christoph-schweizer.name: Christoph Schweizer
person-christoph-schweizer.bio: Serves as chief executive officer of BCG, succeeding Rich Lesser in leading the global consulting firm.

person-daniel-katz.name: Daniel Katz
person-daniel-katz.bio: Co-founded A24 in 2012, building it into one of the most critically acclaimed independent film studios.

person-david-fenkel.name: David Fenkel
person-david-fenkel.bio: Co-founded A24 and oversees the studio's development and production of award-winning independent films.

person-john-hodges.name: John Hodges
person-john-hodges.bio: Co-founded A24 and helped establish the company's distinctive brand identity in independent cinema.

person-dov-behr-manischewitz-man.name: Dov Behr Manischewitz
person-dov-behr-manischewitz-man.bio: Rabbi who founded the Manischewitz company in 1888 in Cincinnati, Ohio, mechanizing the production of matzo to make it widely accessible to Jewish communities.

person-alain-bankier-man.name: Alain Bankier
person-alain-bankier-man.bio: Served as CEO of the Manischewitz Company during a period of modernization and brand expansion beyond traditional Passover products.

person-david-sugarman-man.name: David Sugarman
person-david-sugarman-man.bio: Served as President and CEO of R.A.B. Food Group/Manischewitz, overseeing the kosher food company's product line and market positioning.

person-daniel-loeb.name: Daniel Loeb
person-daniel-loeb.bio: Billionaire activist investor who founded Third Point LLC and is known for his shareholder campaigns at major corporations.

person-josh-targoff.name: Josh Targoff
person-josh-targoff.bio: Serves as chief operating officer and general counsel of Third Point LLC, overseeing the firm's legal and operational functions.

person-munib-islam.name: Munib Islam
person-munib-islam.bio: Partner and chief investment officer at Third Point LLC who helps oversee the firm's investment strategy.

person-daniel-pipes.name: Daniel Pipes
person-daniel-pipes.bio: Historian and commentator who founded the Middle East Forum in 1994 to promote American interests in the region.

person-gregg-roman.name: Gregg Roman
person-gregg-roman.bio: Serves as director of the Middle East Forum, overseeing its research, advocacy, and media operations.

person-steven-rosen.name: Steven J. Rosen
person-steven-rosen.bio: Middle East policy analyst and former AIPAC director of foreign policy issues who joined the Middle East Forum as a fellow.

person-efraim-karsh.name: Efraim Karsh
person-efraim-karsh.bio: Israeli-British historian and professor specializing in Middle Eastern history who serves as an MEF senior fellow.

person-ken-griffin.name: Ken Griffin
person-ken-griffin.bio: Billionaire investor who founded Citadel LLC in 1990 and built it into one of the world's largest hedge funds.

person-gerald-beeson.name: Gerald Beeson
person-gerald-beeson.bio: Longtime chief operating officer and chief financial officer of Citadel LLC overseeing firm operations.

person-peng-zhao.name: Peng Zhao
person-peng-zhao.bio: Leads Citadel Securities as CEO, one of the largest market-making firms in the world.

person-herb-abramson.name: Herb Abramson
person-herb-abramson.bio: Jewish-American music executive who co-founded Atlantic Records in 1947 and helped pioneer rhythm and blues recording.

person-jerry-wexler.name: Jerry Wexler
person-jerry-wexler.bio: Legendary Jewish-American record producer who joined Atlantic Records and coined the term rhythm and blues.

person-craig-kallman.name: Craig Kallman
person-craig-kallman.bio: Serves as chairman and CEO of Atlantic Records, overseeing the label's roster of contemporary artists.

person-jason-flom.name: Jason Flom
person-jason-flom.bio: Music industry executive who served as CEO of Atlantic Records and is known for signing numerous multiplatinum artists.

person-dan-gilbert.name: Dan Gilbert
person-dan-gilbert.bio: Jewish-American billionaire founder of Quicken Loans who purchased the Cleveland Cavaliers in 2005.

person-koby-altman.name: Koby Altman
person-koby-altman.bio: Serves as president of basketball operations for the Cleveland Cavaliers, overseeing roster and personnel decisions.

person-len-komoroski.name: Len Komoroski
person-len-komoroski.bio: Served as CEO of the Cleveland Cavaliers and Quicken Loans Arena, overseeing the team's business operations.

person-steven-a-cohen.name: Steven A. Cohen
person-steven-a-cohen.bio: Billionaire investor who founded SAC Capital Advisors in 1992 and later relaunched it as Point72 Asset Management.

person-matthew-grossman.name: Matthew Grossman
person-matthew-grossman.bio: Chief operating officer at Point72 Asset Management overseeing firm operations and business strategy.

person-harry-schwefel.name: Harry Schwefel
person-harry-schwefel.bio: Serves as co-chief investment officer at Point72 Asset Management helping manage the firm's investment portfolio.

person-doug-haynes.name: Doug Haynes
person-doug-haynes.bio: Former president of Point72 Asset Management who helped restructure the firm's operations and compliance.

person-michael-makovsky.name: Michael Makovsky
person-michael-makovsky.bio: Leads JINSA as president and CEO, overseeing its mission to strengthen U.S.-Israel security cooperation.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Institute for National Security of America (JINSA)

person-shoshana-bryen.name: Shoshana Bryen
person-shoshana-bryen.bio: Longtime senior director of JINSA who shaped the organization's policy programs and public outreach for decades.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Institute for National Security of America (JINSA)

person-david-ivry.name: David Ivry
person-david-ivry.bio: Former commander of the Israeli Air Force and Israeli Ambassador to the U.S. who serves on JINSA's advisory board.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Institute for National Security of America (JINSA)

person-robert-immerman.name: Robert Immerman
person-robert-immerman.bio: Oversees JINSA's foreign policy programs focused on U.S. national security and allied defense cooperation.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Institute for National Security of America (JINSA)

person-michael-dell-dell.name: Michael Dell
person-michael-dell-dell.bio: Founded Dell Technologies in his University of Texas dorm room in 1984. Took the company private in 2013 and returned it to public markets in 2018.

person-jeff-clarke-dell.name: Jeff Clarke
person-jeff-clarke-dell.bio: Serves as Vice Chairman and Chief Operating Officer of Dell Technologies, overseeing product development and supply chain operations.

person-tom-sweet-dell.name: Tom Sweet
person-tom-sweet-dell.bio: Chief Financial Officer of Dell Technologies, managing the company's financial strategy and investor relations.

person-roz-rothstein.name: Roz Rothstein
person-roz-rothstein.bio: Co-founded StandWithUs in 2001 and leads the organization's international Israel education and advocacy efforts.

person-jerry-rothstein.name: Jerry Rothstein
person-jerry-rothstein.bio: Co-founded StandWithUs with his wife Roz to combat anti-Israel bias and support pro-Israel advocacy on campuses.

person-michael-dickson.name: Michael Dickson
person-michael-dickson.bio: Leads StandWithUs operations in Israel and coordinates international advocacy campaigns for the organization.

person-reuben-mattus-hd.name: Reuben Mattus
person-reuben-mattus-hd.bio: Polish-Jewish immigrant who co-founded Häagen-Dazs in 1961 in the Bronx, New York. Invented the faux-Scandinavian name to convey an image of old-world craftsmanship.

person-rose-mattus-hd.name: Rose Mattus
person-rose-mattus-hd.bio: Co-founded Häagen-Dazs alongside her husband Reuben Mattus and was instrumental in building the premium ice cream brand before it was sold to Pillsbury in 1983.

person-doris-mattus-hd.name: Doris Mattus Hurley
person-doris-mattus-hd.bio: Daughter of founders Reuben and Rose Mattus who was involved in the family business during Häagen-Dazs's formative years.

person-joseph-proskauer.name: Joseph M. Proskauer
person-joseph-proskauer.bio: Prominent Jewish-American attorney and New York Supreme Court Justice who was the firm's most distinguished partner.

person-allen-fagin.name: Allen Fagin
person-allen-fagin.bio: Longtime Proskauer partner who later became executive vice president of the Orthodox Union.

person-steven-sandler.name: Steven Sandler
person-steven-sandler.bio: Served in senior leadership at Proskauer Rose and helped grow the firm's corporate practice.

person-bettina-plevan.name: Bettina Plevan
person-bettina-plevan.bio: Served as the first female chair of Proskauer Rose and led the firm's labor and employment practice.

person-nathan-handwerker-nathans.name: Nathan Handwerker
person-nathan-handwerker-nathans.bio: Polish-Jewish immigrant who founded Nathan's Famous hot dog stand on Coney Island in 1916, starting with a nickel hot dog recipe from his former employer, Feltman's.

person-wayne-norbitz-nathans.name: Wayne Norbitz
person-wayne-norbitz-nathans.bio: Served as President and COO of Nathan's Famous for many years, managing the company's expansion from a Coney Island institution to a national franchise brand.

person-eric-gatoff-nathans.name: Eric Gatoff
person-eric-gatoff-nathans.bio: Served as CEO of Nathan's Famous Inc., overseeing the company's restaurant operations, branded products, and the iconic Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest.

person-larry-fink-blk.name: Larry Fink
person-larry-fink-blk.bio: Co-founded BlackRock in 1988 and built it into the world's largest asset manager with over $10 trillion in assets under management.

person-robert-kapito-blk.name: Robert Kapito
person-robert-kapito-blk.bio: Co-founded BlackRock alongside Larry Fink and has served as President since the firm's inception.

person-barbara-novick-blk.name: Barbara Novick
person-barbara-novick-blk.bio: One of the eight co-founders of BlackRock and served as Vice Chairman overseeing government relations and public policy.

person-rob-goldstein-blk.name: Rob Goldstein
person-rob-goldstein-blk.bio: Serves as Chief Operating Officer and oversees BlackRock Solutions, the firm's technology and risk analytics platform.

person-albert-bourla-pfz.name: Albert Bourla
person-albert-bourla-pfz.bio: Chairman and CEO of Pfizer who led the company's rapid development and global rollout of the COVID-19 vaccine in partnership with BioNTech.

person-ian-read-pfz.name: Ian Read
person-ian-read-pfz.bio: Served as Pfizer's CEO from 2010 to 2018 and as Chairman until 2019, overseeing major acquisitions and restructuring.

person-sally-susman-pfz.name: Sally Susman
person-sally-susman-pfz.bio: Executive Vice President and Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at Pfizer, responsible for global communications and government relations.

person-mikael-dolsten-pfz.name: Mikael Dolsten
person-mikael-dolsten-pfz.bio: Served as President of Worldwide Research, Development and Medical at Pfizer, leading the company's R&D pipeline for over a decade.

person-mel-greenberg.name: Mel Greenberg
person-mel-greenberg.bio: Co-founded Greenberg Traurig in Miami in 1967, helping build it into one of the largest U.S. law firms.

person-larry-hoffman.name: Larry J. Hoffman
person-larry-hoffman.bio: Co-founded Greenberg Traurig and helped develop the firm's national and international reputation.

person-robert-traurig.name: Robert Traurig
person-robert-traurig.bio: Co-founded Greenberg Traurig and helped establish the firm's presence in South Florida's legal community.

person-richard-rosenbaum.name: Richard Rosenbaum
person-richard-rosenbaum.bio: Serves as executive chairman of Greenberg Traurig overseeing the firm's global operations and strategic direction.

person-hilarie-bass.name: Hilarie Bass
person-hilarie-bass.bio: Former co-president of Greenberg Traurig who also served as president of the American Bar Association.

person-chase-coleman.name: Chase Coleman III
person-chase-coleman.bio: Founded Tiger Global Management in 2001, building it into one of the most successful technology-focused investment firms.

person-scott-shleifer.name: Scott Shleifer
person-scott-shleifer.bio: Leads Tiger Global's private equity business and has directed early investments in major technology companies worldwide.

person-lee-fixel.name: Lee Fixel
person-lee-fixel.bio: Former Tiger Global partner who led the firm's private equity investments in companies like Flipkart and Spotify.

person-john-curtius.name: John Curtius
person-john-curtius.bio: Former Tiger Global partner focused on late-stage technology investments before founding his own firm.

person-steven-roth.name: Steven Roth
person-steven-roth.bio: Jewish-American billionaire who founded Vornado Realty Trust and built it into a major real estate investment trust.

person-michael-fascitelli.name: Michael Fascitelli
person-michael-fascitelli.bio: Former president and CEO of Vornado Realty Trust who oversaw major development projects in New York City.

person-david-greenbaum.name: David Greenbaum

person-haim-chera.name: Haim Chera

person-ofra-strauss-sabra.name: Ofra Strauss

person-ronen-zohar-sabra.name: Ronen Zohar
person-ronen-zohar-sabra.bio: Former CEO of Strauss Group, the Israeli food conglomerate that partnered with PepsiCo's Frito-Lay to create the Sabra Dipping joint venture.

person-shali-shalit-shelach-sabra.name: Shali Shalit Shelach
person-shali-shalit-shelach-sabra.bio: Served as CEO of Sabra Dipping Company, the joint venture between Strauss Group and PepsiCo that dominates the U.S. hummus market.

person-thomas-h-lee.name: Thomas H. Lee
person-thomas-h-lee.bio: Jewish-American financier whose private equity firm was a lead investor in the leveraged buyout of Clear Channel, now iHeartMedia.

person-jimmy-iovine.name: Jimmy Iovine
person-jimmy-iovine.bio: Legendary music producer and executive who co-founded Interscope Records and built it into a dominant label.

person-david-geffen.name: David Geffen

person-doug-morris.name: Doug Morris

person-lucian-grainge.name: Lucian Grainge
person-lucian-grainge.bio: British-Jewish music executive who leads UMG, the parent company of Interscope Geffen A&M Records.

affiliations.role: Chairman and CEO of Universal Music Group

person-steve-tisch.name: Steve Tisch

person-bob-tisch.name: Bob Tisch

person-rick-jacobs.name: Rabbi Rick Jacobs

person-eric-yoffie.name: Rabbi Eric Yoffie

person-alexander-schindler.name: Rabbi Alexander Schindler
person-alexander-schindler.bio: Led the URJ from 1973 to 1996 and championed interfaith outreach, patrilineal descent, and social justice.

person-daryl-messinger.name: Daryl Messinger
person-daryl-messinger.bio: Served as chair of the URJ board of trustees and has been a leader in Reform Jewish communal governance.

person-walter-fried.name: Walter Fried
person-walter-fried.bio: Jewish-American attorney and name partner who helped establish Fried Frank as a leading New York law firm.

person-valerie-ford-jacob.name: Valerie Ford Jacob

person-david-greenwald.bio: Serves as chairman of Fried Frank Harris Shriver and Jacobson, overseeing the firm's strategic direction.

person-aviva-diamant.name: Aviva Diamant

person-harry-cohn.name: Harry Cohn

person-leo-jaffe.name: Leo Jaffe
person-leo-jaffe.bio: Longtime Columbia Pictures executive who rose from the accounting department to serve as president and chairman.

person-daniel-och.name: Daniel Och

person-dirk-ziff.name: Dirk Ziff
person-dirk-ziff.bio: Scion of the Ziff publishing family who provided founding capital for Och-Ziff Capital Management.

person-robert-ziff.name: Robert Ziff
person-robert-ziff.bio: Member of the Ziff family who co-invested founding capital in Och-Ziff Capital Management alongside his brothers.

person-daniel-ziff.name: Daniel Ziff
person-daniel-ziff.bio: Member of the Ziff publishing family who provided founding capital for Och-Ziff Capital Management.

person-herbert-lehman.name: Herbert Lehman
person-herbert-lehman.bio: Jewish-American banker, New York Governor, and U.S. Senator who provided key leadership to the JDC in its early years.

person-joseph-schwartz.name: Joseph Schwartz

person-ralph-goldman.name: Ralph Goldman

person-david-schizer.name: David Schizer
person-david-schizer.bio: Former Columbia Law School dean who served as CEO of the JDC, overseeing its worldwide Jewish community programs.

person-wyc-grousbeck.name: Wyc Grousbeck
person-wyc-grousbeck.bio: Jewish-American businessman who leads the Boston Celtics ownership group and serves as the team's governor.

person-irving-grousbeck.name: Irving Grousbeck
person-irving-grousbeck.bio: Stanford Business School professor and co-owner of the Boston Celtics alongside his son Wyc.

person-steve-pagliuca.name: Steve Pagliuca
person-steve-pagliuca.bio: Bain Capital managing director and co-owner of the Boston Celtics who has been part of the ownership group since 2002.

person-russell-robinson.name: Russell Robinson

person-sol-lizerbram.bio: Served as president of the JNF-USA national board, providing governance and strategic direction for the organization.

person-steve-griggs.name: Steve Griggs

person-safra-catz-orcl.name: Safra Catz
person-safra-catz-orcl.bio: CEO of Oracle Corporation, previously serving as co-CEO and CFO. One of the highest-paid female executives in the technology industry.

person-bob-miner-orcl.name: Bob Miner

person-steve-cohen.name: Steve Cohen

person-robert-noyce-intc.bio: Co-founded Intel and co-invented the integrated circuit. Known as the 'Mayor of Silicon Valley' for his foundational contributions to the tech industry.

person-andy-grove-intc.name: Andy Grove
person-andy-grove-intc.bio: Third employee and later CEO of Intel who transformed it into the world's dominant semiconductor company. Time Magazine's Man of the Year in 1997.

person-pat-gelsinger-intc.name: Pat Gelsinger
person-pat-gelsinger-intc.bio: Served as Intel's CEO from 2021 to 2024, leading the company's IDM 2.0 strategy and major investments in semiconductor manufacturing.

person-jo-carole-lauder.name: Jo Carole Lauder

person-chaim-dovid-zwiebel.name: Rabbi Chaim Dovid Zwiebel

person-moshe-sherer.name: Rabbi Moshe Sherer

person-avi-shafran.name: Rabbi Avi Shafran

person-william-morris.name: William Morris

person-abe-lastfogel.name: Abe Lastfogel

person-richard-robinson.name: Richard Robinson

person-david-levithan.name: David Levithan

person-ellie-berger.name: Ellie Berger
person-ellie-berger.bio: Leads Scholastic's trade publishing division, overseeing children's book publishing and distribution.

person-harold-grinspoon.name: Harold Grinspoon

person-winnie-sandler-grinspoon.name: Winnie Sandler Grinspoon
person-winnie-sandler-grinspoon.bio: Leads the Harold Grinspoon Foundation which operates PJ Library and its global Jewish family engagement programs.

person-meredith-lewis.name: Meredith Lewis

person-josh-harris.name: Josh Harris

person-mitchell-rales.name: Mitchell Rales
person-mitchell-rales.bio: Jewish-American billionaire industrialist and co-founder of Danaher Corporation who is a co-owner of the Washington Commanders.

person-david-blitzer.name: David Blitzer
person-david-blitzer.bio: Jewish-American investor and co-founder of Blackstone's Tactical Opportunities Fund who co-owns the Washington Commanders.

person-mark-ein.name: Mark Ein
person-mark-ein.bio: Jewish-American entrepreneur and investor based in Washington D.C. who is part of the Commanders ownership group.

person-meir-amit.name: Meir Amit

person-barry-minkov.name: Barry Minkov
person-barry-minkov.bio: American Jewish philanthropist and business leader who served as FIDF National Chairman.

affiliations.organization: American Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)

person-haim-saban.name: Haim Saban
person-haim-saban.bio: Israeli-American media mogul and billionaire who has been a leading supporter and megadonor to FIDF.

affiliations.organization: American Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)

person-sheldon-adelson.name: Sheldon Adelson
person-sheldon-adelson.bio: Casino magnate who was one of the largest individual donors to FIDF before his death in 2021.

affiliations.organization: American Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF)

person-george-klein.name: George Klein
person-george-klein.bio: Holocaust survivor and real estate developer who was a founding supporter of the museum.

person-jacob-schiff.name: Jacob Schiff
person-jacob-schiff.bio: German-born Jewish financier who led Kuhn Loeb to become one of the most powerful investment banks in the US.

person-solomon-loeb.name: Solomon Loeb
person-solomon-loeb.bio: German-Jewish banker who co-founded the firm Kuhn, Loeb & Co. in 1867.

person-abraham-kuhn.name: Abraham Kuhn

person-michael-bloomberg-blp.name: Michael Bloomberg

person-matthew-winkler-blp.name: Matthew Winkler

person-alana-newhouse.name: Alana Newhouse

person-david-samuels.name: David Samuels

person-liel-leibovitz.name: Liel Leibovitz

person-miriam-adelson.name: Miriam Adelson

person-sivan-ochshorn.name: Sivan Ochshorn

person-adam-chesnoff.name: Adam Chesnoff

person-johny-srouji.name: Johny Srouji

person-sumner-redstone.name: Sumner Redstone

person-bob-bakish.name: Bob Bakish

person-philippe-dauman.name: Philippe Dauman

person-david-mccormick.name: David McCormick

person-bob-prince.name: Bob Prince

person-michael-milken.name: Michael Milken

person-lowell-milken.name: Lowell Milken

person-sarah-shulkind.name: Sarah Shulkind

person-david-magerman.name: David Magerman
person-david-magerman.bio: Computer scientist and philanthropist who was a key developer of Renaissance Technologies' trading systems for over two decades.

person-robert-mercer.name: Robert Mercer
person-robert-mercer.bio: Computer scientist and investor who served as co-CEO of Renaissance Technologies from 2010 to 2017.

person-jonathan-cannon.name: Jonathan Cannon

person-sheldon-dorph.name: Sheldon Dorph

person-david-simon.name: David Simon

person-richard-sokolov.name: Richard Sokolov

person-william-mack.name: William Mack

rabbi-israel-kozlovsky.bio: Took over as director of the rebuilt Chabad House (Nariman House) in Mumbai in 2014, reestablishing its role as a center of Jewish life in the city.

sandra-samuel.name: Sandra Samuel
sandra-samuel.bio: Indian nanny who heroically rescued two-year-old Moshe Holtzberg during the 2008 Mumbai attacks, saving the child's life amid the siege.

moshe-holtzberg.name: Moshe Holtzberg
moshe-holtzberg.bio: Son of Gavriel and Rivka Holtzberg who survived the 2008 Mumbai attack as a toddler, becoming a symbol of resilience; returned to visit the renewed Chabad House in 2018.

keith-parker.name: Keith Parker
keith-parker.bio: Contemporary figure involved in the preservation of the historic Paradesi Synagogue in Kochi, built in 1568, the oldest active synagogue in the Commonwealth.

abraham-benedict-salem.name: Abraham Benedict Salem
abraham-benedict-salem.bio: Cochin Jewish community leader known as the 'Jewish Gandhi' who fought against caste discrimination within the community and championed Zionism in India.

sharon-memory.name: Sharon Memory
sharon-memory.bio: Serves as director of the Bene Israel Heritage Museum, curating exhibitions on the community's history from the Konkan coast to modern Mumbai.

ezekiel-isaac-malekar.name: Ezekiel Isaac Malekar
ezekiel-isaac-malekar.bio: Long-serving honorary secretary of the Central Jewish Board of India who has been the primary representative of Indian Jewry for decades.

nissim-ezekiel.name: Nissim Ezekiel
nissim-ezekiel.bio: Legendary Indian Jewish poet, considered the father of post-independence Indian English poetry, who was associated with Jewish community affairs in Mumbai.

ruth-memory.name: Ruth Memory
ruth-memory.bio: Served on the Central Jewish Board of India, contributing to governance and representation of the diverse Jewish communities across the country.

ruth-memory-jc.name: Ruth Memory
ruth-memory-jc.bio: Served as chairperson of the Jewish Club Mumbai, organizing social and cultural events for the city's Jewish community.

romiel-daniel.name: Romiel Daniel
romiel-daniel.bio: Active leader in the Federation of Jewish Communities of India, working to coordinate activities among Bene Israel, Baghdadi, and Cochin Jewish communities.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities of India

dhirubhai-ambani.name: Dhirubhai Ambani
dhirubhai-ambani.bio: Founded Reliance Industries in 1966 as a small textiles firm in Mumbai, building it into India's largest private sector enterprise with interests in petrochemicals, energy, and telecom.

nita-ambani.name: Nita Ambani
nita-ambani.bio: Wife of Mukesh Ambani who leads the Reliance Foundation, overseeing the conglomerate's philanthropic, sports, and educational initiatives.

essie-sassoon.name: Essie Sassoon
essie-sassoon.bio: Member of the Cochin Jewish community who has worked to preserve the heritage centre and its documentation of the community's centuries-long presence in Kerala.

giuliana-benetton.name: Giuliana Benetton
giuliana-benetton.bio: Co-founded Benetton Group alongside her brothers, originally designing the colorful knitwear that became the brand's signature.

alessandro-benetton.name: Alessandro Benetton
alessandro-benetton.bio: Son of Luciano Benetton who became chairman of the Benetton Group, leading the company's strategic restructuring in the 2020s.

oliviero-toscani.name: Oliviero Toscani
oliviero-toscani.bio: Iconic Italian photographer who served as Benetton's creative director for decades, creating the brand's provocative 'United Colors of Benetton' advertising campaigns.

renzo-gattegna.name: Renzo Gattegna
renzo-gattegna.bio: Served as president of UCEI for multiple terms, leading Italian Jewish advocacy on issues including Holocaust remembrance and interfaith dialogue.

amos-luzzatto.name: Amos Luzzatto
amos-luzzatto.bio: Physician and intellectual who served as president of UCEI from 1998 to 2006, also known for his scholarship on Italian Jewish history.

riccardo-calimani.name: Riccardo Calimani
riccardo-calimani.bio: Italian writer and historian of Venetian Jewry, author of 'The Ghetto of Venice,' and former president of the Jewish Community of Venice.

umberto-fortis.name: Umberto Fortis
umberto-fortis.bio: Scholar of Venetian Jewish culture who curated exhibitions and contributed to the scholarship behind the Jewish Museum of Venice's collections.

milo-hasbani.name: Milo Hasbani
milo-hasbani.bio: Businessman who served as co-president of the Jewish Community of Milan, one of Italy's largest and most active Jewish communities.

alfonso-arbib.name: Alfonso Arbib
alfonso-arbib.bio: Serves as chief rabbi of Milan, leading the religious life of the Milanese Jewish community and representing it in interfaith initiatives.

michele-sarfatti.name: Michele Sarfatti
michele-sarfatti.bio: Italian historian who directed CDEC for many years, specializing in the study of Italian Fascist racial laws and the persecution of Jews in Italy.

liliana-picciotto.name: Liliana Picciotto
liliana-picciotto.bio: Leading Holocaust researcher at CDEC who compiled the authoritative database of Italian Jews deported during the Holocaust, author of 'Il Libro della Memoria.'

riccardo-calimani-vg.name: Riccardo Calimani
riccardo-calimani-vg.bio: Italian historian and former president of the Jewish Community of Venice, author of 'The Ghetto of Venice' documenting the history of the world's first Jewish ghetto.

cecil-roth.name: Cecil Roth
cecil-roth.bio: British-Jewish historian who wrote extensively on the Venice Ghetto and Italian Jewish history, including the classic 'History of the Jews of Italy.'

elio-toaff.name: Elio Toaff
elio-toaff.bio: Longtime chief rabbi of Rome who famously hosted Pope John Paul II at the Great Synagogue in 1986, the first papal visit to a synagogue in history.

osvaldo-armanni.name: Osvaldo Armanni
osvaldo-armanni.bio: Italian architect who designed the Great Synagogue of Rome (Tempio Maggiore), completed in 1904 in an eclectic style combining Art Nouveau and Assyrian-Babylonian motifs.

tullia-zevi.name: Tullia Zevi
tullia-zevi.bio: Pioneering Italian Jewish journalist and leader who served as the first female president of the Union of Italian Jewish Communities for fifteen years.

noemi-di-segni-ucei.name: Noemi Di Segni
noemi-di-segni-ucei.bio: Lawyer serving as president of UCEI, representing the interests of Italy's Jewish communities in dealings with the Italian government and international bodies.

renzo-gattegna-ucei.name: Renzo Gattegna
renzo-gattegna-ucei.bio: Led UCEI as president for multiple terms between 2006 and 2016, advocating on issues of antisemitism, interfaith relations, and Jewish heritage preservation.

andrea-riccardi.name: Andrea Riccardi
andrea-riccardi.bio: Italian historian and lay Catholic leader who founded the Community of Sant'Egidio in 1968, initiating its landmark interfaith dialogue programs including engagement with Jewish communities.

riccardo-di-segni-se.name: Riccardo Di Segni
riccardo-di-segni-se.bio: Chief Rabbi of Rome who has been a key Jewish partner in Sant'Egidio's interfaith dialogues, continuing the tradition of Catholic-Jewish engagement in Italy.

mariano-falcini.name: Mariano Falcini
mariano-falcini.bio: One of the principal architects who designed the Great Synagogue of Florence, completed in 1882 in a Moorish Revival style inspired by the Hagia Sophia.

david-levi-fl.name: David Levi
david-levi-fl.bio: Prominent Florentine Jewish leader and philanthropist David Levi bequeathed funds that made possible the construction of the monumental synagogue in the 1870s-1880s.

franco-bonilauri.name: Franco Bonilauri
franco-bonilauri.bio: Co-founded and directed the Jewish Museum of Bologna (Museo Ebraico di Bologna), established in 1999 to document the Jewish heritage of the Emilia-Romagna region.

annie-sacerdoti.name: Annie Sacerdoti
annie-sacerdoti.bio: Italian Jewish heritage scholar and author of the 'Guide to Jewish Italy' who has collaborated with the museum on documenting Jewish history in Emilia-Romagna.

olga-melasecchi.name: Olga Melasecchi
olga-melasecchi.bio: Directed the Jewish Museum of Rome, overseeing its collections of ceremonial art, textiles, and historical artifacts from Rome's ancient Jewish community.

ruth-dureghello-mr.name: Ruth Dureghello
ruth-dureghello-mr.bio: As president of the Jewish Community of Rome, oversaw governance of the Jewish Museum and other communal institutions in the Roman ghetto.

gianni-ascarelli.name: Gianni Ascarelli
gianni-ascarelli.bio: Prominent Roman Jewish community leader who has supported the museum's mission to preserve and present the 2,000-year history of Jews in Rome.

victor-fadlun.name: Victor Fadlun
victor-fadlun.bio: Current president of the Jewish Community of Rome, managing one of the largest and most historically significant Jewish communities in Western Europe.

riccardo-di-segni-jcr.name: Riccardo Di Segni
riccardo-di-segni-jcr.bio: Serves as chief rabbi of Rome, spiritual leader of the Roman Jewish community whose roots date back over two thousand years.

shaul-bassi-jgv.name: Shaul Bassi
shaul-bassi-jgv.bio: Professor at Ca' Foscari University who directed the Venice Ghetto 500th anniversary project in 2016, bringing international attention to the world's first ghetto.

donatella-calabi.name: Donatella Calabi
donatella-calabi.bio: Italian architectural historian at IUAV University of Venice whose research on the urban history of the Venice Ghetto has been widely influential.

paolo-gnignati-jgv.name: Paolo Gnignati
paolo-gnignati-jgv.bio: Rabbi of the Jewish Community of Venice who leads religious life in the historic ghetto, home to five centuries-old synagogues still in use.

chris-schwarz.name: Chris Schwarz
chris-schwarz.bio: British photographer who founded the Galicia Jewish Museum in Kraków in 2004, basing its core exhibition on his photographic project 'Traces of Memory.'

jonathan-webber.name: Jonathan Webber
jonathan-webber.bio: British-Polish social anthropologist and professor who co-created the museum's core exhibition with Chris Schwarz, contributing scholarly framework to the photographic collection.

kasia-leonardi.name: Kasia Leonardi
kasia-leonardi.bio: Serves as deputy director of JCC Kraków, helping develop its extensive cultural, educational, and community programs serving Jews in southern Poland.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community Centre of Kraków (JCC Kraków)

prince-charles.name: Prince Charles (King Charles III)
prince-charles.bio: As Prince of Wales, became a patron of the JCC Kraków, lending royal support to the revival of Jewish communal life in Poland.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community Centre of Kraków (JCC Kraków)

kazimierz-smolen.name: Kazimierz Smoleń
kazimierz-smolen.bio: Auschwitz survivor (prisoner #1327) who served as director of the Auschwitz-Birkenau Museum for 35 years, dedicating his life to preserving the memory of the camp.

teresa-swiebocka.name: Teresa Świebocka
teresa-swiebocka.bio: Historian and former deputy director of the Auschwitz-Birkenau Museum who authored and edited key publications on the history of the camp.

waclaw-dlugoborski.name: Wacław Długoborski
waclaw-dlugoborski.bio: Polish historian who co-edited the comprehensive multi-volume history 'Auschwitz 1940–1945,' a foundational scholarly work on the camp's history.

nathan-rapoport.name: Nathan Rapoport
nathan-rapoport.bio: Polish-Jewish sculptor who designed the iconic Warsaw Ghetto Heroes Monument, unveiled in 1948 on the fifth anniversary of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising.

marek-edelman.name: Marek Edelman
marek-edelman.bio: Last surviving commander of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising of 1943, later a prominent cardiologist and political activist in Poland.

leon-suzin.name: Leon Suzin
leon-suzin.bio: Polish architect who collaborated with Nathan Rapoport on the design and placement of the Warsaw Ghetto Monument, integrating it into the destroyed ghetto landscape.

dariusz-stola.name: Dariusz Stola
dariusz-stola.bio: Polish historian who directed POLIN Museum from 2014 to 2019, winning the European Museum of the Year Award in 2016 during his tenure.

affiliations.organization: POLIN Museum of the History of Polish Jews

marian-turski.name: Marian Turski
marian-turski.bio: Auschwitz survivor, journalist, and historian who chairs the POLIN Museum Council and is a leading voice in Holocaust remembrance and civic education.

affiliations.organization: POLIN Museum of the History of Polish Jews

franciszek-duszenko.name: Franciszek Duszenko
franciszek-duszenko.bio: Polish sculptor who created the monumental stone memorial at the Treblinka extermination camp site, unveiled in 1964, featuring 17,000 stones symbolizing destroyed communities.

adam-haupt.name: Adam Haupt
adam-haupt.bio: Polish architect who designed the Treblinka memorial complex layout alongside sculptor Franciszek Duszenko, creating the symbolic cemetery of stones.

edward-kopowka.name: Edward Kopówka
edward-kopowka.bio: Historian who has served as curator of the Treblinka Museum, researching and documenting the history of the extermination and labor camps at Treblinka.

vasily-grossman.name: Vasily Grossman
