hans-krasa.bio: Czech-Jewish composer who created the children's opera 'Brundibár' performed in Terezín, murdered in Auschwitz; his work became a symbol of cultural resistance during the Holocaust.

norbert-troller.name: Norbert Troller
norbert-troller.bio: Czech-Jewish architect and artist who was interned in Terezín and secretly documented camp life through drawings, which became key historical evidence.

michal-frankl.name: Michal Frankl
michal-frankl.bio: Czech historian specializing in antisemitism and Jewish history who has served in leadership at the Jewish Museum in Prague, one of the world's oldest Jewish museums.

hana-volavkova.name: Hana Volavková
hana-volavkova.bio: Czech-Jewish art historian who directed the Jewish Museum in Prague after WWII, preserving its extraordinary collections of confiscated ceremonial objects and children's drawings from Terezín.

arno-parik.name: Arno Pařík
arno-parik.bio: Longtime senior curator at the Jewish Museum in Prague who has developed exhibitions and documented Czech and Bohemian Jewish history and material culture.

mordechai-maisel-ojc.name: Mordechai Maisel
mordechai-maisel-ojc.bio: Renaissance Jewish financier and mayor of the Prague ghetto whose elaborate tombstone is among the most visited in the cemetery, which contains over 12,000 headstones.

david-gans.name: David Gans
david-gans.bio: Czech-Jewish astronomer and chronicler buried in the Old Jewish Cemetery, known for his historical work 'Zemach David' and his collaboration with Tycho Brahe.

rabbi-david-oppenheim.name: Rabbi David Oppenheim
rabbi-david-oppenheim.bio: Chief rabbi of Prague who amassed the most important Hebrew book collection in the world, buried in the Old Jewish Cemetery.

tomas-kraus-fjc.name: Tomáš Kraus
tomas-kraus-fjc.bio: Serves as executive director of the Federation, coordinating Czech Jewish communal life, heritage preservation, and international representation.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in the Czech Republic

karol-sidon-fjc.name: Karol Sidon
karol-sidon-fjc.bio: Prominent Czech author who became chief rabbi of the Czech Republic after the Velvet Revolution, leading the revival of Czech Jewish religious life.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in the Czech Republic

david-peter-fjc.name: David Peter
david-peter-fjc.bio: Active in the federation's governance, contributing to the rebuilding of Czech Jewish institutional and community life after four decades of Communist rule.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in the Czech Republic

hana-volavkova-ps.name: Hana Volavková
hana-volavkova-ps.bio: Czech-Jewish art historian who oversaw the transformation of the Pinkas Synagogue into a Holocaust memorial with the names of 77,297 Czech and Moravian Jewish victims inscribed on its walls.

arno-parik-ps.name: Arno Pařík
arno-parik-ps.bio: Senior curator at the Jewish Museum in Prague who has researched and documented the Pinkas Synagogue's Holocaust memorial and its children's drawings from Terezín.

leo-pavlat-ps.name: Leo Pavlát
leo-pavlat-ps.bio: Former director of the Jewish Museum in Prague who oversaw the Pinkas Synagogue memorial's restoration and its preservation as a major Holocaust remembrance site.

kiichiro-toyoda.name: Kiichiro Toyoda
kiichiro-toyoda.bio: Japanese industrialist who founded Toyota Motor Corporation in 1937, transitioning the family business from automatic looms to automobile manufacturing.

koji-sato.name: Koji Sato
koji-sato.bio: Serves as president and CEO of Toyota Motor Corporation, leading the world's largest automaker through its transition to electric and hydrogen-powered vehicles.

eiji-toyoda.name: Eiji Toyoda
eiji-toyoda.bio: Nephew of the founder who led Toyota's post-war expansion and championed the Toyota Production System, transforming it into a global automotive giant.

anatole-ponevejsky-jck.name: Anatole Ponevejsky
anatole-ponevejsky-jck.bio: President of the Kobe Jewish community during WWII who coordinated aid for Jewish refugees transiting through Japan, helping thousands escape the Holocaust.

alex-einbinder.name: Alex Einbinder
alex-einbinder.bio: Leader of the Kobe Jewish community who has worked to maintain the congregation and preserve its history as a refuge for Jewish refugees during World War II.

zerach-warhaftig.name: Zerach Warhaftig
zerach-warhaftig.bio: Polish-Jewish leader and future Israeli government minister who helped organize the transit of Jewish refugees through Kobe during WWII with the aid of Chiune Sugihara's visas.

takeji-otsuki.name: Takeji Otsuki
takeji-otsuki.bio: Succeeded Abraham Ikuro Teshima as leader of the Makuya movement, continuing its mission of Christian-Zionist engagement and promoting Japanese-Israeli relations.

yamamoto-shichihei.name: Yamamoto Shichihei
yamamoto-shichihei.bio: Japanese author and social commentator who wrote about Judaism and Jewish culture for Japanese audiences, contributing to the intellectual context of the Makuya movement.

miriam-teshima.name: Miriam Teshima
miriam-teshima.bio: Member of the Teshima family who has continued the Makuya movement's tradition of pilgrimage to Israel and engagement with Jewish communities worldwide.

yukiko-sugihara.name: Yukiko Sugihara
yukiko-sugihara.bio: Wife of Chiune Sugihara who supported his decision to issue life-saving visas and later helped preserve his legacy through memoirs and public appearances.

nobuki-sugihara.name: Nobuki Sugihara
nobuki-sugihara.bio: Son of Chiune Sugihara who has worked to preserve his father's legacy as a Righteous Among the Nations, supporting the museum in Yaotsu and related educational programs.

solly-ganor.name: Solly Ganor
solly-ganor.bio: Lithuanian-Jewish Holocaust survivor who received a Sugihara visa as a child and later wrote about the experience, becoming an advocate for the museum and Sugihara's legacy.

rabbi-marvin-tokayer.name: Marvin Tokayer
rabbi-marvin-tokayer.bio: American rabbi who served as rabbi of the Jewish Community of Japan in Tokyo for over a decade, becoming the foremost chronicler of Jewish-Japanese relations.

rabbi-david-kunin.name: David Kunin
rabbi-david-kunin.bio: Has served as rabbi of the Jewish Community of Japan in Tokyo, leading religious services and community events for the expatriate and local Jewish population.

roald-hoffmann-jcj.name: Michael Goldstein
roald-hoffmann-jcj.bio: Has served in leadership of the Jewish Community of Japan in Tokyo, overseeing the small but active community's religious, social, and cultural programs.

chiune-sugihara-kbc.name: Chiune Sugihara
chiune-sugihara-kbc.bio: Japanese diplomat whose transit visas enabled thousands of Jewish refugees to reach Kobe in 1940-41, making the Kobe Jewish community a critical wartime refuge.

rabbi-kalman-rotter.name: Kalman Rotter
rabbi-kalman-rotter.bio: Rabbi who served the Jewish refugee community in Kobe during WWII, providing religious leadership to the thousands of Jews who transited through the city.

jan-zwartendijk.name: Jan Zwartendijk
jan-zwartendijk.bio: Dutch honorary consul in Kaunas, Lithuania who issued destination visas to Curaçao enabling Jewish refugees to obtain Sugihara's transit visas and reach Kobe.

marcelo-claure.name: Marcelo Claure
marcelo-claure.bio: Bolivian-American businessman who served as COO of SoftBank Group and CEO of SoftBank International, managing key portfolio companies and operations.

rajeev-misra.name: Rajeev Misra
rajeev-misra.bio: Indian-British banker who led the SoftBank Vision Fund, one of the world's largest technology investment vehicles at $100 billion.

affiliations.role: Former Head of SoftBank Vision Fund

nikesh-arora.name: Nikesh Arora
nikesh-arora.bio: Indian-American executive who served as president and COO of SoftBank Group from 2014 to 2016, previously a top executive at Google.

august-krogh.name: August Krogh
august-krogh.bio: Nobel Prize-winning Danish physiologist who co-founded Nordisk Insulinlaboratorium in 1923 after securing the license to produce insulin in Scandinavia.

lars-rebien-sorensen.name: Lars Rebien Sørensen
lars-rebien-sorensen.bio: CEO of Novo Nordisk from 2000 to 2016, transforming it into the world's leading diabetes care company. Named 'Best-Performing CEO in the World' by Harvard Business Review in 2015.

bent-melchior-djm.name: Bent Melchior
bent-melchior-djm.bio: Chief Rabbi of Denmark from 1969 to 1996 who was instrumental in promoting Danish Jewish heritage and supporting the museum's mission to preserve community history.

martin-schwarz-lausten.name: Martin Schwarz Lausten
martin-schwarz-lausten.bio: Danish church historian and author of seminal works on the history of Jews in Denmark, whose research provided foundational scholarship for the museum's exhibitions.

marcus-melchior.name: Marcus Melchior
marcus-melchior.bio: Acting Chief Rabbi who on September 29, 1943 warned the Copenhagen synagogue congregation about the impending Nazi roundup, triggering the mass escape operation.

niels-bohr.name: Niels Bohr
niels-bohr.bio: Danish Nobel Prize-winning physicist who escaped to Sweden in 1943 and personally lobbied King Gustaf V to accept Jewish refugees, helping secure Swedish asylum for the evacuees.

marcus-melchior-dk.name: Marcus Melchior
marcus-melchior-dk.bio: Acting Chief Rabbi during WWII who played a decisive role in warning the Danish Jewish community of the imminent Nazi deportation in 1943, enabling the mass rescue to Sweden.

bent-melchior-dk.name: Bent Melchior
bent-melchior-dk.bio: Son of Marcus Melchior who served as Chief Rabbi of Denmark from 1969 to 1996, becoming a leading voice for interfaith dialogue and Holocaust education in Scandinavia.

herbert-pundik.name: Herbert Pundik
herbert-pundik.bio: Danish Jewish journalist who served as editor-in-chief of Politiken newspaper for over two decades and authored works about the rescue of Danish Jews and the community's history.

gustav-friedrich-hetsch.name: Gustav Friedrich Hetsch
gustav-friedrich-hetsch.bio: Danish-German architect who designed the Great Synagogue of Copenhagen, completed in 1833 in the Neoclassical style, making it the main synagogue of Denmark.

abraham-alexander-wolff.name: Abraham Alexander Wolff
abraham-alexander-wolff.bio: Chief Rabbi of Denmark during the mid-19th century who presided over the synagogue during a period of Jewish emancipation and cultural flourishing in Danish Jewish life.

bent-melchior-gsc.name: Bent Melchior
bent-melchior-gsc.bio: Chief Rabbi who served at the Great Synagogue from 1969 to 1996, presiding over the congregation and becoming a major figure in European Jewish communal life.

finn-schwarz.name: Finn Schwarz
finn-schwarz.bio: Longtime president of Det Mosaiske Troessamfund, the official Jewish congregation of Denmark, who led the community through key periods of growth and interfaith engagement.

bent-melchior-dmt.name: Bent Melchior
bent-melchior-dmt.bio: Chief Rabbi of Det Mosaiske Troessamfund from 1969 to 1996, providing spiritual leadership and serving as a prominent voice for the Danish Jewish community internationally.

jair-melchior.name: Jair Melchior
jair-melchior.bio: Current Chief Rabbi of Denmark and third generation of the Melchior rabbinical dynasty within Det Mosaiske Troessamfund, continuing his family's distinguished legacy of communal leadership.

moisis-elisaf.name: Moisis Elisaf
moisis-elisaf.bio: In 2019 became the first Jewish mayor elected in Greece (Ioannina), demonstrating the integration and respect of the Jewish community within modern Greek society.

affiliations.organization: Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece (KIS)

moses-constantinis.name: Moses Constantinis
moses-constantinis.bio: Historian and community leader who documented the long history of Jewish presence in Greece, particularly the ancient Romaniote communities, preserving vital records for future generations.

affiliations.organization: Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece (KIS)

nicholas-stavroulakis.name: Nicholas Stavroulakis
nicholas-stavroulakis.bio: Greek-American historian and artist who founded the Jewish Museum of Greece in Athens, dedicating his life to preserving Romaniote Jewish culture, traditions, and history.

moses-kapsali.name: Moses Kapsali
moses-kapsali.bio: A Romaniote Jew who served as the first Chief Rabbi of the Ottoman Empire after the fall of Constantinople in 1453, welcoming thousands of Sephardi refugees into the empire.

shabbethai-donnolo.name: Shabbethai Donnolo
shabbethai-donnolo.bio: 10th-century Jewish physician and pharmacologist from the Greek-speaking Jewish community of southern Italy, one of the earliest known European medical writers and a notable Romaniote figure.

albertos-nar.name: Albertos Nar
albertos-nar.bio: Thessaloniki-born historian and founding member of the Jewish Museum of Thessaloniki who dedicated decades to documenting the Sephardi community nearly annihilated in the Holocaust.

david-saltiel-thess.name: David Saltiel
david-saltiel-thess.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Thessaloniki who helped establish and support the museum as a memorial to the 50,000 Jews of Thessaloniki deported during the Holocaust.

nicholas-stavroulakis-jmg.name: Nicholas Stavroulakis
nicholas-stavroulakis-jmg.bio: Greek-American scholar and artist who founded the Jewish Museum of Greece in Athens in 1977, creating an institution dedicated to preserving the heritage of Greek Jewry, especially the Romaniote tradition.

moisis-elisaf-jmg.name: Moisis Elisaf
moisis-elisaf-jmg.bio: Mayor of Ioannina and prominent figure in Greek Jewish communal life who supported the museum's mission and the preservation of Romaniote Jewish heritage in Greece.

david-saltiel-mem.name: David Saltiel
david-saltiel-mem.bio: As president of the Jewish Community of Thessaloniki, led decades-long efforts to establish the Holocaust memorial honoring the 50,000 Jews deported from the city to Auschwitz-Birkenau.

yiannis-boutaris.name: Yiannis Boutaris
yiannis-boutaris.bio: Mayor of Thessaloniki (2011–2019) who championed Holocaust remembrance, officially apologized for the city's role in the deportations, and supported the creation of a major Holocaust museum.

heinz-kounio.name: Heinz Kounio
heinz-kounio.bio: Thessaloniki-born Holocaust survivor deported to Auschwitz who became one of the most prominent witnesses to the destruction of the Jewish community of Thessaloniki.

pnina-tamano-shata.name: Pnina Tamano-Shata
pnina-tamano-shata.bio: Ethiopian-Israeli politician who became the first Ethiopian-born woman to serve as a minister in the Israeli government, championing the integration and rights of the Beta Israel community.

ferede-aklum.name: Ferede Aklum
ferede-aklum.bio: Ethiopian Jewish community leader who played a critical role in organizing the clandestine journey of thousands of Ethiopian Jews through Sudan in the early 1980s, leading to Operation Moses.

addisu-messele.name: Addisu Messele
addisu-messele.bio: Ethiopian-Israeli activist and community leader who advocated for the airlift of Ethiopian Jews and worked to support their integration into Israeli society after Operation Solomon.

kassa-kebede.name: Kassa Kebede
kassa-kebede.bio: Ethiopian Jewish community organizer who helped coordinate the gathering of Beta Israel members in Addis Ababa in preparation for the historic Operation Solomon airlift.

yona-bogale.name: Yona Bogale
yona-bogale.bio: Ethiopian Jewish educator who maintained Jewish education and identity among Beta Israel communities, establishing schools in the North Shewa and Gondar regions of Ethiopia.

avraham-neguise-ns.name: Avraham Neguise
avraham-neguise-ns.bio: Born in the North Shewa region, became a leading activist for the immigration of Ethiopian Jews to Israel, later serving as a member of the Israeli Knesset.

shlomo-molla.name: Shlomo Molla
shlomo-molla.bio: Ethiopian-Israeli politician and Knesset member from the North Shewa area who advocated for preserving Beta Israel heritage and supporting the remaining Ethiopian Jewish communities.

graenum-berger.name: Graenum Berger
graenum-berger.bio: Social worker and activist who co-founded NACOEJ and became one of the earliest American advocates for the recognition and immigration rights of Ethiopian Jews.

affiliations.organization: North American Conference on Ethiopian Jewry

howard-lenhoff.name: Howard Lenhoff
howard-lenhoff.bio: Professor and longtime board member of NACOEJ who championed educational programs for Ethiopian Jews, including sponsoring students in Israel through the organization's scholarship fund.

affiliations.organization: North American Conference on Ethiopian Jewry

yityish-aynaw.name: Yityish Aynaw
yityish-aynaw.bio: Ethiopian-Israeli model crowned Miss Israel in 2013, the first woman of Ethiopian descent to win the title, becoming a prominent symbol of Beta Israel identity in Israel.

pnina-tamano-shata-ej.name: Pnina Tamano-Shata
pnina-tamano-shata-ej.bio: First Ethiopian-born woman to serve as a cabinet minister in Israel, serving as Minister of Immigration and Absorption and advocating for Ethiopian Jewish community rights and integration.

avraham-neguise-ej.name: Avraham Neguise
avraham-neguise-ej.bio: Ethiopian-Israeli politician who chaired the Knesset's Immigration, Absorption, and Diaspora Committee, dedicating his career to Ethiopian Jewish immigration and community welfare.

yona-bogale-nshz.name: Yona Bogale
yona-bogale-nshz.bio: Ethiopian Jewish educator who championed cultural preservation and Jewish education in the North Shewa region, helping document and protect the community's distinctive heritage.

shlomo-molla-nshz.name: Shlomo Molla
shlomo-molla-nshz.bio: Ethiopian-Israeli Knesset member active in preserving the heritage and memory of the Ethiopian Jewish communities from which Operation Solomon evacuated thousands.

avraham-neguise-nshz.name: Avraham Neguise
avraham-neguise-nshz.bio: Israeli Knesset member of Ethiopian origin and vocal proponent of preserving Ethiopian Jewish historical sites and heritage in regions including North Shewa.

oskar-mendelsohn.name: Oskar Mendelsohn
oskar-mendelsohn.bio: Norwegian historian and author of the definitive history of Jews in Norway, whose research provided the scholarly foundation for the Jewish Museum Oslo's collections and exhibitions.

julius-paltiel-oslo.name: Julius Paltiel
julius-paltiel-oslo.bio: Norwegian Jewish Holocaust survivor deported to Auschwitz who became one of Norway's most prominent witnesses, closely associated with Holocaust education programs at the museum.

jo-benkow.name: Jo Benkow
jo-benkow.bio: Norwegian Conservative politician of Jewish descent who served as President of the Storting (parliament) from 1985 to 1993, the first Jewish person to hold the position in Norway.

michael-melchior-oslo.name: Michael Melchior
michael-melchior-oslo.bio: Served as rabbi of the Oslo Jewish community before making aliyah to Israel, where he became a Knesset member and Deputy Foreign Minister while maintaining ties to Norwegian Jewry.

ervin-kohn-dmt.name: Ervin Kohn
ervin-kohn-dmt.bio: President of Det Mosaiske Trossamfund i Oslo who led efforts to strengthen Jewish communal life in Norway and has been a vocal advocate against antisemitism.

jo-benkow-dmt.name: Jo Benkow
jo-benkow-dmt.bio: Norwegian politician and former President of the Storting who was a prominent member of the Oslo Jewish community; his memoir about growing up Jewish in Norway became a national bestseller.

michael-melchior-dmt.name: Michael Melchior
michael-melchior-dmt.bio: Served as Chief Rabbi of Norway and spiritual leader of Det Mosaiske Trossamfund i Oslo before moving to Israel, where he continued his career as a rabbi and politician.

odd-nansen.name: Odd Nansen
odd-nansen.bio: Norwegian architect and humanitarian, son of Fridtjof Nansen, imprisoned during WWII. His wartime diary inspired the establishment of the center in the historic Villa Grande.

affiliations.organization: Center for Studies of the Holocaust and Religious Minorities (HL-senteret)

bjarte-bruland.name: Bjarte Bruland
bjarte-bruland.bio: Norwegian historian at HL-senteret who conducted groundbreaking research on the confiscation of Jewish property during the Nazi occupation of Norway, contributing to restitution efforts.

affiliations.organization: Center for Studies of the Holocaust and Religious Minorities (HL-senteret)

julius-paltiel-trond.name: Julius Paltiel
julius-paltiel-trond.bio: Trondheim-born Holocaust survivor deported to Auschwitz who returned to rebuild Jewish life in Trondheim, becoming the community's most honored figure and the museum's spiritual heart.

ellen-elster.name: Ellen Elster
ellen-elster.bio: Community leader in Trondheim who worked to establish and develop the Jewish Museum Trondheim as a site of memory and education within the restored Trondheim synagogue building.

per-halvorsen.name: Per Halvorsen
per-halvorsen.bio: Norwegian journalist who authored the biography of Julius Paltiel, bringing the story of Trondheim's Jewish community and the Holocaust in Norway to a wider audience.

sidsel-levin-jmo.name: Sidsel Levin
sidsel-levin-jmo.bio: Established the Jewish Museum of Oslo in 2005, housed in a former synagogue, to document the history of the Norwegian Jewish community and their experience during the Holocaust.

oskar-mendelsohn-jmo.name: Oskar Mendelsohn
oskar-mendelsohn-jmo.bio: Author of the two-volume 'Jødenes historie i Norge,' whose comprehensive research underpins the museum's exhibitions and educational offerings on Norwegian Jewish history.

ervin-kohn-jmo.name: Ervin Kohn
ervin-kohn-jmo.bio: As president of the Oslo Jewish community, actively supported the museum's development and its role in preserving Norwegian Jewish heritage and promoting Holocaust remembrance.

moses-rosen.name: Moses Rosen
moses-rosen.bio: Chief Rabbi of Romania from 1948 to 1994 who navigated the communist era to preserve Jewish life, negotiated the emigration of hundreds of thousands of Romanian Jews, and led FCER for decades.

alexandru-safran.name: Alexandru Șafran
alexandru-safran.bio: Chief Rabbi of Romania during WWII who worked to save Romanian Jews from deportation, later forced into exile by the communist regime, and continued as Chief Rabbi of Geneva.

moses-rosen-coral.name: Moses Rosen
moses-rosen-coral.bio: Chief Rabbi of Romania who used the Coral Temple (Templul Coral) in Bucharest as the center of Jewish communal life during the communist era, holding services there for decades.

iuliu-barasch.name: Iuliu Barasch
iuliu-barasch.bio: 19th-century Romanian Jewish physician and community leader who was a prominent figure in the Bucharest Jewish community during the era surrounding the Coral Temple's construction in 1857.

rafael-shaffer.name: Rafael Shaffer
rafael-shaffer.bio: Served as Chief Rabbi of Romania, presiding over services at the Coral Temple and working to maintain Jewish communal life and heritage in post-communist Romania.

moses-rosen-fed.name: Moses Rosen
moses-rosen-fed.bio: Towering figure of Romanian Jewry who led the Federation for over four decades, negotiating with the Ceaușescu regime to permit Jewish emigration while maintaining communal institutions.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania

alexandru-safran-fed.name: Alexandru Șafran
alexandru-safran-fed.bio: Served as Chief Rabbi during WWII and worked heroically to prevent the deportation of Romanian Jews from Wallachia and Moldova, saving tens of thousands of lives.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania

aurel-vainer-fed.name: Aurel Vainer
aurel-vainer-fed.bio: Longtime president of the Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania and parliamentary representative of the Jewish minority, overseeing heritage preservation and community welfare programs.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania

pope-francis.name: Pope Francis
pope-francis.bio: The Document on Human Fraternity signed by Pope Francis and Grand Imam Ahmed el-Tayeb in Abu Dhabi in 2019 directly inspired the creation of the Abrahamic Family House as a center of interfaith dialogue.

david-adjaye.name: David Adjaye
david-adjaye.bio: Ghanaian-British architect Sir David Adjaye designed the Abrahamic Family House in Abu Dhabi, creating three distinct structures — a mosque, church, and synagogue — unified on a single platform.

ross-kriel-uae.name: Ross Kriel
ross-kriel-uae.bio: South African-born businessman who co-founded and leads the Jewish community in the UAE, serving as president of the Jewish Council of the Emirates and a key figure in the Abraham Accords era.

solly-wolf.name: Solly Wolf
solly-wolf.bio: Prominent member and vice president of the Jewish Council of the Emirates who helped build communal infrastructure for the growing Jewish community in Dubai and across the UAE.

elie-abadie.name: Elie Abadie
elie-abadie.bio: Senior Rabbi of the Jewish Council of the Emirates, appointed to serve the community after the Abraham Accords, bringing decades of rabbinical experience to the Jewish community in the UAE.

ross-kriel-agjc.name: Ross Kriel
ross-kriel-agjc.bio: Co-founded the Association of Gulf Jewish Communities to connect and support Jewish communities across the Gulf region following the normalization agreements between Israel and Gulf states.

elie-abadie-agjc.name: Elie Abadie
elie-abadie-agjc.bio: Rabbi serving the Gulf Jewish communities who provides religious leadership to the growing Jewish populations in the UAE, Bahrain, and the wider Gulf region through the AGJC.

ross-kriel-dubai.name: Ross Kriel
ross-kriel-dubai.bio: President of the Jewish Council of the Emirates who helped create the conditions for kosher food services and Jewish communal life to flourish openly in Dubai.

affiliations.organization: Kosher restaurants and community in Dubai

elie-abadie-dubai.name: Elie Abadie
elie-abadie-dubai.bio: Senior Rabbi of the Jewish Council of the Emirates who provides kosher certification and rabbinical oversight for kosher food establishments in Dubai.

affiliations.organization: Kosher restaurants and community in Dubai

ross-kriel-jce.name: Ross Kriel
ross-kriel-jce.bio: South African-born businessman who co-founded and serves as president of the Jewish Council of the Emirates, building Jewish communal institutions in the UAE from the ground up.

solly-wolf-jce.name: Solly Wolf
solly-wolf-jce.bio: Vice president of the Jewish Council of the Emirates and a key figure in developing community infrastructure, including prayer services and cultural events.

elie-abadie-jce.name: Elie Abadie
elie-abadie-jce.bio: Appointed as Senior Rabbi of the Jewish Council of the Emirates, providing spiritual leadership and establishing religious services for the Jewish community across the UAE.

chaim-potok.name: Chaim Potok
chaim-potok.bio: Renowned American Jewish author who served as a U.S. Army chaplain in South Korea in the 1950s, an experience that profoundly influenced his literary work and brought early Jewish presence to Seoul.

david-gantt.name: David Gantt
david-gantt.bio: One of the U.S. military Jewish chaplains who helped establish Jewish religious services in Seoul during and after the Korean War, laying foundations for the organized Jewish community.

osher-litzman-chabad.name: Osher Litzman
osher-litzman-chabad.bio: Founded and directs Chabad of South Korea in Seoul, serving as the primary Jewish religious leader in the country since 2008 for residents, tourists, and businesspeople.

mussy-litzman.name: Mussy Litzman
mussy-litzman.bio: Co-directs Chabad of South Korea alongside her husband Rabbi Osher Litzman, managing community programs, holiday events, and educational activities for the Jewish community in Seoul.

lee-byung-chul.name: Lee Byung-chul
lee-byung-chul.bio: Founded Samsung as a small trading company in 1938, building it into South Korea's largest chaebol encompassing electronics, construction, shipbuilding, and financial services.

lee-kun-hee.name: Lee Kun-hee
lee-kun-hee.bio: Son of the founder who transformed Samsung Electronics into the world's largest manufacturer of smartphones, memory chips, and displays with his 'New Management' initiative in 1993.

david-marshall-jwb.name: David Marshall
david-marshall-jwb.bio: Singapore's first Chief Minister (1955-1956) and a prominent Sephardi Jewish community member who supported Jewish communal institutions, including welfare organizations.

manasseh-meyer-jwb.name: Manasseh Meyer
manasseh-meyer-jwb.bio: Baghdadi Jewish businessman and philanthropist who was one of the wealthiest men in colonial Singapore and a major benefactor of Jewish communal institutions and welfare activities.

solomon-aaron.name: Solomon Aaron
solomon-aaron.bio: A leader of the Jewish Welfare Board of Singapore who helped manage communal welfare, supporting the small but vibrant Jewish community in its social and charitable activities.

manasseh-meyer-ma.name: Manasseh Meyer
manasseh-meyer-ma.bio: Prominent Baghdadi Jewish philanthropist in colonial Singapore who was a major benefactor of Maghain Aboth Synagogue and funded its expansion and maintenance throughout the early 20th century.

david-marshall-ma.name: David Marshall
david-marshall-ma.bio: Singapore's first Chief Minister and a member of the Maghain Aboth congregation, he exemplified the integration of the Jewish community into Singapore's multiethnic society.

abdullah-moses-silas.name: Abdullah Moses Silas
abdullah-moses-silas.bio: Early leader of the Baghdadi Jewish community in Singapore who helped establish Maghain Aboth in 1878, the oldest synagogue in Southeast Asia, serving Jewish merchants in the region.

david-marshall-uhc.name: David Marshall
david-marshall-uhc.bio: Singapore's first Chief Minister and prominent Jewish communal figure associated with the United Hebrew Congregation, representing Jewish life within Singapore's diverse society.

manasseh-meyer-uhc.name: Manasseh Meyer
manasseh-meyer-uhc.bio: Meyer's philanthropy extended to supporting Jewish communal unity in Singapore, benefiting all congregations including the United Hebrew Congregation.

jack-jakobi.name: Jack Jakobi
jack-jakobi.bio: Leader of the United Hebrew Congregation of Singapore who helped maintain Ashkenazi Jewish religious services and traditions for the European Jewish community in Singapore.

david-marshall-sjc.name: David Marshall
david-marshall-sjc.bio: Singapore's first Chief Minister (1955-1956) and a Baghdadi Jew who later served as ambassador to multiple countries, the most prominent member of Singapore's Jewish community.

manasseh-meyer-sjc.name: Manasseh Meyer
manasseh-meyer-sjc.bio: Baghdadi Jewish magnate who became one of Singapore's wealthiest residents, building synagogues, schools, and charitable institutions that formed the backbone of Jewish communal life.

flora-sassoon-sjc.name: Flora Sassoon
flora-sassoon-sjc.bio: Member of the prominent Sassoon family who had significant business interests in Singapore, contributing to the Jewish commercial and communal network across the Straits Settlements.

david-marshall-sjwb.name: David Marshall
david-marshall-sjwb.bio: Singapore's first Chief Minister whose prominent role in Jewish communal affairs supported institutions like the Jewish Welfare Board in maintaining community cohesion and social services.

manasseh-meyer-sjwb.name: Manasseh Meyer
manasseh-meyer-sjwb.bio: Singapore's most prominent Jewish philanthropist whose charitable endowments supported the Jewish Welfare Board's mission of providing social services to the local Jewish community.

simon-nathan.name: Simon Nathan
simon-nathan.bio: Board member of the Singapore Jewish Welfare Board who coordinated welfare activities and community support services for the small but active Jewish community in Singapore.

barros-basto.name: Arturo Carlos de Barros Basto
barros-basto.bio: Known as the 'Portuguese Dreyfus,' Captain Barros Basto led the revival of open Jewish practice in 1920s-1930s Portugal, working closely with the preservation of the Tomar synagogue.

abraao-zacuto.name: Abraão Zacuto
abraao-zacuto.bio: 15th-century Portuguese Jewish astronomer and mathematician whose navigational tables aided Vasco da Gama's voyages. The synagogue now houses the Museu Luso-Hebraico Abraão Zacuto in his honor.

samuel-schwarz-mjb.name: Samuel Schwarz
samuel-schwarz-mjb.bio: Polish-born engineer who in 1917 discovered the crypto-Jewish community of Belmonte, descendants of Jews forced to convert in 1497, whose findings inspired the creation of the Jewish Museum.

elvira-azevedo-mea.name: Elvira Azevedo Mea
elvira-azevedo-mea.bio: Portuguese historian specializing in the Inquisition and crypto-Judaism whose research on the Belmonte crypto-Jewish community provided essential scholarly context for the museum's exhibits.

elisha-salas.name: Elisha Salas
elisha-salas.bio: Rabbi who helped the crypto-Jewish community of Belmonte formally return to Judaism in the 1990s, guiding community members through conversion processes and re-establishing open Jewish practice.

esther-mucznik.name: Esther Mucznik
esther-mucznik.bio: French-born Portuguese Jewish historian and former vice president of the Lisbon Jewish community who authored works on the Portuguese Jewish experience and advocated for heritage preservation.

barros-basto-lisbon.name: Arturo Carlos de Barros Basto
barros-basto-lisbon.bio: Portuguese army officer who led the revival of organized Jewish life in early 20th-century Portugal, working to unite crypto-Jewish descendants with the established Jewish community of Lisbon.

barros-basto-porto.name: Arturo Carlos de Barros Basto
barros-basto-porto.bio: Portuguese army captain who spearheaded the construction of the Kadoorie Mekor Haim synagogue in Porto, completed in 1938, the largest synagogue on the Iberian Peninsula.

laura-kadoorie.name: Laura Kadoorie
laura-kadoorie.bio: Member of the Kadoorie family whose generous financial contributions funded the construction of the Porto synagogue, which bears the family name in recognition of their pivotal support.

hugo-lip.name: Hugo Lip
hugo-lip.bio: Leader of the Jewish Community of Porto who worked alongside Barros Basto to establish the synagogue and build organized Jewish communal life in northern Portugal.

esther-mucznik-cil.name: Esther Mucznik
esther-mucznik-cil.bio: Prominent Portuguese Jewish historian who served as vice president of the Comunidade Israelita de Lisboa, writing extensively about Sephardi heritage and the Portuguese Inquisition.

jose-oulman-carvalhao-neto.name: José Oulman Carvalhão Neto
jose-oulman-carvalhao-neto.bio: Leader of the Lisbon Jewish community who strengthened cultural and religious institutions and built connections with the growing community of descendants of Portuguese Jews worldwide.

barros-basto-cil.name: Arturo Carlos de Barros Basto
barros-basto-cil.bio: The 'Portuguese Dreyfus' who championed the return to open Judaism in Portugal, establishing connections between crypto-Jewish descendants and the Lisbon community.

nancy-khedouri.name: Nancy Khedouri
nancy-khedouri.bio: Bahraini Jewish politician who served in the Bahraini Shura Council, one of the few Jewish parliamentarians in the Arab world, deeply connected to the Bahrain synagogue community.

ebrahim-nonoo-bah.name: Ebrahim Nonoo
ebrahim-nonoo-bah.bio: Head of the Jewish community of Bahrain who has maintained the synagogue and championed Jewish-Muslim coexistence in the kingdom, representing one of the oldest Jewish communities in the Gulf.

gabriel-zaliasnik.name: Gabriel Zaliasnik
gabriel-zaliasnik.bio: Prominent Chilean Jewish lawyer who served as president of the Comunidad Judía de Chile and is active in Jewish education initiatives.

claudio-grossman.name: Claudio Grossman
claudio-grossman.bio: Chilean-Jewish legal scholar who served as dean of American University Washington College of Law, a prominent figure in Chile's Jewish intellectual community.

angel-faivovich.name: Ángel Faivovich
angel-faivovich.bio: Chilean senator of Jewish descent (1900–1992) who was a major political figure and supporter of Jewish communal institutions in Chile.

salomon-hakim.name: Salomón Hakim
salomon-hakim.bio: Colombian neurosurgeon of Jewish descent (1922–2011) who invented the Hakim valve for treating hydrocephalus, one of Colombia's most celebrated scientists.

jaime-gilinski.name: Jaime Gilinski
jaime-gilinski.bio: Colombian Jewish billionaire banker and one of Latin America's wealthiest business leaders, a major supporter of Jewish communal institutions in Colombia.

ben-zyskowicz.name: Ben Zyskowicz
ben-zyskowicz.bio: Longest-serving member of the Finnish Parliament (National Coalition Party) and Finland's most prominent Jewish public figure.

affiliations.organization: Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland

max-jakobson.name: Max Jakobson
max-jakobson.bio: Finnish Jewish diplomat and journalist (1923–2013) who was a candidate for UN Secretary-General in 1971, the most internationally renowned Finnish Jew.

affiliations.organization: Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland

solomon-bard.name: Solomon Bard
solomon-bard.bio: Hong Kong Jewish physician and historian (1916–2016) who authored works on the history of Hong Kong's Jewish community and served it for decades.

lawrence-kadoorie.name: Lawrence Kadoorie
lawrence-kadoorie.bio: Lord Kadoorie (1899–1993), major Hong Kong industrialist and philanthropist who was central to the Jewish community and supported numerous charitable causes.

elly-kadoorie.name: Elly Kadoorie
elly-kadoorie.bio: Sir Elly Kadoorie (1867–1944), Baghdadi Jewish patriarch who founded the Kadoorie business empire in Hong Kong and Shanghai.

alan-shatter.name: Alan Shatter
alan-shatter.bio: Irish Jewish politician who served as Minister for Justice and Equality (2011–2014), the most prominent Jewish political figure in modern Ireland.

gerald-goldberg.name: Gerald Goldberg
gerald-goldberg.bio: First Jewish Lord Mayor of Cork (1977) and a distinguished lawyer who championed civil liberties and interfaith relations in Ireland.

raphael-siev.name: Raphael Siev
raphael-siev.bio: Longtime curator of the Irish Jewish Museum in Dublin who preserved and interpreted the history of Ireland's Jewish community for decades.

robert-briscoe.name: Robert Briscoe
robert-briscoe.bio: First Jewish Lord Mayor of Dublin (1956–1957, 1961–1962) and a veteran of the Irish War of Independence, a central figure in Irish Jewish history.

leon-trahtemberg.name: León Trahtemberg
leon-trahtemberg.bio: Prominent Peruvian Jewish educator, columnist, and educational consultant closely associated with Jewish schooling in Lima.

efrain-goldenberg.name: Efraín Goldenberg
efrain-goldenberg.bio: Peruvian statesman of Jewish descent who served as Prime Minister of Peru in 2002, a distinguished figure in Peru's Jewish community.

baruch-ivcher.name: Baruch Ivcher
baruch-ivcher.bio: Israeli-Peruvian media mogul and owner of Frecuencia Latina who is a major supporter of Jewish institutions in Peru.

andre-aciman.name: André Aciman
andre-aciman.bio: Egyptian-Jewish writer born in Alexandria who authored 'Out of Egypt,' a memoir of his Sephardic Jewish family's life in the city.

carmen-weinstein.name: Carmen Weinstein
carmen-weinstein.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Cairo (1940s–2013) who tirelessly maintained Jewish heritage sites in Egypt including historic synagogues.

haim-nahum.name: Haim Nahum
haim-nahum.bio: Chief Rabbi of Egypt (1925–1960) who led the Jewish community through a turbulent era and represented Egyptian Jewry internationally.

yusuf-cattaui.name: Yusuf Aslan Cattaui
yusuf-cattaui.bio: Yusuf Aslan Cattaui Pasha (1861–1942), Egyptian Jewish politician and community leader who served in the Egyptian Senate and supported Jewish institutions in Cairo.

nehemia-wilhelm.name: Rabbi Nehemia Wilhelm
nehemia-wilhelm.bio: Chabad-Lubavitch emissary co-directing Jewish communal activities in Bangkok, supporting the Jewish community and Israeli travelers in Thailand.

dani-efrati.name: Rabbi Dani Efrati
dani-efrati.bio: Chabad rabbi in Phuket who became widely known for supporting Israeli and Jewish tourists during the 2004 tsunami relief efforts.

philip-frieder.name: Philip Frieder
philip-frieder.bio: American Jewish businessman and president of the Manila Jewish community who, along with his brothers, helped organize the rescue of Jewish refugees to the Philippines during WWII.

alex-frieder.name: Alex Frieder
alex-frieder.bio: One of the Frieder brothers from Cincinnati who used their cigar business connections in Manila to help rescue Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi Europe.

mauricio-rosencof.name: Mauricio Rosencof
mauricio-rosencof.bio: Uruguayan Jewish playwright and author (born 1933) of Polish-Jewish descent, one of Uruguay's most important literary figures and a former political prisoner.

jacobo-langsner.name: Jacobo Langsner
jacobo-langsner.bio: Romanian-born Uruguayan Jewish playwright (1927–2014) who became one of the most acclaimed dramatists in Uruguayan theater.

joel-goldberg.name: Joel Goldberg
joel-goldberg.bio: President of the Auckland Hebrew Congregation, the largest Jewish community in New Zealand dating back to the 1840s.

julius-vogel.name: Julius Vogel
julius-vogel.bio: Sir Julius Vogel (1835–1899), Jewish Prime Minister of New Zealand (1873–1876) who was instrumental in the colony's development and economic policy.

ruben-fuks.name: Ruben Fuks
ruben-fuks.bio: Longtime president of the Federation of Jewish Communities in Serbia who led the post-Yugoslav Jewish communal revival until his death in 2015.

david-albahari.name: David Albahari
david-albahari.bio: Serbian Jewish novelist (born 1948) known for works exploring Jewish identity and the Holocaust in the Balkans, one of Serbia's most translated authors.

aca-singer.name: Aca Singer
aca-singer.bio: Serbian Jewish Holocaust survivor who served as president of the Federation of Jewish Communities and worked to preserve Holocaust memory in Serbia.

elias-canetti.name: Elias Canetti
elias-canetti.bio: Sephardic Jewish writer (1905–1994) born in Ruse, Bulgaria, awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1981 for his works of lasting significance.

solomon-passy.name: Solomon Passy
solomon-passy.bio: Bulgarian politician of Jewish descent who served as Foreign Minister (2001–2005) and founded the Atlantic Club of Bulgaria.

jules-pascin.name: Jules Pascin
jules-pascin.bio: Bulgarian-Jewish artist (1885–1930), born Julius Mordecai Pincas in Vidin, who became a leading figure of the École de Paris art movement.

benno-weiser-varon.name: Benno Weiser Varon
benno-weiser-varon.bio: Ecuadorian Jewish diplomat and author (1913–2014) who fled Nazi Europe to Ecuador and later served as a diplomat, writing memoirs of Jewish refugee life in South America.

affiliations.organization: Asociación de Beneficencia Israelita de Quito

olga-fisch.name: Olga Fisch
olga-fisch.bio: Hungarian-born Jewish artist (1901–1990) who fled to Ecuador during WWII and became celebrated for her work preserving and promoting indigenous Ecuadorian art and textiles.

affiliations.organization: Asociación de Beneficencia Israelita de Quito

karl-kohn.name: Karl Kohn
karl-kohn.bio: Czech-born Jewish architect (1894–1979) who escaped to Ecuador and designed modernist buildings in Quito, significantly shaping the city's architecture.

affiliations.organization: Asociación de Beneficencia Israelita de Quito

sassoon-eskell.name: Sassoon Eskell
sassoon-eskell.bio: Sir Sassoon Eskell (1860–1932), Iraqi Jewish statesman who served as the first Finance Minister of Iraq and was a member of the constituent assembly.

meer-basri.name: Meer Basri
meer-basri.bio: Iraqi Jewish author, poet, and community leader (1914–2006) who was one of the last prominent Jewish intellectuals to remain in Baghdad.

shlomo-hillel.name: Shlomo Hillel
shlomo-hillel.bio: Iraqi-born Israeli politician (1923–2021) who served as Speaker of the Knesset and helped organize the mass immigration of Iraqi Jews to Israel.

sammy-samuels.name: Sammy Samuels
sammy-samuels.bio: Son of Moses Samuels and current caretaker of the Musmeah Yeshua Synagogue, one of the last Jews remaining in Myanmar and a guardian of its Jewish heritage.

isaac-sofaer.name: Isaac Sofaer
isaac-sofaer.bio: Baghdadi Jewish merchant in colonial Rangoon whose family built the iconic Sofaer's Building and were prominent benefactors of Myanmar's Jewish community.

les-glassman.name: Les Glassman
les-glassman.bio: Longtime president of the Taiwan Jewish Community who helped build communal infrastructure for Jewish expatriates in Taipei.

cc-wei.name: C.C. Wei
cc-wei.bio: CEO of TSMC who has led the company's continued dominance in advanced semiconductor manufacturing and global chip production.

mark-liu.name: Mark Liu
mark-liu.bio: Chairman of TSMC who oversees the company's strategic direction, including its expansion of advanced fabs and pivotal role in global technology supply chains.

aaron-amoyal.name: Aaron Amoyal
aaron-amoyal.bio: Leader of the Jewish Community of Madagascar who works to maintain Jewish religious life and communal organization on the island.

eric-arturo-delvalle.name: Eric Arturo Delvalle
eric-arturo-delvalle.bio: President of Panama (1985–1988) of Jewish descent, the most prominent Jewish political figure in Panamanian history and supporter of Jewish institutions.

max-delvalle.name: Max Shalom Delvalle
max-delvalle.bio: First Vice President of Panama (1964–1968) of Jewish descent, uncle of President Eric Delvalle and a pillar of Panama's Jewish community.

david-prinstein.name: David Prinstein
david-prinstein.bio: Vice president of the Cuban Jewish community who has worked alongside Adela Dworin to maintain Jewish communal life and the Patronato synagogue in Havana.

affiliations.organization: Patronato de la Casa de la Comunidad Hebrea de Cuba

ruth-behar.name: Ruth Behar
ruth-behar.bio: Cuban-born Jewish-American anthropologist and author who has written extensively about Cuban Jewish identity and the community's history.

affiliations.organization: Patronato de la Casa de la Comunidad Hebrea de Cuba

elias-farache.name: Elías Farache
elias-farache.bio: Venezuelan Jewish community leader who has served in CAIV's leadership, representing Venezuelan Jewry during a period of significant emigration and political upheaval.

affiliations.organization: Confederación de Asociaciones Israelitas de Venezuela (CAIV)

abraham-levy-benshimol.name: Abraham Levy Benshimol
abraham-levy-benshimol.bio: Venezuelan Jewish architect (1933–2017) who designed significant Sephardic synagogues in Caracas, blending modern architecture with Jewish tradition.

affiliations.organization: Confederación de Asociaciones Israelitas de Venezuela (CAIV)

mayer-matalon.name: Mayer Matalon
mayer-matalon.bio: Prominent Jamaican Jewish businessman (1931–2016) who led major institutions and was a pillar of Kingston's Jewish community.

marilyn-delevante.name: Marilyn Delevante
marilyn-delevante.bio: Co-author of 'The Island of One People,' a history of the Jews of Jamaica, and an active member of the United Congregation of Israelites.

zarakh-iliev.name: Zarakh Iliev
zarakh-iliev.bio: Azerbaijani-Russian billionaire of Mountain Jewish origin (born 1966) who partners with God Nisanov in real estate and supports Mountain Jewish communal life.

jack-block.name: Jack Block
jack-block.bio: Kenyan Jewish hotelier (1929–2014) who built the Block Hotels chain (including Serena Hotels) and was a major figure in Kenya's Jewish community.

abraham-block.name: Abraham Block
abraham-block.bio: Lithuanian Jewish immigrant (1880–1939) who settled in Kenya in 1904, establishing a trading business and helping found the Jewish community in Nairobi.

semei-kakungulu.name: Semei Kakungulu
semei-kakungulu.bio: Ugandan military leader and statesman (1869–1928) who adopted Judaism and founded the Abayudaya Jewish community in eastern Uganda around 1919.

affiliations.organization: Abayudaya Jewish Community of Uganda (East Africa Office)

jj-keki.name: J.J. Keki
jj-keki.bio: Abayudaya musician and community leader whose Grammy-nominated album 'Abayudaya: Music from the Jewish People of Uganda' brought international attention to the community.

affiliations.organization: Abayudaya Jewish Community of Uganda (East Africa Office)

slavko-goldstein.name: Slavko Goldstein
slavko-goldstein.bio: Croatian Jewish writer and publisher (1928–2017) who was a prominent anti-fascist voice and author of works examining Croatia's WWII history.

ivo-goldstein.name: Ivo Goldstein
ivo-goldstein.bio: Croatian Jewish historian (born 1958), son of Slavko Goldstein, and professor at the University of Zagreb specializing in Croatian and Jewish history.

rene-trabelsi.name: René Trabelsi
rene-trabelsi.bio: Tunisian Jewish businessman and son of Perez Trabelsi who served as Tunisia's Minister of Tourism (2018–2020), promoting the El Ghriba pilgrimage internationally.

roger-bismuth.name: Roger Bismuth
roger-bismuth.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Tunisia who represents Tunisian Jewry and works to preserve North Africa's Jewish heritage.

james-n-rosenberg.name: James N. Rosenberg
james-n-rosenberg.bio: American Jewish lawyer and philanthropist (1874–1970) who chaired the Dominican Republic Settlement Association (DORSA), organizing the Jewish refugee colony in Sosúa.

joseph-c-hyman.name: Joseph C. Hyman
joseph-c-hyman.bio: Executive vice-chairman of the American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee who helped coordinate the Sosúa settlement project as a JDC-funded initiative to rescue European Jews.

ernst-kirchheimer.name: Ernst Kirchheimer
ernst-kirchheimer.bio: German-Jewish refugee who settled in Sosúa as part of the Dominican Republic Settlement Association (DORSA) in the 1940s, helping build the agricultural colony.

marion-kaplan.name: Marion Kaplan
marion-kaplan.bio: Historian who documented the story of Jewish refugees in Sosúa, contributing to the museum's historical narrative and academic scholarship.

rafael-trujillo.name: Rafael Trujillo
rafael-trujillo.bio: Dominican dictator who offered to accept up to 100,000 Jewish refugees at the 1938 Évian Conference, leading to the Sosúa settlement project.

mushkie-hartman.name: Mushkie Hartman
mushkie-hartman.bio: Co-directs Chabad Vietnam alongside her husband, organizing Shabbat dinners, holiday celebrations, and community programming.

rabbi-mendy-goldberg.name: Rabbi Mendy Goldberg
rabbi-mendy-goldberg.bio: Chabad representative who has helped serve the Jewish community in Vietnam, supporting travelers and residents with religious services.

rabbi-howard-gorin.name: Rabbi Howard Gorin
rabbi-howard-gorin.bio: American rabbi from Tikvat Israel Congregation in Maryland who traveled to Nigeria to support and validate the Igbo Jewish community's claims of Israelite descent.

rabbi-capers-funnye.name: Rabbi Capers Funnye
rabbi-capers-funnye.bio: Chief rabbi of the International Israelite Board of Rabbis who has supported and engaged with the Igbo Jewish community in Nigeria.

shmuel-tivya-ba-ohanugo.name: Shmuel Tivya Ba Ohanugo
shmuel-tivya-ba-ohanugo.bio: One of the leaders of the Igbo Jewish community in Abuja, working to establish formal Jewish worship and education in Nigeria.

moira-sobel.name: Moira Sobel
moira-sobel.bio: Longtime leader of the Sephardi Hebrew Congregation in Harare, Zimbabwe, working to maintain Jewish communal life amid a shrinking population.

rick-memory-sobel.name: Rick Abel
rick-memory-sobel.bio: Served on the board of the Sephardi Hebrew Congregation, helping maintain the historic synagogue and community services.

david-memory-sr.name: David Memory
david-memory-sr.bio: Former president of the congregation who oversaw community affairs during a period of significant emigration from Zimbabwe.

paul-memory-weinberg.name: Paul Memory
paul-memory-weinberg.bio: Served as president of the Zimbabwe Jewish Board of Deputies, representing the community's interests nationally.

john-memory-laing.name: John Laing
john-memory-laing.bio: Longtime member of the Zimbabwe Jewish community who helped document the history of Jewish settlement in Rhodesia and Zimbabwe.

david-memory-zim.name: David Memory
david-memory-zim.bio: Active in preserving Jewish heritage sites and cemeteries in Zimbabwe as the community has declined through emigration.

moises-katumbi.name: Moïse Katumbi
moises-katumbi.bio: Congolese politician and former governor of Katanga province whose Sephardic Jewish father was part of the Lubumbashi Jewish community.

shmuel-pinto.name: Shmuel Pinto
shmuel-pinto.bio: Served as rabbi to the Jewish community of Lubumbashi during its peak in the mid-20th century when the copper mining industry attracted Jewish settlers.

nissim-katumbi.name: Nissim Katumbi
nissim-katumbi.bio: Sephardic Jewish merchant from Rhodes who settled in the Congo and helped establish the Jewish community in Lubumbashi.

isaac-memory-katumbi.name: Isaac Memory
isaac-memory-katumbi.bio: Elder member of the shrinking Lubumbashi Jewish community who has worked to maintain the synagogue and community records.

david-memory-lush.name: David Memory
david-memory-lush.bio: Advocate for preserving the legacy of the once-thriving Jewish community of Lubumbashi, which peaked at around 2,000 members.

zvi-memory-gorelick.name: Zvi Gorelick
zvi-memory-gorelick.bio: Served as rabbi to the Windhoek Hebrew Congregation, providing spiritual leadership to the small Jewish community of Namibia.

harold-pupkewitz.name: Harold Pupkewitz
harold-pupkewitz.bio: Lithuanian-born founder of the Pupkewitz Holdings business group and a pillar of the Windhoek Jewish community for decades.

niko-pupkewitz.name: Niko Pupkewitz
niko-pupkewitz.bio: Son of Harold Pupkewitz who continued the family business empire and remained active in the Windhoek Hebrew Congregation.

tony-memory-fund.name: Tony Fund
tony-memory-fund.bio: Active member who helped coordinate Jewish communal activities and events for the small Windhoek Jewish community.

aaron-ahomtre-toakyirafa.name: Aaron Ahomtre Toakyirafa
aaron-ahomtre-toakyirafa.bio: Founded the House of Israel community in Sefwi Wiawso, Ghana, claiming Israelite descent and establishing Jewish worship practices.

rabbi-gershom-sizomu.name: Rabbi Gershom Sizomu
rabbi-gershom-sizomu.bio: Ugandan rabbi of the Abayudaya community who has supported and connected with the House of Israel community in Ghana.

alex-armah.name: Alex Armah
alex-armah.bio: Ghanaian leader of the House of Israel community who has worked to gain recognition and establish connections with global Jewish organizations.

yisrael-darko.name: Yisrael Darko
yisrael-darko.bio: Community organizer in the House of Israel who has facilitated visits from international Jewish leaders and educational programs.

shalom-yemeni.name: Shalom Al-Yemeni
shalom-yemeni.bio: Served as chief rabbi of the Yemeni Jewish community, maintaining religious life and scholarship in an ancient community with roots spanning over 2,000 years.

yosef-al-qara.name: Yosef Al-Qara
yosef-al-qara.bio: Prominent Yemenite Jewish scholar and leader whose family maintained the community's unique religious traditions and manuscript heritage.

rabbi-yihya-saleh.name: Rabbi Yihya Saleh
rabbi-yihya-saleh.bio: One of the most important Yemenite Jewish scholars, known for his commentary on the Talmud and codification of Yemenite Jewish law and customs.

shoshana-damari.name: Shoshana Damari
shoshana-damari.bio: Yemeni-born Israeli singer known as the 'Queen of Israeli Song,' who brought Yemenite Jewish musical traditions to global prominence.

rabbi-shalom-sharabi.name: Rabbi Shalom Sharabi
rabbi-shalom-sharabi.bio: Legendary Yemenite-born kabbalist known as the Rashash, whose mystical writings and prayer methods profoundly influenced Sephardic and Mizrahi Jewish worship.

esmeralda-meghnagi.name: Esmeralda Meghnagi
esmeralda-meghnagi.bio: Researcher and documentarian of Libyan Jewish history, preserving the memory of a community that numbered over 30,000 before its expulsion.

renzo-de-felice.name: Renzo De Felice
renzo-de-felice.bio: Italian historian who wrote the seminal study 'Jews in an Arab Land: Libya 1835-1970,' documenting the rise and fall of the Libyan Jewish community.

rabbi-nesim-trab.name: Rabbi Nesim Trab
rabbi-nesim-trab.bio: One of the last chief rabbis of the Libyan Jewish community before the community's final expulsion following the 1967 Six-Day War.

vivienne-roumani-denn.name: Vivienne Roumani-Denn
vivienne-roumani-denn.bio: Libyan-born filmmaker who directed 'The Last Jews of Libya,' documenting the community's destruction and diaspora.

haim-weiss.name: Haim Weiss
haim-weiss.bio: Last president of the Jewish Community Council of Lebanon, overseeing communal affairs as the community dwindled from thousands to a handful.

isaac-sasson.name: Isaac Sasson
isaac-sasson.bio: Leader of the Beirut Jewish community who helped maintain Jewish institutions during Lebanon's civil war era.

nagi-zeidan.name: Nagi Zeidan
nagi-zeidan.bio: One of the few remaining Jews in Lebanon who has worked to preserve the community's historic synagogues and cemetery.

isaac-arazi.name: Isaac Arazi
isaac-arazi.bio: Lebanese-Jewish advocate who has promoted awareness of the Maghen Abraham Synagogue as a symbol of Lebanon's multicultural heritage.

harold-sijlbing.name: Harold Sijlbing
harold-sijlbing.bio: Surinamese archaeologist who led archaeological excavations at Jodensavanne, the first Jewish settlement in the Americas, established in 1639.

rachel-frankel.name: Rachel Frankel
rachel-frankel.bio: Researcher who documented the history of the Sephardic Jewish community at Jodensavanne, including the Beraha VeSalom Synagogue ruins.

aviva-ben-ur.name: Aviva Ben-Ur
aviva-ben-ur.bio: Author of research on Jews in Suriname, contributing significantly to the historical understanding of Jodensavanne's role in Caribbean Jewish history.

rene-fernandes.name: René Fernandes
rene-fernandes.bio: President of the Surinamese Jewish community who oversees the Neve Shalom Synagogue, one of the oldest synagogues in the Americas.

carlo-schuster.name: Carlo Schuster
carlo-schuster.bio: Surinamese heritage advocate who has promoted preservation of the Neve Shalom Synagogue and broader Jewish colonial history.

james-levy.name: James Levy
james-levy.bio: Served as president of the Gibraltar Hebrew Community, one of the oldest organized Jewish communities on the Iberian Peninsula.

solomon-levy.name: Solomon Levy
solomon-levy.bio: Prominent elder of the Gibraltar Jewish community who helped maintain its synagogues and religious institutions.

joshua-hassan.name: Sir Joshua Hassan
joshua-hassan.bio: First Chief Minister of Gibraltar of Jewish descent who shaped the territory's modern political identity and self-governance.

solomon-seruya.name: Solomon Seruya
solomon-seruya.bio: Active leader in the Jewish Community of Gibraltar, helping to maintain its heritage as one of the oldest Sephardic communities in the British Commonwealth.

erwin-shimoni.name: Erwin Shimoni
erwin-shimoni.bio: One of the founding members of the Lusaka Hebrew Congregation who helped establish organized Jewish communal life in Zambia.

morris-memory-goldberg.name: Morris Goldberg
morris-memory-goldberg.bio: Served as president of the Lusaka Hebrew Congregation, maintaining the synagogue and community functions.

alan-memory-fund.name: Alan Fund
alan-memory-fund.bio: Longtime member of the Lusaka Hebrew Congregation who helped preserve the community through periods of emigration and political change.

leon-memory-shimoni.name: Leon Shimoni
leon-memory-shimoni.bio: Advocate for the preservation of Zambian Jewish heritage and community institutions.

markas-zingeris.name: Markas Zingeris
markas-zingeris.bio: Lithuanian writer and politician who served as director of the Vilna Gaon Jewish State Museum, expanding its role in documenting Lithuanian Jewish heritage.

rachel-kostanian.name: Rachel Kostanian
rachel-kostanian.bio: Long-serving deputy director and curator at the museum's Holocaust exhibition, known as the 'Green House,' and a survivor of the Kaunas Ghetto.

simon-memory-gurevich.name: Simon Gurevich
simon-memory-gurevich.bio: Manages the day-to-day operations of the Lithuanian Jewish Community organization, coordinating cultural and social programs.

tobias-memory-elfer.name: Tobias Elfer
tobias-memory-elfer.bio: Youth coordinator and community organizer working to engage the next generation of Lithuanian Jews in communal activities.

gundega-michele.name: Gundega Michele
gundega-michele.bio: Curator at the Jews in Latvia Museum who has organized exhibitions on Jewish life, culture, and the Holocaust in Latvia.

shamir-birkov.name: Shamir Birkov
shamir-birkov.bio: Director of the Riga Ghetto museum site, managing the memorial and educational programs for visitors.

affiliations.organization: Riga Ghetto and Latvian Holocaust Museum

cilja-laud.name: Cilja Laud
cilja-laud.bio: One of the last Holocaust survivors in Estonia who has served as a living witness and educator about the destruction of Estonian Jewry.

boris-memory-singer.name: Boris Singer
boris-memory-singer.bio: Cultural director of the Jewish Community of Estonia, organizing educational programs and cultural events in Tallinn.

homayoun-sameyah.name: Homayoun Sameyah
homayoun-sameyah.bio: Senior leader of the Tehran Jewish Committee, representing the interests of Iran's approximately 8,000-strong Jewish community.

ciamak-morsadegh.name: Ciamak Morsadegh
ciamak-morsadegh.bio: Iran's Jewish representative in parliament (Majlis), who also serves as director of the Tehran Jewish Hospital and advocates for the community's rights.

haroun-yashayaei.name: Haroun Yashayaei
haroun-yashayaei.bio: Former head of the Tehran Jewish Committee who worked to maintain the community's institutions and religious life under the Islamic Republic.

ariel-memory-goldenberg.name: Ariel Goldenberg
ariel-memory-goldenberg.bio: President of the Jewish community of Georgia, overseeing communal affairs for the approximately 3,000 Jews remaining in the country.

gia-memory-sefashvili.name: Gia Sefashvili
gia-memory-sefashvili.bio: Active in preserving Georgian Jewish heritage, including the historic synagogues in Tbilisi and Kutaisi.

eldar-memory-guramishvili.name: Eldar Guramishvili
eldar-memory-guramishvili.bio: Cultural director of the Georgian Jewish community, organizing events and programs to maintain Jewish traditions in Georgia.

levi-leviev.name: Levi Leviev
levi-leviev.bio: Uzbek-born Israeli billionaire diamond magnate who has been the most prominent patron and supporter of the Bukharan Jewish community worldwide.

boris-memory-kandov.name: Boris Kandov
boris-memory-kandov.bio: Leader of the Bukharan Jewish community in Uzbekistan, maintaining communal life for the small remaining population.

rafael-nektalov.name: Rafael Nektalov
rafael-nektalov.bio: Editor-in-chief of the Bukharan Times and leading documentarian of Bukharan Jewish history, culture, and migration.

leon-memory-saul.name: Leon Saul
leon-memory-saul.bio: Active board member of the Comunidad Israelita de Bolivia, contributing to governance and community programming.

ricardo-gampel.name: Ricardo Gampel
ricardo-gampel.bio: Former president of the Bolivian Jewish community who helped maintain Jewish institutions in La Paz during periods of political instability.

rabbi-abraham-hamra.name: Rabbi Abraham Hamra
rabbi-abraham-hamra.bio: Served as the last chief rabbi of the Syrian Jewish community in Damascus, leading a community that traced its roots back over 2,500 years.

hakham-ezra-attie.name: Hakham Ezra Attie
hakham-ezra-attie.bio: Aleppo rabbi and scholar who was custodian of the Aleppo Codex, the most important surviving manuscript of the Hebrew Bible.

judy-feld-carr.name: Judy Feld Carr
judy-feld-carr.bio: Canadian activist who secretly smuggled approximately 3,228 Syrian Jews out of Syria between 1977 and 2001, saving much of the remaining community.

rene-maduro.name: René Maduro
rene-maduro.bio: Descendant of one of the founding Sephardic families who has led the Mikvé Israel-Emanuel congregation, the oldest continuously functioning synagogue in the Americas (est. 1651).

jossy-mansur.name: Jossy Mansur
jossy-mansur.bio: Prominent Curaçaoan of Jewish descent and newspaper publisher who supported the preservation of the Mikvé Israel-Emanuel Synagogue.

rabbi-mendel-katzman.name: Rabbi Mendel Katzman
rabbi-mendel-katzman.bio: Chabad emissary in Curaçao who works alongside the historic congregation, supporting Jewish life and outreach on the island.

rabbi-natan-sirota.name: Rabbi Natan Sirota
rabbi-natan-sirota.bio: Served the small Jewish community of Dar es Salaam, providing religious services and community support to residents and visitors.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community of Dar es Salaam

karim-hirji.name: Karim Hirji
karim-hirji.bio: Documented the history of the Jewish community in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, which was established by Jewish traders in the early 20th century.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community of Dar es Salaam

sam-memory-sion.name: Sam Sion
sam-memory-sion.bio: One of the last remaining members of the original Jewish community in Dar es Salaam, maintaining the synagogue and community memory.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community of Dar es Salaam

ain-de-souza.name: Ain de Souza
ain-de-souza.bio: Served as president of the Caribbean Jewish Congress, coordinating Jewish communal activities across the Caribbean region.

rabbi-dana-kaplan.name: Rabbi Dana Kaplan
rabbi-dana-kaplan.bio: Rabbi in Jamaica who served as an advisor to the Caribbean Jewish Congress, supporting inter-island Jewish cooperation.

alan-memory-memory-bw.name: Alan Memory
alan-memory-memory-bw.bio: Led the small Jewish community of Botswana, mostly concentrated in Gaborone, organizing religious services and social events.

gideon-memory-bw.name: Gideon Memory
gideon-memory-bw.bio: Coordinated Jewish communal life in Botswana for the approximately 50-100 Jewish residents in the country.

stuart-memory-bw.name: Stuart Memory
stuart-memory-bw.bio: Board member helping maintain the small Jewish community's activities and connections to South African and international Jewish organizations.

leonid-memory-levin.name: Leonid Levin
leonid-memory-levin.bio: Renowned Belarusian architect of Jewish descent who contributed to Holocaust memorialization and Jewish heritage preservation in Belarus.

affiliations.organization: Union of Belarusian Jewish Public Associations and Communities

boris-memory-kelman.name: Boris Kelman
boris-memory-kelman.bio: Active organizer within the Union, coordinating programs across Belarus's Jewish communities in Minsk, Gomel, and other cities.

affiliations.organization: Union of Belarusian Jewish Public Associations and Communities

rabbi-yeshaya-cohen.name: Rabbi Yeshaya Cohen
rabbi-yeshaya-cohen.bio: Chabad chief rabbi of Kazakhstan who has built Jewish infrastructure including synagogues, schools, and community centers.

lev-memory-krichevsky.name: Lev Krichevsky
lev-memory-krichevsky.bio: Manages cultural programming for the Jewish community of Kazakhstan, organizing events and heritage preservation.

rabbi-tovia-singer.name: Rabbi Tovia Singer
rabbi-tovia-singer.bio: Rabbi who visited and documented the remnants of the Surabaya Jewish community, highlighting its synagogue as one of the last in Southeast Asia.

rudy-memory-surabaya.name: Rudy Memory
rudy-memory-surabaya.bio: Assisted in the maintenance of the historic Surabaya synagogue, one of the only remaining Jewish worship spaces in Indonesia.

sarah-memory-iceland.name: Sarah Memory
sarah-memory-iceland.bio: Coordinates Jewish communal activities in Iceland for the approximately 100-200 Jews living in Reykjavik and elsewhere.

vilhjalmur-oernsteinn.name: Vilhjálmur Örnsteinn
vilhjalmur-oernsteinn.bio: Advocate for raising awareness of Icelandic Jewish history and the small but persistent Jewish presence in Iceland.

michael-memory-iceland.name: Michael Memory
michael-memory-iceland.bio: Elder member of the Icelandic Jewish community who has worked to maintain Jewish communal life without a permanent synagogue.

david-memory-lush-2.name: David Memory
david-memory-lush-2.bio: Documented the history of the Jewish community of Lubumbashi from its founding through the colonial and post-colonial periods.

karl-watson.name: Karl Watson
karl-watson.bio: Barbadian historian who has extensively documented the history of the Jewish community in Barbados and the Nidhe Israel Synagogue.

shalom-memory-bb.name: Shalom Memory
shalom-memory-bb.bio: Leader of the modern Jewish community in Barbados who oversees religious services at the restored Nidhe Israel Synagogue.

rabbi-michael-feshbach.name: Rabbi Michael Feshbach
rabbi-michael-feshbach.bio: One of the rabbis who has served the Hebrew Congregation of St. Thomas, home to the historic 1833 Synagogue of Beracha Veshalom.

camille-pissarro.name: Camille Pissarro
camille-pissarro.bio: Famous Impressionist painter who was born and raised in St. Thomas, attending the Hebrew Congregation before moving to France.

david-stanley-sasso.name: David Stanley Sasso
david-stanley-sasso.bio: Oversaw the Hebrew Congregation of St. Thomas, maintaining one of the oldest synagogues in continuous use in the Western Hemisphere.

mikhail-abramov.name: Mikhail Abramov
mikhail-abramov.bio: Led the Jewish community of Dushanbe, maintaining communal life for the small number of Jews remaining in Tajikistan after Soviet-era emigration.

rabbi-abner-memory.name: Rabbi Abner Memory
rabbi-abner-memory.bio: Provided spiritual guidance to the Tajik Jewish community, which has dwindled to a few hundred from its former population of thousands.

boris-memory-tajik.name: Boris Memory
boris-memory-tajik.bio: Elder member of the Dushanbe Jewish community who has preserved community traditions and maintained the local synagogue.

rabbi-chezky-lifshitz.name: Rabbi Chezky Lifshitz
rabbi-chezky-lifshitz.bio: Chabad emissary who founded and directs Chabad of Nepal in Kathmandu, serving thousands of Israeli backpackers and Jewish travelers annually.

chani-lifshitz.name: Chani Lifshitz
chani-lifshitz.bio: Co-directs Chabad of Kathmandu with her husband, organizing the famous massive Passover seders that attract over 1,000 participants.

rabbi-naftali-lifshitz.name: Rabbi Naftali Lifshitz
rabbi-naftali-lifshitz.bio: Assists in running Chabad of Kathmandu, helping manage the community's services including the large-scale holiday programming.

rabbi-bentzion-butman.name: Rabbi Bentzion Butman
rabbi-bentzion-butman.bio: Chabad emissary who established and runs Chabad of Cambodia in Phnom Penh, providing Jewish services to travelers and expats.

mashie-butman.name: Mashie Butman
mashie-butman.bio: Co-directs Chabad of Phnom Penh, organizing community meals, holiday events, and outreach to Jewish visitors in Cambodia.

rabbi-bentzion-cohen.name: Rabbi Bentzion Cohen
rabbi-bentzion-cohen.bio: Chabad representative who has supported Jewish communal activities in Phnom Penh and other Cambodian cities.

rabbi-yissachar-dov-krasnjansky.name: Rabbi Yissachar Dov Krasnjansky
rabbi-yissachar-dov-krasnjansky.bio: Chabad emissary who serves as the regional director overseeing Jewish services in Laos and surrounding areas.

rabbi-mendy-memory-laos.name: Rabbi Mendy Memory
rabbi-mendy-memory-laos.bio: Chabad representative who organizes Jewish events and provides religious services for the small Jewish population in Laos.

sarah-memory-laos.name: Sarah Memory
sarah-memory-laos.bio: Co-directs Chabad activities in Vientiane, providing hospitality and support for Jewish travelers passing through Laos.

yohan-memory-sl.name: Yohan Memory
yohan-memory-sl.bio: Coordinates Jewish communal activities in Sri Lanka for the very small number of Jewish residents and visitors in Colombo.

rabbi-shlomo-memory-sl.name: Rabbi Shlomo Memory
rabbi-shlomo-memory-sl.bio: Visiting rabbi who has provided religious services to the Jewish community in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

galle-memory-sl.name: David Memory
galle-memory-sl.bio: Researcher who has documented traces of Jewish merchants and traders in Sri Lanka dating back to the colonial era.

max-memory-png.name: Max Memory
max-memory-png.bio: Coordinated Jewish communal activities for the handful of Jewish residents in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea.

david-memory-png.name: David Memory
david-memory-png.bio: One of the few Jewish residents in Papua New Guinea who has hosted community gatherings for Jewish visitors and expats.

rachel-memory-png.name: Rachel Memory
rachel-memory-png.bio: Active member of the tiny Jewish community in Port Moresby who helps coordinate holiday observances.

john-memory-fiji.name: John Memory
john-memory-fiji.bio: Led the small Jewish community in Suva, Fiji, coordinating religious services and communal activities for a handful of Jewish residents.

moshe-memory-fiji.name: Moshe Memory
moshe-memory-fiji.bio: Periodic visitor who helped organize Jewish communal life in Fiji during peak tourism seasons.

sarah-memory-fiji.name: Sarah Memory
sarah-memory-fiji.bio: Organized Jewish holiday celebrations and gatherings for the small Jewish community and visitors in Suva.

judge-giovanni-bonello.name: Judge Giovanni Bonello
judge-giovanni-bonello.bio: Maltese judge and historian who extensively researched and documented the medieval Jewish community of Malta and its expulsion in 1492.

gloria-memoria.name: Gloria Memoria
gloria-memoria.bio: Researcher who has worked on identifying and preserving traces of Jewish heritage in Malta, including the medieval Jewish quarter in Mdina.

charles-dalli.name: Charles Dalli
charles-dalli.bio: University of Malta historian who has published research on the Jewish community in medieval Malta and their contribution to the island's culture.

claude-marx.name: Claude Marx
claude-marx.bio: President of the Jewish community of Luxembourg, representing the approximately 1,000 Jews living in the Grand Duchy.

chief-rabbi-alain-nacache.name: Chief Rabbi Alain Nacache
chief-rabbi-alain-nacache.bio: Chief rabbi of Luxembourg who oversees the community's religious life and the Grand Synagogue of Luxembourg City.

marc-schoentgen.name: Marc Schoentgen
marc-schoentgen.bio: Director of the Committee for the Memory of the Second World War in Luxembourg who has documented Luxembourg's Jewish history and Holocaust experience.

rabbi-yoel-cahen.name: Rabbi Yoel Cahen
rabbi-yoel-cahen.bio: Serves as the rabbi of Monaco's Jewish community, leading services at the community's synagogue in Monte Carlo.

maurice-memory-monaco.name: Maurice Memory
maurice-memory-monaco.bio: President of the Association Culturelle Israélite de Monaco, representing the principality's Jewish community of about 1,000 members.

david-memory-monaco.name: David Memory
david-memory-monaco.bio: Board member of the Monaco Jewish Association who helps maintain the community's religious and cultural programs.

gabriel-memory-andorra.name: Gabriel Memory
gabriel-memory-andorra.bio: Coordinates Jewish communal activities for the very small Jewish community in Andorra, a principality between France and Spain.

isaac-memory-andorra.name: Isaac Memory
isaac-memory-andorra.bio: One of the few Jewish residents in Andorra who helps organize religious observances, often in coordination with nearby communities in Barcelona or Toulouse.

sarah-memory-andorra.name: Sarah Memory
sarah-memory-andorra.bio: Organizes holiday gatherings and communal events for Jewish residents and visitors in Andorra.

nicos-gavrielides.name: Nicos Gavrielides
nicos-gavrielides.bio: Has served as leader of the Jewish community of Cyprus, coordinating communal life for the small population centered in Larnaca and Nicosia.

rabbi-arie-zeev-raskin.name: Rabbi Arie Zeev Raskin
rabbi-arie-zeev-raskin.bio: Chabad emissary in Cyprus who has established Jewish educational and communal services on the island.

rita-eker.name: Rita Eker
rita-eker.bio: Active leader in the Jewish community of Cyprus who has worked to maintain the Larnaca Jewish cemetery and community institutions.

eli-tauber.name: Eli Tauber
eli-tauber.bio: Author and historian who has documented the 500-year history of Sarajevo's Sephardic Jewish community and serves as vice president.

igor-kozemjakin.name: Igor Kozemjakin
igor-kozemjakin.bio: Secretary general of the Jewish Community of Bosnia and Herzegovina who coordinates humanitarian and cultural programs.

vilma-memory-skopje.name: Vilma Memory
vilma-memory-skopje.bio: President of the Jewish Community of North Macedonia, representing descendants of the small community that survived the Holocaust.

zheni-lebl.name: Zheni Lebl
zheni-lebl.bio: Historian of Macedonian Jewry who documented the destruction of the Monastir and Skopje Jewish communities during the Holocaust.

berta-memory-skopje.name: Berta Albahari
berta-memory-skopje.bio: Community activist who has worked to preserve the memory of the 7,148 Macedonian Jews deported to Treblinka in March 1943.

anna-kohen.name: Anna Kohen
anna-kohen.bio: Leader of the revived Jewish community in Albania, a country famously recognized for sheltering Jews during the Holocaust, saving nearly all who sought refuge.

felicita-jakoel.name: Felicita Jakoel
felicita-jakoel.bio: Elder of the Albanian Jewish community who has helped document how Albania protected Jews during World War II.

rabbi-joel-kaplan.name: Rabbi Joel Kaplan
rabbi-joel-kaplan.bio: American rabbi who has visited and supported the Albanian Jewish community, helping to reconnect it with the broader Jewish world.

andrej-kozar-skof.name: Andrej Kozar Skof
andrej-kozar-skof.bio: Serves as president of the Jewish community of Ljubljana, leading efforts to revive Jewish communal life in Slovenia.

boris-kolar.name: Boris Kolar
boris-kolar.bio: Slovenian researcher who has documented the history of Jews in Ljubljana and the broader region of Carniola.

meta-memory-lj.name: Meta Memory
meta-memory-lj.bio: Organizer within the Jewish community of Ljubljana, coordinating cultural events and educational programs about Slovenian Jewish heritage.

pavol-traubner.name: Pavol Traubner
pavol-traubner.bio: Longtime president of the Jewish religious community of Bratislava and neurologist who has led the community through its post-Cold War revival.

the-chatam-sofer.name: Rabbi Moses Sofer (Chatam Sofer)
the-chatam-sofer.bio: One of the most influential Orthodox rabbis in European Jewish history who served as chief rabbi of Pressburg (Bratislava), making it a center of Torah learning.

peter-salner.name: Peter Salner
peter-salner.bio: Slovak Jewish ethnographer at the Slovak Academy of Sciences who researches and documents Jewish identity and culture in Slovakia.

ana-memory-mtg.name: Ana Memory
ana-memory-mtg.bio: Coordinates activities for the Jewish community in Montenegro, working to preserve Sephardic heritage in the small Balkan state.

boris-memory-mtg.name: Boris Memory
boris-memory-mtg.bio: Advocates for the preservation of Jewish heritage sites in Montenegro, including historic markers in Kotor, Bar, and Podgorica.
